u

u 1

letter. (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel
Sanskrit u

Example

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
u 2

prefix. up; upwards ✓

Grammar prefix
Meaning up; upwards
Synonym ud
Notes classical grammatical form of ud
Sanskrit ud

Example

pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, pahāro, parābhavo, nihāro, nīhāro, uhāro, duhāro, saṃhāro, vihāro, avahāro, anuhāro, parihāro, adhihāro, abhihāro, patihāro, suhāro, āhāro, atihāro, apihāro, apahāro, upahāro, evaṃ vīsati upasaggehi ca.

kaccāyana nāmakappa 221
ukāra

masc. (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel [u + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel
Construction u + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (u + kāra)
Synonym utta
Sanskrit ukāra

Examples

487, 478. vaca vasa vah'ādīnam'ukāro vassa ye.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 487

vaca vasa vaha'icc'evam'ādīnaṃ dhātūnaṃ vakārassa ukāro hoti yapaccaye pare. uccate, vuccati, vussati, vuyhati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 487
ukka 1

masc. re-opening (of a (legal) question already settled) ✗
ukka 2

masc. house ✗
ukkacelasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.14 (SN47.14) ✗
ukkacelā

fem. name of a Vajjian town [ukkā + celā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a Vajjian town
Construction ukkā + celā
Commentary (MNa) tattha ukkacelāyan'ti evaṃnāmake nagare. tasmiṃ kira māpiyamāne rattiṃ gaṅgāsotato maccho thalaṃ patto. manussā celāni telapātiyaṃ temetvā ukkā katvā macchaṃ gaṇhiṃsu. nagare niṭṭhite tassa nāmaṃ karonte amhehi nagaraṭṭhānassa gahitadivase celukkāhi maccho gahito'ti ukkacelā-tv'ev'assa nāmaṃ akaṃsu.

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vajjīsu viharati ukkacelāyaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aciraparinibbutesu sāriputtamoggallānesu.

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vajjīsu viharati ukkacelāyaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

MN 34 cūḷagopālakasuttaṃ
ukkaṭṭha 1

pp. (+loc) prominent (in); elevated (in); in a high position (in); lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ukkaṃsati (+loc)
Meaning prominent (in); elevated (in); in a high position (in); lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Synonym samukkaṭṭha
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

y'āhu raṭṭhe samukkaṭṭho,
rañño aṅgassa paddhagū,
sv'ājja dhammesu ukkaṭṭho,
soṇo dukkhassa pāragū.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā
ukkaṭṭha 2

pp. large-sized; lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ukkaṃsati
Meaning large-sized; lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Antonym omaka
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Examples

tayo pattassa vaṇṇā ukkaṭṭho patto majjhimo patto omako patto.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ

daṇḍo nāma majjhimassa purisassa catuhattho daṇḍo. tato ukkaṭṭho adaṇḍo, omako adaṇḍo.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
ukkaṭṭha 3

pp. high-class; rich; lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ~

Grammar pp of ukkaṃsati
Meaning high-class; rich; lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ukkaṭṭha 4

pp. excellent, specialised [ud + √kas] ✗
ukkaṭṭha 5

pp. pulled up; hitched up; lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ~

Grammar pp of ukkaṃsati
Meaning pulled up; hitched up; lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Antonym okkaṭṭha
Commentary (MNa) accukkaṭṭhan'ti yo hi yāva hanukaṭṭhito ukkhipitvā pārupati, tassa accukkaṭṭhaṃ nāma hoti ... yo'pi ubhato ukkhipitvā udaraṃ vivaritvā yāti, tassa'pi accukkaṭṭhaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ukkaṭṭharoga

masc. high-class disease; rich people's disease; i.e. diabetes [ukkaṭṭha + roga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning high-class disease; rich people's disease; i.e. diabetes
Construction ukkaṭṭha + roga
ukkaṭṭhā

fem. name of town; lit. elevated [ud + √kas + ta + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from ukkaṭṭha
Meaning name of town; lit. elevated
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta + ā
ukkaṭṭha + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Commentary (MNa) ukkaṭṭhāyaṃ viharatī'ti ettha ukkāti dīpikā, tañ'ca nagaraṃ, maṅgaladivaso sukhaṇo sunakkhattaṃ mā atikkamī'ti rattim'pi ukkāsu ṭhitāsu māpitattā ukkaṭṭhā'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

ekam'id'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, samayaṃ ukkaṭṭhāyaṃ viharāmi subhagavane sālarājamūle.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
ukkaṭṭhita

pp. boiled up, seething [ud + √kaṭh] ✗
ukkaḍḍhati

pr. postpones; puts off; delays [ud + √kaḍḍh] ✗
ukkaḍḍhiyyati

pr. is postponed; is put off; is delayed; lit. is dragged up [ud + √kaḍḍh + īya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of ukkaḍḍhati, intrans
Meaning is postponed; is put off; is delayed; lit. is dragged up
Root Family ud √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 īya (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + īya > kaḍḍhīya > kaḍḍhiyya (pass, irreg)
Construction ud + kaḍḍhiyya + ti
Phonetic Change īy > iyy
Sanskrit utkṛṣyate
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ukkaṇṭaka

masc. disease (of animals) ✗
ukkaṇṭhati

pr. (+instr) sick (of); is fed up (with); is dissatisfied (with); is annoyed (with); up to the neck (with) [ud + √kaṭh + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+instr)
Meaning sick (of); is fed up (with); is dissatisfied (with); is annoyed (with); up to the neck (with)
Root Family ud √kaṭh
Root √kaṭh･2 ṃa (live in distress)
Base √kaṭh + ṃa > kaṇṭha
Construction ud + kaṇṭha + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkaṇṭhati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √kaṭh 1 (live in distress)

Example

ukkaṇṭhāmi sarīrena,
bhaven'amhi anatthiko,
so'yaṃ bhijjissati kāyo,
añño ca na bhavissati.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
ukkaṇṭhanā

fem. dissatisfaction, commotion [ud + √kaṭh] ✗
ukkaṇṭhanta

prp. (+instr) being sick (of); being fed up (with); being dissatisfied (with); being annoyed (with); being up to the neck (with) [ud + √kaṭh + ṃa + nta] ~

Grammar prp of ukkaṇṭhati, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being sick (of); being fed up (with); being dissatisfied (with); being annoyed (with); being up to the neck (with)
Root Family ud √kaṭh
Root √kaṭh･2 ṃa (live in distress)
Base √kaṭh + ṃa > kaṇṭha
Construction ud + kaṇṭha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkaṇṭhat
Sanskrit Root √kaṭh 1 (live in distress)
ukkaṇṭhi

aor. dissatisfied [ud + √kaṭh] ✗
ukkaṇṭhita

pp. dissatisfied, fretting [ud + √kaṭh] ✗
ukkaṇḍaka

nt. mange; skin inflammation [ud + √kaṇḍ + aka] ✓

Grammar nt, from kaṇḍa
Meaning mange; skin inflammation
Root Family ud √kaṇḍ
Root √kaṇḍ･8 *e (break, pierce)
Construction ud + √kaṇḍ + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change d > k
Variant ukkaṇṭaka
Commentary (SNa) ukkaṇṭakena nāmā'ti evaṃnāmakena rogena. so kira sītakāle uppajjati. tasmiṃ uppanne sakalasarīrato lomāni patanti, sakalasarīraṃ nillomaṃ hutvā, samantato phuṭati, vātabbhāhatā vaṇā rujjanti. yathā ummattakasunakhena daṭṭho puriso anavaṭṭhitova bhamati, evaṃ tasmiṃ uppanne bhamitabbo hoti, asukaṭṭhāne sotthi bhavissatī'ti na paññāyati.
Sanskrit utkhaṇḍita (broken)
Sanskrit Root √kaḍ √kaṇḍ 10 (separate, destroy)

Example

eso kho, bhikkhave, jarasiṅgālo ukkaṇḍakena nāma rogajātena phuṭṭho. so yena yena icchati tena tena gacchati. yattha yattha icchati tattha tattha tiṭṭhati.

SN 20.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ
ukkaṇṇa

adj. having the ears erect [kaṇṇa] ✗
ukkaṇṇaka

masc. disease (of animals) ✗
ukkantati

pr. cuts or tears out [ud + √kat] ✗
ukkanti

aor. cut or tore out [ud + √kat] ✗
ukkantita

pp. cut or tore out [ud + √kat] ✗
ukkantitvā

abs. having cut out; having cut off; having cut up; having butchered [ud + √kat] ✗
ukkapiṇḍaka

masc. ‘finding food in a house ‘, perhaps a house-lizard, or vermin generally ✗
ukkamma

ger. going out; going away (from) going over; omitting; neglecting [ud + √kam] ✗
ukkara

masc. rubbish dug up by rats; lit. made up [ud + √kar + a] ~

Grammar masc
Meaning rubbish dug up by rats; lit. made up
Root Family ud √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ud + √kar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > k
Variant ukkura
Commentary (VMVt) mūsik'ukkaraṃ nāma mūsikāhi khanitvā bahi katapaṃsurāsi.
Sanskrit utkara
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)
ukkala

adj. from Ukkala; living in Ukkala [ukkala + a] ~

Grammar adj, from ukkala
Meaning from Ukkala; living in Ukkala
Construction ukkala + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (SNa) ukkalā'ti ukkalajanapadavāsino.
Sanskrit utkala
ukkalā

masc. inhabitants of the country Ukkala (modern day Orissa) [ukkala] ✗
ukkaṃsa

masc. increase; elevation; excellence [ud + √kas + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ukkaṃsati
Meaning increase; elevation; excellence
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Base √kas + a > kasa > kaṃsa (irreg)
Construction ud + kaṃsa + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > k
Antonym avakaṃsa
Commentary (DNa) ukkaṃs'āvakaṃse'ti ukkaṃs'āvakaṃsā. hāyanavaḍḍhanānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit utkarṣa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

doṇamite sukhadukkhe pariyantakate saṃsāre, n'atthi hāyanavaḍḍhane, n'atthi ukkaṃsa-avakaṃse.

DN 2.5 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
ukkaṃsaka

adj. praising; elevating; exalting [ud + √kas + a + aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ukkaṃsati
Meaning praising; elevating; exalting
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Base √kas + a > kasa > kaṃsa (irreg)
Construction ud + kaṃsa + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change d > k
Antonym vambhaka
Sanskrit utkarṣaka
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

att'ukkaṃsakaparavambhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, sandiṭṭhiparāmāsā ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggino, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, kuhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpicchā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpamittā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi asaddhammehi samannāgatā nigaṇṭhā'ti.

AN 10.78 nigaṇṭhasuttaṃ
ukkaṃsati

pr. (+acc) exalts; praises [ud + √kas] ✗
ukkaṃsato

ind. at the maximum ✗
ukkaṃsanā

fem. praising; elevating; exalting [ud + √kas + a + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from ukkaṃsati
Meaning praising; elevating; exalting
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Base √kas + a > kasa > kaṃsa (irreg)
Construction ud + kaṃsa + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Phonetic Change d > k
Antonym vambhanā
Sanskrit utkarṣaṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Example

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā att'ukkaṃsakā paravambhī araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, att'ukkaṃsanaparavambhanasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
ukkaṃsayati

pr. (also ukkaṃseti) exalts; praises [ud + √kas] ✗
ukkaṃsavakaṃsa

masc. excess and deficiency; superiority and inferiority; maximum and minimum ✗
ukkaṃsāvakaṃsa

nt. excellence or deficiency; increase or decrease; superiority or inferiority [ukkaṃsa + avakaṃsa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning excellence or deficiency; increase or decrease; superiority or inferiority
Construction ukkaṃsa + avakaṃsa
Compound dvanda (ukkaṃsa ca avakaṃsa ca)
Commentary (DNa) ukkaṃs'āvakaṃse'ti ukkaṃs'āvakaṃsā. hāyanavaḍḍhanānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Notes see SCPN §3, 10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit utkarṣa + apakarṣa

Example

doṇamite sukhadukkhe pariyantakate saṃsāre, n'atthi hāyanavaḍḍhane, n'atthi ukkaṃs'āvakaṃse.

DN 2.5 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
ukkaṃseti

pr. (+acc) exalts; praises; lit. causes to drag up [ud + √kas + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ukkaṃsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning exalts; praises; lit. causes to drag up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 *e (drag, draw)
Base √kas + *e > kāse > kaṃse (caus, irreg)
Construction ud + kaṃse + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Synonym samukkaṃsati, samukkaṃseti
Variant ukkaṃsati
Sanskrit utkarṣayati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Examples

ahaṃ kho'mhi uccākulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya uccākulīnatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

n'ev'attān'ukkaṃsissāma na paraṃ vambhissāmā'ti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ukkaṃsesi

aor. exalted, praised [ud + √kas] ✗
ukkā 1

fem. torch; firebrand ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning torch; firebrand
Sanskrit ulkā

Examples

atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto pañcasu hatthinikāsatesu paccekā itthiyo āropetvā ārohaṇīyaṃ nāgaṃ abhiruhitvā ukkāsu dhāriyamānāsu rājagahamhā niyyāsi

DN 2.2 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

maṃsapes'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. tiṇ'ukkā-upamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ukkā 2

fem. crucible; melting pot ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning crucible; melting pot
Synonym mūsā
Commentary (ANa) ukkaṃ bandheyyā'ti aṅgārakapallaṃ sajjeyya. (VISMa) ukkaṃ bandhatī'ti mūsaṃ sampādeti.
Sanskrit mūkā

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā ukkaṃ bandheyya, ukkaṃ bandhitvā ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpeyya, ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpetvā saṇḍāsena jātarūpaṃ gahetvā ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyya

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ
ukkā 3

fem. meteor ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning meteor
Sanskrit ulkā

Example

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ ... candaggāhaṃ sūriyaggāhaṃ sukkarāhucaritaṃ uḷuggahayuddhaṃ devadundubhissaraṃ okkanti ukkāpātaṃ ... sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
ukkācita

nt. boasting; bragging; empty talk; lit. talked up [ud + √kac + *e + ita] ~

Grammar nt, pp of ud √kac
Meaning boasting; bragging; empty talk; lit. talked up
Root Family ud √kac
Root √kac･8 *e (shine, bind)
Base √kac + *e > kāce
Construction ud + kāce + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change a > ā
d > k
Synonym ullapana
Variant okkācita
Commentary (ANa) ukkācitavinītā'ti appaṭipucchitvā vinītā dubbinītaparisā.
Sanskrit Root √kac √kañc 1 (shine, bind)
ukkācitavinīta

adj. trained in boastful talk [ukkācita + vinīta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning trained in boastful talk
Construction ukkācita + vinīta
Variant okkācitavinīta
Commentary (ANa) ukkācitavinītā'ti appaṭipucchitvā vinītā dubbinītaparisā.
Sanskrit ?? + vinīta
ukkādhāra

masc. torch-bearer [ukkā + dhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning torch-bearer
Construction ukkā + dhāra
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ukkaṃ + dhāra)
Commentary (ITIa) tathā ñāṇ'ukkā-ñāṇappabhā-dhamm'ukkā-dhammappabhānaṃ dhāraṇena karaṇena ca ukkādhārā'ti'pi
Sanskrit ulkā + dhārā

Example

evarūpā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū satthāro'ti'pi vuccanti, satthavāhā'ti'pi vuccanti, raṇañ'jahā'ti'pi vuccanti, tamonudā'ti'pi vuccanti, ālokakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, obhāsakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, pajjotakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, ukkādhārā'ti'pi vuccanti, pabhaṅ'karā'ti'pi vuccanti, ariyā'ti'pi vuccanti, cakkhumanto'ti'pi vuccantī'ti. etam'atthaṃ bhagavā avoca.

ITI 104 sīlasampannasuttaṃ
ukkāpata

masc. fall of a meteor ✗
ukkāpāta

masc. meteor shower; shooting star; lit. falling of meteors [ukkā + pāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning meteor shower; shooting star; lit. falling of meteors
Construction ukkā + pāta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ukkāya + pāta)
Sanskrit ulkāpāta

Example

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ ... candaggāhaṃ sūriyaggāhaṃ sukkarāhucaritaṃ uḷuggahayuddhaṃ devadundubhissaraṃ okkanti ukkāpātaṃ ... sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
ukkāmukha 1

nt. furnace; forge; lit. fire mouth [ukkā + mukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning furnace; forge; lit. fire mouth
Construction ukkā + mukha
Compound kammadhāraya (ukkā + mukha)
Commentary (MNa) ukkāmukhe'ti uddhane.
Sanskrit ulkā + mukha

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā ukkaṃ bandheyya, ukkaṃ bandhitvā ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpeyya, ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpetvā saṇḍāsena jātarūpaṃ gahetvā ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyya

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vatthaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ malaggahitaṃ acchodakaṃ āgamma parisuddhaṃ hoti pariyodātaṃ, ukkāmukhaṃ vā pan'āgamma jātarūpaṃ parisuddhaṃ hoti pariyodātaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
ukkāmukha 2

masc. name of one of the sons of king Okkāka ✗
ukkāra

masc. dung, excrement [ud + √kar] ✗
ukkārabhūmi

fem. dung-hill, unclean place ✗
ukkāsati

pr. coughs; clears one's throat; lit. coughs up [ud + √kās + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning coughs; clears one's throat; lit. coughs up
Root Family ud √kās
Root √kās･1 a (cough)
Base √kās + a > kāsa
Construction ud + kāsa + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkāsate
Sanskrit Root √kās 1 (cough)

Example

bhikkhussa ṭhit'okāsaṃ vā nisinn'okāsaṃ vā nipann'okāsaṃ vā āgantvā mantentaṃ ukkāsitabbaṃ, vijānāpetabbaṃ, no ce ukkāseyya vā vijānāpeyya vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
ukkāsi

aor. coughed, cleared one's throat [ud + √kās] ✗
ukkāsikā

fem. pad of cloth (for rubbing the body) ✗
ukkāsita 1

pp. coughed out [ud + √kās] ✗
ukkāsita 2

nt. coughing, clearing of one's throat [ud + √kās] ✗
ukkāsitabba

ptp. should cough; should clear one's throat; lit. to be coughed up [ud + √kās + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of ukkāsati
Meaning should cough; should clear one's throat; lit. to be coughed up
Root Family ud √kās
Root √kās･1 a (cough)
Construction ud + √kās + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkās
Sanskrit Root √kās 1 (cough)

Example

bhikkhussa ṭhit'okāsaṃ vā nisinn'okāsaṃ vā nipann'okāsaṃ vā āgantvā mantentaṃ ukkāsitabbaṃ, vijānāpetabbaṃ, no ce ukkāseyya vā vijānāpeyya vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
ukkāsitasadda

masc. sound of coughing ✗
ukkāsitvā

abs. having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having coughed up [ud + √kās + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ukkāsati, intrans
Meaning having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having coughed up
Root Family ud √kās
Root √kās･1 a (cough)
Construction ud + √kās + itvā
Phonetic Change d > k
Synonym ukkāsetvā
Sanskrit utkās
Sanskrit Root √kās 1 (cough)

Examples

atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.

DN 3.3 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā kathāpariyosānaṃ viditvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ukkāsetvā

abs. (+acc) having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having caused to cough up [ud + √kās + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ukkāseti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having caused to cough up
Root Family ud √kās
Root √kās･1 *e (cough)
Base √kās + e > kāse (caus)
Construction ud + kāse + tvā
Phonetic Change d > k
Synonym ukkāsitvā
Commentary (DNa) ukkāsitvā'ti ukkāsitasaddaṃ katvā.
Sanskrit utkāstvā
Sanskrit Root √kās 1 (cough)

Example

atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'upaṭṭhānasālā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhāsi kathāpariyosānaṃ āgamayamāno. atha kho bhagavā kathāpariyosānaṃ viditvā ukkāsetvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivariṃsu kho te bhikkhū bhagavato dvāraṃ.

adj. turned right way up [ud + √kujj + a] ✓

Phonetic Change d > k

Example

AN 3.30 avakujjasuttaṃ
ukkujjati

pr. holds or sets upright; holds or sets the right way up; especially turns (the bowl) the right way up (to accept food again from a layman whose alms had been refused) [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjana

nt. turning up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjanā

fem. setting upright; turning the right way up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjavakujja

nt. setting up and upsetting; rise and fall ✗
ukkujjāvakujjaṃ

ind. up and down; this way and that; (comm) arising and passing; lit. turned up and turned down [ukkujja + avakujja + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning up and down; this way and that; (comm) arising and passing; lit. turned up and turned down
Construction ukkujja + avakujja + aṃ
ukkujjāvakujja + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) ukkujj'āvakujjan'ti ettha ukkujjaṃ vuccati udayo, avakujjaṃ vayo'ti udayabbayavasena parivattento sammasanto'ti dīpeti.
ukkujji

aor. (+acc) turned up, bent up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjita

pp. turned up, bent up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjitvā

abs. (+acc) having turned upright [ud + √kujj + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ukkujjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having turned upright
Root Family ud √kujj
Root √kujj･1 a (turn)
Construction ud + √kujj + itvā
Phonetic Change d > k
Antonym nikkujjitvā
Sanskrit udubjya
Sanskrit Root √ubj 6 (force)

Example

atha kho bhagavā taṃ udak'ādhānaṃ ukkujjitvā āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, passasi no tvaṃ, rāhula, imaṃ udak'ādhānaṃ rittaṃ tucchan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
ukkujjeti

pr. (+acc) turns the right way up [ud + √kujj + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ukkujjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning turns the right way up
Root Family ud √kujj
Root √kujj･1 *e (turn)
Base √kujj + e > kujje (caus)
Construction ud + kujje + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Antonym nikkujjeti
Commentary (SNa) ukkujjeyyā'ti uparimukhaṃ kareyya.
Sanskrit udubjati
Sanskrit Root √ubj 6 (force)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
ukkuṭika 1

adj. squatting; sitting on haunches; lit. bent up [ud + √kuṭ + a + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from ukkuṭa
Meaning squatting; sitting on haunches; lit. bent up
Root Family ud √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction ud + √kuṭ + a + ika
ukkuṭa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkuṭaka
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

Examples

na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā,
n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ,
sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

DHP 141 daṇḍavaggo

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

na ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gantabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.3 khambhakatavaggo

Example

ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyoga

masc. bribing, defrauding, counterfeiting and dishonest dealing; (comm) crooked dealing by bribery, fraud and counterfeiting [ukkoṭana + vañcana + nikati + sāciyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bribing, defrauding, counterfeiting and dishonest dealing; (comm) crooked dealing by bribery, fraud and counterfeiting
Construction ukkoṭana + vañcana + nikati + sāciyoga
Compound dvanda (ukkoṭana ca vañcana ca nikati ca sāciyoga ca)
Commentary (DNa) sāciyogo'ti kuṭilayogo, etesaṃ'y'eva ukkoṭan'ādīnam'etaṃ nāmaṃ. tasmā, ukkoṭanasāciyogo, vañcanasāciyogo, nikatisāciyogo'ti, evam'ettha attho daṭṭhabbo. keci aññaṃ dassetvā aññassa parivattanaṃ sāciyogo'ti vadanti. taṃ pana vañcanen'eva saṅgahitaṃ.
Sanskrit utkocaka + vañcana + nikṛti + sāci + yoga

Example

dūteyyapahiṇagaman'ānuyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, kayavikkayā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, tulākūṭakaṃsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ

Synonym bhattaukkhalikā

ukkhaliparimajjana

nt. cleaning cauldrons; scouring pots [ukkhali + parimajjana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning cleaning cauldrons; scouring pots
Construction ukkhali + parimajjana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ukkhaliṃ + parimajjana)
Commentary (ANa) ukkhaliparimajjanan'ti ukkhaliparipuñchanaṃ
Sanskrit ukha + parimārjana
ukkhalimukhavaṭṭipidhānī

fem. rim and lid of the pot [ukkhali + mukhavaṭṭi + pidhānī] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning rim and lid of the pot
Construction ukkhali + mukhavaṭṭi + pidhānī
ukkhā

fem. cooking pot [ukkhā] ✗
ukkhāsata

nt. hundred cooking pots ✗
ukkhitta 1

pp. lifted up; drawn up; raised; lit. thrown up [ud + √khip + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ukkhipati
Meaning lifted up; drawn up; raised; lit. thrown up
Root Family ud √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ud + √khip + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
p > t
Antonym anukkhitta
Synonym uccārita
Sanskrit utkṣipta
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sāmuddikāya nāvāya vettabandhanabaddhāya vassamāsāni udake pariyādāya hem'antikena thalaṃ ukkhittāya vāt'ātapaparetāni vettabandhanāni.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ

puriso ca te ukkhitta-asiko piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhissati. yatth'eva naṃ thokam'pi chaḍḍessati tatth'eva te siro pātessatī'ti.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
ukkhitta 2

pp. (vinaya) suspended; lit. thrown up [ud + √khip + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ukkhipati
Meaning (vinaya) suspended; lit. thrown up
Root Family ud √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ud + √khip + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
p > t
Antonym anukkhitta
Sanskrit utkṣipta
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Examples

akaṭ'ānudhammo nāma ukkhitto anosārito.

VIN 2.5.7.9 ukkhittasambhogasikkhāpadaṃ

yattakā bhikkhū tassa uposathakammassa pattā yuttā anurūpā, sabb'antimena paricchedena cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā, saṅghena anukkhitā, te ca kho hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā ekasīmayaṃ ṭhitā.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
ukkhittaojjagghikā

fem. raised (robe) and loud laughter ✗

Grammar masc, from ukkhitta
Meaning suspended monk
Root Family ud √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ud + √khip + ta + ka

Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > k
p > t
Sanskrit utkṣipta +
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Examples

puggal'ānādariyaṃ nāma upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno ayaṃ ukkhittako vā vambhito vā garahito vā, imassa vacanaṃ akataṃ bhavissatī'ti anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.4 anādariyasikkhāpadaṃ

saṃvaseyya vā'ti ukkhittakena saddhiṃ uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā saṅghakammaṃ vā karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

p > t
Commentary (VINa) ukkhittakāyā'ti ukkhepena, ittham'bhūtalakkhaṇe karaṇavacanaṃ ekato vā ubhato vā ukkhittacīvaro hutvā'ti attho.
Notes agreeing with unexpressed feminine saṅghāṭi
Sanskrit utkṣipta +
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Examples

na ukkhittakāya antaraghare gamissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

na ukkhittakāya antaraghare nisīdissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

adj. who has raised the crossbar; who has lifted the obstacle [ukkhitta + paligha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has raised the crossbar; who has lifted the obstacle
Construction ukkhitta + paligha

Commentary (DHPa) idaṃ sabbam'pi chinditvā ṭhitaṃ avijjāpalighassa ukkhittattā ukkhittapalighaṃ
Sanskrit utkṣipta + parigha

Examples

chetvā naddhiṃ varattañ'ca,
sandānaṃ sah'anukkamaṃ,
ukkhittapalighaṃ buddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 398 brāhmaṇavaggo

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ukkhittapaligho iti'pi, saṃkiṇṇaparikkho iti'pi, abbūḷh'esiko iti'pi, niraggaḷo iti'pi, ariyo pannaddhajo pannabhāro visaṃyutto iti'pi.

Examples

AN 6.103 ukkhittāsikasuttaṃ

puriso ca te ukkhitt'āsiko piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhissati. yatth'eva naṃ thokam'pi chaḍḍessati tatth'eva te siro pātessatī'ti.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
ukkhittāsikasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.103 (AN6.103) ✗
ukkhipati 1

pr. (+acc) throws out; suspends; lit. throws up [ud + √khip + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning throws out; suspends; lit. throws up
Root Family ud √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Base √khip + a > khipa
Construction ud + khipa + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkṣipati
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Example

atha kho naṃ khippam'eva sannipatitvā ukkhipati. kiñ'cā'pi so hoti majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinno, atha kho so ārakā'va saṅghamhā, saṅgho ca tena

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
ukkhipati 2

pr. (+acc) raises up; lifts up; holds up; lit. throws up [ud + √khip + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning raises up; lifts up; holds up; lit. throws up
Root Family ud √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Base √khip + a > khipa
Construction ud + khipa + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Synonym paggaṇhati, paggaṇhāti
Sanskrit utkṣipati
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Example

brāhmaṇo evam'āha, ukkhipa laṅgiṃ, abhikkhaṇa, sumedha, satthaṃ ādāyā'ti. abhikkhaṇanto sumedho satthaṃ ādāya addasa uddhumāyikaṃ. uddhumāyikā, bhadante'ti.

Example

DNa 2.4.2 mahāsudassanasuttavaṇṇanā

Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ud + √khip + itvā

Examples

na ukkhittakāya antaraghare gantabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā ukkhipitvā antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo

dhātiyo ayyaputto ekako'ti vegena sāṇiṃ ukkhipitvā anto pavisamānā bodhisattaṃ sayane pallaṅkena nisinnaṃ tañ'ca pāṭihāriyaṃ disvā gantvā rañño ārocayiṃsu

ukkhipiyati

ukkhipiyyati

pr. is raised; is thrown up or about [ud + √khip] ✗

prp. being raised; being lifted; lit. being thrown up [ud + √khip + īya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ukkhipīyati, pass, intrans
Meaning being raised; being lifted; lit. being thrown up

Root √khip･1 īya (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Base √khip + īya > khipīya (pass)
Construction ud + khipīya + māna

Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkṣipyamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Example

cakkhussa rahonāma na sakkā hoti akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇīyamāne bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne sīsaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne passituṃ. sotassa rahonāma na sakkā hoti pakatikathā sotuṃ.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ

Examples

satthaṃ isīnaṃ sahas'ādiyitvā,
māraṃ sasenaṃ sahasā bhañjissaṃ,
sīh'āsane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cattāro āsīvisā uggatejā ghoravisā. atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo.

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ

Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kūṭ'āgāre vā kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ vā pācīnavātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi vā panānanda, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ sūriye uggacchante, jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, andhakāro antaradhāyissati, āloko pātubhavissatī'ti?

AN 6.62 purisindriyañāṇasuttaṃ
uggacchamāna

prp. (+abl) rising; coming up (from) [ud + √gam + a + māna] ~

Grammar prp of uggacchati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning rising; coming up (from)
Root Family ud √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ud + gaccha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym uggacchanta
Sanskrit udgacchamāna
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
uggacchi 1

aor. (+abl) arose (from); came up (from); suddenly appeared (from); lit. went up [ud + √gam + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of uggacchati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning arose (from); came up (from); suddenly appeared (from); lit. went up
Root Family ud √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ud + gaccha + i
Phonetic Change d > g
Variant uggañchi
Sanskrit udgam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

atha kho nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa bhagavato sakkāraṃ asahamānassa tatth'eva uṇhaṃ lohitaṃ mukhato uggacchī'ti.

aor. shouted out [ud + √gajj] ✗
uggañchi

aor. (+abl) arose (from); came up (from); suddenly appeared (from); lit. went up [ud + √gam + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of uggacchati, intrans (+abl)

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
uggañchitvāna

Phonetic Change d > g
m > n
Synonym uggantvā, ummujjitvā
Sanskrit udgantvā
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
uggaṇhana

nt. learning, studying [ud + √gah] ✗
uggaṇhanta

prp. (+acc) grasping; learning; lit. picking up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + nta] ~

Grammar prp of uggaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasping; learning; lit. picking up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction ud + gaṇhā + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > g
Sanskrit udgrahṇat
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)
uggaṇhāti 1

pr. (+acc) picks up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning picks up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction ud + gaṇhā + ti
Phonetic Change d > g
Commentary (VIN 2.5.9.4) uggaṇheyyā'ti sayaṃ gaṇhāti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
Sanskrit udgṛhṇāti
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā aññatra ajjhārāmā vā ajjhāvasathā vā uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 84 ratanasikkhāpadaṃ
uggaṇhāti 2

pr. (+acc) takes; accepts; lit. picks up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning takes; accepts; lit. picks up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction ud + gaṇhā + ti
Phonetic Change d > g
Synonym paṭiggaṇhāti, paṭiggaheti, patigaṇhāti, patiggaṇhāti
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.8) uggaṇheyyā'ti sayaṃ gaṇhāti nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ
Sanskrit udgṛhṇāti
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu jātarūparajataṃ uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 18 rūpiyasikkhāpadaṃ
uggaṇhāti 3

pr. (+acc) grasps; learns; understands; comprehends; lit. picks up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasps; learns; understands; comprehends; lit. picks up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction ud + gaṇhā + ti
Phonetic Change d > g
Synonym vijānāti, sammasati
Sanskrit udgṛhṇāti
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

na c'eva lābhī hoti diṭṭh'eva dhamme sukhavihārānaṃ, na lābhī satisampajaññassa. taṃ kissa hetu? tathā hi so, bhikkhave, bālo abyatto akusalo bhikkhu sakassa cittassa nimittaṃ na uggaṇhāti.

SN 47.8 sūdasuttaṃ

uggaṇhātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. pariyāpuṇātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. dhāretha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. atthasaṃhitā, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā ādibrahmacariyikā'ti.

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ

Example

tena kho pana samayena uggatasarīrassa brāhmaṇassa mahāyañño upakkhaṭo hoti. pañca usabhasatāni thūṇ'ūpanītāni honti yaññ'atthāya, pañca vacchatarasatāni thūṇ'ūpanītāni honti yaññ'atthāya

uggateja

adj. powerful and piercing; of fiery might; blazing hot [ugga + teja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp

Construction ugga + teja
Compound dvanda (ugga ca teja ca)
Sanskrit ugra + teja

Examples

kadā nu paññāmayam'uggatejaṃ,
satthaṃ isīnaṃ sahas'ādiyitvā,
māraṃ sasenaṃ sahasā bhañjissaṃ,
sīh'āsane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

yo andhakāre tamasi pabhaṅ'karo,
verocano maṇḍalī uggatejo.
mā rāhu gilī caram'antalikkhe,
pajaṃ mamaṃ rāhu pamuñca sūriyan'ti.

SN 2.10 sūriyasuttaṃ
uggattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 80 (TH80) ✗

inf. to rise; to go up [ud + √gam] ✗

Sanskrit udgantvā

uggaputta

masc. member of the ugga caste ✗
uggama 1

uggama 2

masc. increase [ud + √gam] ✗

Meaning (of the sun) rises; ascends; comes up; lit. goes up

Sanskrit udgacchati

Example

obhāsati tāva so kimi,
yāva na uggamati pabhaṅ'karo,
sa verocanamhi uggate,
hatappabho hoti na c'āpi bhāsati.

VIN 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ
uggamana 2

nt. increase [ud + √gam] ✗
uggamissati

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bho gotama, sārīrikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambho'pi nāma bhavissati, hadayam'pi nāma phalissati, uṇham'pi lohitaṃ mukhato uggamissati, ummādam'pi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uggamma

ger. rising; going up [ud + √gam] ✗
uggayha 1

ger. (+acc) taking up; grasping; embracing; holding (onto); taking a stand (on) [ud + √gah + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of uggaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking up; grasping; embracing; holding (onto); taking a stand (on)
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction ud + √gah + ya > gayha
Phonetic Change d > g
hy > yh (metathesis)
Synonym upādā, upādāya, samuggahāya
Sanskrit udgṛhya
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti,
idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi,
vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

yehi vivitto vicareyya loke,
na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo,
jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā,
jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ,
evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho,
kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

aṭṭhakavaggo 9

ñatvā ca so sammutiyo puthujjā,
upekkhatī uggahaṇanti m'aññe.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
uggahanimitta

nt. learning-sign in meditation ✗

Sanskrit udgrāha + paripṛcchā + vaśena
uggahasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.33 (AN5.33) ✗
uggahāpeti

pr. causes to pick up; makes take or accept; makes learn, teaches [ud + √gah] ✗
uggahāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having made pick up; having caused to pick up [ud + √gah + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uggaṇhāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having made pick up; having caused to pick up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 *āpe (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + *āpe > gāhāpe > gahāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ud + gahāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change d > g
Sanskrit udgrah
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhunā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbaṃ, yassa bhavissati, so harissatī'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

VIN PAT PC 84 ratanasikkhāpadaṃ
uggahāyati

pr. (+acc) picks up; takes up; grasps hold (of); catches hold (of) [ud + √gah + ṇhā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning picks up; takes up; grasps hold (of); catches hold (of)
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahāya (irreg)
Construction ud + gahāya + ti
Phonetic Change d > g
Antonym nirassajati
Sanskrit udgṛbhāyati
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

purimaṃ pahāya aparaṃ sitāse,
ej'ānugā te na taranti saṅgaṃ,
te uggahāyanti nirassajanti,
kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
uggahita 1

pp. learned; studied; acquired; lit. picked up [ud + √gah + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of uggaṇhāti
Meaning learned; studied; acquired; lit. picked up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction ud + √gah + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change d > g
Antonym anuggahita
Sanskrit udgrāhita
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

aññātavāde na saṇṭhātī'ti aññātavāde jānitavāde na saṇṭhāti. kathaṃ? ekacco pañhaṃ pucchati, taṃ itaro, manāpo tayā pañho pucchito, kahaṃ te esa uggahito'ti vadati.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā

aparo pañhaṃ puṭṭho katheti, tam'añño, suṭṭhu te pañho kathito, kattha te uggahito, pañhaṃ kathentena nāma evaṃ kathetabbo'ti vadati.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā
uggahita 2

pp. raised [ud + √gah] ✗
uggahita 3

pp. taken wrongly [ud + √gah] ✗
uggahitakālasadisa

adj. like the time when it was learned [uggahita + kāla + sadisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like the time when it was learned
Construction uggahita + kāla + sadisa
uggahitapaṭiggahitaka

adj. received formally after being picked up or taken (by oneself ✗
uggahitabuddhavacana

nt. learned discourse of the Buddha [uggahita + buddhavacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning learned discourse of the Buddha
Construction uggahita + buddhavacana
uggahitasippa

adj. learned the craft; acquired the skill [uggahita + sippa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning learned the craft; acquired the skill
Construction uggahita + sippa
uggahituṃ

inf. to learn; to study; to pick up [ud + √gah] ✗
uggahīta

pp. grasped; held onto; raised up; lit. picked up [ud + √gah + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of uggaṇhāti
Meaning grasped; held onto; raised up; lit. picked up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction ud + √gah + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change d > g
with metrically lengthened ī
Antonym niratta, anuggahīta
Sanskrit udgṛhīta
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

kāmesu vinaya gedhaṃ,
nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato,
uggahītaṃ nirattaṃ vā,
mā te vijjittha kiñcanaṃ.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11
uggahetabba

ptp. should be learned; should be grasped; lit. to be picked up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of uggaṇhāti
Meaning should be learned; should be grasped; lit. to be picked up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahe (irreg)
Construction ud + gahe + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change d > g
Sanskrit udgrahītavya
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti na sotaṃ odahissanti na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.

SN 20.7 āṇisuttaṃ
uggahetar 1

masc. who grasps; who comprehends ✗
uggahetar 2

masc. who learns or takes up ✗
uggahetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to learn; to grasp; lit. to pick up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + tuṃ] ~

Grammar inf of uggaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning to learn; to grasp; lit. to pick up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahe (irreg)
Construction ud + gahe + tuṃ
Phonetic Change d > g
Sanskrit udgrahitum
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)
uggahetvā 1

abs. (+acc) having picked up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uggaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having picked up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahe (irreg)
Construction ud + gahe + tvā
Phonetic Change d > g
Sanskrit udgṛbhītvā
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhunā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbaṃ, yassa bhavissati, so harissatī'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

VIN PAT PC 84 ratanasikkhāpadaṃ
uggahetvā 3

abs. (+acc) having learned; having memorized; lit. having picked up [ud + √gah + ṇhā + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uggaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having learned; having memorized; lit. having picked up
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahe (irreg)
Construction ud + gahe + tvā
Phonetic Change d > g
Sanskrit udgṛbhītvā
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Examples

atha kho sabhiyo paribbājako tassā devatāya santike te pañhe uggahetvā ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇ'ācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa ... te upasaṅkamitvā te pañhe pucchati.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti … sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti

Synonym sāsa, svāsa
uggāhaka

adj. who is learning ✗
uggāhamāna

masc. name of a wandering ascetic ✗
uggira

masc. raising ✗
uggiraṇa 1

nt. utterance [ud + √gir] ✗
uggiraṇa 2

nt. brandishing of [ud + √gir] ✗
uggirati 1

pr. (+acc) (of a weapon) lifts up; raises; brandishes [ud + √gir + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a weapon) lifts up; raises; brandishes
Root Family ud √gir
Root √gir･1 a (raise)
Base √gir + a > gira
Construction ud + gira + ti
Phonetic Change d > g
Synonym uccāreti, uddharati, unnāmeti
Commentary (VIN 2.5.8.5) talasattikaṃ uggireyyā'ti kāyaṃ vā kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ vā antamaso uppalapattam'pi uccāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
Sanskrit udgurate
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa kupito anattamano talasattikaṃ uggireyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 75 talasattikasikkhāpadaṃ
uggirati 2

pr. (+acc) utters [ud + √gir] ✗

Root √gir･1 a (raise)

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ rañño pasenadissa kosalassa koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pivitvā gharaṃ āgantvā uggiritvāna dadeyyaṃ, yaṃ imissā vijātāya bhavissatī'ti.

UD 16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
uggilati

pr. vomits [ud + √gil] ✗
uggili

aor. vomited [ud + √gil] ✗
uggilituṃ

inf. (+acc) to cough up; to hack up; to retch up; to vomit up [ud + √gil + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of uggilati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to cough up; to hack up; to retch up; to vomit up
Root Family ud √gil
Root √gil･1 a (eat, swallow)
Construction ud + √gil + ituṃ
Antonym ogilituṃ
Commentary (MNa) uggilitun'ti dve ante mocetvā kathetuṃ asakkonto uggilituṃ bahi nīharituṃ na sakkhiti.
Sanskrit udgaritum
Sanskrit Root √gṛ √gṝ √gir 6, 9 (swallow)

Example

imaṃ kho te, rājakumāra, samaṇo gotamo ubhatokoṭikaṃ pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno n'eva sakkhiti uggilituṃ na sakkhiti ogilituṃ.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
ugghaṭita 1.1

pp. contracted; condensed; abbreviated [ud + √ghaṭ + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of ud √ghaṭ
Meaning contracted; condensed; abbreviated
Root Family ud √ghaṭ
Root √ghaṭ･1 a (join together)
Construction ud + √ghaṭ + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym saṅkhitta
Commentary (ANa) katamo ca puggalo ugghaṭitaññū, yassa puggalassa saha udāhaṭavelāya dhamm'ābhisamayo hoti, ayaṃ vuccati puggalo ugghaṭitaññū.
Sanskrit udghaṭita
Sanskrit Root √ghaṭ 1 (strive)

Example

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. katame cattāro? ugghaṭitaññū, vipañcitaññū, neyyo, padaparamo, ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

AN 4.133 ugghaṭitaññūsuttaṃ
ugghaṭita 2.1

adj. keen, striving [ud + √ghaṭ] ✗
ugghaṭitaññū

adj. who grasps the meaning of a brief statement [ugghaṭita + ñū] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who grasps the meaning of a brief statement
Construction ugghaṭita + ñū
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ugghaṭitaṃ + ñū)
Commentary (ANa) katamo ca puggalo ugghaṭitaññū, yassa puggalassa saha udāhaṭavelāya dhamm'ābhisamayo hoti, ayaṃ vuccati puggalo ugghaṭitaññū.
Sanskrit udghaṭitajña (bsk)

Example

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. katame cattāro? ugghaṭitaññū, vipañcitaññū, neyyo, padaparamo, ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

AN 4.133 ugghaṭitaññūsuttaṃ
ugghaṭitaññūsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.133 (AN4.133) ✗
ugghaṭeti

pr. opens, unlocks; unveils, reveals [ud + √ghaṭ] ✗
ugghaṭṭa

pp. rubbed; scratched [ud + √ghaṃs] ✗
ugghaṭṭapāda

adj. with rubbed feet, footsore ✗
ugghaṭṭha

pp. rubbed; scratched [ud + √ghaṃs] ✗
ugghara

adj. (or uggharanta) dripping; oozing ✗
uggharati

pr. oozes [ud + √ghar] ✗
uggharanta

prp. oozing up; overflowing; lit. dripping up [ud + √ghar + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of uggharati, intrans
Meaning oozing up; overflowing; lit. dripping up
Root Family ud √ghar
Root √ghar･1 a (drip)
√ In Comps gghar
Base √ghar + a > ghara
Construction ud + ghara + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > g
Commentary (ANa) uggharantan'ti uparimukhehi chiddehi nikkhamamānayūsaṃ.
Sanskrit ud + ghārayat
Sanskrit Root √ghṛ 1, 3 (drip)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso medakathālikaṃ parihareyya chidd'āvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharāmi chidd'āvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ.

Examples

aññavādako nāma saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetu'kāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetu'kāmo aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati

VIN 2.5.2.2 aññavādakasikkhāpadaṃ

vihesako nāma saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetu'kāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetu'kāmo tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ viheseti. eso vihesako nāma.

VIN 2.5.2.2 aññavādakasikkhāpadaṃ

ugghāṭesi

ugghāti 1

Grammar fem, from ugghāṭeti
Meaning victory; elation; winning blow
Root Family ud √ghaṭ
Root √ghaṭ･8 *e (strike, kill)

Phonetic Change d > g
a > ā
ṭ > t
Antonym nighāti
Sanskrit udghātin
Sanskrit Root √han √ghaṭ 1, 2, 8 (smite)

Example

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

ucca 1

adj. high; tall [ud + tya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ud
Meaning high; tall
Construction ud + tya
Derivative taddhita (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Antonym nīca, avaca
Sanskrit ucca

Examples

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

na nīce āsane nisīditvā ucce āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 69 nīcāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
ucca 2

adj. noble; distinguished; eminent; lit. high [ud + tya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ud
Meaning noble; distinguished; eminent; lit. high
Construction ud + tya
Derivative taddhita (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Synonym ariya, mahanta
Sanskrit ucca

Example

āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ,
saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ,
ratiyo patthayantena,
uḷārā apar'āparā.

SN 3.17 attabyābādhasuttaṃ
uccaka

adj. high, tall ✗

nt. high work; important work [ucca + kamma] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning high work; important work
Construction ucca + kamma

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha
uccaṭṭhāniya

adj. (one) of high rank ✗
uccaṭhāniya

adj. (one) of high rank ✗

Grammar adj, compar of ucca
Meaning higher; loftier
Construction ud + tya + tara
ucca + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
uccati 1

pr. is said; is called [√vac + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of vacati, intrans
Meaning is said; is called
Root Family √vac
Root √vac･1 ya (say, speak)
Base √vac > vuc + ya > vucca > ucca (pass, irreg)
Construction ucca + ti
Phonetic Change va > u
y > c
Variant vuccati
Sanskrit ucyate, vācyate
Sanskrit Root √vac 2, 3 (speak)

Examples

tassa vaḍḍhanti vedanā,
anekā rūpasambhavā,
abhijjhā ca vihesā ca,
cittam'ass'ūpahaññati,
evaṃ ācinato dukkhaṃ,
ārā nibbānam'uccati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

sabbehi dhātūhi bhāvakammesu yapaccayo hoti. ṭhīyate, bujjhate, paccate, labbhate, karīyate, yujjate, uccate. bhāvakammesū'ti kim'atthaṃ? karoti, pacati, paṭhati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 440
uccati 2

pr. (gram) is pronounced; is articulated [√vac + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of vacati, intrans
Meaning (gram) is pronounced; is articulated
Root Family √vac
Root √vac･1 ya (say, speak)
Base √vac > vuc + ya > vucca > ucca (pass, irreg)
Construction ucca + ti
Phonetic Change va > u
y > c
Notes uccante is pr reflx 3rd pl "they are pronounced"
Sanskrit ucyate, vācyate
Sanskrit Root √vac 2, 3 (speak)

Example

saṃyogato pubbe eo rassā iva-uccante kvaci, anantarā byañjanā saṃyogo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

uccaya

masc. heap; pile; accumulation [ud + √ci + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from uccināti
Meaning heap; pile; accumulation
Root Family ud √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction ud + √ci > cay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > c
i > ay
Synonym upacaya, khandha, khala, caya, puñja, rāsi, sannicaya, samussaya
Sanskrit uccaya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Examples

pāpañ'ce puriso kayirā,
na naṃ kayirā punappunaṃ,
na tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha,
dukkho pāpassa uccayo.

puññañ'ce puriso kayirā,
kayirāth'etaṃ punappunaṃ,
tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha,
sukho puññassa uccayo.

a > ā

uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī

jegucchī hoti uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā abhinisīdituṃ vā abhinipajjituṃ vā.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

uccāraṇa 1

uccārapassāva

masc. excrement and urine [uccāra + passāva] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning excrement and urine
Construction uccāra + passāva
Compound dvanda (uccāra ca passāva ca)
Sanskrit uccāraprasrāva

Examples

asitapītakhāyitasāyitassa kho, nāgita, uccārapassāvo, eso tassa nissando.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ

asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
uccārapassāvakamma

nt. going to the toilet; defecating and urinating; lit. making excrement and urine [uccāra + passāva + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning going to the toilet; defecating and urinating; lit. making excrement and urine
Construction uccāra + passāva + kamma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (uccārapassāvaṃ + kamma)
Commentary (MNa) uccārapassāvakamme'ti uccārassa ca passāvassa ca karaṇe.
Sanskrit uccāraprasrāva + karman

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, aññatr'eva asitapītakhāyitasāyitā aññatra uccārapassāvakammā aññatra niddākilamathapaṭivinodanā vassasat'āyuko vassasatajīvī vassasataṃ gantvā appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ antarā'y'eva kālaṅ'kato.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī ahosiṃ.

VIN PAT SE 75 udakeuccārasikkhāpadaṃ
uccārita 1

pp. raised; lifted up [ud + √car + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of uccāreti, caus
Meaning raised; lifted up
Root Family ud √car
Root √car･1 *e (move, walk)
Base √car + *e > cāre (caus)
Construction ud + cāre + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change d > c
a > ā
Synonym ukkhitta
Sanskrit ucchrita
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

anatirittaṃ nāma akappiyakataṃ hoti, appaṭiggahitakataṃ hoti, anuccāritakataṃ hoti, ahatthapāse kataṃ hoti, abhuttāvinā kataṃ hoti, bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti

VIN 2.5.4.5 paṭhamapavāraṇāsikkhāpadaṃ

pp. uttered, pronounced [ud + √car] ✗

Construction uccārita + kata

Example

VIN 2.5.4.5 paṭhamapavāraṇāsikkhāpadaṃ
uccāreti 1

pr. (+acc) raises; lifts up; lit. causes to move up [ud + √car + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ud √car, trans (+acc)
Meaning raises; lifts up; lit. causes to move up
Root Family ud √car
Root √car･1 *e (move, walk)
Base √car + *e > cāre (caus)
Construction ud + cāre + ti
Phonetic Change d > c
a > ā
Synonym uggirati, uddharati, unnāmeti
Sanskrit uccārayati
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

talasattikaṃ uggireyyā'ti kāyaṃ vā kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ vā antamaso uppalapattam'pi uccāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.4 pahārasikkhāpadaṃ
uccāreti 2

pr. (+acc) utters, pronounces [ud + √car] ✗
uccāretuṃ

inf. to raise; to lift up [ud + √car] ✗
uccāretvā

abs. (+acc) having hoisted up; having loaded up; having lifted up; lit. having caused to move up [ud + √car + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uccāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having hoisted up; having loaded up; having lifted up; lit. having caused to move up
Root Family ud √car
Root √car･1 *e (move, walk)
Base √car + *e > cāre (caus)
Construction ud + cāre + tvā
Phonetic Change d > c
a > ā
Variant uccopetvā
Sanskrit uccarayitvā
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ kullaṃ sīse vā āropetvā khandhe vā uccāretvā yena kāmaṃ pakkameyyan'ti.

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bite of a hairy caterpillar
Construction uccāliṅgapāṇaka + daṭṭha
Commentary (VINa) uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭh'ūpatthambhe'ti uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭhena aṅgajāte upatthambhe. uccāliṅgapāṇakā nāma lomasapāṇakā honti, tesaṃ lomehi phuṭṭhaṃ aṅgajātaṃ kaṇḍuṃ gahetvā thaddhaṃ hoti, tattha yasmā tāni lomāni aṅgajātaṃ ḍaṃsantāni viya vijjhanti, tasmā uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭhenā'ti vuttaṃ, atthato pana uccāliṅgapāṇakalomavedhanenā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭhūpatthambha

masc. erection due to the bite of a caterpillar [uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭha + upatthambha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning erection due to the bite of a caterpillar
Construction uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭha + upatthambha
Commentary (VINa) uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭh'ūpatthambhe'ti uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭhena aṅgajāte upatthambhe. uccāliṅgapāṇakā nāma lomasapāṇakā honti, tesaṃ lomehi phuṭṭhaṃ aṅgajātaṃ kaṇḍuṃ gahetvā thaddhaṃ hoti, tattha yasmā tāni lomāni aṅgajātaṃ ḍaṃsantāni viya vijjhanti, tasmā uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭhenā'ti vuttaṃ, atthato pana uccāliṅgapāṇakalomavedhanenā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
uccāvaca 1

adj. high and low; here and there; good and bad; elation and depression [ucca + avaca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning high and low; here and there; good and bad; elation and depression
Construction ucca + avaca
Compound dvanda (ucca ca avaca ca)
Commentary (VINa) ucc'āvacehi ākārehī'ti mahant'āmahantehi upāyehi.
Sanskrit uccāvaca

Examples

sabbattha ve sappurisā cajanti,
na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo,
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena,
na ucc'āvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

DHP 83 paṇḍitavaggo

sayaṃ samādāya vatāni jantu,
ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati saññasatto,
vidvā ca vedehi samecca dhammaṃ,
na ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati bhūripañño.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
uccāvaca 2

adj. diverse; various kinds of; manifold; lit. high and low [ucca + avaca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning diverse; various kinds of; manifold; lit. high and low
Construction ucca + avaca
Compound dvanda (ucca ca avaca ca)
Synonym nānatta
Commentary (SNa) ucc'āvacā'ti aññesu ṭhānesu paṇītaṃ uccaṃ vuccati, hīnaṃ avacaṃ. idha pana ucc'āvacā'ti nānāvidhā vaṇṇanibhā. (SNa) uccāvacehī'ti nānāvidhehi.
Sanskrit uccāvaca

Examples

atha kho susimassa devaputtassa devaputtaparisā āyasmato sāriputtassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamanā pamuditā pītisomanassajātā ucc'āvacā vaṇṇanibhā upadaṃseti.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ

ucc'āvacehi vaṇṇehi,
urago carati tejasī,
so āsajja ḍaṃse bālaṃ,
naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
uccāvaca 3

adj. large and small; important and minor; lit. high and low [ucca + avaca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning large and small; important and minor; lit. high and low
Construction ucca + avaca
Compound dvanda (ucca ca avaca ca)
Commentary (ANa) uccāvacānī'ti mahantakhuddakāni. (ANa) uccāvacānī'ti uccanīcāni.
Sanskrit uccāvaca

Examples

puna caparaṃ, subhūti, bhikkhu yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tatra dakkho hoti analaso tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgato alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.

AN 11.14 subhūtisuttaṃ

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'cā'pi yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tattha ussukkaṃ āpanno hoti, atha khv'āssa tibb'āpekkhā hoti adhisīlasikkhāya adhicittasikkhāya adhipaññāsikkhāya.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
uccāsadda 1

masc. loud noise; great racket; lit. high sound [uccā + sadda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning loud noise; great racket; lit. high sound
Construction uccā + sadda
Compound kammadhāraya (uccā + sadda)
Sanskrit ucca + śabda

Examples

tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṃ nisinno hoti unnādiniyā uccāsaddamahāsaddāya anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathentiyā.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū uccāsaddaṃ mahāsaddaṃ karontā antaraghare gacchanti

VIN 2.7.2 ujjagghikavaggo
uccāsadda 2

adj. making a loud noise; making an enormous racket [uccā + sadda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning making a loud noise; making an enormous racket
Construction uccā + sadda
Compound kammadhāraya (uccā + sadda)
Sanskrit ucca + śabda

Example

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī bhadrehi bhadrehi yānehi parapurāya uccāsaddā mahāsaddā mahāvanaṃ ajjhogāhanti bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ
uccāsaddamahāsadda

adj. making an enormous racket; making a great commotion [uccā + sadda + mahā + sadda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning making an enormous racket; making a great commotion
Construction uccā + sadda + mahā + sadda
Compound dvanda (uccāsadda ca mahāsadda ca)
Commentary (ANa) uddhaṃ uggatattā ucco, rāsibhāvena ca mahā saddo etesan'ti uccāsaddamahāsaddā.
Sanskrit ucca + śabda + mahā + śabda

Examples

tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṃ nisinno hoti unnādiniyā uccāsaddamahāsaddāya anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathentiyā.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu

atha kho icchānaṅgalakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tassā rattiyā accayena pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya yena icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhaṃsu uccāsaddamahāsaddā.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
uccāsayana

nt. large bed; lit. high bed [uccā + sayana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning large bed; lit. high bed
Construction uccā + sayana
Compound kammadhāraya (uccā + sayana)
Commentary (MNa) uccāsayanaṃ vuccati pamāṇ'ātikkantaṃ.
Sanskrit uccā + śayana

Example

uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato hoti jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ
uccāsayanamahāsayana

nt. large and luxurious beds [uccā + sayana + mahā + sayana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning large and luxurious beds
Construction uccā + sayana + mahā + sayana
Compound dvanda (uccāsayana ca mahāsayana ca)
Commentary (MNa) uccāsayanaṃ vuccati pamāṇātikkantaṃ. mahāsayanaṃ akappiyattharaṇaṃ. tato paṭivirato'ti attho.
Sanskrit uccā + śayana + mahāśayana

Example

uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
uccāsayanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.82 (SN56.82) ✗
uccāsoṇḍaṃ paggahetvā

idiom. arrogantly; with an attitude; (comm) drunk on conceit; lit. having raised trunk high ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + abs
Meaning arrogantly; with an attitude; (comm) drunk on conceit; lit. having raised trunk high
Commentary (ANa) soṇḍan'ti mānasoṇḍaṃ.

Example

tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na uccāsoṇḍaṃ paggahetvā kulāni upasaṅkamissāmī'ti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

Grammar fem, comp

Commentary (ANa) soṇḍan'ti mānasoṇḍaṃ.

tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na uccāsoṇḍaṃ paggahetvā kulāni upasaṅkamissāmī'ti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
ucciṭṭha

adj. left over (food or drink), impure, used ✗
uccinati

pr. gathers, collects; picks out, selects; sorts out, sets in order [ud + √ci] ✗
uccināti

pr. selects, chooses, picks out [ud + √ci] ✗
uccini

aor. selected, chose, picked out [ud + √ci] ✗
uccinitvā

abs. having selected, having chosen, having picked out [ud + √ci] ✗
uccopetvā

abs. (+acc) having raised up; having lifted up; lit. having caused to move up [ud + √cup + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uccopeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having raised up; having lifted up; lit. having caused to move up
Root Family ud √cup
Root √cup･1 *e (move)
Base √cup + *e > cope (caus)
Construction ud + cope + tvā
Synonym ukkhipitvā, ussāpetvā, paggahetvā
Variant uccāretvā
Sanskrit ud + cupayitvā
Sanskrit Root √cup 1 (stir)

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ kullaṃ sīse vā āropetvā khandhe vā uccopetvā yena kāmaṃ pakkameyyan'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ucchaṅga 1

masc. bag; backpack; lit. lap [ud + √sañj + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning bag; backpack; lit. lap
Root Family ud √sañj
Root √sañj･1 a (clasp, embrace)
Construction ud + √sañj > saṅg > chaṅg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > c
s > ch
ñj > ṅg
Sanskrit utsaṅga
Sanskrit Root √sañj √svañj 1 (embrace)

Examples

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, devānam'inda, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre mahādhaññarāsi. tato mahājanakāyo dhaññaṃ āhareyya, kājehi'pi piṭakehi'pi ucchaṅgehi'pi añjalīhi'pi.

AN 8.8 uttaravipattisuttaṃ
ucchaṅga 2

masc. lap, hip [ud + √sañj] ✗
ucchaṅgajātaka

nt. Jātaka 67 (JA 67) ✗
ucchaṅgapañña

adj. "lap brained", scatterbrained; who does not retain what he has heard ✗
ucchaḍḍitvāna

abs. having brought up; having regurgitated [ud + √chaḍḍ + itvāna] ✓

Grammar abs, intrans
Meaning having brought up; having regurgitated
Root Family ud √chaḍḍ
Root √chaḍḍ･8 *e (discard, abandon)
√ In Comps cchaḍḍ
Construction ud + √chaḍḍ + itvāna
Variant ucchadditvāna, uggiritvāna, ucchaditvā
Commentary (UDa) ucchadditvānā'ti vamitvā, yaṃnūna dadeyyan'ti sambandho.
Sanskrit uttyaktvā
Sanskrit Root √chṛd √tyaj 1, 7 (spue, eject)

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ rañño pasenadissa kosalassa koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pivitvā gharaṃ āgantvā ucchaḍḍitvāna dadeyyaṃ, yaṃ imissā vijātāya bhavissatī'ti.

UD 16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
ucchadditvāna

abs. having brought up; having regurgitated [ud + √chaḍḍ + itvāna] ✓

Grammar abs, intrans
Meaning having brought up; having regurgitated
Root Family ud √chaḍḍ
Root √chaḍḍ･8 *e (discard, abandon)
√ In Comps cchaḍḍ
Construction ud + √chaḍḍ > chadd + itvāna
Phonetic Change ḍḍ > dd
Variant uggiritvāna, ucchaditvā, ucchaḍḍitvāna
Commentary (UDa) ucchadditvānā'ti vamitvā, yaṃnūna dadeyyan'ti sambandho. evaṃ kir'assa ahosi ahaṃ rañño koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telaṃ kaṇṭhamattaṃ pivitvā tāva'd'eva gharaṃ āgantvā ekasmiṃ bhājane yathāpītaṃ vamitvā uddhanaṃ āropetvā pacissāmi, yaṃ pittasemh'ādimissitaṃ, taṃ agginā jhāyissati, telaṃ pana gahetvā imissā paribbājikāya kamme upanessāmī'ti.
Sanskrit uttyaktvā
Sanskrit Root √chṛd √tyaj 1, 7 (spue, eject)

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ rañño pasenadissa kosalassa koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pivitvā gharaṃ āgantvā ucchadditvāna dadeyyaṃ, yaṃ imissā vijātāya bhavissatī'ti.

UD 16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
ucchādana 1

nt. massaging; rubbing; lit. covering [ud + √chad + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ucchādeti
Meaning massaging; rubbing; lit. covering
Root Family ud √chad
Root √chad･8 *e (cover, conceal)
√ In Comps cchad
Construction ud + √chad > chād + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change d > c
a > ā
Synonym sambāhana
Sanskrit ucchādana
Sanskrit Root √chad 1 (cover)

Examples

tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca,
ucchādanena nhāpanena,
pādānaṃ dhovanena ca.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

api ca kho mātugāmassa ucchādanaparimaddananhāpanasambāhanaṃ sādiyati.

AN 7.50 methunasuttaṃ
ucchādana 2

nt. chafing; rubbing away; abrasion; erosion [ud + √chad + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ucchādeti
Meaning chafing; rubbing away; abrasion; erosion
Root Family ud √chad
Root √chad･8 *e (cover, conceal)
√ In Comps cchad
Construction ud + √chad > chād + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change d > c
a > ā
Synonym parimaddana
Sanskrit ucchādana
Sanskrit Root √chad 1 (cover)

Example

ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātā-pettika-sambhavo odana-kummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

DN 2.24 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
ucchādanaparimaddananhāpanasambāhana

nt. massaging, kneading, bathing and rubbing down [ucchādana + parimaddana + nhāpana + sambāhana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning massaging, kneading, bathing and rubbing down
Construction ucchādana + parimaddana + nhāpana + sambāhana
Commentary (ANa) so ca nesaṃ ucchādana-parimaddana-nhāpana-sambāhanenā'ti so ca putto nesaṃ mātāpitūnaṃ aṃsakūṭesu ṭhitānaṃ'y'eva duggandha-paṭivinodan'atthaṃ sugandha-karaṇena ucchādanena, parissama-vinodan'atthaṃ hattha-parimaddanena, sīt'uṇhakāle ca uṇh'odakasīt'odaka-nhāpanena, hatthapādādīnaṃ ākaḍḍhana-parikaḍḍhana-saṅkhātena sambāhanena upaṭṭhānaṃ kareyya.
ucchādeti

pr. rubs the body (in bathing or with perfumes) [ud + √chad] ✗
ucchādesi

aor. rubbed the body (in bathing or with perfumes) [ud + √chad] ✗
ucchijja

ger. (+acc) cutting off; hacking up; destroying; lit. cutting up [ud + √chid + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ucchindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning cutting off; hacking up; destroying; lit. cutting up
Root Family ud √chid
Root √chid･2 ṃa (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Construction ud + √chid + ya
Phonetic Change dc > cc
dy > jj
Sanskrit ucchid, ucchidya
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Example

yo jātam'ucchijja na ropayeyya,
jāyantam'assa nānuppavecche,
tam'āhu ekaṃ muninaṃ carantaṃ,
addakkhi so santipadaṃ mahesi.

SNP 12 munisuttaṃ
ucchijjati

pr. is destroyed; is annihilated; lit. is cut up [ud + √chid + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of ucchindati, intrans
Meaning is destroyed; is annihilated; lit. is cut up
Root Family ud √chid
Root √chid･2 ya (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Base √chid + ya > chijja (pass)
Construction ud + chijja + ti
Phonetic Change d > c
dy > jj
Sanskrit ucchidyate
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Examples

byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

tassa evaṃ hoti, ucchijjissāmi nāmassu, vinassissāmi nāmassu, nassu nāma bhavissāmī'ti

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

adj. cut the root; eradicated at the source [ucchinna + mūla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning cut the root; eradicated at the source
Construction ucchinna + mūla
Compound kammadhāraya (ucchinna + mūla)
Commentary (MNa) se ucchinnamūle'ti so ucchinnamūlo.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit ucchinna + mūla

Examples

evam'eva kho, vaccha, yena rūpena tathāgataṃ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya taṃ rūpaṃ tathāgatassa pahīnaṃ ucchinnamūlaṃ tāl'āvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṃkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ

evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

ucchinnamūle

adj. cut the root; eradicated at the source ✗
ucchu

masc. sugar cane; Saccharum officinarum ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning sugar cane; Saccharum officinarum
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugarcane
Sanskrit ikṣu

Examples

tuvañ'ca bhante anukampakaṃ viduṃ,
upecca vandiṃ kusalañ'ca pucchisaṃ,
tato te ucchussa adāsi khaṇḍikaṃ,
pasannacitā atulāya pītiyā'ti.

VV 30 ucchudāyikā vimānavatthu

madhu nāma makkhikāmadhu. phāṇitaṃ nāma ucchumhā nibbattaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.3 bhesajjasikkhāpadaṃ

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning field of sugarcane
Construction ucchu + khetta

Sanskrit ikṣu + kṣetra

Example

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, sampanne ucchukkhette mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ ucchukkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.

i > e
Sanskrit uccheda
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Examples

ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhātī'ti kāraṇ'ākāraṇe na saṇṭhāti. tatr'āyaṃ nayo, sassatavādī yuttena kāraṇena pahoti ucchedavādiṃ niggahetuṃ, ucchedavādī tena niggayhamāno, kiṃ pan'āhaṃ ucchedaṃ vadāmī'ti

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā

evaṃvādiṃ kho maṃ, bhikkhave, evam'akkhāyiṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, venayiko samaṇo gotamo, sato sattassa ucchedaṃ vināsaṃ vibhavaṃ paññāpetī'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ucchedadiṭṭhi

fem. doctrine of annihilation at death [uccheda + diṭṭhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning doctrine of annihilation at death
Construction uccheda + diṭṭhi
Compound kammadhāraya (uccheda + diṭṭhi)
Sanskrit uccheda + dṛṣṭi
ucchedavāda

masc. (proponent of) doctrine of annihilation; annihilationist view [uccheda + vāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (proponent of) doctrine of annihilation; annihilationist view
Construction uccheda + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (uccheda + vāda)
Sanskrit ucchedavāda

Example

ucchedavādo bhavaṃ gotamo'ti

AN 8.11 verañjasuttaṃ
ucchedavādī

masc. annihilationist; proponent of the doctrine of annihilation [uccheda + vādī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning annihilationist; proponent of the doctrine of annihilation
Construction uccheda + vādī
Compound kammadhāraya (uccheda + vādī)
Antonym sassatavādī
Synonym venayika
Sanskrit ucchedavādin

Example

ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhātī'ti kāraṇ'ākāraṇe na saṇṭhāti. tatr'āyaṃ nayo, sassatavādī yuttena kāraṇena pahoti ucchedavādiṃ niggahetuṃ, ucchedavādī tena niggayhamāno, kiṃ pan'āhaṃ ucchedaṃ vadāmī'ti

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā
ucchediṭṭhi

fem. belief in the annihilation of the soul ✗
ucchepaka

adj. connected with throwing away; involving what is thrown away ✗
ujita

pp. straightened out; straightened up [√uj + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of √uj, in comps
Meaning straightened out; straightened up
Root Family √uj
Root √uj×1 a (be straight)
Construction √uj + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit ṛju
Sanskrit Root √ubj √ṛñj 6 (force)

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yato kho bhikkhuno chasu phass'āyatanesu cittaṃ udujitaṃ hoti sudujitaṃ, ajjhattam'eva santiṭṭhati, sannisīdati, ekodi hoti, samādhiyati.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
uju 1

adj. straight; upright; erect [√uj + u] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning straight; upright; erect
Root Family √uj
Root √uj×1 a (be straight)
Construction √uj + u
Derivative kita (u)
Synonym akukkuka, avaṅka, ujuka, ujugata, ujubhūta, ujjugata, ujjubhūta, tujjubhūta, sūju
Commentary (KPa) ujū'ti ajjavayutto.
Sanskrit ṛju
Sanskrit Root √ubj √ṛñj 6 (force)

Examples

so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

AN 5.202 dhammassavanasuttaṃ
uju 2

adj. direct; exact [√uj + u] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning direct; exact
Root Family √uj
Root √uj×1 a (be straight)
Construction √uj + u
Derivative kita (u)
Sanskrit ṛju
Sanskrit Root √ubj √ṛñj 6 (force)

Example

tesaṃ'y'eva kho, gahapatayo, samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ujuvipaccanīkavādā. te evam'āhaṃsu, atthi dinnaṃ, atthi yiṭṭhaṃ, atthi hutaṃ

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ujuka 1

adj. straight; upright [√uj + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from uju
Meaning straight; upright
Root Family √uj
Root √uj×1 a (be straight)
Construction √uj + u + ka
uju + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Antonym anujuka
Synonym akukkuka, avaṅka, uju, ujugata, ujubhūta, ujjugata, ujjubhūta, tujjubhūta, sūju
Commentary (SNa) cittam'attano ujukaṃ akaṃsū'ti attano citte sabbe vaṅkakuṭilajimhabhāve haritvā ujukaṃ akariṃsu.
Sanskrit ṛjutva
Sanskrit Root √ubj √ṛñj 6 (force)

Examples

tatra bhikkhavo samādahaṃsu,
cittam'attano ujukaṃ akaṃsu,
sārathī'va nettāni gahetvā,
indriyāni rakkhanti paṇḍitā'ti.

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ

ujuko nāma so maggo,
abhayā nāma sā disā,
ratho akūjano nāma,
dhammacakkehi saṃyuto.

SN 1.46 accharāsuttaṃ
ujuka 2

uju + ka

Example

ambho, rukkha, pubbe tvaṃ olambakaṃ otārento viya ujukam'eva phalāni pātesi

ujugata

adj. straight; upright; steadfast; unswerving; lit. gone straight [uju + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning straight; upright; steadfast; unswerving; lit. gone straight
Construction uju + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ujuṃ + gata)
Synonym akukkuka, avaṅka, uju, ujuka, ujubhūta, ujjubhūta, tujjubhūta, sūju
Variant ujjugata
Commentary (ANa) ujugatan'ti buddh'ānussatikammaṭṭhāne ujukam'eva gataṃ.
Sanskrit ṛjuga

Examples

yaṃ kiñci yiṭṭhaṃ va hutaṃ va loke,
saṃvaccharaṃ yajetha puññapekkho,
sabbam'pi taṃ na catubhāgam'eti,
abhivādanā ujugatesu seyyo.

DHP 108 sahassavaggo

ujugatam'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti sīlaṃ ārabbha.

Example

saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
ujubhūta

adj. straight; upright; erect; lit. become straight [uju + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning straight; upright; erect; lit. become straight
Construction uju + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (uju + bhūta)
Synonym akukkuka, avaṅka, uju, ujuka, ujugata, ujjugata, tujjubhūta, sūju
Variant ujjubhūta
Sanskrit ṛju + bhūta

Example

kāle dadanti sappaññā,
vadaññū vītamaccharā,
kālena dinnaṃ ariyesu,
ujubhūtesu t'ādisu,
vippasannamanā tassa,
vipulā hoti dakkhiṇā.

AN 5.36 kāladānasuttaṃ

Meaning straight road; direct route
Construction uju + magga
Compound kammadhāraya (uju + magga)
Sanskrit ṛju + mārga

Examples

sekhassa sikkhamānassa,
ujumagg'ānusārino,
khayasmiṃ paṭhamaṃ ñāṇaṃ,
tato aññā anantarā.

ITI 62 indriyasuttaṃ

gacchanto kho pana ujumaggen'eva gacchati, tatr'āyaṃ ujumaggo, seyyath'idaṃ, sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ujuṃ karoti

idiom. straightens; rectifies; lit. makes straight ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + pr
Meaning straightens; rectifies; lit. makes straight
Sanskrit ṛju + karoti

Examples

phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ,
dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

DHP 33 cittavaggo

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

ujja

ptp. should be said; lit. to be spoken [√vad + ya] ✓

Grammar ptp of vadati
Meaning should be said; lit. to be spoken
Root Family √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)
Construction √vad > ud + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change a > u
dy > jj
Sanskrit udya
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)

Examples

te vādakāmā parisaṃ vigayha,
bālaṃ dahantī mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
vadanti te aññasitā kath'ojjaṃ,
pasaṃsakāmā kusalā vadānā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

aṭṭhakavaggo 8

ujjala

adj. bright, blazing ✗
ujjalati

pr. shines, blazes up [ud + √jal] ✗
ujjalana

nt. lighting; lit. setting fire [ud + √jal + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ujjalati
Meaning lighting; lit. setting fire
Root Family ud √jal
Root √jal･1 a (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Construction ud + √jal + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change d > j
Sanskrit ujjvalana
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)

Examples

padīpo ca: padīp'ujjalanaṃ kataṃ kiṃ. padīp'ujjalanaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi

taṇ'ṭhānasammajjanañ'ca, tattha padīp'ujjalanañ'ca, āsanapaññapanañ'ca

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca
ujjalayati

pr. cause to blaze up; kindles; lights [ud + √jal] ✗
ujjalāpetvā

abs. having lit; having kindled [ud + √jal] ✗
ujjali

aor. shone, blazed up [ud + √jal] ✗
ujjalita

pp. shone, blazed up [ud + √jal] ✗
ujjaliyati

pr. is kindled; is lit [ud + √jal] ✗
ujjaletabba

ptp. should be kindled; should be lit; lit. to cause to be blazed up [ud + √jal + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of ujjaleti, caus
Meaning should be kindled; should be lit; lit. to cause to be blazed up
Root Family ud √jal
Root √jal･1 *e (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Base √jal + *e > jāle > jale (caus, irreg)
Construction ud + jale + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit ujjvalayitavya
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)

Example

ayaṃ kho pana, brāhmaṇa, kaṭṭh'aggi kālena kālaṃ ujjaletabbo, kālena kālaṃ ajjhupekkhitabbo, kālena kālaṃ nibbāpetabbo, kālena kālaṃ nikkhipitabbo'ti.

Phonetic Change d > j
u > av
Commentary (VINa) ujjav'ujjave'ti yattakaṃ hatthena añchitaṃ hoti, tasmiṃ takkamhi veṭhite ekā āpatti. kantanato pana pubbe kappāsavicinanaṃ ādiṃ katvā sabbapayogesu hatthavāragaṇanāya dukkaṭaṃ.
Sanskrit ud + java
Sanskrit Root √jū 1, 9 (be swift)
ujjavati

pr. goes up-stream [ud + √ju] ✗
ujjavanaka

adj. (of a ship) going upstream [ud + √ju + *ana + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ujjavana
Meaning (of a ship) going upstream
Root Family ud √ju
Root √ju･1 a (be fast)
Construction ud + √ju > jav + *ana + ka
ujjavana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > j
u > av
Antonym ojavanaka
Commentary (VINa) yasmā pana yo uddhaṃ javanato ujjavanikāya nāvāya kīḷati, so uddhaṃgāminiṃ abhiruhatī'ti vuccati. ten'assa padabhājane attham'eva dassetuṃ ujjavanikāyā'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit ud + javana
Sanskrit Root √jū 1, 9 (be swift)

Example

uddhaṃgāminin'ti ujjavanikāya. adhogāminin'ti ojavanikāya.

h > j

Commentary (THa) ujunā ... avaṅkagatinā

na ujjhānasaññī paresaṃ pattaṃ olokessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 38 ujjhānasaññīsikkhāpadaṃ

Commentary (SNa) ujjhānasaññikā'ti ujjhānasaññī devaloko nāma pāṭiyekko n'atthi, imā pana devatā tathāgatassa catupaccayaparibhogaṃ nissāya ujjhāyamānā āgatā.
Sanskrit apadhyāna + saṃjñin

Example

atha kho sambahulā ujjhānasaññikā devatāyo abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā vehāsaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ

manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti, kathañ'hi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā purato'pi pacchato'pi olambentā nivāsessanti, seyyathā'pi gihī kāmabhogino'ti.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ
ujjhāyi

√ In Comps jjhā
Base √jhā + ya > jhāya
Construction ava > o > u + jhāya + i
Phonetic Change ava > u
d > j
Commentary (UDa) mā ujjhāyitthā'ti mā heṭṭhā katvā cintayittha, olokayitthā'ti attho.
Sanskrit avadhyai
Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

Example

atha kho bhagavā āyasmato pilindavacchassa pubbenivāsaṃ manasi karitvā bhikkhū āmantesi, mā kho tumhe, bhikkhave, vacchassa bhikkhuno ujjhāyittha. na, bhikkhave, vaccho do'santaro bhikkhū vasalavādena samudācarati.

Examples

yathā saṅkāraṭhānasmiṃ,
ujjhitasmiṃ mahāpathe,
padumaṃ tattha jāyetha,
sucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ.

ujjhitvā

abs. (+acc) having discarded; dumped; abandoned; left [√ujjh] ✗

ger. leaving, forsaking [√ujjh] ✗
