Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, dubbhikkhaṃ hoti dussassaṃ dullabhapiṇḍaṃ, na sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo asamayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
uñchati

pr. seeks alms, gleans [√uñch] ✗
uñchapattāgata

adj. whatever has come into the bowl by gathering or begging, whatever comes into the alms bowl ✗
uñchā

fem. anything gathered for sustenance [√uñch] ✗
uñchācariyā

fem. wandering for gleaning; walking in search of food pickings ✗
uñchāsaka

adj. involving eating by means of gleaning or begging ✗
uñchi

aor. sought alms, gleaned [√uñch] ✗
uñchita

pp. sought alms, gleaned [√uñch] ✗
uññā

fem. contempt; disrespect ✗
uññātabba

ptp. to be despised; to be disdained; should be looked down (on); lit. to be known down [ava + √ñā + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of avajānāti
Meaning to be despised; to be disdained; should be looked down (on); lit. to be known down
Root Family ava √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction ava > o > u + √ñā + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change ava > u
Commentary (SNa) na uññātabbā'ti na avajānitabbā.
Sanskrit avajñeya
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

cattāro kho me, mahārāja, daharā'ti na uññātabbā, daharā'ti na paribhotabbā. katame cattāro?

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

samaṇo kho daharo'ti na uññātabbo na paribhotabbo. daharo'pi c'esa samaṇo gotamo mah'iddhiko hoti mah'ānubhāvo, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ime pañhe puccheyyan'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
uṭṭaṇḍa

masc. granary (?) ✗
uṭṭhapeti

pr. (also uṭṭhāpayati and uṭṭhāpeti) makes get up, rouses; makes rise, lifts, erects; makes appear, produces, lets rise, appear [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhapetvā

abs. having made stand up; having made rise [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhapenta

prp. making stand up; making get up [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhahati 1

pr. gets up; gets out; arouses oneself; lit. stands up [ud + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning gets up; gets out; arouses oneself; lit. stands up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + ti
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit uttiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

so uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati anavaññappaṭilābhāya lābhasakkārasilokappaṭilābhāya

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ

uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10
uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati

idiom. gets up, makes and effort and strives for ✓

Grammar idiom, pr + pr + pr
Meaning gets up, makes and effort and strives for

Example

so uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati anavaññappaṭilābhāya lābhasakkārasilokappaṭilābhāya

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ
uṭṭhahati 2

pr. stands up; gets up; arises [ud + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning stands up; gets up; arises
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + ti
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Synonym uṭṭheti, uttiṭṭhati
Sanskrit uttiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, alaṃ, brāhmaṇa, uṭṭhaha nisīda tvaṃ sake āsane yato te mayi cittaṃ pasannan'ti. atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhahitvā sake āsane nisīdi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

thaddhavisamabhūmibhāgasmiñ'hi caṅkame caṅkamantassa pādā rujjanti, phoṭā uṭṭhahanti, cittaṃ ekaggaṃ na labhati, kammaṭṭhānaṃ vipajjati.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
uṭṭhahanta

prp. getting up; arousing oneself; lit. standing up [ud + √ṭhā + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of uṭṭhahati, intrans
Meaning getting up; arousing oneself; lit. standing up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Commentary (MNa) uṭṭhahato'ti ājīvasamuṭṭhāpakavīriyena uṭṭhahantassa
Sanskrit utthāt
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti

MN 13 mahā dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
uṭṭhahi 1

aor. (+acc) went up; climbed up; rose up; ascended [ud + √ṭhā + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of uṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning went up; climbed up; rose up; ascended
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + i
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

atha te, jarasakko amhe matte katvā mahāsamuddapiṭṭhe khipitvā amhākaṃ devanagaraṃ gaṇhi, te mayaṃ tena saddhiṃ yujjhitvā amhākaṃ devanagaram'eva gaṇhissāmā'ti kipillikā viya thambhaṃ sineruṃ anusañcaramānā uṭṭhahiṃsu.

JAa 31 kulāvakajātakavaṇṇanā
uṭṭhahi 2

aor. stood up, arose [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhahitvā 1

abs. having stood up; having gotten up; having risen up [ud + √ṭhā + a + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uṭṭhahati or utthāti, intrans
Meaning having stood up; having gotten up; having risen up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + itvā
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthītvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, alaṃ, brāhmaṇa, uṭṭhaha nisīda tvaṃ sake āsane yato te mayi cittaṃ pasannan'ti. atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhahitvā sake āsane nisīdi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

bhikkhu nipanne, anupasampanno nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa. ubho vā nipajjanti, āpatti pācittiyassa. uṭṭhahitvā punappunaṃ nipajjanti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.1.5 sahaseyyasikkhāpadaṃ
uṭṭhahitvā 2

abs. having arisen; having emerged [ud + √ṭhā + a + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of uṭṭhahati or utthāti, intrans
Meaning having arisen; having emerged
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + itvā
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthītvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
uṭṭhahitvā 3

abs. having lifted up; having raised; lit. having stood up [ud + √ṭhā + a + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uṭṭhahati or utthāti, intrans
Meaning having lifted up; having raised; lit. having stood up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + itvā
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthītvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

tam'enaṃ uṭṭhahitvā apāpuritvā olokeyya. tassa sahadassanena amanāpatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, pāṭikulyatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jegucchatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jighacchitānam'pi na bhottukamyatā assa, pag'eva suhitānaṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
uṭṭhātar

masc. who rouses himself, is energetic [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāti

pr. (+abl) arises (from); emerges (from); gets up (from) [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhātuṃ

inf. to stand up; to get up [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāna 1

nt. waking up; getting up; rising; lit. standing up [ud + √ṭhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from uṭṭhahati
Meaning waking up; getting up; rising; lit. standing up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Antonym anuṭṭhāna
Sanskrit utthāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappessāma pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.

MN 65 bhaddālisuttaṃ
uṭṭhāna 2

nt. effort; exertion; initiative; activity; lit. standing up [ud + √ṭhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from uṭṭhahati
Meaning effort; exertion; initiative; activity; lit. standing up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Antonym anuṭṭhāna
Synonym anālasya, ātappa, vuṭṭhāna
Sanskrit utthāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

uṭṭhānen'appamādena,
saṃyamena damena ca,
dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī,
yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.

DHP 25 appamādavaggo

uṭṭhānaṃ anālasyaṃ bhogānaṃ āhāro, maṇḍanā vibhūsanā vaṇṇassa āhāro, sappāyakiriyā ārogyassa āhāro, kalyāṇamittatā sīlānaṃ āhāro

AN 10.73 iṭṭhadhammasuttaṃ
uṭṭhāna 3

Meaning occurrence; appearance; origin; lit. standing up

Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Antonym anuṭṭhāna
Sanskrit utthāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
uṭṭhāna 4

nt. product [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhānaka

adj. producing, yielding [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhānakāla

masc. right time for making an effort; suitable time for exertion; lit. get up time [uṭṭhāna + kāla] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning right time for making an effort; suitable time for exertion; lit. get up time
Construction uṭṭhāna + kāla
Compound kammadhāraya (uṭṭhāna + kāla)
Sanskrit utthāna + kāla

Example

uṭṭhānakālamhi anuṭṭhahāno,
yuvā balī ālasiyaṃ upeto,
saṃsannasaṅkappamano kusīto,
paññāya maggaṃ alaso na vindati.

DHP 280 maggavaggo
uṭṭhānaṭṭhāna

nt. place of occurrence; place of manifesting [uṭṭhāna + ṭhāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning place of occurrence; place of manifesting
Construction uṭṭhāna + ṭhāna
uṭṭhānanisajjā

fem. standing up and sitting down [uṭṭhāna + nisajjā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning standing up and sitting down
Construction uṭṭhāna + nisajjā
uṭṭhānaphalasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.134 (AN4.134) ✗
uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī

adj. living off the fruit of one's efforts [uṭṭhāna + phalūpajīvī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living off the fruit of one's efforts
Construction uṭṭhāna + phalūpajīvī
Commentary (ANa) uṭṭhānavīriyen'eva divasaṃ vītināmetvā tassa nissandaphalamattaṃ kiñcideva labhitvā jīvikaṃ kappeti, taṃ pana uṭṭhānaṃ āgamma kiñci puññaphalaṃ nappaṭilabhati, ayaṃ uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvī na kammaphal'ūpajīvī nāma. cātumahārājike pana deve ādiṃ katvā sabbe'pi devā uṭṭhānavīriyena vinā puññaphalasseva upajīvanato kammaphal'ūpajīvino na uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino nāma. rājarājamahāmatt'ādayo uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino ca kammaphal'ūpajīvino ca. nerayikasattā n'eva uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino na kammaphal'ūpajīvino.
uṭṭhānavant

adj. energetic; ready for action; lit. having stand up quality [ud + √ṭhā + ana + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from uṭṭhāna
Meaning energetic; ready for action; lit. having stand up quality
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + ana + vant
uṭṭhāna + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthānavat
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

uṭṭhānavato satīmato,
sucikammassa nisammakārino,
saññatassa dhammajīvino,
appamattassa yaso'bhivaḍḍhati.

DHP 24 appamādavaggo
uṭṭhānavīriya

nt. effort and exertion; get up and go [uṭṭhāna + vīriya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning effort and exertion; get up and go
Construction uṭṭhāna + vīriya
Compound dvanda (uṭṭhāna ca vīriya ca)
Sanskrit utthāna + vīrya

Examples

so, bhogā me atthi uṭṭhānavīriya-adhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā'ti adhigacchati sukhaṃ, adhigacchati somanassaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, gahapati, atthisukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriya-adhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
uṭṭhānavīriyādhigata

adj. obtained by effort and exertion [uṭṭhāna + vīriya + adhigata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obtained by effort and exertion
Construction uṭṭhāna + vīriya + adhigata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uṭṭhānavīriyena + adhigata)
Commentary (SNa) uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassā'ti uṭṭhānena ca vīriyena ca adhigatassa bhogassa.
Sanskrit utthāna + vīrya + adhigata

Examples

yo dhammaladdhassa dadāti dānaṃ,
uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassa jantu,
atikkamma so vetaraṇiṃ yamassa,
dibbāni ṭhānāni upeti macco'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
uṭṭhānasaññā

fem. notion of waking up; wake up time [uṭṭhāna + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning notion of waking up; wake up time
Construction uṭṭhāna + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uṭṭhānassa + saññā)
Commentary (MNa) uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā'ti ettakaṃ kālaṃ atikkamitvā vuṭṭhahissāmī'ti vuṭṭhānasaññaṃ citte ṭhapetvā.
Sanskrit utthāna + saṃjñā

Examples

rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappessāma pāde pādaṃ accādhāya, sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappesi, pāde pādaṃ accādhāya, sato sampajāno, uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
uṭṭhānasampadā

fem. successful initiative; accomplishment in undertakings [uṭṭhāna + sampadā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning successful initiative; accomplishment in undertakings
Construction uṭṭhāna + sampadā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uṭṭhānassa + sampadā)
Sanskrit utthāna + sampradā

Example

idha, byagghapajja, kulaputto yena kammaṭṭhānena jīvikaṃkappeti ... tattha dakkho hoti analaso, tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgato, alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, byagghapajja, uṭṭhānasampadā.

AN 8.54 dīghajāṇusuttaṃ
uṭṭhānasampanna

adj. abounding in energy; zealous ✗
uṭṭhānasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 2.10 (SNP 22) ✗
uṭṭhānādhigata

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obtained by hard work; acquired by effort; achieved by initiative
Construction uṭṭhāna + adhigata
Commentary (ANa) uṭṭhān'ādhigatan'ti vīriyena adhigataṃ.
uṭṭhāpayati

pr. (also uṭṭhapeti and uṭṭhāpeti) makes get up, rouses; makes rise, lifts, erects; makes appear, produces, lets rise, appear [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāpeti

pr. makes rise, raises, turns a person out [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāpetvā

abs. having made stand up; having made rise [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāpenta

prp. (+acc) making stand up; forcing to rise [ud + √ṭhā + *āpe + nta] ~

Grammar prp of uṭṭhāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning making stand up; forcing to rise
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction ud + ṭhāpe + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthāyat
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
uṭṭhāpesi

aor. made rise, raised, turned a person out [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāya

ger. (+abl) rising (from); emerging (from); getting up (from) [ud + √ṭhā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of uṭṭhahati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning rising (from); emerging (from); getting up (from)
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + ya
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Synonym vuṭṭhāya
Sanskrit utthāya
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

uṭṭhāya-āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ

ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sakakammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

DHP 240 malavaggo
uṭṭhāyaka

adj. active, industrious [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāyāsanā

ger. rising from one’s seat [uṭṭhāya + āsanā] ✓

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning rising from one’s seat
Construction uṭṭhāya + āsanā
Commentary (VINa) uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkāmī'ti āsanato uṭṭhahitvā gato.
Sanskrit utthāya + āsana

Examples

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
uṭṭhāyikā

fem. active, industrious [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāyī

adj. rising; waking up; getting up; lit. standing up [ud + √ṭhā + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from uṭṭhahati
Meaning rising; waking up; getting up; lit. standing up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + [y] + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Phonetic Change +y
Antonym nipātī
Commentary (SNa) dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ disvā āsanato paṭhamataraṃ vuṭṭhātī'ti pubb'uṭṭhāyī.
Sanskrit utthāyin
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
uṭṭhāsi

√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + si
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Synonym vuṭṭhahi, vuṭṭhāsi
Commentary (MNa) divā uṭṭhāsī'ti pāto'va kattabbāni dhenuduhan'ādikammāni akatvā ussūre uṭṭhitā.
Sanskrit utthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

he je kāḷī'ti. kiṃ, ayye'ti? kiṃ, je, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti?

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
uṭṭhāsu

masc. who gets up or rouses himself [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhāhaka

adj. energetic; effortful; productive [ud + √ṭhā + a + *aka] ~

Grammar adj, from uṭṭhahati
Meaning energetic; effortful; productive
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha > ṭhāha + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
a > ā
Synonym akilāsu, atandita, analasa, vīra, vīriyavant
Sanskrit utthānavat
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
uṭṭhita 1

pp. arisen; appeared; come up; lit. stood up [ud + √ṭhā + ita] ~

Grammar pp of uṭṭhahati
Meaning arisen; appeared; come up; lit. stood up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Antonym anuṭṭhita
Synonym uppanna, pahūta, sañjāta
Sanskrit utthita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
uṭṭhita 2

pp. stood up, stood above, got up [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭheti

pr. (+acc) gets up; stands up; lit. causes to stand up [ud + √ṭhā + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of uṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning gets up; stands up; lit. causes to stand up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *e (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + e > ṭhe (caus)
Construction ud + ṭhe + ti
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Synonym uṭṭhahati, uttiṭṭhati
Sanskrit utthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

uṭṭhehi, āvuso, diṭṭho'si bhagavatā, n'atthi te bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāso'ti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke,
desassu bhagavā dhammaṃ,
aññātāro bhavissantī'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
uḍḍayati

Construction ud + ḍaya + ti

Variant uḍḍīyati
Commentary (MNa) uḍḍīyeyyā'ti uppatitvā gaccheyya.
Sanskrit uḍḍayate, uḍḍīyate

Example

Commentary (SNa) taṇhāya uḍḍito'ti taṇhāya ullaṅghito. (SNt) ullaṅghito'ti ubbandhitvā laṅghito.

Examples

kenassu uḍḍito loko,
kenassu parivārito,

taṇhāya uḍḍito loko,
jarāya parivārito,
maccunā pihito loko,
dukkhe loko patiṭṭhito'ti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 448
uṇṇa

nt. wool, fibre (With reference to the Buddha:) a hair between the eyebrows ✗
uṇṇakajāta

adj. reduced to powder ✗
uṇṇata

pp. raised; lifted; elevated; lit. bent up [ud + √nam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uṇṇamati
Meaning raised; lifted; elevated; lit. bent up
Root Family ud √nam
Root √nam･1 a (bend)
Construction ud + √nam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dn > ṇṇ
mt > t
Antonym anuṇṇata, avanata
Variant unnata
Commentary (MNa) vaṭṭan'āvaḷī'ti yathā rajjuyā āvunitvā katā vaṭṭan'āvaḷī vaṭṭanānaṃ antar'antarā ninnā hoti, vaṭṭanaṭṭhānesu unnatā, evaṃ piṭṭhikaṇṭako unnatāvanato hoti.
Sanskrit unnata
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma vaṭṭan'āvaḷī, evam'ev'assu me piṭṭhikaṇṭako uṇṇata-avanato hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uṇṇati

fem. elation; raising oneself; pride ✗

mt > t

Sanskrit unnati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Example

mān'ātimānaṃ vadate pan'eso,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

masc. spider; lit. woollen navel [uṇṇā + nābhi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning spider; lit. woollen navel

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
uṇṇamati

pr. is haughty; becomes arrogant; becomes conceited; lit. bends up [ud + √nam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning is haughty; becomes arrogant; becomes conceited; lit. bends up
Root Family ud √nam
Root √nam･1 a (bend)
Base √nam + a > ṇama
Construction ud + ṇama + ti
Phonetic Change n > ṇ
Variant unnamati
Sanskrit unnamati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Examples

pasaṃsito vā pana tattha hoti,
akkhāya vādaṃ parisāya majjhe,
so hassatī uṇṇamatī ca tena,
pappuyya tam'atthaṃ yathā mano ahu.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

nindāya nappavedheyya,
na uṇṇameyya pasaṃsito bhikkhu,
lobhaṃ saha macchariyena,
kodhaṃ pesuṇiyañ'ca panudeyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
uṇṇametave

inf. (+instr) becomes arrogant (about); prides oneself (about); lit. to cause to bend up [ud + √nam + *e + tave] ✓

Grammar inf of uṇṇameti, caus, intrans (+instr)
Meaning becomes arrogant (about); prides oneself (about); lit. to cause to bend up
Root Family ud √nam
Root √nam･1 *e (bend)
Base √nam + *e > nāme > ṇame (caus, irreg)
Construction ud + ṇame + tave
Variant unnametave
Commentary (SNPa) tattha dāni passatha, etādisena kāyena yo puriso vā itthī vā koci bālo maññe uṇṇametave taṇhādiṭṭhimānamaññanāhi ahan'ti vā maman'ti vā nicco'ti vā'tiādinā nayena yo uṇṇamituṃ maññeyya
Sanskrit unnam, unnamayitum
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Example

etādisena kāyena,
yo maññe uṇṇametave,
paraṃ vā avajāneyya,
kim'aññatra adassanā'ti.

DN 31.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bho gotama, sārīrikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambho'pi nāma bhavissati, hadayam'pi nāma phalissati, uṇham'pi lohitaṃ mukhato uggamissati, ummādam'pi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepaṃ.

nt. warm water; hot water [uṇha + udaka] ✓

Meaning warm water; hot water
Construction uṇha + udaka
Phonetic Change au > o
Sanskrit uṣṇodaka

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, idhassa nigaṇṭho ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno sīt'odakapaṭikkhitto uṇh'odakapaṭisevī. so sīt'odakaṃ alabhamāno kālaṅ'kareyya. imassa pana, gahapati, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto katth'ūpapattiṃ paññapetī'ti?

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
uṇhodakapaṭisevī

adj. making use of hot water [uṇhodaka + paṭisevī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning making use of hot water
Construction uṇhodaka + paṭisevī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (uṇhodakaṃ + paṭisevī)
Sanskrit uṣṇodaka + pratisevin

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, idhassa nigaṇṭho ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno sīt'odakapaṭikkhitto uṇh'odakapaṭisevī. so sīt'odakaṃ alabhamāno kālaṅ'kareyya. imassa pana, gahapati, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto katth'ūpapattiṃ paññapetī'ti?

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
utu 1

masc. weather; climate; temperature ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning weather; climate; temperature
Sanskrit ṛtu

Example

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso sen'āsanaṃ paṭisevati, yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya, uṇhassa paṭighātāya, ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya, yāva'd'eva utuparissayavinodanapaṭisallān'ārām'atthaṃ

MN 2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
utu 2

nt. weather; climate; temperature ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning weather; climate; temperature
Sanskrit ṛtu

Example

pittaṃ semhañ'ca vāto ca,
sannipātā utūni ca,
visamaṃ opakkamikaṃ,
kammavipākena aṭṭhamī'ti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ
utu 3

masc. season; time of year ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning season; time of year
Sanskrit ṛtu

Examples

madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,
kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā,
paṭhamavasanto sukho utu,
ehi ramāma supupphite vane.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

chandaparisuddhi, utu'kkhānaṃ, bhikkhugaṇanā ca, ovādo, uposathassa etāni, pubbakiccan'ti vuccati.

Meaning refreshment
Sanskrit ṛtu

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi

ut'ukkhāna'ca, bhikkhugaṇanā'ca, bhikkhunīnam'ovādo cā'ti.

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca
utuguṇa

masc. climate ✗
utuddhaṭa

nt. worn thin or worn away through time ✗
utuddhata

nt. worn thin or worn away through time ✗
utunī

adj. menstruating [utu + unī] ✓

Grammar adj, from utu
Meaning menstruating
Construction utu + unī
Derivative taddhita (unī)
Commentary (MNa) mātā ca utunī hotī'ti idaṃ utusamayaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. mātugāmassa kira yasmiṃ okāse dārako nibbattati, tattha mahatī lohitapīḷakā saṇṭhahitvā bhijjitvā paggharati, vatthu suddhaṃ hoti, suddhe vatthumhi mātāpitūsu ekavāraṃ sannipatitesu yāva satta divasāni khettam'eva hoti. tasmiṃ samaye hatthaggāhaveṇiggāh'ādinā aṅgaparāmasanena'pi dārako nibbattati'y'eva.
Sanskrit ṛtu

Example

tiṇṇaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, sannipātā gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti. idha mātā'pitaro ca sannipatitā honti, mātā ca na utunī hoti, gandhabbo ca na paccupaṭṭhito hoti, n'eva tāva gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
utupariṇāma

masc. change in weather; seasonal variation; alteration in climate [utu + pariṇāma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning change in weather; seasonal variation; alteration in climate
Construction utu + pariṇāma
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (utūnaṃ + pariṇāma)
Commentary (SNa) utupariṇāmajānī'ti visabhāgaututo jātāni. jaṅgaladesavāsīnañ'hi anupadese vasantānaṃ visabhāgo utu uppajjati, anupadesavāsīnañ'ca jaṅgaladese'ti evaṃ malayasamuddatīr'ādivasenā'pi utuvisabhāgatā uppajjati'y'eva. tato jātāti utupariṇāmajātāni nāma.
Sanskrit ṛtu + pariṇāma

Example

pittasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... semhasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... vātasamuṭṭhānāni'pi … sannipātikāni'pi … utupariṇāmajāni'pi … visamaparihārajāni'pi … opakkamikāni'pi … kammavipākajāni'pi kho, sīvaka, idh'ekaccāni vedayitāni uppajjanti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ
utupariṇāmaja

adj. produced by change in the weather; caused by seasonal variation; due to alteration in climate [utu + pariṇāma + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by change in the weather; caused by seasonal variation; due to alteration in climate
Construction utu + pariṇāma + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (utupariṇāmasmā + ja)
Commentary (SNa) utupariṇāmajānī'ti visabhāgaututo jātāni. jaṅgaladesavāsīnañ'hi anupadese vasantānaṃ visabhāgo utu uppajjati, anupadesavāsīnañ'ca jaṅgaladese'ti evaṃ malayasamuddatīr'ādivasenā'pi utuvisabhāgatā uppajjati'y'eva. tato jātāti utupariṇāmajātāni nāma. (NIDD1a) utupariṇāmajā'ti utupariṇāmena.
Sanskrit ṛtu + pariṇāma + ja

Examples

pittasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... semhasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... vātasamuṭṭhānāni'pi … sannipātikāni'pi … utupariṇāmajāni'pi … visamaparihārajāni'pi … opakkamikāni'pi … kammavipākajāni'pi kho, sīvaka, idh'ekaccāni vedayitāni uppajjanti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pittasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā semhasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā vātasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā sannipātikā ābādhā utupariṇāmajā ābādhā visamaparihārajā ābādhā opakkamikā ābādhā kammavipākajā ābādhā sītaṃ uṇhaṃ jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo'ti.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
utupariṇāmī

adj. development in due season ✗
utuparissaya

masc. inclement weather; harsh climate; lit. danger of the season [utu + parissaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning inclement weather; harsh climate; lit. danger of the season
Construction utu + parissaya
Compound kammadhāraya (utu + parissaya)
Sanskrit ṛtu + parisrava

Example

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso sen'āsanaṃ paṭisevati, yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya, uṇhassa paṭighātāya, ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya, yāva'd'eva utuparissaya-vinodana-paṭisallān'ārām'atthaṃ

MN 2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
utuparissayavinodana

nt. warding off the perils of seasonal weather [utuparissaya + vinodana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning warding off the perils of seasonal weather
Construction utuparissaya + vinodana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (utuparissayaṃ + vinodana)
Commentary (VISM) utuparissaya-vinodana-paṭisallān'ārām'atthan'ti parisahan'aṭṭhena utu'y'eva utuparissayo. utuparissayassa vinodan'atthañ'ca paṭisallān'ārām'atthañ'ca. yo sarīr'ābādhacittavikkhepakaro asappāyo utu sen'āsanapaṭisevanena vinodetabbo hoti, tassa vinodan'atthaṃ ekībhāvasukh'atthañ'cā'ti vuttaṃ hoti. kāmañ'ca sītapaṭighāt'ādināva utuparissayavinodanaṃ vuttam'eva.
Sanskrit ṛtu + parisrava + vinodana (bsk)

Example

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso sen'āsanaṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-siriṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva utuparissaya-vinodanaṃ paṭisallān'ārām'atthaṃ

MN 2.4 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
utuparissayavinodanapaṭisallānārāmatthaṃ

ind. for the purpose of warding off the perils of seasonal weather and the enjoying solitude [utuparissaya + vinodana + paṭisallāna + ārāma + attha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the purpose of warding off the perils of seasonal weather and the enjoying solitude
Construction utuparissaya + vinodana + paṭisallāna + ārāma + attha + aṃ
utuparissayavinodanapaṭisallānārāmattha + aṃ
Sanskrit ṛtu + parisrava + vinodana + pratisaṃlayana + ārāma + artham

Example

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso sen'āsanaṃ paṭisevati, yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya, uṇhassa paṭighātāya, ḍaṃsamakasavāt'ātapasarīṃsapasamphassānaṃ paṭighātāya, yāva'd'eva utuparissayavinodanapaṭisallān'ārām'atthaṃ.

UD 70 utenasuttaṃ
utenasutta

nt. Udāna 70 (UD 70) ✗
utta 1.1

nt. (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel; lit. u state [u + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, letter, abstr, from u
Meaning (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel; lit. u state
Construction u + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym ukāra
Sanskrit u + tva

Examples

511, 521. uttam'okāro.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 511

kara'icc'etassa dhātussa akāro uttam'āpajjate vā. kurute, karoti, kubbanti, kayirati. karasse'ti kim'atthaṃ? sarati, marati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 512
utta 2.1

pp. said; spoken; uttered [√vac + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of vacati
Meaning said; spoken; uttered
Root Family √vac
Root √vac･1 a (say, speak)
Construction √vac > uc + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change va > u
c > t
Synonym udīrita, pabhāvita, pavutta, bhaṭṭha, bhaṇita, bhāsita, lapita, samudāciṇṇa
Variant vutta
Sanskrit ukta
Sanskrit Root √vac 2, 3 (speak)

Example

khamā bhavissāma sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ

pp. shining [ud + √tap] ✗
uttanta

uttama 1

adj. best; highest; ultimate; supreme; top [ud + tama] ✓

Grammar adj, superl of ud
Meaning best; highest; ultimate; supreme; top
Construction ud + tama
Derivative taddhita (tama)
Phonetic Change d > t
Antonym adhama
Synonym agga, jeṭṭha, parama, sattama, seṭṭha
Sanskrit uttama

Examples

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yv'āyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā'ti.

tass'āhaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
vihāsiṃ sāsane rato,
samādhiṃ paṭipādesiṃ,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā.

TH 236 cūḷapanthakattheragāthā

Examples

uttam'atthassa pattiyā,
tisso vijjā anuppattā,
kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā

yoniso manasikāro,
dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno,
n'atth'añño evaṃ bahukāro,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā,
yoniso padahaṃ bhikkhu,
khayaṃ dukkhassa pāpuṇe'ti.

uttamapurisa 1

masc. highest of men; best of men; superman [uttama + purisa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning highest of men; best of men; superman
Construction uttama + purisa
Compound kammadhāraya (uttama + purisa)
Synonym uttamaporisa, purisuttama
Commentary (SNa) uttamapuriso'ti seṭṭhapuriso. (NIDD1a) uttamapuriso'ti khīṇakilesattā visesapuriso ājaññapuriso.
Sanskrit uttama + puruṣa

Examples

sattaṭṭhānakusalo, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī imasmiṃ dhammavinaye kevalī vusitavā uttamapuriso'ti vuccati.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yo'pi'ssa sāvako uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto tam'pi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti, asu amutra upapanno, asu amutra upapanno'ti.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
uttamapurisa 2

masc. (gram) 1st person (I; we); lit. last person [uttama + purisa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) 1st person (I; we); lit. last person
Construction uttama + purisa
Compound kammadhāraya (uttama + purisa)
Sanskrit uttamapuruṣa

Examples

taṃ yathā? ti anti iti paṭhamapurisā, si tha iti majjhimapurisā, mi ma iti uttamapurisā. attanopadānampi te ante iti paṭhamapurisā, se vhe iti majjhimapurisā, e mhe iti uttamapurisā. evaṃ sabbattha.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 408

amhe payujjamāne'pi appayujjamāne'pi tuly'ādhikaraṇe uttamapuriso hoti. ahaṃ yajāmi, mayaṃ yajāma. appayujjamāne'pi yajāmi, yajāma.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 412
uttamaporisa

masc. highest of men; best of men; superman [uttama + porisa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning highest of men; best of men; superman
Construction uttama + porisa
Compound kammadhāraya (uttama + porisa)
Synonym uttamapurisa, purisuttama
Sanskrit uttama + puruṣa

Example

assaddho akataññū ca,
sandhicchedo ca yo naro,
hat'āvakāso vant'āso,
sa ve uttamaporiso.

uttamātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 30 (THI30) ✗
uttara 1.1

adj. crossing over; going over; lit. crossing up [ud + √tar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from uttarati
Meaning crossing over; going over; lit. crossing up
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ud + √tar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ ... na c'assa nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
uttara 2.1

adj. (+abl) higher (than); superior (to) [ud + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of ud (+abl)
Meaning higher (than); superior (to)
Construction ud + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Phonetic Change d > t
Antonym anuttara
Synonym atireka, uttari
Sanskrit uttara

Examples

sauttaraṃ vā cittaṃ, sauttaraṃ cittan'ti pajānāti, anuttaraṃ vā cittaṃ, anuttaraṃ cittan'ti pajānāti

DN 22.8 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

te pana, samiddhi, kiṃuttarā'ti? paññ'uttarā, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ
uttara 2.2

adj. northern; north; lit. higher [ud + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, from ud
Meaning northern; north; lit. higher
Construction ud + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Phonetic Change d > t
Antonym dakkhiṇa
Sanskrit uttara

Examples

tam'enaṃ puratthimo vāto pacchimena saṃhareyya, pacchimo vāto puratthimena saṃhareyya, uttaro vāto dakkhiṇena saṃhareyya, dakkhiṇo vāto uttarena saṃhareyya.

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
uttara 2.3

nt. north; lit. higher [ud + tara] ✓

Grammar nt, from ud
Meaning north; lit. higher
Construction ud + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttara

Example

ko nu kho, bho, pahoti imaṃ mahāpathaviṃ uttarena āyataṃ dakkhiṇena sakaṭamukhaṃ sattadhā samaṃ suvibhattaṃ vibhajitun'ti

Example

uttara 2.5

Meaning upper robe; lit. higher
Construction ud + tara

Antonym santara
Synonym uttarasaṅga, uttarāsaṅga
Sanskrit uttara

Example

tañ'ce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santar'uttaraparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
uttaraṇa

nt. crossing over, overcoming, delivery, passing (of an exam) [ud + √tar] ✗
uttaraṇī

fem. upper of the two pieces of wood used for kindling fire ✗
uttarati

pr. (+acc) crosses (over); gets out (of); escapes (misfortune); lit. crosses up [ud + √tar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning crosses (over); gets out (of); escapes (misfortune); lit. crosses up
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction ud + tara + ti
Phonetic Change d > t
Synonym upātivattati, nibbeṭheti
Sanskrit uttarati
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ saṃkaḍḍhitvā, kullaṃ bandhitvā, taṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttareyyan'ti.

uttarato

ind. in a north direction; to the north (of) ✗
uttarattharaṇa

nt. bed cover; quilt; lit. upper cover [uttara + attharaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bed cover; quilt; lit. upper cover
Construction uttara + attharaṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (uttara + attharaṇa)
Commentary (VINa) uttar'attharaṇaṃ nāma mañcapīṭhānaṃ upari attharitabbakaṃ paccattharaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit uttara + āstaraṇa

Example

seyyaṃ nāma bhisi, cimilikā uttar'attharaṇaṃ, bhūm'attharaṇaṃ, taṭṭikā, cammakhaṇḍo, nisīdanaṃ, paccattharaṇaṃ, tiṇasanthāro, paṇṇasanthāro.

VIN 2.5.2.5 dutiyasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
uttarattheragāthā 1

fem. Theragāthā 121 (TH121) ✗
uttarattheragāthā 2

fem. Theragāthā 141 (TH141) ✗
uttaranta 1.1

prp. (+acc) emerging; getting out (of); lit. crossing up [ud + √tar + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of uttarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning emerging; getting out (of); lit. crossing up
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction ud + tara + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > t
Commentary (VINa) ogayha uttarantānan'ti ogayha ogāhetvā puna uttarantānaṃ. te kira gambhīraṃ udakaṃ otaritvā tattha nhatvā ca pivitvā ca soṇḍāya udakaṃ gahetvā aññam'aññaṃ ālolentā uttaranti, tesaṃ evaṃ ogayha uttarantānan'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit uttarat
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
uttaranta 2.1

masc. northern side; north end [uttara + anta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning northern side; north end
Construction uttara + anta
Antonym dakkhiṇanta
uttarapada

nt. (gram) last member of a compound word [uttara + pada] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (gram) last member of a compound word
Construction uttara + pada
Compound kammadhāraya (uttara + pada)
Antonym paṭhamapada
Sanskrit uttarapada

Example

nassa padassa tappurise uttarapade attaṃ hoti. nabrāhmaṇo abrāhmaṇo, avasalo, abhikkhu, apañcavassaṃ, apañcagavaṃ.

masc. contrivance to prevent a pot of dye from boiling over ✗
uttarāḷuva

masc. contrivance to prevent a pot of dye from boiling over ✗
uttari 1.1

adj. (+abl) superior (than); higher (than); better (than) [ud + tara + i] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of ud (+abl)
Meaning superior (than); higher (than); better (than)
Construction ud + tara + i
uttara + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Phonetic Change d > t
Synonym atireka, uttara, visesi, visesī
Sanskrit uttara

Examples

paraman'ti diṭṭhīsu paribbasāno,
yaduttari kurute jantu loke,
hīnā'ti aññe tato sabbam'āha,
tasmā vivādāni avītivatto.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

nihīyati puriso nihīnasevī,
na ca hāyetha kadāci tulyasevī,
seṭṭham'upanamaṃ udeti khippaṃ,
tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
uttari 1.2

ind. (+abl) more (than); moreover; further (than); beyond [ud + tara + i] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from ud (+abl)
Meaning more (than); moreover; further (than); beyond
Construction ud + tara + i
uttara + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Phonetic Change d > t
Synonym paro
Variant uttariṃ
Sanskrit uttarin

Examples

apalokento kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo sabbakāyen'eva apaloketi, so na uddhaṃ ulloketi, na adho oloketi, na ca vipekkhamāno gacchati, yugamattañ'ca pekkhati, tato c'assa uttari anāvaṭaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesu'y'eva kusalesu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya uttari āsavānaṃ khayāya yogo karaṇīyo'ti.

uttara + i

uttari 2.1

aor. came out of water, went over, overcame [ud + √tar] ✗
uttarika

DN 10.4 subhasuttaṃ
uttarichappañcavācā

fem. more than five or six sentences; more than five or six lines [uttari + chappañca + vācā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning more than five or six sentences; more than five or six lines
Construction uttari + chappañca + vācā
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (uttari + chappañcavācāya)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.1.7) uttarichappañcavācāhī'ti atirekachappañcavācāhi. (KVa) uttarichappañcavācāhī'ti ettha eko gāthāpādo ekā vācā'ti evaṃ sabbattha vācāpamāṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit uttarin + pañca + ṣaṣ + vācā

Example

yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 7 dhammadesanāsikkhāpadaṃ
uttariñca

sandhi. and further; and in addition; and what’s more [uttariṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning and further; and in addition; and what’s more
Construction uttariṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit uttaram + ca

Example

evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na c'eva sampāyissanti, uttariñ'ca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti. taṃ kissa hetu? yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
uttaritabba

ptp. (+acc) should be risen out of; should be emerged (from); lit. to be crossed up [ud + √tar + itabba] ~

Grammar ptp of uttarati (+acc)
Meaning should be risen out of; should be emerged (from); lit. to be crossed up
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ud + √tar + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttīrtavya
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
uttaritara

adj. (+instr or +abl) more excellent (than); even better (than); even higher (than) [ud + √tar + i + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of uttari (+instr or +abl)
Meaning more excellent (than); even better (than); even higher (than)
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ud + √tar + i + tara
uttari + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttaratara
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu tādī'y'eva tādī. tamhā ca pana tādimhā añño tādī uttaritaro vā paṇītataro vā n'atthī'ti vadāmī'ti.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ

etadānuttariyaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇānaṃ yadidaṃ tattha tattha yathābhūtañāṇaṃ. etasmā c'āhaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇā aññaṃ ñāṇaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā n'atthī'ti vadāmi

AN 10.22 adhivuttipadasuttaṃ
uttaritā

fem. fact of being superior; fact of being greater [ud + tara + i + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from uttari
Meaning fact of being superior; fact of being greater
Construction ud + tara + i + tā
uttari + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttaratva
uttaritvā

abs. (+acc) having risen up out of (water); having emerged [ud + √tar + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of uttarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having risen up out of (water); having emerged
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ud + √tar + itvā
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttīrtvā
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
uttaridirattatirattaṃ

ind. for more than two or three days; lit. for more than two or three nights [uttari + diratta + tiratta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of uttaridirattatiratta
Meaning for more than two or three days; lit. for more than two or three nights
Construction uttari + diratta + tiratta + aṃ
uttaridirattatiratta + aṃ
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (uttari + dirattatirattehi)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.1.7) uttarichappañcavācāhī'ti atirekachappañcavācāhi.
Sanskrit uttarin + dvirātra + trirātra

Example

yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 5 paṭhamasahaseyyasikkhāpadaṃ
uttaridhamma

masc. higher teaching; further Dhamma [uttari + dhamma] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning higher teaching; further Dhamma
Construction uttari + dhamma
uttaribhaṅga

masc. side dish; snack; accompaniment; lit. further fragment [uttari + bhaṅga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning side dish; snack; accompaniment; lit. further fragment
Construction uttari + bhaṅga
Compound kammadhāraya (uttari + bhaṅga)
Sanskrit uttarin + bhaṅga

Examples

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, aññesaṃ dento omasati, aññassa bhājane ākiranto omasati, uttaribhaṅge, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassāti.

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, khajjake, phalāphale, uttaribhaṅge, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo
uttarimanussadhamma

masc. super-human state; super-power; super human distinction; lit. beyond human nature [uttari + manussadhamma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning super-human state; super-power; super human distinction; lit. beyond human nature
Construction uttari + manussadhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (uttari + manussadhamma)
Commentary (VIN 1.1.4) uttarimanussadhammo nāma jhānaṃ vimokkho samādhi samāpatti ñāṇadassanaṃ maggabhāvanā phalasacchikiriyā kilesappahānaṃ vinīvaraṇatā cittassa suññ'āgāre abhirati. (VINa) uttarimanussadhamman'ti uttarimanussānaṃ jhāyīnañ'c'eva ariyānañ'ca dhammaṃ
Sanskrit uttara + manuṣya + dharma

Examples

assosi kho āyasmā sāriputto sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa vesāliyaṃ parisati evaṃ vācaṃ bhāsamānassa, n'atthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

imehi kho me, gahapati, tiṃsamattehi vassehi pabbajitassa n'atthi koci uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato phāsuvihāro, aññatra naggeyyā ca muṇḍeyyā ca pāvaḷanipphoṭanāya cā'ti

SN 41.9 acelakassapasuttaṃ
uttarimanussadhammacakkapeyyāla

nt. elided repetition series regarding super-human states [uttarimanussadhamma + cakkapeyyāla] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning elided repetition series regarding super-human states
Construction uttarimanussadhamma + cakkapeyyāla
uttarimanussadhammapārājikāpatti

fem. expellable offence of (falsely stating) super-human states [uttarimanussadhamma + pārājikāpatti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning expellable offence of (falsely stating) super-human states
Construction uttarimanussadhamma + pārājikāpatti
uttarimanussadhammasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.77 (AN6.77) ✗
uttarimanussadhammādhigamaparidīpanavācā

fem. talk illuminating the attainment of super-human states ✗

uttarisāṭaka

masc. upper garment ✗
uttariṃ 1

ind. (+abl) more (than) [ud + √tar + i + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of uttari (+abl)
Meaning more (than)
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ud + √tar + i + iṃ
uttari + iṃ

Sanskrit uttaram
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

eko āvasathapiṇḍo bhuñjitabbo. tato ce uttariṃ bhuñjeyya, pācittiyan'ti.

VIN PAT āvasathapiṇḍasikkhāpadaṃ

tam'enaṃ tathāgato uttariṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
uttariṃ 2

ind. further; another; in addition [ud + √tar + i + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of uttari
Meaning further; another; in addition
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ud + √tar + i + iṃ
uttari + iṃ
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttaram
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

sādh'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ uttariṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi brāhmaṇa dakkho assadammako bhaddaṃ ass'ājānīyaṃ labhitvā paṭhamen'eva mukh'ādhāne kāraṇaṃ kāreti atha uttariṃ kāraṇaṃ kāreti

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
uttariṃkaraṇīya

nt. more to be done; something further to do [uttariṃ + karaṇīya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning more to be done; something further to do
Construction uttariṃ + karaṇīya
Compound kammadhāraya (uttariṃ + karaṇīya)
Sanskrit uttara + karaṇīya

Example

phasse, bhikkhave, āhāre pariññāte tisso vedanā pariññātā honti. tīsu vedanāsu pariññātāsu ariyasāvakassa n'atthi kiñci uttariṃkaraṇīyan'ti vadāmi

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
uttarīya

nt. cloak ✗
uttaruttara

adj. higher and higher [uttara + uttara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning higher and higher
Construction uttara + uttara
uttaruttari

adj. higher and higher; further and further [uttara + uttari] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning higher and higher; further and further
Construction uttara + uttari
Compound kammadhāraya (uttara + uttari)
Commentary (MNa) uttar'uttariṃ paṇītapaṇītan'ti uttar'uttariṃ c'eva paṇītatarañ'ca katvā deseti.
Sanskrit uttara + uttara

Example

evaṃvādiṃ kho, bhikkhave, satthāraṃ arahati sāvako upasaṅkamituṃ dhammassavanāya. tassa satthā dhammaṃ deseti uttar'uttariṃ paṇītapaṇītaṃ kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgaṃ.

uttasati

pr. alarms or terrifies [ud + √tas] ✗
uttasana

nt. alarm, terror [ud + √tas] ✗
uttasi

aor. alarmed or terrified [ud + √tas] ✗
uttasitvā

abs. having been frightened; having got a shock; having become terrified [ud + √tas + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of uttasati, intrans
Meaning having been frightened; having got a shock; having become terrified

√ In Comps ttas
Construction ud + √tas + itvā
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttrastvā
Sanskrit Root √tras 1 (be terrified)
uttasta

pp. frightened, terrified [ud + √tas] ✗
uttāna 1

adj. open; evident; lit. spread out [ud + √tan + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from uttanoti
Meaning open; evident; lit. spread out
Root Family ud √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction ud + √tan > tān + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > t
a > ā
Synonym uttānī
Commentary (MNa) uttāno'ti uggato pākaṭo.
Sanskrit uttāna
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Examples

parisuddho no kāyasamācāro bhavissati uttāno vivaṭo na ca chiddavā saṃvuto ca

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

evaṃ svākkhāto, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo uttāno vivaṭo pakāsito chinnapilotiko.

SN 12.22 dutiyadasabalasuttaṃ
uttāna 2

adj. lying on one's back; supine; lit. spread up [ud + √tan + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from uttanoti
Meaning lying on one's back; supine; lit. spread up
Root Family ud √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction ud + √tan > tān + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > t
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) uttānaseyyako'ti atidaharatāya uttānaseyyako, dakkhiṇena vā vāmena vā passena sayituṃ na sakkotī'ti attho.
Sanskrit uttāna
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, daharo kumāro mando uttānaseyyako hatthena vā pādena vā aṅgāraṃ akkamitvā khippam'eva paṭisaṃharati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ

udar'āvadehakaṃ bhutvā, sayant'uttānaseyyakā.
kathaṃ vattenti paṭibuddhā, yā kathā satthugarahitā.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā

uttāna 4

adj. clear; self-evident [ud + √tan] ✗
uttānaka 1

adj. open; overt; obvious; manifest [ud + √tan + *a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from uttāna
Meaning open; overt; obvious; manifest
Root Family ud √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction ud + √tan > tān + *a + ka
uttāna + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > t
a > ā
Antonym gahana
Sanskrit uttāna
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Example

yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā evaṃ manussagahane evaṃ manussakasaṭe evaṃ manussasāṭheyye vattamāne sattānaṃ hit'āhitaṃ jānāti. gahanañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ manussā, uttānakañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ pasavo.

uttānaka 2

adj. lying on one's back, supine [ud + √tan] ✗

uttānaseyyaka 1

adj. lying down on one's back [uttāna + seyyaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning lying down on one's back

Compound kammadhāraya (uttāna + seyyaka)
Commentary (MNa) uttānaseyyako'ti atidaharatāya uttānaseyyako, dakkhiṇena vā vāmena vā passena sayituṃ na sakkotī'ti attho.
Sanskrit uttāna + śāyikā

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, daharo kumāro mando uttānaseyyako hatthena vā pādena vā aṅgāraṃ akkamitvā khippam'eva paṭisaṃharati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena daharo kumāro mando uttānaseyyako abhayassa rājakumārassa aṅke nisinno hoti.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
uttānaseyyaka 2

masc. infant ✗
uttānikata

pp. made clear ✗
uttānikamma

nt. making clear; explanations ✗
uttānikaroti

pr. makes clear; explains ✗
uttānī

adj. open; evident; lit. spread out [ud + √tan + *a + ī] ~

Grammar adj, from uttāna
Meaning open; evident; lit. spread out
Root Family ud √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction ud + √tan > tān + *a + ī
uttāna + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change d > t
a > ā
a > ī before √kar
Synonym uttāna
Sanskrit uttāna
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)
uttānī karoti

idiom. (+acc) explains; clarifies; elucidates; lit. make spread out [uttāna + karoti] ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning explains; clarifies; elucidates; lit. make spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + karoti
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Variant uttānīkaroti
Sanskrit uttānīkaroti

Example

tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañ'c'eva vivaranti, anuttānīkatañ'ca uttānī karonti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
uttānīkata

pp. revealed; laid open; made plain; clarified; lit. made open [uttāna + kata] ✓

Grammar pp of uttānīkaroti, comp vb
Meaning revealed; laid open; made plain; clarified; lit. made open
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kata
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Antonym anuttānīkata
Synonym vivaṭa
Sanskrit uttānīkṛta (opened wide)

Example

ta'y'idaṃ āyasmatā khemakena tassa bhagavato sāsanaṃ vitthārena ācikkhitaṃ desitaṃ paññāpitaṃ paṭṭhapitaṃ vivaritaṃ vibhajitaṃ uttānīkatan'ti.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
uttānīkattabba

ptp. should be explained; should be clarified; should be elucidated; lit. to be made spread out [uttāna + kattabba] ~

Grammar ptp of uttānīkaroti, comp vb
Meaning should be explained; should be clarified; should be elucidated; lit. to be made spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kattabba
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
uttānīkatvā

abs. (+acc) having revealed; having openly admitted; lit. having made spread out [uttāna + katvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uttānīkaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning having revealed; having openly admitted; lit. having made spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + katvā
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + katvā)
Sanskrit uttānīkṛ (to open wide)

Examples

evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyakammaṃ satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu desetabbaṃ, vivaritabbaṃ, uttānīkātabbaṃ, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'cā'pi tathārūpiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu deseti vivarati uttānīkaroti, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
uttānīkamma

nt. exposition, manifestation ✗
uttānīkaraṇa

nt. exposition, manifestation ✗
uttānīkari

aor. made clear ✗
uttānīkariyamāna

prp. (+instr) being explained (by); being clarified (by); being elucidated (by); lit. being made spread out [uttāna + kariyamāna] ✓

Grammar prp of uttānīkariyati, comp vb, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being explained (by); being clarified (by); being elucidated (by); lit. being made spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kariyamāna
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Synonym vivariyamāna
Sanskrit uttānīkriyamāṇa

Example

yo, bhikkhave, tathāgatena evaṃ ācikkhiyamāne desiyamāne paññapiyamāne paṭṭhapiyamāne vivariyamāne vibhajiyamāne uttānīkariyamāne na jānāti na passati tam'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, bālaṃ puthujjanaṃ andhaṃ acakkhukaṃ ajānantaṃ apassantaṃ kin'ti karomi!

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
uttānīkaroti 1

pr. (+acc) explains; clarifies; elucidates; lit. makes spread out [uttāna + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning explains; clarifies; elucidates; lit. makes spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + karoti
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Synonym akkhāti, ādisati, ārocayati, āroceti, āvikaroti, upadisati, jānāpeti, jotayati, joteti, dīpeti, deseti, pakāseti, pilapati, vivarati, sandasseti
Variant uttānī karoti
Commentary (SNa) uttānīkarotī'ti pākaṭaṃ karoti
Sanskrit uttānīkaroti

Examples

na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti … sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā … vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti

DN 16.20 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti, abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā taṃ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
uttānīkaroti 2

pr. (+acc) reveals; openly admits; exposes; lit. makes spread out [uttāna + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning reveals; openly admits; exposes; lit. makes spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + karoti
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Synonym vivarati
Variant uttānī karoti
Commentary (SNa) uttānīkarotī'ti pākaṭaṃ karoti
Sanskrit uttānīkaroti

Example

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'cā'pi tathārūpiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu deseti vivarati uttānīkaroti, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
uttānīkātabba

ptp. (+loc) should be revealed (to); should be laid open (to); should be made evident (to); lit. to be made spread out [uttāna + kātabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of uttānīkaroti, comp vb (+loc)
Meaning should be revealed (to); should be laid open (to); should be made evident (to); lit. to be made spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kātabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + kātabba)
Sanskrit uttānīkṛ (to open wide)

Example

evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyakammaṃ satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu desetabbaṃ, vivaritabbaṃ, uttānīkātabbaṃ, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
uttānīkātuṃ

inf. (+acc) to reveal; to lay open; to make plain; to make evident; lit. to make spread out [uttāna + kātuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of uttānīkaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning to reveal; to lay open; to make plain; to make evident; lit. to make spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kātuṃ
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + kātuṃ)
Commentary (SNa) uttānīkātun'ti uttānakaṃ kātuṃ.
Sanskrit uttānīkṛ (to open wide)

Examples

sakkā evam'evaṃ viññāṇam'p'idaṃ ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ iti'p'idaṃ viññāṇaṃ anattā'ti.

SN 35.234 udāyīsuttaṃ

na kho mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ khemakaṃ vihes'āpekhā pucchimha, api c'āyasmā khemako pahosi tassa bhagavato sāsanaṃ vitthārena ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
uttānobhāsa 1

adj. (of a lake) appearing shallow; seemingly shallow [uttāna + obhāsa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of a lake) appearing shallow; seemingly shallow
Construction uttāna + obhāsa
Commentary (ANa) uttāno gambhīr'obhāso'tiādīsu purāṇa-paṇṇa-rasa-sambhinna-vaṇṇo kāḷaudako gambhīr'obhāso nāma, accha-vippasanna-maṇivaṇṇa-udako uttān'obhāso nāma.
uttānobhāsa 2

adj. (of a person) appearing shallow; seemingly simple [uttāna + obhāsa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of a person) appearing shallow; seemingly simple
Construction uttāna + obhāsa
uttāpeti

pr. heats, torments [ud + √tap] ✗
uttāpesi

aor. heated, tormented [ud + √tap] ✗
uttāra

masc. transporting over ✗
uttārasetu

masc. bridge or causeway for transporting over ✗
uttāreti

pr. lets cross, saves, assists [ud + √tar] ✗
uttāresi

aor. let cross, saved, assisted [ud + √tar] ✗
uttāsa

masc. fear; fright; terror; dread [ud + √tas + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from uttasati
Meaning fear; fright; terror; dread
Root Family ud √tas
Root √tas･1 a (tremble, fear)
√ In Comps ttas
Construction ud + √tas > tās + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym utrāsa, dara, bherava, santāsa
Commentary (DNa) taṃmuhuttikaṃ caṇḍahatthiass'ādīni vā ahiyakkh'ādayo vā paṭicca lomahaṃsanakaraṃ bhayaṃ uttāsabhayaṃ nāma. taṃ sabbaṃ apanuditā vūpasametā.
Sanskrit uttrāsa
Sanskrit Root √tras 1 (be terrified)
uttāsana

nt. impalement [ud + √tas] ✗
uttāsayati

pr. impales (on a stake) [ud + √tas] ✗
uttāsavant

adj. fearful, afraid [ud + √tas] ✗
uttāsita

pp. impaled [ud + √tas] ✗
uttāsī

adj. (from uttāsa) fearful, very afraid [ud + √tas] ✗
uttāseti 1.1

pr. (+acc and +loc) impales (on) [ud + √tas + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc and +loc)
Meaning impales (on)
Root Family ud √tas
Root √tas･8 *e (decorate, impale)
Base √tas + *e > tāse
Construction ud + tāse + ti
Phonetic Change d > t
a > ā
Sanskrit uttaṃsayati
Sanskrit Root √taṃs 1 (decorate)

Example

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti ... palālapīṭhakam'pi karonti, tattena'pi telena osiñcanti, sunakhehi'pi khādāpenti, jīvantam'pi sūle uttāsenti, asinā'pi sīsaṃ chindanti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
uttāseti 2.1

pr. (+acc) frightens or terrifies [ud + √tas] ✗
uttāsenta

prp. (+acc and +loc) impaling (on) [ud + √tas + *e + nta] ~

uttāsesi

aor. impaled [ud + √tas] ✗
uttiṭṭhati

pr. gets up; stands up [ud + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning gets up; stands up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction ud + tiṭṭha + ti
Phonetic Change d > t
ṭ > t
Synonym uṭṭhahati, uṭṭheti
Sanskrit utthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

uttiṭṭhe nappamajjeyya,
dhammaṃ sucaritaṃ care,
dhammacārī sukhaṃ seti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

DHP 168 lokavaggo
uttiṭṭhapatta

nt. bowl for leftovers or containing leftovers ✗
uttiṭṭhapiṇḍa

masc. left over food; food consisting of leavings ✗
uttiṇa

Meaning removed the thatch

pp. (of water) emerged from; come out the other side; crossed over [ud + √tar + na] ✓

Grammar pp of uttarati
Meaning (of water) emerged from; come out the other side; crossed over
Root Family ud √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ud + √tar > tir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > t
a > i (Kacc 581, 616)
rn > ṇṇ
Variant tiṇṇa
Sanskrit uttīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

divāvihārā nikkhamma,
gijjhakūṭamhi pabbate,
nāgaṃ ogāham'uttiṇṇaṃ,
nadītīramhi addasaṃ.

THI 32 dantikātherīgāthā

tassa purisassa uttiṇṇassa pāraṅ'gatassa evam'assa, bahukāro kho me ayaṃ kullo, im'āhaṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttiṇṇo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
uttiya 1

masc. name of a wandering ascetic ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a wandering ascetic
Sanskrit uttiya (bsk)

Example

atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi, mā h'evaṃ kho uttiyo paribbājako pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ paṭilabhi, sabbasāmukkaṃsikaṃ vata me samaṇo gotamo pañhaṃ puṭṭho saṃsādeti, no vissajjeti, na nūna visahatī'ti.

AN 10.95 uttiyasuttaṃ
uttiya 2

masc. personal name of an arahant monk ✗

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.95 (AN10.95) ✗
uttuttariṃ

ind. more and more; to a greater and greater extent ✗
uttrasta

pp. frightened, terrified [ud + √tas] ✗
uttrāsī

adj. fearful, timid [ud + √tas] ✗
utrasta 1

pp. frightened; alarmed; terrified; lit. shaken up [ud + √tras + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ud √tras
Meaning frightened; alarmed; terrified; lit. shaken up
Root Family ud √tras
Root √tras･1 a (fear, shake)
Construction ud + √tras + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym anutrasta
Synonym ubbigga, bhīta, saṃvijita, saṃvejita
Notes see utrasta 2
Sanskrit uttrasta
Sanskrit Root √tras 1 (be terrified)

Example

niccaṃ utrastam'idaṃ cittaṃ,
niccaṃ ubbiggam'idaṃ mano,
anuppannesu kicchesu,
atho uppatitesu ca,
sace atthi anutrastaṃ,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

MN 30 cūḷasāropamasuttaṃ

abhikkantā, bhante, ratti, nikkhanto paṭhamo yāmo, ciranisinno bhikkhusaṅgho, uddisatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ pātimokkhan'ti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
uda 1.1

ind. either; or ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning either; or
Sanskrit uta

Examples

samo visesī uda vā nihīno,
yo maññatī so vivadetha tena,
tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno,
samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
uda 2.1

nt. water [√ud + a] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps
Meaning water
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ambu, udaka, oka, oda, odaka, ka, jala, toya, daka, ninnaga, vāri, salila
Notes often oda in comps
Sanskrit uda
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto saṃsaṭṭho lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati tap'od'ārāme. atha kho āyasmā samiddhi rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tap'odā ten'upasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.

samo visesī uda vā nihīno,
yo maññatī so vivadetha tena,
tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno,
samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.

ahi āviñcheyya, vammikaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, susumāro āviñcheyya, udakaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, pakkhī āviñcheyya, ākāsaṃ ḍessāmī'ti

VIN 2.5.4.9 paṇītabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ
udaka 1.3

nt. juice; drink [√ud + aka] ✓

Meaning juice; drink
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit udaka
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

Example

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, kolehi yāpemā'ti. te kolam'pi khādanti, kolacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, kol'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi kolavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
udaka 2.1

masc. name of the Buddha's second teacher; Udaka Rāmaputta ✓

Meaning name of the Buddha's second teacher; Udaka Rāmaputta
Variant uddaka
Commentary (SNa) udako'ti tassa nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit udraka, rudraka

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, kiṃkusalagavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno yena udako rāmaputto ten'upasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā udakaṃ rāmaputtaṃ etadavocaṃ

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

ayaṃ kho udako rāmaputto paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī dīgharattaṃ apparaj'akkhajātiko. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ udakassa rāmaputtassa paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ. so imaṃ dhammaṃ khippam'eva ājānissatī'ti.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
udakaṭṭhapana

nt. setting up water; arranging water [udaka + ṭhapana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning setting up water; arranging water

Sanskrit udaka + pratiṣṭhāpam

Example

udakaṃ āsanena ca: āsanena saha pāṇīyaparibhojaṇīyaṃ udakaṭṭhapanaṃ kataṃ kiṃ? āsanena saha pāṇīyaparibhojaṇīyaṃ udakaṭṭhapanaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
udakaṇṇava

masc. sea; ocean; body of water [udaka + aṇṇava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sea; ocean; body of water
Construction udaka + aṇṇava
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + aṇṇava)
Synonym aṇṇava, udadhi, mahodadhi, samudda
Sanskrit udaka + arṇava

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
udakatala

nt. surface of the water [udaka + tala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning surface of the water
Construction udaka + tala
Synonym udakapiṭṭhi
udakatārakā

fem. sparkle of the water; shimmer of the water [udaka + tārakā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning sparkle of the water; shimmer of the water
Construction udaka + tārakā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + tārakā)
Sanskrit udaka + tārakā

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma gambhīre udapāne udakatārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti, evam'ev'assu me akkhikūpesu akkhitārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
udakadantapoṇa

nt. water and tooth-stick [udaka + dantapoṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning water and tooth-stick
Construction udaka + dantapoṇa
Compound dvanda (udaka ca dantapoṇa ca)
Variant udakadantapona
Commentary (KVa) udakañ'hi yathāsukhaṃ pātuṃ, dantakaṭṭhañ'ca dantaponaparibhogena paribhuñjituṃ vaṭṭati.
Sanskrit udaka + danta + pravaṇa
udakadantapona

nt. water and tooth-stick [udaka + dantapona] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning water and tooth-stick
Construction udaka + dantapona
Compound dvanda (udaka ca dantapona ca)
Variant udakadantapoṇa
Commentary (KVa) udakañ'hi yathāsukhaṃ pātuṃ, dantakaṭṭhañ'ca dantaponaparibhogena paribhuñjituṃ vaṭṭati.
Sanskrit udaka + danta + pravaṇa

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhareyya aññatra udakadantaponā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 40 dantaponasikkhāpadaṃ

āhāro nāma udakadantaponaṃ ṭhapetvā yaṃkiñci ajjhoharaṇīyaṃ, eso āhāro nāma.

VIN 2.5.4.10 dantaponasikkhāpadaṃ
udakadaha

udakanta

Grammar masc, comp

Construction udaka + anta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + anta)
Commentary (MNa) udakantan'ti udakaṃ.
Sanskrit udaka + anta

Example

sā harit'antaṃ vā panth'antaṃ vā sel'antaṃ vā udak'antaṃ vā ramaṇīyaṃ vā bhūmibhāgaṃ āgamma anāhārā nibbāyati. hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ kukkuṭapattena'pi nhārudaddulena'pi aggiṃ gavesanti.

udakabindu

nt. drop of water [udaka + bindu] ✓

Construction udaka + bindu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + bindu)
Synonym udakaphusita, udabindu
Sanskrit udaka + bindu

Examples

tatrāssu me idaṃ, sāriputta, jegucchismiṃ hoti, so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, sato'va abhikkamāmi, sato'va paṭikkamāmi, yāva udakabindumhi'pi me dayā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti, m'āhaṃ khuddake pāṇe visamagate saṅghātaṃ āpādesin'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

sā udakabindūhi paggharanteh'eva aḍḍh'ullikhitehi kesehi vegena gantvā, tuvaṭaṃ kho, ayyaputta, āgaccheyyāsī'ti āha

DHPa 1.1.9 nandatthera vatthu
udakabubbuḷa

nt. water bubble [udaka + bubbuḷa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning water bubble
Construction udaka + bubbuḷa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + bubbuḷa)
Variant udakapupphuḷa, udakapubbuḷa
Sanskrit udaka + budbuda

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, thullaphusitake deve vassante udakabubbuḷaṃ khippaṃ'y'eva paṭivigacchati, na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, udakabubbuḷ'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ bahudukkhaṃ bah'upāyāsaṃ mantāyaṃ boddhabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, n'atthi jātassa amaraṇaṃ.

AN 7.74 arakasuttaṃ

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a water bubble
Construction udakabubbuḷa + upama
Compound kammadhāraya (udakabubbuḷa + upama)
Sanskrit udaka + budbuda + upamā

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, thullaphusitake deve vassante udakabubbuḷaṃ khippaṃ'y'eva paṭivigacchati, na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, udakabubbuḷ'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ bahudukkhaṃ bah'upāyāsaṃ mantāyaṃ boddhabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, n'atthi jātassa amaraṇaṃ.

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning water jar; large clay water-pot
Construction udaka + maṇika
Compound kammadhāraya (udaka + maṇika)
Commentary (MNa) udakamaṇikan'ti mahākucchikaṃ udakacāṭiṃ. (ANa) udakamaṇiko'ti samekhalā udakacāṭi.
Sanskrit udaka + maṇika

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ādhāre ṭhapito pūro udakassa samatittiko kākapeyyo. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āvajjeyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

Meaning (ritually married by) pouring water (on the hands)
Construction udaka + upassaṭṭha
Commentary (ANa) udak'ūpassaṭṭhan'ti udakena upassaṭṭhaṃ pariccattaṃ. so hi yasmiṃ kule vayappattā dārikā atthi, gantvā tassa dvāre tiṭṭhati. kasmā ṭhitosī'ti vutte ahaṃ aṭṭhacattālīsa vassāni komārabrahmacariyaṃ cariṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ tumhākaṃ demi, tumhe mayhaṃ dārikaṃ dethā'ti vadati. te dārikaṃ ānetvā tassa hatthe udakaṃ pātetvā denti.
udakeuccārasikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 75; lit. rule about defecating (, urinating and spitting) in water [udake + uccāra + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 75; lit. rule about defecating (, urinating and spitting) in water
Construction udake + uccāra + sikkhāpada
udakecara

adj. who moves or lives in water; aquatic creature ✗
udakorohaka

masc. bather; ritual bather; lit. who descends into water [udaka + orohaka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning bather; ritual bather; lit. who descends into water
Construction udaka + orohaka
Compound sattamī tappurisa > bahubbīhi (udake + orohaka)
Commentary (MNa) udakorohakassā'ti divasassa tikkhattuṃ udakaṃ orohantassa.
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaka

Examples

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, udak'orohakassa udak'orohakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
udakorohakamatta

nt. mere fact of being a ritual bather [udakorohaka + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mere fact of being a ritual bather
Construction udakorohaka + matta
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaka + mātra

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, udakorohakassa udakorohakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlikassa rukkhamūlikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, abbhokāsikassa abbhokāsikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
udakorohaṇa

nt. ritual bathing; lit. descending into water [udaka + orohaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ritual bathing; lit. descending into water
Construction udaka + orohaṇa
Compound sattamī tappurisa (udake + orohaṇa)
Commentary (APAa) udakorohaṇā udakapavesakā'ti attho.
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaṇa

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, udakorohakassa udakorohaṇamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlikassa rukkhamūlikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, abbhokāsikassa abbhokāsikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
udakorohaṇanuyoga

masc. practice of ritual bathing ✗

nt. mere fact of ritual bathing [udakorohaṇa + matta] ✓

Sanskrit udaka + avarohaṇa + mātra

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
udakorohana

nt. going down into the water; ritual bath ✗
udakorohanānuyoga

masc. practice of ritual bathing; act of descending into water (for ritual purification) [udaka + orohana + anuyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning practice of ritual bathing; act of descending into water (for ritual purification)
Construction udaka + orohana + anuyoga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakorohanassa + anuyoga)
Commentary (MNa) pāto majjhanhike sāyan'ti divasassa tikkhattuṃ pāpaṃ pavāhessāmī'ti udak'orohan'ānuyogaṃ anuyutto viharāmī'ti dasseti
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaṇa + anuyoga

Example

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
udakorohanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the practice of ritual bathing [udaka + orohana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the practice of ritual bathing
Construction udaka + orohana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (udakorohanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Commentary (MNa) pāto majjhanhike sāyan'ti divasassa tikkhattuṃ pāpaṃ pavāhessāmī'ti udak'orohan'ānuyogaṃ anuyutto viharāmī'ti dasseti
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaṇa + anuyoga + anuyukta

Example

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
udakorohanta

masc. bather; swimmer; lit. going down into water [udaka + orohanta] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, prp of udakaṃ orohati, comp
Meaning bather; swimmer; lit. going down into water
Construction udaka + orohanta
Commentary (ANa) udak'orohantassā'ti udakaṃ otarantassa. (MNa) udak'orohante'ti udakaṃ orohante puggale.
Sanskrit udaka + avarohat

Example

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, bhayāni udak'orohantassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni. katamāni cattāri? ūmibhayaṃ, kumbhīlabhayaṃ, āvaṭṭabhayaṃ, susukābhayaṃ

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
udagga

adj. elated; enraptured; exulted; lit. up foremost [ud + agga] ✓

Grammar adj, from agga
Meaning elated; enraptured; exulted; lit. up foremost
Construction ud + agga
Sanskrit udagra

Examples

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

yaṃ vat'āhaṃ aññesu samaṇabrāhmaṇesu okāsakammamattam'pi n'ālatthaṃ taṃ me idaṃ samaṇena gotamena okāsakammaṃ katan'ti. attamano pamudito udaggo pītisomanassajāto bhagavantaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
udaggacitta

adj. with elated heart; with exulted mind; lit. up foremost mind [udagga + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with elated heart; with exulted mind; lit. up foremost mind
Construction udagga + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (udagga + citta)
Commentary (THa) udaggacittā'ti odagyapītiyā vasena udaggacittā alīnacittā.
Sanskrit udagra + citta

Examples

yadā bhagavā aññāsi brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ kallacittaṃ muducittaṃ vinīvaraṇacittaṃ udaggacittaṃ pasannacittaṃ, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā taṃ pakāsesi, dukkhaṃ, samudayaṃ, nirodhaṃ, maggaṃ.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

udaggudagga

Meaning extremely elated; very joyful
Construction udagga + udagga
Sanskrit udagra + udagra
udaṅgaṇe

ind. in the open [ud + √aṅg] ✗
udacchidā

imperf. (+acc) has stopped; has cut off [ud + a + √chid + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of ucchindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning has stopped; has cut off
Root Family ud √chid
Root √chid･2 ṃa (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Construction ud + a + √chid + ā
Commentary (SNPa) udacchidā'ti ucchindati, bhañjati, vināseti. atītakālikānam'pi hi chandasi vattamānavacanaṃ akkharacintakā icchanti.
Sanskrit ucchid, aucchinat
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Example

yo rāgam'udacchidā asesaṃ,
bhisapupphaṃ'va saroruhaṃ vigayha,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

Examples

sobbhesu padaresu ca,
saṇantā yanti kusobbhā,
tuṇhīyanti mahā-udadhī.

mahāvaggo 11

samuddo udadhinaṃ seṭṭho,
nakkhattānañ'ca candimā,
sadevakassa lokassa,
buddho aggo pavuccatī'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
udapajjatha

imperf. appeared; arose [ud + √pad + ya + ttha] ✓

Grammar imperf, reflx 3rd sg of udapajjā, irreg form of udapajjattha, intrans
Meaning appeared; arose
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ud + a + pajja + ttha > udapajjatha
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Synonym udapajjā
Notes (THa) evaṃ yoniso manasikāro uppajji.
Sanskrit utpad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

tato me manasīkāro,
yoniso udapajjatha,
ādīnavo pāturahu,
nibbidā samatiṭṭhatha.

yoniso udapajjatha,

nibbidā samatiṭṭhatha.

SN 22.26 assādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.

VIN 4.1.7 pabbajjākathā

aor. was re-born [ud + a + √pad + i] ✓

Meaning was re-born
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ud + a + √pad + i
Sanskrit utpad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ, tatrā'p'āsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto

Sanskrit udapāna

Examples

papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,
ye dadanti upassayaṃ,
tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati.

SN 1.47 vanaropasuttaṃ

kiṃ kayirā udapānena,
āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
taṇhāya mūlato chetvā,
kissa pariyesanaṃ care'ti.

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ
udapānadūsakajātaka

nt. Jātaka 271 (JA 271) ✗
udapānapanāḷiyatthika

adj. wanting an outlet pipe for a well; lit. water drinking tube wanting [udapāna + panāḷī + atthika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting an outlet pipe for a well; lit. water drinking tube wanting
Construction udapāna + panāḷī + [y] + atthika
Phonetic Change +y
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (udapānapanāḷiṃ + atthika)
Sanskrit udapāna + praṇāḍī, praṇālī + arthika

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso udapānapanāḷi'y'atthiko tiṇhaṃ kuṭhāriṃ ādāya vanaṃ paviseyya. so yaṃ yadeva rukkhaṃ kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭeyya tattha yāni tāni rukkhāni daḷhāni sāravantāni tāni kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭitāni kakkhaḷaṃ paṭinadanti, yāni pana tāni rukkhāni antopūtīni avassutāni kasambujātāni tāni kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭitāni daddaraṃ paṭinadanti.

AN 8.10 kāraṇḍavasuttaṃ
udapānapanāḷī

fem. outlet pipe for a well; lit. water drinking tube [udapāna + panāḷī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning outlet pipe for a well; lit. water drinking tube
Construction udapāna + panāḷī
Compound catutthī tappurisa (udapānassa + panāḷī)
Sanskrit udapāna + praṇāḍī, praṇālī

Example

tam'enaṃ mūle chindati, mūle chinditvā agge chindati, agge chinditvā anto suvisodhitaṃ visodheti, anto suvisodhitaṃ visodhetvā udapānapanāḷiṃ yojeti.

na man'taṃ āgamissati,
udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,
bālo pūrati pāpassa,
thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

udabindu yathā'pi pokkhare,
padume vāri yathā na limpati,
evaṃ muni n'opalimpati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā.
