TH 139 nandattheragāthā
udabbahi 2

aor. plucked out, rooted up [ud + √vah] ✗
udaya 1

masc. rising; coming; up; appearance [ud + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from udeti
Meaning rising; coming; up; appearance
Root Family ud √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ud + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym vaya
Sanskrit udaya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassī viharati

AN 4.41 samādhibhāvanāsuttaṃ

yo ca vassasataṃ jīve,
apassaṃ udayabbayaṃ,
ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo,
passato udayabbayaṃ.

DHP 113 sahassavaggo
udaya 2

masc. income; profit; revenue; lit. rising up [ud + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from udeti
Meaning income; profit; revenue; lit. rising up
Root Family ud √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ud + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Synonym āya
Variant uddaya
Commentary (ANa) uday'atthiko'ti vaḍḍhiatthiko
Sanskrit udaya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso uday'atthiko assapaṇiyaṃ poseyya. so udayañ'c'eva n'ādhigaccheyya, uttariñ'ca kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assa. evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, uday'atthiko bāle nigaṇṭhe payirupāsiṃ.

Commentary (SNa) udayagāminin'ti attano samaye vaḍḍhigāminiṃ. (SNt) udayagāminin'ti ārambhato paṭṭhāya sampattiāvahaṃ.

udayati

pr. rises, comes out, increases [ud + √i] ✗
udayatthagama

masc. rise and fall ✗
udayatthagāmī

adj. which discerns appearance and disappearance; related to rising and falling; of arising and passing [udaya + atthagāmī] ✓

Construction udaya + atthagāmī

Sanskrit udaya + astagāmin

Examples

kathañ'ca, visākhe, mātugāmo paññāsampanno hoti? idha, visākhe, mātugāmo paññavā hoti, uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammādukkhakkhayagāminiyā.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu paññavā hoti uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā. sambodhipakkhikānaṃ, āvuso, dhammānaṃ ayaṃ pañcamī upanisā bhāvanāya.

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ
udayatthika

adj. wanting revenue; seeking a profit [udaya + atthika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting revenue; seeking a profit
Construction udaya + atthika
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (udayaṃ + atthika)
Synonym vaḍḍhiatthika
Commentary (ANa) uday'atthiko'ti vaḍḍhiatthiko.
Sanskrit udaya + arthika

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso uday'atthiko assapaṇiyaṃ poseyya. so udayañ'c'eva n'ādhigaccheyya, uttariñ'ca kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assa. evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, uday'atthiko bāle nigaṇṭhe payirupāsiṃ.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
udayana

nt. rise, going up [ud + √i] ✗
udayanta

prp. rising, growing [ud + √i] ✗
udayapañha

nt. Sutta Nipāta 5.14 (SNP 68) ✗
udayabbaya

masc. rising and falling; appearance and disappearance; formation and dissolution [udaya + vaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning rising and falling; appearance and disappearance; formation and dissolution
Construction udaya + vaya > baya
Phonetic Change v > b
Compound dvanda (udaya ca baya ca)
Commentary (THa) udayabbayañ'cā'ti uppādañ'c'eva vayañ'ca
Sanskrit udaya + vyaya

Examples

yo ca vassasataṃ jīve,
apassaṃ udayabbayaṃ,
ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo,
passato udayabbayaṃ.

DHP 113 sahassavaggo

katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbaya-anupassī viharati

AN 4.41 samādhibhāvanāsuttaṃ
udayabbayānupassana

nt. seeing appearance and disappearance; observing formation and dissolution [udayabbaya + anupassana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning seeing appearance and disappearance; observing formation and dissolution
Construction udayabbaya + anupassana
udayabbayānupassanā

fem. observing formation and dissolution [udayabbaya + anupassanā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning observing formation and dissolution
Construction udayabbaya + anupassanā
udayabbayānupassī

adj. (+loc) seeing the rise and fall (of); following the appearance and disappearance (of); watching the formation and dissolution (of) [udayabbaya + anupassī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning seeing the rise and fall (of); following the appearance and disappearance (of); watching the formation and dissolution (of)
Construction udayabbaya + anupassī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (udayabbayaṃ + anupassī)
Sanskrit udaya + vyaya + anupaśyin

Examples

pañcasu kho pana upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassī viharati, iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅ'gamo. iti vedanā, iti vedanāya samudayo, iti vedanāya atthaṅ'gamo.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassī viharati

udayabhadda

masc. name of a prince; Ajātasattu's son ✗

fem. Sutta Nipāta 5.14 (SNP 68) ✗
udayavaya

masc. rise and fall; arising and passing away ✗

masc. rise and fall; arising and passing away ✗
udayasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 7.12 (SN7.12) ✗
udara 1.1

nt. stomach; belly [ud + √dar + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning stomach; belly
Root Family ud √dar
Root √dar･1 a (break, split apart)
Construction ud + √dar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym kucchi
Sanskrit udara

Examples

kāyagutto vacīgutto,
āhāre udare yato,
saccaṃ karomi niddānaṃ,
soraccaṃ me pamocanaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

ūn'ūdaro mit'āhāro,
app'icchassa alolupo,
sadā icchāya nicchāto,
aniccho hoti nibbuto.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of undigested food; lit. full of stomach
Construction udara + pūra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udarassa + pūra)
Commentary (SNPa) udarassa pūro udarapūro. udaran'ti ca udariyass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tañ'hi ṭhānanāmena udaran'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit udara + pūra

Example

antapūro udarapūro,
yakanapeḷassa vatthino,
hadayassa papphāsassa,
vakkassa pihakassa ca.

Sanskrit udara + ava + deha +

Examples

yo so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yāva'd'atthaṃ udar'āvadehakaṃ bhuñjitvā seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutto viharati, tassa cittaṃ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ

udar'āvadehakaṃ bhutvā, sayant'uttānaseyyakā.
kathaṃ vattenti paṭibuddhā, yā kathā satthugarahitā.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā

udara + iya

masc. inspired saying; exclamation; one of the nine kinds of suttas; lit. breath up; sigh [ud + √an + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning inspired saying; exclamation; one of the nine kinds of suttas; lit. breath up; sigh

Root √an･1 a (breath, blow)
Construction ud + √an > ān + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) somanassañāṇamayikagāthāpaṭisaṃyuttā dveasītisuttantā udānan'ti veditabbā.
Sanskrit udāna
Sanskrit Root √an 1, 2, 6 (breathe)

Examples

atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo anupubbena nāḷik'odanaparamatāya saṇṭhāsi. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo aparena samayena susallikhitagatto pāṇinā gattāni anumajjanto tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacce moghapurisā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

udānaṭṭhakathā

fem. commentary on the Udāna ✗
udānapāḷi

fem. Book 3 of the Khuddaka Nikāya ✗
udānayati

pr. utters an udāna; makes a joyful utterance [ud + √an] ✗
udānavasena

ind. by means of an inspired saying ✗
udānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.55 (SN22.55) ✗
udānaṃ udānesi

idiom. uttered an exclamation; expressed a sentiment ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + aor
Meaning uttered an exclamation; expressed a sentiment
Commentary (MNa) udānaṃ udānesī'ti udāhāraṃ udāhari. yathā hi yaṃ telaṃ mānaṃ gahetuṃ na sakkoti, vissanditvā gacchati, taṃ avaseko'ti vuccati, yañ'ca jalaṃ taḷākaṃ gahetuṃ na sakkoti, ajjhottharitvā gacchati, taṃ ogho'ti vuccati. evam'eva yaṃ pītimayaṃ vacanaṃ hadayaṃ gahetuṃ na sakkoti, adhikaṃ hutvā anto asaṇṭhahitvā bahi nikkhamati, taṃ udānan'ti vuccati. evarūpaṃ pītimayaṃ vacanaṃ nicchāresī'ti attho.
Sanskrit udānam + udāniṣus

Examples

evaṃ vutte, jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo sabbasetā vaḷavābhirathā orohitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udānesi, namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ

atha kho aparā devatā bhagavato santike imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, passa samādhiṃ subhāvitaṃ cittañ'ca suvimuttaṃ, na c'ābhinataṃ na c'āpanataṃ na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagataṃ.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
udāneti

pr. (+acc) says something inspirational; utters; lit. causes to sigh; breath up [ud + √an + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ud √an, trans (+acc)
Meaning says something inspirational; utters; lit. causes to sigh; breath up
Root Family ud √an
Root √an･1 *e (breath, blow)
Base √an + *e > āne (caus)
Construction ud + āne + ti
Sanskrit udānayati
Sanskrit Root √an 1, 2, 6 (breathe)

Example

evaṃ vutte brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udāneti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
udānenta

prp. (+acc) saying something inspirational; uttering; lit. causing to sigh; breath up [ud + √an + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of udāneti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning saying something inspirational; uttering; lit. causing to sigh; breath up
Root Family ud √an
Root √an･1 *e (breath, blow)
Base √an + *e > āne (caus)
Construction ud + āne + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit udānayat
Sanskrit Root √an 1, 2, 6 (breathe)

Example

assosuṃ kho sambahulā bhikkhū āyasmato bhaddiyassa kāḷīgodhāya puttassa araññagatassa'pi rukkhamūlagatassa'pi suññ'āgāragatassa'pi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānentassa, aho sukhaṃ, aho sukhan'ti!

Synonym athavā, va
Sanskrit utāro

Examples

kacci te, bhante, bhikkhū samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaṃsu udāhu sant'etth'ekacce bhikkhū adhimānena aññaṃ byākaṃsū'ti?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
udikkhati

pr. (+acc) sees; perceives; beholds; expects [ud + √ikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sees; perceives; beholds; expects
Root Family ud √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction ud + ikkha + ti
Synonym samanupassati
Sanskrit udīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Example

kiṃ te idha sārasammataṃ,
kuṇapapūramhi susānavaḍḍhane,
bhedanadhamme kaḷevare,
yaṃ disvā vimano udikkhasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
udikkhi

aor. (+acc) saw; looked up (at) [ud + √ikkh + i] ✓

Grammar aor of udikkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning saw; looked up (at)
Root Family ud √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Construction ud + √ikkh + i
Commentary (THa) gacchanto naṃ udikkhisan'ti nagaravīthiyaṃ gacchanto parissayapariharaṇatthaṃ vīthiṃ olokento taṃ naṭṭakiṃ olokesiṃ.
Sanskrit udīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Example

piṇḍikāya paviṭṭho'haṃ,
gacchanto naṃ udikkhisaṃ,
alaṅ'kataṃ suvasanaṃ,
maccupāsaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ.

TH 186 nāgasamālattheragāthā
udikkhita

pp. looked at, surveyed [ud + √ikkh] ✗
udikkhitar

masc. who looks at; who looks upon [ud + √ikkh] ✗
udikkhiya

ger. seeing or looking at [ud + √ikkh] ✗
udikkhisaṃ

aor. (+acc) I saw; I looked up (at) [ud + √ikkh + isaṃ] ✓

Grammar aor 1st sg of udikkhi, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning I saw; I looked up (at)
Root Family ud √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Construction ud + √ikkh + isaṃ
Commentary (THa) gacchanto naṃ udikkhisan'ti nagaravīthiyaṃ gacchanto parissayapariharaṇatthaṃ vīthiṃ olokento taṃ naṭṭakiṃ olokesiṃ.
Sanskrit udīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Example

piṇḍikāya paviṭṭho'haṃ,
gacchanto naṃ udikkhisaṃ,
alaṅ'kataṃ suvasanaṃ,
maccupāsaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ.

TH 186 nāgasamālattheragāthā
udicca 1

adj. high born; noble; lit. northern [ud + √i + ta + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from udita
Meaning high born; noble; lit. northern
Root Family ud √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ud + √i + ta + ya
udita + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit udīcya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

brahmajacco pure āsiṃ,
udicco ubhato ahu,
sojja putto sugatassa,
dhammarājassa satthuno.

TH 255 aṅgulimālattheragāthā
udicca 2

adj. of the northern origin [ud + √i] ✗
udita

pp. spoken; proclaimed; uttered [ud + √i] ✗
udīraṇa

nt. utterance, saying [ud + √īr] ✗
udīrayati

pr. (+acc) speaks; utters [ud + √īr + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaks; utters
Root Family ud √īr
Root √īr･8 *aya (speak)
Base √īr + aya > īraya
Construction ud + īraya + ti
Sanskrit udīrayati
Sanskrit Root √īr 1, 2 (set in motion)

Example

akakkasaṃ viññāpaniṃ,
giraṃ saccam'udīraye,
yāya n'ābhisaje kañci,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 408 brāhmaṇavaggo
udīrayanta

prp. (+acc) speaking (about); talking (about); proclaiming [ud + √īr + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of udīrayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaking (about); talking (about); proclaiming
Root Family ud √īr
Root √īr･8 *aya (speak)
Base √īr + aya > īraya
Construction ud + īraya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym bhaṇamāna, bhāsanta, bhāsamāna
Commentary (ITIa) dhammam'udīrayantā'ti catusaccadhammaṃ kathentā.
Sanskrit udīrayat
Sanskrit Root √īr 1, 2 (set in motion)

Example

ete tayo devamanussaseṭṭhā,
pabhaṅ'karā dhammam'udīrayantā,
apāpuranti amatassa dvāraṃ,
yogā pamocenti hujjanaṃ te.

ITI 84 bahujanahitasuttaṃ
udīrayi

aor. (+acc) spoke; uttered [ud + √īr + *aya + i] ~

Grammar aor of udīrayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning spoke; uttered
Root Family ud √īr
Root √īr･8 *aya (speak)
Base √īr + aya > īraya
Construction ud + īraya + i
Variant udīriyi, udīriyati, udiyyati, udayyati, uṭṭhahati
Sanskrit udīr
Sanskrit Root √īr 1, 2 (set in motion)
udīrita

pp. said; uttered; spoken; mentioned [ud + √īr + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of udīreti
Meaning said; uttered; spoken; mentioned
Root Family ud √īr
Root √īr･8 *e (speak)
Construction ud + √īr + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym utta, kathita, pabhāvita, pavutta, bhaṭṭha, bhaṇita, bhāsita, lapita, vutta, samudāciṇṇa
Sanskrit udīrita
Sanskrit Root √īr 1, 2 (set in motion)

Example

tathāgataṃ buddham'asayhasāhinaṃ,
duve vitakkā samudācaranti naṃ,
khemo vitakko paṭhamo udīrito,
tato viveko dutiyo pakāsito.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
udumbara

masc. cluster fig; Ficus racemosa ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning cluster fig; Ficus racemosa
Synonym udumbarī
Notes Flower of the plant are sheathed within the fruits and these are not visible directly.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ficus_racemosa
Sanskrit uḍumbara

Examples

yo n'ājjhagamā bhavesu sāraṃ,
vicinaṃ puppham'iva udumbaresu,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

khandhabījaṃ nāma, assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi khandhe jāyanti, khandhe sañjāyanti, etaṃ khandhabījaṃ nāma.

VIN 2.5.2.1 bhūtagāmasikkhāpadaṃ
udumbarakaṭṭha

nt. cluster fig log; cluster fig tree timber [udumbara + kaṭṭha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cluster fig log; cluster fig tree timber
Construction udumbara + kaṭṭha
udumbarakhādaka

masc. sqanderer; who wastes resources; lit. cluster fig eater [udumbara + khādaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sqanderer; who wastes resources; lit. cluster fig eater
Construction udumbara + khādaka
Synonym udumbarakhādī
Commentary (ANa) udumbarakhādī'vā'ti yathā udumbarāni khāditu'kāmena pakke udumbararukkhe cālite ekappahāren'eva bahūni phalāni patanti, so khāditabbayuttakāni khāditvā itarāni bahutarāni pahāya gacchati, evam'evaṃ yo āyato vayaṃ bahutaraṃ katvā vippakiranto bhoge paribhuñjati, so udumbarakhādikaṃ'v'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit uḍumbara + khādin

Example

sac'āyaṃ, byagghapajja, kulaputto app'āyo samāno uḷāraṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti, tassa bhavanti vattāro, udumbarakhādakaṃ c'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti.

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sqanderer; who wastes resources; lit. cluster fig eater

Sanskrit uḍumbara + khādin

Example

udumbarikā

fem. name of a queen who built a park for wandering ascetics [udumbara + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from udumbara
Meaning name of a queen who built a park for wandering ascetics

Example

atha kho bhagavā udumbarikāya paribbājak'ārāme sīhanādaṃ naditvā vehāsaṃ abbhuggantvā gijjhakūṭe pabbate paccupaṭṭhāsi. sandhāno pana gahapati tāva'd'eva rājagahaṃ pāvisī'ti.

udeti

pr. (+acc) rises; grows; develops [ud + √i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning rises; grows; develops
Root Family ud √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction ud + e + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym pabbati, pavaḍḍhati, vaḍḍhati, vaḍḍheti, vaddhati, viruhati, virūhati
Sanskrit udeti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

na ca hāyetha kadāci tulyasevī,
seṭṭham'upanamaṃ udeti khippaṃ,
tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā'ti.

VIN PAT PC 88 tūlonaddhasikkhāpadaṃ

Phonetic Change a > ā

Sanskrit uddal
Sanskrit Root √dal √dṝ 1 (burst)

upasaṅkamitvā kummaṃ kacchapaṃ paccupaṭṭhito ahosi, yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

VIN 2.5.9.6 tūlonaddhasikkhāpadaṃ
uddālesi

aor. tore off [ud + √dal] ✗
uddiṭṭha 1

pp. (+instr) recited (by); explained (by); mentioned (by); lit. pointed up [ud + √dis + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddisati (+instr)
Meaning recited (by); explained (by); mentioned (by); lit. pointed up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Antonym anuddiṭṭha
Sanskrit uddiṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

uddiṭṭhā kho āyasmanto cattāro pārājikā dhammā. yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ yathā pure, tathā pacchā, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA pārājikuddeso

ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṃkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṃ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṃ vibhajeyyā'ti?

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
uddiṭṭha 2

pp. (+dat) proposed (to); assigned (to); allotted (to); lit. pointed up [ud + √dis + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddisati (+dat)
Meaning proposed (to); assigned (to); allotted (to); lit. pointed up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Antonym anuddiṭṭha
Commentary (SNPa) uddiṭṭhā'ti uddesamatten'eva vuttā, na vibhaṅgena.
Sanskrit uddiṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

tena kho pana samayena sabhiyassa paribbājakassa purāṇasālohitāya devatāya pañhā uddiṭṭhā honti, yo te, sabhiya, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā ime pañhe puṭṭho byākaroti tassa santike brahmacariyaṃ careyyāsī'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
uddiṭṭha 3

pp. listed; lit. pointed up [ud + √dis + ta] ~

Grammar pp of uddisati
Meaning listed; lit. pointed up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Antonym anuddiṭṭha
Sanskrit uddiṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)
uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭha

nt. what is allocated and what is not; allotted and unallotted [uddiṭṭha + anuddiṭṭha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning what is allocated and what is not; allotted and unallotted
Construction uddiṭṭha + anuddiṭṭha
uddisati 1

pr. (+acc) recites; chants; lit. points up [ud + √dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning recites; chants; lit. points up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Base √dis + a > disa
Construction ud + disa + ti
Synonym anugāyati, anusajjhāyati, sajjhāyati
Sanskrit uddiśati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

abhikkantā, bhante, ratti, nikkhanto paṭhamo yāmo, ciranisinno bhikkhusaṅgho, uddisatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ pātimokkhan'ti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

suṇātu me bhante saṅgho? ajj'uposatho pannaraso, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso
uddisati 2

pr. (+acc) points out; names as; lit. points up [ud + √dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning points out; names as; lit. points up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Base √dis + a > disa
Construction ud + disa + ti
Commentary (MNa) kam'uddiseyyan'ti kaṃ aññaṃ, ayaṃ me ācariyo'ti uddiseyyaṃ. (DHPa) kam'uddiseyyan'ti, ayaṃ me upajjhāyo vā ācariyo vā'ti kaṃ nāma uddiseyyan'ti.
Sanskrit uddiśati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

sabb'ābhibhū sabbavidū'ham'asmi,
sabbesu dhammesu anūpalitto,
sabbañ'jaho taṇhakkhaye vimutto,
sayaṃ abhiññāya kam'uddiseyyaṃ.

DHP 353 taṇhāvaggo

api nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṃ jānantā evaṃ passantā aññaṃ satthāraṃ uddiseyyāthā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
uddisati 3

pr. (+acc) appoints; designates; directs towards; lit. points up [ud + √dis + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning appoints; designates; directs towards; lit. points up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Base √dis + a > disa
Construction ud + disa + ti
Sanskrit uddiśati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)
uddisana

nt. reciting [ud + √dis] ✗
uddisanta

prp. (+acc) reciting; chanting; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of uddisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning reciting; chanting; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Base √dis + a > disa
Construction ud + disa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym sajjhāyanta
Sanskrit uddiśat
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

pātimokkhe uddissamāne'ti uddisante vā uddisāpente vā sajjhāyaṃ vā karonte.

VIN 2.5.8.2 vilekhanasikkhāpadaṃ

pātimokkhe uddissamāne'ti uddisante.

VIN 2.5.8.3 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ
uddisapeti

pr. makes recite or allot [ud + √dis] ✗
uddisāpana

nt. making recite [ud + √dis] ✗
uddisāpeti

pr. (+acc) makes recite; causes to chant; lit. causes to point up [ud + √dis + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of uddisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes recite; causes to chant; lit. causes to point up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 *āpe (point out, explain)
Base √dis + āpe > disāpe (caus)
Construction ud + disāpe + ti
Sanskrit uddeśayati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

dhammasambhogo nāma uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, padena uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, pade pade āpatti pācittiyassa. akkharāya uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, akkhar'akkharāya āpatti pācittiyassa.

Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

pātimokkhe uddissamāne'ti uddisante vā uddisāpente vā sajjhāyaṃ vā karonte.

VIN 2.5.8.2 vilekhanasikkhāpadaṃ
uddisi

aor. points out, appoints, allots, recites [ud + √dis] ✗

uddisita

nt. (from uddisati) who looks to, refers to [ud + √dis] ✗
uddisitar

masc. who looks to, refers to [ud + √dis] ✗
uddisituṃ 1

inf. (+acc) to recite; lit. to point up [ud + √dis + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of uddisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to recite; lit. to point up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis + ituṃ
Synonym uddesituṃ
Sanskrit deṣṭum
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

[ārādhanaṃ] pubbakaraṇapubbakiccāni samāpetvā desit'āpattikassa samaggassa bhikkhusaṅghassa anumatiyā pātimokkhaṃ uddisituṃ ārādhanaṃ karomi. sādhu! sādhu! sādhu!

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi

MN 138 uddesavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
uddisitvā 2.1

Examples

DN 23.5 pāyāsisuttaṃ

yāv'āhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti, udāhu vippalapan'tass'eva coraghātā sīsaṃ chindeyyun'ti?

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso
uddissa 1

ger. (+acc) in the name of; on account of; for the sake of; especially for; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of uddisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning in the name of; on account of; for the sake of; especially for; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis + ya
Phonetic Change y > s
Variant uddisiya
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissā'ti bhikkhuss'atthāya, bhikkhuṃ ārammaṇaṃ karitvā, bhikkhuṃ acchādetu'kāmo. (VINa) ettha uddissā'ti apadissa ārabbha. yasmā pana yaṃ uddissa upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, taṃ tass'atthāya upakkhaṭaṃ nāma hoti.
Sanskrit uddiśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

tena kho pana samayena pukkusāti nāma kulaputto bhagavantaṃ uddissa saddhāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.

iminā puññakammena, iminā uddissena ca khipp'āhaṃ sulabhe c'eva taṇh'ūpādānachedanaṃ.

Thai Traditional
uddissakaṭa

nt. specially prepared food; meal made on purpose; lit. made pointing up [uddissa + kaṭa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning specially prepared food; meal made on purpose; lit. made pointing up
Construction uddissa + kaṭa
Compound kammadhāraya (uddissa + kaṭa)
Variant uddissakata
Commentary (DNa) uddissakatan'ti imaṃ tumhe uddissa katan'ti evaṃ ārocitabhikkhaṃ.
Sanskrit uddiśya + kṛta

Example

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhanti, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakaṭaṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman'ti.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
uddissakata

nt. specially prepared food; meal made on purpose; lit. made pointing up [uddissa + kata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning specially prepared food; meal made on purpose; lit. made pointing up
Construction uddissa + kata
Compound kammadhāraya (uddissa + kata)
Variant uddissakaṭa
Commentary (DNa) uddissakatan'ti imaṃ tumhe uddissa katan'ti evaṃ ārocitabhikkhaṃ.
Sanskrit uddiśya + kṛta

Examples

seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhanti, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman'ti.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
uddissati

pr. is appointed; is assigned; is specified; lit. is pointed up [ud + √dis + ya + ti] ~

Meaning is appointed; is assigned; is specified; lit. is pointed up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 ya (point out, explain)
Base √dis + ya > dissa (pass)
Construction ud + dissa + ti
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)
uddissamāna

prp. being recited; being chanted; lit. being pointed up [ud + √dis + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of uddissati, pass, intrans
Meaning being recited; being chanted; lit. being pointed up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 ya (point out, explain)
Base √dis + ya > dissa (pass)
Construction ud + dissa + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change y > s
Synonym bhaññamāna
Commentary (VINa) uddissamāne'ti uddisiyamāne.
Sanskrit uddiśamāna
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya, kiṃ pan'imehi khudd'ānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāva'd'eva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṃvattantī'ti, sikkhāpadavivaṇṇake pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 72 vilekhanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu anvaddhamāsaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya, idān'eva kho ahaṃ jānāmi, ayam'pi kira dhammo sutt'āgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī'ti.

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ
uddissābhata

Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym vibhaṅga
Commentary (MNa) uddesan'ti mātikaṃ

Examples

MN 138 uddesavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

ataramāno'va bhāseyya, no taramāno. janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, ayam'uddeso araṇavibhaṅgassa.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
uddesa 2

masc. recitation; chanting; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Examples

sādhikam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, diyaḍḍhasikkhāpadasataṃ anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchati yattha attakāmā kulaputtā sikkhanti.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ

etāni pañca kammāni, chand'āharaṇ'ādīni pātimokkh'uddesato paṭhamaṃ kattabbatā, uposathassa uposathakammassa pubbakiccan'ti vuccati. pubbakiccānī'ti akkhātāni.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
uddesa 3

masc. indication; expression; characteristic; description; identification; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from uddisati
Meaning indication; expression; characteristic; description; identification; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (DNa) tathā tathā uddisitabbato uddesā.
Sanskrit uddeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

yehi, ānanda, ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi yehi uddesehi nāmakāyassa paññatti hoti, tesu ākāresu tesu liṅgesu tesu nimittesu tesu uddesesu asati api nu kho rūpakāye adhivacanasamphasso paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

DN 15.1 mahānidānasuttaṃ, paṭiccasamuppādo

saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena, assāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ, pamāṇikā kāretabbā. tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā.

VIN PAT SA 6 kuṭikāra sikkhāpada
uddesa 4

masc. rules; precepts; Pātimokkha; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from uddisati
Meaning rules; precepts; Pātimokkha; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit uddeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

bhikkhu pan'eva dubbacajātiko hoti uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti

VIN PAT SA 12 dubbacasikkhāpadaṃ
uddesa 5

masc. teaching; instruction; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from uddisati
Meaning teaching; instruction; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym pariyāya, suttanta
Commentary (DNa) uddesā no cāvetu'kāmo'ti attano anusāsaniṃ gāhāpetvā amhe amhākaṃ uddesato cāvetu'kāmo.
Sanskrit uddeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, uddesā no cāvetu'kāmo samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo uddeso so eva vo uddeso hotu.

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ
uddesa 6

adj. destined for; lit. pointing at (as authority) [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from uddisati
Meaning destined for; lit. pointing at (as authority)
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit uddeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

so samaṇ'uddeso bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo, m'āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ

ajja't'agge te, āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa na c'eva so bhagavā satthā apadisitabbo

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭaka sikkhāpada
uddesa 7

adj. intended for; designated for; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from uddisati
Meaning intended for; designated for; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (VIN 1.2.6) att'uddesan'ti attano atthāya. (VINa) att'uddesan'ti, mayhaṃ esā'ti evaṃ attā uddeso assā'ti att'uddesā, taṃ att'uddesaṃ.
Sanskrit uddeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Examples

saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena assāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā

VIN PAT SA 6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena sassāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.

VIN PAT SA 7 vihārakārasikkhāpadaṃ
uddesa 8

masc. (gram) summary, indication, indicative pronoun [ud + √dis] ✗
uddesaka

masc. (+gen) appointer (of); director (of); manager (of); lit. who points up [ud + √dis + *aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, in comps, from uddisati (+gen)
Meaning appointer (of); director (of); manager (of); lit. who points up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym paññāpaka
Sanskrit uddeśaka
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

ujjhāpanakaṃ nāma upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ sen'āsanapaññāpakaṃ vā bhatt'uddesakaṃ vā yāgubhājakaṃ vā phalabhājakaṃ vā khajjabhājakaṃ vā appamattakavissajjakaṃ vā avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo

VIN 2.5.2.3 ujjhāpanakasikkhāpadaṃ
uddesanta

prp. reciting; chanting [ud + √dis] ✗
uddesaparipucchāyonisomanasikāra

masc. ?? careful attention to the questions about precepts [uddesa + paripucchā + yonisomanasikāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ?? careful attention to the questions about precepts
Construction uddesa + paripucchā + yonisomanasikāra
uddesapariyāpanna

adj. included in the Pātimokkha recitation; contained in the Pātimokkha chanting [uddesa + pariyāpanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning included in the Pātimokkha recitation; contained in the Pātimokkha chanting
Construction uddesa + pariyāpanna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (uddese + pariyāpanna)
Commentary (VIN 1.2.12) uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesū'ti pātimokkhapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu. (VINa) uddesapariyāpannesū'ti uddese pariyāpannesu antogadhesu. yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyyā'ti evaṃ saṅgahitattā anto pātimokkhassa vattamānesū'ti attho.
Sanskrit uddeśa + paryāpanna (bsk)

Example

bhikkhu pan'eva dubbacajātiko hoti uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti

VIN PAT SA 12 dubbacasikkhāpadaṃ
uddesabhatta

nt. food specially prepared for a specific number of persons ✗
uddesavibhaṅga

masc. detailed analysis of a brief statement [uddesa + vibhaṅga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detailed analysis of a brief statement
Construction uddesa + vibhaṅga
uddesavibhaṅgasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 138 (MN138) ✗
uddesavevacana

nt. synonym for the recitation of precepts [uddesa + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for the recitation of precepts
Construction uddesa + vevacana
Synonym pātimokkhavevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.
uddesaṃ āgacchati

idiom. comes up for recitation; arrives for chanting ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning comes up for recitation; arrives for chanting
Sanskrit uddeśam + āgacchati

Examples

ime kho pan'āyasmanto terasa saṅghādisesā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso

sādhikam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, diyaḍḍhasikkhāpadasataṃ anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchati yattha attakāmā kulaputtā sikkhanti.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
uddesika 1

adj. at the age of; lit. indicating [ud + √dis + *a + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from uddesa
Meaning at the age of; lit. indicating
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a + ika
uddesa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (MNa) pannarasavass'uddesikā'ti pannarasavassavayā.
Sanskrit uddeśaka
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhāti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
uddesika 2

adj. indicating, referring to, memorial [ud + √dis] ✗
uddesituṃ

inf. (+acc) to recite [ud + √dis + *ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of uddisati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to recite
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *ituṃ
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym uddisituṃ
Sanskrit uddeśitum
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

Example

okāsaṃ me bhante thero detu pāṭimokkhaṃ uddesituṃ.

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca
uddehaka

adj. bubbling up; boiling over [ud + √dih + *aka] ~

Grammar adj
Meaning bubbling up; boiling over
Root Family ud √dih
Root √dih×1 a (accumulate, smear)
Construction ud + √dih > deh + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit uddeha (anthill)
Sanskrit Root √dih 2 (smear)
uddehakaṃ

ind. bubbling or seething up [ud + √dih] ✗
uddosita

masc. shed, store [ud + ava + √sā] ✗
uddha

adj. upper; upwards; upright [ud + dha] ✓

Grammar adj, from ud
Meaning upper; upwards; upright
Construction ud + dha
Derivative taddhita (dha)
Antonym adho, ora
Sanskrit ud, ūrdhva

Examples

dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, saṃyojanāni. katamāni dasa? pañc'oram'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni, pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.

AN 10.13 saṃyojanasuttaṃ

uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
uddhagāmī

adj. going upwards; headed in a good direction [uddha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning going upwards; headed in a good direction
Construction uddha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (uddhaṃ + gāmī)
Antonym adhogāmī
Variant uddhaṃgāmī
Sanskrit ūrdhvagāmin

Example

taṃ idh'eva kākā vā khādanti gijjhā vā khādanti kulalā vā khādanti sunakhā vā khādanti siṅgālā vā khādanti vividhā vā pāṇakajātā khādanti, yañ'ca khv'assa cittaṃ dīgharattaṃ saddhāparibhāvitaṃ ... taṃ uddhagāmi hoti visesagāmi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
uddhaggika

adj. resulting in a lofty end; promoting spiritual welfare; lit. relating to upper point ✗

uddhacca

nt. agitation; restlessness; distraction; excitement [ud + √dhar + ta + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from uddhata
Meaning agitation; restlessness; distraction; excitement
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + ta + ya
uddhata + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Antonym kosajja, anuddhacca
Commentary (ANa) uddhaccāya saṃvattatī'ti uddhatabhāvāya saṃvattati.
Notes CPD suggests √han PED suggests √dhar
Sanskrit auddhatya
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

evam'evaṃ kho, soṇa, accāraddhavīriyaṃ uddhaccāya saṃvattati, atisithilavīriyaṃ kosajjāya saṃvattati.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

kathābāhulle sati uddhaccaṃ, uddhatassa asaṃvaro, asaṃvutassa ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
uddhaccakukucca

nt. restlessness and fidgetiness; agitation and edginess [uddhacca + kukucca] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning restlessness and fidgetiness; agitation and edginess
Construction uddhacca + kukucca
Variant uddhaccakukkucca
uddhaccakukuccanīvaraṇa

nt. obstacle of restlessness and fidgetiness; hindrance of agitation and edginess [uddhacca + kukucca + nīvaraṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning obstacle of restlessness and fidgetiness; hindrance of agitation and edginess
Construction uddhacca + kukucca + nīvaraṇa
Variant uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇa
uddhaccakukkucca

nt. restlessness and fidgetiness; agitation and edginess [uddhacca + kukkucca] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning restlessness and fidgetiness; agitation and edginess
Construction uddhacca + kukkucca
Compound dvanda (uddhacca ca kukkucca ca)
Variant uddhaccakukucca
Commentary (ANa) uddhaccañ'ca kukkuccañ'ca uddhaccakukkuccaṃ.
Sanskrit auddhatya + kaukṛtya

Examples

idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno kāmacchando pahīno hoti, byāpādo pahīno hoti, thīnamiddhaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, vicikicchā pahīnā hoti

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahāya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṃ parisodheti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
uddhaccakukkuccaṭṭhāniya

adj. serving as a basis for restlessness and fidgetiness; giving support to agitation and edginess [uddhaccakukkucca + ṭhāniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning serving as a basis for restlessness and fidgetiness; giving support to agitation and edginess
Construction uddhaccakukkucca + ṭhāniya
uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇa

nt. obstacle of restlessness and fidgetiness; hindrance of agitation and edginess [uddhaccakukkucca + nīvaraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning obstacle of restlessness and fidgetiness; hindrance of agitation and edginess
Construction uddhaccakukkucca + nīvaraṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uddhaccakukkuccassa + nīvaraṇa)
Variant uddhaccakukuccanīvaraṇa
Sanskrit auddhatya + kaukṛtya + nīvaraṇa

Example

caṅgavāran'ti kho, bhikkhu, pañcann'etaṃ nīvaraṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmacchandanīvaraṇassa, byāpādanīvaraṇassa, thīnamiddhanīvaraṇassa, uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇassa, vicikicchānīvaraṇassa.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by restlessness and fidgetiness; consumed by agitation and edginess [uddhacca + kukkucca + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by restlessness and fidgetiness; consumed by agitation and edginess
Construction uddhacca + kukkucca + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uddhaccakukkuccena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Sanskrit auddhatya + kaukṛtya + paryavasthita

Examples

uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati uddhaccakukkuccaparetena uppannassa ca uddhaccakukkuccassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. so uddhaccakukkuccaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ katvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati avajjhāyati.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhito hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti. sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhito hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti. sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu idhalokacintāya pasuto hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
uddhaccakukkuccapareta

adj. afflicted with restlessness and fidgetiness; overcome by agitation and edginess [uddhacca + kukkucca + pareta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with restlessness and fidgetiness; overcome by agitation and edginess
Construction uddhacca + kukkucca + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uddhaccakukkuccena + pareta)
Sanskrit auddhatya + kaukṛtya + parīta

Example

uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati uddhaccakukkuccaparetena uppannassa ca uddhaccakukkuccassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. so uddhaccakukkuccaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ katvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati avajjhāyati.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
uddhaccakukkuccābhibhūta

adj. overcome by restlessness and fidgetiness; overpowered by agitation and edginess [uddhaccakukkucca + abhibhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overcome by restlessness and fidgetiness; overpowered by agitation and edginess
Construction uddhaccakukkucca + abhibhūta
uddhaccapariyuṭṭhāna

nt. being obsessed by agitation; being consumed by restlessness [uddhacca + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning being obsessed by agitation; being consumed by restlessness
Construction uddhacca + pariyuṭṭhāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uddhaccena + pariyuṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit auddhatya + paryavasthāna

Example

uddhato kho pana ayam'āyasmā, uddhaccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. uddhaccapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

uddhaccasahagata

adj. accompanied by agitation [uddhacca + sahagata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning accompanied by agitation
Construction uddhacca + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uddhaccena + sahagata)
Commentary (SNa) uddhaccasahagato'ti idha bhikkhu chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasikaronto nisīdati. ath'assa cittaṃ uddhacce patati. so buddhadhammasaṅghaguṇe āvajjetvā cittaṃ hāsetvā tosetvā kammaniyaṃ katvā puna chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasi karoti. ath'assa puna cittaṃ uddhacce patati.
uddhaccasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.116 (AN6.116) ✗
uddhaṭa 1

pp. pulled out; removed; extracted [ud + √dhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddharati
Meaning pulled out; removed; extracted
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > ṭ
Antonym anuddhaṭa
Synonym abbuḷha, ubbhata, nīhaṭa, pavāḷha
Sanskrit uddhṛta
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

s'āhaṃ sugatassa sāvikā,
magg'aṭṭh'aṅgikayānayāyinī,
uddhaṭasallā anāsavā,
suññ'āgāragatā ramām'ahaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

nivāto nāma nīcamanatā nivātavuttitā, yāya samannāgato puggalo nihatamāno nihatadappo pādapuñchanakacoḷasadiso chinnavisāṇausabhasamo uddhaṭadāṭhasappasamo ca hutvā saṇho sakhilo sukhasambhāso hoti, ayaṃ nivāto.

KHPa 5 maṅgalasuttavaṇṇanā
uddhaṭa 2

pp. raised, lifted [ud + √dhar] ✗
uddhaṭasalla

adj. who has pulled out the arrow; who has extracted the barb [uddhaṭa + salla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has pulled out the arrow; who has extracted the barb
Construction uddhaṭa + salla
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (uddhaṭa + sallaṃ)
Commentary (THIa) uddhaṭasallā'ti attano santānato samuddhaṭarāg'ādisallā.
Sanskrit uddhṛta + śalya

Example

s'āhaṃ sugatassa sāvikā,
magg'aṭṭh'aṅgikayānayāyinī,
uddhaṭasallā anāsavā,
suññ'āgāragatā ramām'ahaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
uddhata 1

pp. arrogant; conceited; haughty; puffed up; overbearing; (comm) confused about what is right and wrong; lit. raised up [ud + √dhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddharati
Meaning arrogant; conceited; haughty; puffed up; overbearing; (comm) confused about what is right and wrong; lit. raised up
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym anuddhaṭa
Synonym atimānī, unnaḷa, upatthaddha, samussita
Commentary (SNa) uddhatā'ti akappiye kappiyasaññitāya ca kappiye akappiyasaññitāya ca anavajje sāvajjasaññitāya ca sāvajje anavajjasaññitāya ca uddhaccapakatikā hutvā.
Sanskrit uddhata
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvik'atthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

ime pana dhammayog'amhā, dhammayog'amhā'ti uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākat'indriyā

AN 6.46 mahācundasuttaṃ
uddhata 2

pp. agitated; restless; unbalanced; lit. raised up [ud + √dhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddharati
Meaning agitated; restless; unbalanced; lit. raised up
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym anuddhaṭa
Synonym lola, lolajātika, loḷa
Notes CPD √han PED √dhar
Sanskrit uddhata
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

kathābāhulle sati uddhaccaṃ, uddhatassa asaṃvaro, asaṃvutassa ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye uddhataṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo vīriyasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo pītisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
uddhataavūpasantacittasandosahetu

ind. due to the defilement of being agitated and having an unsettled mind [uddhata + avūpasantacitta + sandosahetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the defilement of being agitated and having an unsettled mind
Construction uddhata + avūpasantacitta + sandosahetu
Sanskrit uddhata + vyupaśānta + citta + saṃdosa + hetu

Example

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā uddhatā avūpasantacittā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, uddhat'āvūpasantacittasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
uddhatasutta

nt. Udāna 32 (UD 32) ✗
uddhana

nt. blacksmith's fire; forge; oven; kiln; lit. placing up [ud + √dhā + ana] ~

Grammar nt
Meaning blacksmith's fire; forge; oven; kiln; lit. placing up
Root Family ud √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction ud + √dhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (APt) kammār'uddhanaṃ kammārānaṃ uddhanaṃ, kammārānaṃ yathā ukkā'ti.
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
uddhapāda

adj. having heels upwards ✗
uddhamadho

ind. above and below [uddhaṃ + adho] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning above and below
Construction uddhaṃ + adho
Compound dvanda (uddhaṃ ca adho ca)
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + adhaḥ

Examples

dukkhavepakkaṃ yadatthi kammaṃ,
uddham'adho tiriyaṃ vā'pi majjhe,
paribbājayitvā pariññacārī,
māyaṃ mānam'atho'pi lobhakodhaṃ,
pariyantam'akāsi nāmarūpaṃ,
taṃ paribbājakam'āhu pattipattan'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabb'attatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
uddhamadhotiriyaṃ

sandhi. above, below and across; in every direction ✗
uddhamāghātana

adj. after death ✗
uddhamāghātanika

adj. (doctrine of) post-mortem (consciousness) ✗
uddhampādaṃ

ind. upside down; with feet in the air [uddhaṃ + pādaṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning upside down; with feet in the air
Construction uddhaṃ + pādaṃ
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + pādam
uddhambhāgiya

adj. higher; upper; lit. connected to the upper part [uddhaṃ + bhāgiya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning higher; upper; lit. connected to the upper part
Construction uddhaṃ + bhāgiya
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + bhāgiya)
Antonym oraṃbhāgiya
Synonym uparima
Variant uddhaṃbhāgiya
Commentary (SNa) uddhambhāgiyānī'ti uparikoṭṭhāsiyāni. (SNt) uddhaṃ vuccati catasso arūpadhātuyo, vuttanayena taṃ bhajantī'ti uddhambhāgiyāni, saṃyojanāni rūp'ārūparāgamān'uddhacc'āvijjā.
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + bhāgīya

Examples

katamāni pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni? rūparāgo, arūparāgo, māno, uddhaccaṃ, avijjā, imāni pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.

AN 10.13 saṃyojanasuttaṃ

pañca oram'bhāgiyāni saññojanāni, sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso, kāmacchando, byāpādo. pañca uddham'bhāgiyāni saññojanāni, rūparāgo, arūparāgo, māno, uddhaccaṃ, avijjā.

DN 33.8 saṅgītisuttaṃ
uddhambhāgiyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.181 (SN45.181) ✗
uddhambhāgiyasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.129 (SN46.129) ✗
uddhambhāgiyasutta 3

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.70 (AN9.70) ✗
uddhambhāgiyādisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.95-104 (SN47.95) ✗
uddhambhāgiyādisuttadasaka

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.95-104 (SN47.95-104) ✗
uddhamma

masc. false doctrine [ud + √dhar] ✗
uddharaṇa

nt. lifting; removing; dragging out; pulling out; lit. carrying up [ud + √dhar + aṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, from uddharati
Meaning lifting; removing; dragging out; pulling out; lit. carrying up
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Synonym abbuhana
Sanskrit uddharaṇa
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)
uddharaṇīya

ptp. able to be lifted up; should be withdrawn; could be removed [ud + √dhar] ✗
uddharati 1

pr. (+acc) pulls up; pulls out; lifts up; raises [ud + √dhar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning pulls up; pulls out; lifts up; raises
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Base √dhar + a > dhara
Construction ud + dhara + ti
Synonym uggirati, uccāreti, unnāmeti
Sanskrit uddharati
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

appamādaratā hotha,
sacittam'anurakkhatha,
duggā uddharatha-attānaṃ,
paṅke sanno'va kuñjaro.

DHP 327 nāgavaggo

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷamattāni'pi.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
uddharati 2

pr. (+acc) removes; takes away; packs up [ud + √dhar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning removes; takes away; packs up
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Base √dhar + a > dhara
Construction ud + dhara + ti
Commentary (VIN 2.5.2.5) taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyyā'ti na sayaṃ uddhareyya.
Sanskrit uddharati
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 14 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

uddharati 3

pr. derives (a meaning), adduces [ud + √dhar] ✗

VIN PAT PC 14 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

aor. raised, lifted, pulled out, removed, uprooted [ud + √har] ✗

Example

upajjhāyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ. sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā
uddharitukāma

adj. (+abl) wanting to lift out (from); wishing to extract (from) [uddharituṃ + kāma] ~

Meaning wanting to lift out (from); wishing to extract (from)
Construction uddharituṃ + kāma

inf. (+acc and +abl) to raise (out of); to remove (from); to lift up (from); lit. to carry up [ud + √dhar + ituṃ] ~

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo

atha kho, bhante, sambahulā kumārakā vā kumārikā vā tamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā nikkhamitvā yena sā pokkharaṇī ten'upasaṅkameyyuṃ, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā taṃ kakkaṭakaṃ udakā uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

uddhavirecana

nt. "purging upwards", emetic treatment ✗

adj. with a covering of plaster; or covering plaster ✗

pp. risen; appeared [ud + √dhaṃs + ta] ✓

Example

tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

uddhasta 2

Examples

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
uddhaste aruṇe nandimukhiyā rattiyā

idiom. when the rosy smile of dawn was rising; when dawn had risen and the night had a cheerful face; lit. when risen red happy face night ✓

Grammar idiom, pp + masc + fem + fem, loc abs
Meaning when the rosy smile of dawn was rising; when dawn had risen and the night had a cheerful face; lit. when risen red happy face night

Example

tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañca

idiom. above below and across; in every direction [uddhaṃ + adho + tiriyaṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar idiom, prep + prep + adv + ind
Meaning above below and across; in every direction
Construction uddhaṃ + adho + tiriyaṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + adhaḥ + tiryañc

Example

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'cā'pi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ

idiom. above below and across; in every direction ✗
uddhaṃ 1

ind. above; up; on top [ud + dha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, prep, acc sg of uddha
Meaning above; up; on top
Construction ud + dha + aṃ
uddha + aṃ
Antonym adho
Variant ubbha
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit ūrdhvam

Examples

mettañ'ca sabbalokasmi,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ,
uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyañ'ca,
asambādhaṃ averamasapattaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, kasiṇ'āyatanāni. katamāni dasa? pathavīkasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
uddhaṃ 2

ind. (+abl) upwards (from) [ud + dha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, prep, acc sg of uddha (+abl)
Meaning upwards (from)
Construction ud + dha + aṃ
uddha + aṃ
Antonym adho
Synonym upari
Commentary (VISM) uddhaṃ pādatalā'ti pādatalato upari.
Sanskrit ūrdhvam

Examples

tatra y'āssa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa, yañ'ca khv'assa tatra sappi vā telaṃ vā taṃ uddhaṃ gāmi assa.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati

Construction ud + dha + aṃ
uddha + aṃ
Synonym pacchato
Sanskrit ūrdhvam

Examples

kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā idh'eva sabbavedayitāni anabhinanditāni sītībhavissantī'ti pajānāti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yāv'assa kāyo ṭhassati tāva naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā kāyassa bhedā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā na naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā'ti

DN 1.21 brahmajālasuttaṃ
uddhaṃ 4

ind. further; more; all the more [ud + dha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of uddha
Meaning further; more; all the more
Construction ud + dha + aṃ
uddha + aṃ
Sanskrit ūrdhvam

Example

vinicchaye ṭhatvā sayaṃ pamāya,
uddhaṃ sa lokasmiṃ vivādam'eti,
hitvāna sabbāni vinicchayāni,
na medhagaṃ kubbati jantu loke'ti.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
uddhaṃadhotiriyatā

fem. fact of being above, below and across; fact of being in every direction ✗
uddhaṃāghātanika

adj. with a belief in existence after death ✗
uddhaṃkhitta

adj. thrown up; tossed upwards [uddhaṃ + khitta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning thrown up; tossed upwards
Construction uddhaṃ + khitta
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + khitta)
Variant uddhaṅkhitta
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + kṣipta

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, apaṇṇako maṇi uddhaṃkhitto yena yen'eva patiṭṭhāti suppatiṭṭhitaṃ'y'eva patiṭṭhāti

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
uddhaṃgama

adj. going upwards ✗
uddhaṃgāmī

adj. going upwards; going upstream [uddhaṃ + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning going upwards; going upstream
Construction uddhaṃ + gāmī
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (uddhaṃ + gāmī)
Antonym adhogāmī
Variant uddhagāmī
Commentary (VIN 2.5.3.8) uddhaṃgāminin'ti ujjavanikāya. (VINa) uddhaṃgāminin'ti uddhaṃ nadiyā paṭisotaṃ gacchantiṃ.
Sanskrit ūrdhvagāmin

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 28 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ

saṃvidahite saṃvidahitasaññī ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhati uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.3.8 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ
uddhaṃpāda

adj. going upwards; going upstream ✗
uddhaṃbhāgiya

adj. belonging to the upper part ✗
uddhaṃmukha

adj. facing upwards; lit. up face [uddhaṃ + mukha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning facing upwards; lit. up face
Construction uddhaṃ + mukha
Compound kammadhāraya (ubbha + mukha)
Antonym adhomukha
Variant ubbhamukha
Commentary (SNt) ubbhamukho'ti uparimukho.
Sanskrit abhimukha
uddhaṃvirecana

nt. purgative; emetic; which induces vomiting; lit. purging up [uddhaṃ + virecana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning purgative; emetic; which induces vomiting; lit. purging up
Construction uddhaṃ + virecana
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + virecana)
Commentary (DNa) uddhaṃvirecanan'ti uddhaṃ dosānaṃ nīharaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + virecana

Example

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
uddhaṃsara

adj. with a high voice; with a lofty voice; (comm) believing in purity of saṃsāra; lit. up sound [uddhaṃ + sara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a high voice; with a lofty voice; (comm) believing in purity of saṃsāra; lit. up sound
Construction uddhaṃ + sara
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + sara)
Commentary (NIDD1) uddhaṃsarā suddhim'anutthunantī'ti. sant'eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhaṃsarāvādā. katame te samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhaṃsarāvādā? ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā accantasuddhikā, saṃsārasuddhikā, akiriyadiṭṭhikā, sassatavādā, ime te samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhaṃsarāvādā. te saṃsāre suddhiṃ visuddhiṃ parisuddhiṃ, muttiṃ vimuttiṃ parimuttiṃ thunanti vadanti kathenti bhaṇanti dīpayanti voharantī'ti
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + svara

Example

tam'ūpanissāya jigucchitaṃ vā,
athavā'pi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
uddhaṃsarā suddhim'anutthunanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
uddhaṃsarāsatti

fem. attachment to, devotion to moving on (?) ✗
uddhaṃsarāsuddhi

fem. purity by means of continuing further; purity through saṃsara ✗
uddhaṃseti

pr. destroys, brings ruin on [ud + √dhaṃs] ✗
uddhaṃsesi

aor. destroyed, brought ruin on [ud + √dhaṃs] ✗
uddhaṃsota

adj. flowing upstream; going against the flow [uddhaṃ + sota] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning flowing upstream; going against the flow
Construction uddhaṃ + sota
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + sota)
Commentary (DHPa) uddhaṃsoto'ti evarūpo bhikkhu avihesu nibbattitvā tato paṭṭhāya paṭisandhivasena akaniṭṭhaṃ gacchanto uddhaṃsoto'ti vuccati, t'ādiso vo upajjhāyo'ti attho.
Sanskrit ūrdhvasrotaḥ (bsk)

Examples

chandajāto anakkhāte,
manasā ca phuṭo siyā,
kāmesu ca appaṭibaddhacitto,
uddhaṃsoto'ti vuccati.

DHP 218 piyavaggo

no ce pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti, atha pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā uddhaṃsoto hoti akaniṭṭhagāmī.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ
uddhaṃsotoakaniṭṭhagāmī

adj. headed upstream to the highest deva realm [uddhaṃsoto + akaniṭṭhagāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning headed upstream to the highest deva realm
Construction uddhaṃsoto + akaniṭṭhagāmī
Commentary (DNa) uddhaṃsotoakaniṭṭhagāmī'ti ettha pana catukkaṃ veditabbaṃ. yo hi avihāto paṭṭhāya cattāro devaloke sodhetvā akaniṭṭhaṃ gantvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ uddhaṃsoto akaniṭṭhagāmī nāma. yo avihāto dutiyaṃ vā tatiyaṃ vā catutthaṃ vā devalokaṃ gantvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ uddhaṃsoto na akaniṭṭhagāmī nāma. yo kāmabhavato akaniṭṭhesu nibbattitvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ na uddhaṃsoto akaniṭṭhagāmī nāma.
uddhāpa 1

masc. raised mound for fortification; lit. dig up [ud + √vap + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning raised mound for fortification; lit. dig up
Root Family ud √vap
Root √vap･1 a (sow, shave)
Construction ud + √vap > vāp + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change dv > ddh
a > ā
Variant uddāpa
Commentary (SNa) daḷh'uddhāpan'ti thirapākāraṃ.
Sanskrit udvāpa
Sanskrit Root √vap 1 (strew)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhu, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ daḷh'uddhāpaṃ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṃ chadvāraṃ. tatr'assa dovāriko paṇḍito byatto medhāvī, aññātānaṃ nivāretā, ñātānaṃ pavesetā.

uddhumāta

pp. swollen; bloated; inflated [ud + √dham + āya + ta] ~

Grammar pp of uddhumāyati, deno
Meaning swollen; bloated; inflated
Root Family ud √dham
Root √dham･1 āya (blow, sound)

Construction ud + dhumāya + ta
Derivative kita (ta)

Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)
uddhumātaka

adj. (of a corpse) swollen; bloated; lit. blown up; inflated [ud + √dham + āya + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from uddhumāta, deno
Meaning (of a corpse) swollen; bloated; lit. blown up; inflated
Root Family ud √dham
Root √dham･1 āya (blow, sound)
Base √dham + a + āya > dhamāya > dhumāya (deno, irreg)
Construction ud + dhumāya + ta + ka
uddhumāta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (DNa) kammārabhastā viya vāyunā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā yath'ānukkamaṃ samuggatena sūnabhāvena uddhumātattā uddhumātaṃ, uddhumātam'eva uddhumātakaṃ. paṭikūlattā vā kucchitaṃ uddhumātan'ti uddhumātakaṃ.
Sanskrit vyādhmātaka
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)

Example

puna caparaṃ bhikkhave bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ ek'āhamataṃ vā dvī'hamataṃ vā tī'hamataṃ vā uddhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbakajātaṃ

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

uddhumāyati

pr. swells up, puffs [ud + √dham] ✗
uddhumāyi

aor. swelled up, puffed [ud + √dham] ✗
uddhumāyikā

fem. Indian bullfrog; Hoplobatrachus tigerinus; lit. blowing up; puffing up [ud + √dham + āya + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from uddhumāyati, deno
Meaning Indian bullfrog; Hoplobatrachus tigerinus; lit. blowing up; puffing up
Root Family ud √dham
Root √dham･1 āya (blow, sound)
Base √dham + a + āya > dhamāya > dhumāya (deno, irreg)
Construction ud + dhumāya + ikā
Derivative kita (ikā)
Commentary (MNa) uddhumāyikan'ti maṇḍūkaṃ.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoplobatrachus_tigerinus
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)

Example

brāhmaṇo evam'āha, ukkhipa laṅgiṃ, abhikkhaṇa, sumedha, satthaṃ ādāyā'ti. abhikkhaṇanto sumedho satthaṃ ādāya addasa uddhumāyikaṃ. uddhumāyikā, bhadante'ti.

uddhumāyita

pr. (+acc) eats [√udrabh + a + ti] ✓

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā udrabheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
udraya

adj. yielding; resulting in; producing; lit. coming up [ud + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from udeti
Meaning yielding; resulting in; producing; lit. coming up
Root Family ud √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ud + [r] + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change +r
i > ay
Variant undraya, udaya
Sanskrit udaya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā, amhākañ'c'ev'āyaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
undrīyati

Variant uddīyati, udrīyati

Example

atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato avidūre mahantaṃ bhayabheravaṃ saddam'akāsi, apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyati

masc. elevation ✗
unnamati 1

pr. (of the sun) rises; ascends; comes up; lit. bends upwards [ud + √nam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning (of the sun) rises; ascends; comes up; lit. bends upwards
Root Family ud √nam
Root √nam･1 a (bend)
Base √nam + a > nama
Construction ud + nama + ti
Phonetic Change d > n
Synonym uggacchati, uggamati
Commentary (UDa) yāva na unnamate pabhaṅ'karo'ti tīsu'pi mahādīpesu ekakkhaṇe ālokakaraṇena pabhaṅ'karo'ti laddhanāmo sūriyo yāva na uggamati na udeti.
Sanskrit unnamati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Example

obhāsati tāva so kimi,
yāva na unnamate pabhaṅ'karo,
sa verocanamhi uggate,
hatappabho hoti na c'āpi bhāsati.

mn > ḷ

Commentary (THa) unnaḷassā'ti uggatatucchamānassa. (SNa) unnaḷā'ti uggatanaḷā, uṭṭhitatucchamānā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit unnata

Examples

bāhir'āsassa bhikkhuno,
sīlaṃ samādhi paññā ca,
pāripūriṃ na gacchati.

yañ'hi kiccaṃ apaviddhaṃ,
akiccaṃ pana kayirati,
unnaḷānaṃ pamattānaṃ,
tesaṃ vaḍḍhanti āsavā.

unnāda

Commentary (ANa) unnāmaninnāmī'ti thalaninnavasena visamatalaṃ. tattha thale udakaṃ na saṇṭhāti, ninne atibahu tiṭṭhati.

Example

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

Antonym onāmeti
Synonym uggirati, uccāreti, uddharati
Commentary (MNa) na satthiṃ unnāmetī'ti gambhīre udake gacchanto viya na ūruṃ unnāmeti.
Sanskrit unnāmayati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Examples

so gacchanto na satthiṃ unnāmeti, na satthiṃ onāmeti, na satthiṃ sannāmeti, na satthiṃ vināmeti. gacchato kho pana tassa bhoto gotamassa adharakāyo'va iñjati, na ca kāyabalena gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so antaragharaṃ pavisanto na kāyaṃ unnāmeti, na kāyaṃ onāmeti, na kāyaṃ sannāmeti, na kāyaṃ vināmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
unnāmetvā

abs. having raised; having bent up [ud + √nam] ✗
unnītaka

adj. led off, led away ✗
unhīsa

nt. turban [uṇhīsa] ✗
upa 1

prefix. towards; near; alongside ✓

Grammar prefix
Meaning towards; near; alongside
Sanskrit upa

Examples

pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, pahāro, parābhavo, nihāro, nīhāro, uhāro, duhāro, saṃhāro, vihāro, avahāro, anuhāro, parihāro, adhihāro, abhihāro, patihāro, suhāro, āhāro, atihāro, apihāro, apahāro, upahāro, evaṃ vīsati upasaggehi ca.

kaccāyana nāmakappa 221

yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 1
upa 2

prefix. son of; descendent of ~

Grammar prefix
Meaning son of; descendent of
Sanskrit upa
upaka 1

masc. name of an arahant; lit. approaching [upa + √gam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upagacchati
Meaning name of an arahant; lit. approaching
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam > ga > ka + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change g > k
Commentary (SNa) upako'tiādīni tesaṃ therānaṃ nāmāni.
Sanskrit upaga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

upako palagaṇḍo ca,
pukkusāti ca te tayo,
bhaddiyo khaṇḍadevo ca,
bāhuraggi ca siṅgiyo.
te hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
dibbayogaṃ upaccagun'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
upaka 2

masc. name of an ascetic; first person the Buddha met after his enlightenment; lit. approaching [upa + √gam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upagacchati
Meaning name of an ascetic; first person the Buddha met after his enlightenment; lit. approaching
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam > ga > ka + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change g > k
Sanskrit upaga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

addasā kho maṃ, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako antarā ca gayaṃ antarā ca bodhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannaṃ. disvāna maṃ etadavoca, vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto!

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
upakaḍḍhati

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning drags (towards); pulls (to)
Root Family upa √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction upa + kaḍḍha + ti
Antonym apakaḍḍhati
Synonym kaḍḍhati
Sanskrit upakarṣati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

Examples

kuso yathā duggahito,
hattham'ev'ānukantati,
sāmaññaṃ dupparāmaṭṭhaṃ,
nirayāy'upakaḍḍhati.

tam'enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ

upakāra 1

adj. helpful; useful; beneficial; supportive; lit. supporting [upa + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from upakaroti
Meaning helpful; useful; beneficial; supportive; lit. supporting
Root Family upa √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction upa + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym atthakara, atthakaraṇa, atthika, atthiya, upakāraka, karaṇa, kusala, sappāya, sātthaka
Sanskrit upakāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

akkharā'pi akār'ādayo ekacattālīsaṃ suttanta-upakārā.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca

upakāri

Grammar fem, from upakaroti
Meaning military fortification; bastion; rampart

Commentary (MNa) upakāriyo'ti c'ettha manussā pākārapādaṃ assakhurasaṇṭhānena iṭṭhakāhi cinitvā upari sudhāya limpanti. evaṃ katā pākārapādā upakāriyo'ti vuccanti.

Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Example

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

manussā vā maṃ upakkameyyuṃ, amanussā vā maṃ upakkameyyuṃ, tena me assa kālakiriyā. so mama assa antarāyo'ti.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhi sikkhāpada
upakkitaka

masc. bought man; purchased labourer; (comm) buyer [upa + √kī + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning bought man; purchased labourer; (comm) buyer
Root Family upa √kī
Root √kī･5 nā (buy)
√ In Comps kkī
Construction upa + √kī + ta + ka
upakitta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change īt > itt
Commentary (UDa) upakkitakavādenā'ti yo kahāpaṇ'ādīhi kiñci kiṇāti, so upakkitako'ti vuccati, ayam'pi āyasmā accharānaṃ hetu attano brahmacariyaṃ kiṇāti, tasmā upakkitako'ti evaṃ vacanena. atha vā bhagavato āṇāya accharāsambhogasaṅkhātāya bhatiyā brahmacariyavāsasaṅkhātaṃ jīvitaṃ pavattento tāya bhatiyā yāpane bhagavatā bhariyamāno viya hotī'ti bhatako'ti vutto, tathā accharāsambhogasaṅkhātaṃ vikkayaṃ ādātabbaṃ katvā bhagavato āṇattiyaṃ tiṭṭhanto tena vikkayena bhagavatā upakkito viya hotī'ti vuttaṃ upakkitako'ti.
Sanskrit krītaka
Sanskrit Root √krī 9 (buy)

Example

atha kho āyasmato nandassa sahāyakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ nandaṃ bhatakavādena ca upakkitakavādena ca samudācaranti, bhatako kir'āyasmā nando upakkitako kir'āyasmā nando accharānaṃ hetu brahmacariyaṃ carati, bhagavā kir'assa pāṭibhogo pañcannaṃ accharāsatānaṃ paṭilābhāya kakuṭapādānan'ti.

UD 22 nandasuttaṃ
upakkitakavāda

masc. the word "bought man"; the term "purchased"; (comm) the word "buyer" [upakkitaka + vāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning the word "bought man"; the term "purchased"; (comm) the word "buyer"
Construction upakkitaka + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (upakkitaka iti vāda)
Commentary (UDa) upakkitakavādenā'ti yo kahāpaṇ'ādīhi kiñci kiṇāti, so upakkitako'ti vuccati, ayam'pi āyasmā accharānaṃ hetu attano brahmacariyaṃ kiṇāti, tasmā upakkitako'ti evaṃ vacanena. atha vā bhagavato āṇāya accharāsambhogasaṅkhātāya bhatiyā brahmacariyavāsasaṅkhātaṃ jīvitaṃ pavattento tāya bhatiyā yāpane bhagavatā bhariyamāno viya hotī'ti bhatako'ti vutto, tathā accharāsambhogasaṅkhātaṃ vikkayaṃ ādātabbaṃ katvā bhagavato āṇattiyaṃ tiṭṭhanto tena vikkayena bhagavatā upakkito viya hotī'ti vuttaṃ upakkitako'ti.
Sanskrit krītaka + vāda

Example

atha kho āyasmato nandassa sahāyakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ nandaṃ bhatakavādena ca upakkitakavādena ca samudācaranti, bhatako kir'āyasmā nando upakkitako kir'āyasmā nando accharānaṃ hetu brahmacariyaṃ carati, bhagavā kir'assa pāṭibhogo pañcannaṃ accharāsatānaṃ paṭilābhāya kakuṭapādānan'ti.

UD 22 nandasuttaṃ
upakkiliṭṭha

pp. (+instr) defiled (by); blemished (by); stained (by); contaminated (by) [upa + √kilis + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upakkilissati (+instr)
Meaning defiled (by); blemished (by); stained (by); contaminated (by)
Root Family upa √kilis
Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Construction upa + √kilis + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Synonym kiliṭṭha
Sanskrit upa + kliṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

Examples

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

rāg'upakkiliṭṭhaṃ vā, bhikkhave, cittaṃ na vimuccati, avijj'upakkiliṭṭhā vā paññā bhāvīyati. iti kho, bhikkhave, rāgavirāgā cetovimutti, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimuttī'ti.

AN 2.33 bālavaggo
upakkiliṭṭhacitta

adj. with a defiled mind; mentally corrupt [upakkiliṭṭha + citta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a defiled mind; mentally corrupt
Construction upakkiliṭṭha + citta
upakkilesa

masc. impurity; imperfection; flew; blemish; corruption [upa + √kilis + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upakkilissati
Meaning impurity; imperfection; flew; blemish; corruption
Root Family upa √kilis
Root √kilis･3 ya (be dirty, be molested)
√ In Comps kilis or kkilis
Construction upa + √kilis > kiles + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym anupakkilesa, nirupakkilesa
Synonym saṅkilesa, saṃkilesa
Variant upakilesa
Sanskrit upakleśa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

Examples

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti

upakkhaṭa 1

pp. prepared; set-up; supplied; arranged [upa + √kar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upakaroti
Meaning prepared; set-up; supplied; arranged
Root Family upa √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction upa + √kar > khar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
rt > ṭ
Synonym paññatta, paṭiyatta, parikappita, vihita, sajjita
Commentary (VINa) upakkhaṭaṃ hotī'ti sajjitaṃ hoti, saṃharitvā ṭhapitaṃ
Sanskrit upaskṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa ubhinnaṃ aññātakānaṃ gahapatīnaṃ vā gahapatānīnaṃ vā paccekacīvaracetāpannāni upakkhaṭāni honti

upaga 1

adj. headed towards; going to; approaching [upa + √gam + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from upagacchati
Meaning headed towards; going to; approaching
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym upagama, upagāmī
Notes normally ūpaga in comps
Sanskrit upaga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

cetovimuttihīnā te,
atho paññāvimuttiyā,
abhabbā te antakiriyāya,
te ve jātijarā-upagā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

sugate duggate yathākamma-upage satte pajānāmi

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ
upaga 2

adj. experiencing; living in; undergoing; having; with; lit. going towards [upa + √gam + a] ✓

Examples

ye ca arūpaṭṭhāyino,
nirodhaṃ appajānantā,
āgantāro punabbhavaṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

tatra, bhante, y'āyaṃ attabhāvapaṭilābho yasmiṃ attabhāvapaṭilābhe n'eva attasañcetanā kamati no parasañcetanā, katame tena devā daṭṭhabbā'ti? n'evasaññānāsaññāyatana-upagā, sāriputta, devā tena daṭṭhabbā'ti.

VIN 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

nānappakārakaṃ nāma katam'pi akatam'pi kat'ākatam'pi. kataṃ nāma sīs'ūpagaṃ gīv'ūpagaṃ hatth'ūpagaṃ pād'ūpagaṃ kaṭ'ūpagaṃ. akataṃ nāma ghanakataṃ vuccati. kat'ākataṃ nāma tadubhayaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.9 rūpiyasaṃvohārasikkhāpadaṃ
upaga 4

adj. passing on to (used of consciousness's linking at death with a new existence) [upa + √gam] ✗
upagaṅgaṃ

ind. near the Ganges River [upa + gaṅgā + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from gaṅgā
Meaning near the Ganges River
Construction upa + gaṅgā + aṃ
upagaṅga + aṃ
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Sanskrit upa + gaṅgā

Examples

kumārīsu adhikicca pavattati kathā iti adhikumāri, vadhuyā samīpe pavattati kathā iti upavadhu, gaṅgāya samīpe pavattati kathā iti upagaṅgaṃ, maṇikāya samīpe pavattati kathā iti upamaṇikaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 320

napuṃsake vattamānassa abyayībhāvasamāsassa liṅgassa saro rasso hoti. kumārīsu adhikicca pavattati kathā iti adhikumāri. upavadhu, upagaṅgaṃ, upamaṇikaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 342
upagacchati 1

pr. (+acc) veers towards; swerves towards; lit. goes towards [upa + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning veers towards; swerves towards; lit. goes towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction upa + gaccha + ti
Sanskrit upagacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sā gaddulabaddho daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibaddho. so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, sace tumhe'pi na orimaṃ tīraṃ upagacchatha, na pārimaṃ tīraṃ upagacchatha, na majjhe saṃsīdissatha, na thale ussīdissatha, na manussaggāho gahessati

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
upagacchati 2

pr. (+acc) takes as; accepts as; regards as; interprets as; lit. goes towards [upa + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Meaning takes as; accepts as; regards as; interprets as; lit. goes towards

Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction upa + gaccha + ti
Synonym dahati, dahāti, maññati
Sanskrit upagacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

varaṃ bhikkhave assutavā puthujjano imaṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kāyaṃ attato upagaccheyya na tv'eva cittaṃ

prp. approaching; going towards [upa + √gam] ✗

upagañchi

upagata 1

pp. entered; gone into; undertaken; underwent; lit. approached [upa + √gam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upagacchati
Meaning entered; gone into; undertaken; underwent; lit. approached
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)

Antonym anupagata
Sanskrit upagata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

abhijānāsi no tvaṃ, rājañña, divā seyyaṃ upagato supinakaṃ passitā ārāmarāmaṇeyyakaṃ vanarāmaṇeyyakaṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakaṃ pokkharaṇīrāmaṇeyyakan'ti

DN 23.10 pāyāsisuttaṃ

Meaning arrived; came to; lit. approached
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)

Antonym anupagata
Sanskrit upagata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubb'upagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya, yassa sambādho bhavissati, so pakkamissatī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 16 dutiyasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
upagata 3

pp. approached; visited; (comm) gone there [upa + √gam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upagacchati
Meaning approached; visited; (comm) gone there

Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)

Example

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva kulaṃ upagataṃ pūvehi vā manthehi vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahetabbā.

VIN PAT PC 34 kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṃ
upagata 4

Meaning acquired; obtained; lit. approached
