Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Antonym anupagata
Sanskrit upagata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā bhavadiṭṭhiṃ allīnā bhavadiṭṭhiṃ upagatā bhavadiṭṭhiṃ ajjhositā, vibhavadiṭṭhiyā te paṭiviruddhā. ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā vibhavadiṭṭhiṃ allīnā vibhavadiṭṭhiṃ upagatā vibhavadiṭṭhiṃ ajjhositā, bhavadiṭṭhiyā te paṭiviruddhā.

Grammar adj, comp (+acc)
Meaning wanting to enter (the rains retreat)
Construction upagantuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (upagantuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit upagamitum + kāma

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodh'ārāme. tena kho pana samayena bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ vass'āvāsaṃ upagantu'kāmo hoti.

AN 11.13 nandiyasuttaṃ

Sanskrit upagam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

atthavasikena, bhikkhave, kulaputtena alaṃ upagantuṃ. taṃ kissa hetu?

SN 56.35 sattisatasuttaṃ
upagantuṃ 2

inf. (+acc) to enter; lit. to approach [upa + √gam + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to enter; lit. to approach
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + tuṃ
Phonetic Change m > n
Commentary (VINa) satthe vassaṃ upagantun'ti ettha vass'ūpanāyikadivase tena bhikkhunā upāsakā vattabbā kuṭikā laddhuṃ vaṭṭatī'ti. sace karitvā denti, tattha pavisitvā idha vassaṃ upemī'ti tikkhattuṃ vattabbaṃ. no ce denti, sālāsaṅkhepena ṭhitasakaṭassa heṭṭhā upagantabbaṃ. tam'pi alabhantena ālayo kātabbo.
Sanskrit upagamitum
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodh'ārāme. tena kho pana samayena bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ vass'āvāsaṃ upagantu'kāmo hoti.

upagama

adj. going to; approaching; entering [upa + √gam + a] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, from upagacchati, neg
Meaning going to; approaching; entering
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym upaga, upanāyika
Notes ūpagama in comps
Sanskrit upagama
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
upagamana 1

nt. approaching; going towards [upa + √gam + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from upagacchati
Meaning approaching; going towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upagamana
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
upagamana 2

nt. undergoing, undertaking [upa + √gam] ✗
upagamanabhaya

nt. danger of undertaking; peril of approaching [upagamana + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning danger of undertaking; peril of approaching
Construction upagamana + bhaya
upagamaniya

ptp. should be undertaken; lit. to be gone towards [upa + √gam + aniya] ~

Grammar ptp of upagacchati
Meaning should be undertaken; lit. to be gone towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + aniya
Derivative kicca (aniya)
Sanskrit upagamanīya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
upagami

aor. (+acc) entered; lit. went towards [upa + √gam + i] ~

Grammar aor of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning entered; lit. went towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + i
Sanskrit upagam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
upagamma 1

ger. (+acc) coming to; approaching [upa + √gam + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning coming to; approaching
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ya
Phonetic Change y > m
Sanskrit upagamya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

supupphit'aggaṃ upagamma bhikkhuni,
ekā tuvaṃ tiṭṭhasi sālamūle,
na c'atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,
bāle na tvaṃ bhāyasi dhuttakānan'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ
upagamma 2

ger. (+acc) going (into); getting involved (in); lit. going towards [upa + √gam + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning going (into); getting involved (in); lit. going towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ya
Phonetic Change y > m
Sanskrit upagamya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

yo hoti bhikkhu arahaṃ katāvī,
khīṇ'āsavo antimadehadhārī,
mānaṃ nu kho so upagamma bhikkhu,
ahaṃ vadāmī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
mamaṃ vadantī'ti'pi so vadeyyā'ti.

SN 1.25 arahantasuttaṃ
upagā

imperf. approached; arrived at [upa + √gam] ✗
upagāmī

adj. (+acc) going to; headed towards; experiencing; lit. going towards [upa + √gam + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from upagacchati (+acc)
Meaning going to; headed towards; experiencing; lit. going towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam > gām + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym upaga
Variant upagāhī
Sanskrit upagāmin
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

ye keci kāmesu asaññatā janā,
avītarāgā idha kāmabhogino,
punappunaṃ jātijarā-upagāmi te,
taṇh'ādhipannā anusotagāmino.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ
upagāyati

pr. (+acc and instr) accompanies (with); sings along (with) [upa + √gā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc and instr)
Meaning accompanies (with); sings along (with)
Root Family upa √gā
Root √gā･3 ya (sing)
Base √gā + ya > gāya
Construction upa + gāya + ti
Sanskrit upagāyati
Sanskrit Root √gai √gā 4 (sing)

Example

tasmā nāmasmā ṇayapaccayo hoti kāritasañño ca dhāturūpe sati. hatthinā atikkamati maggaṃ, atihatthayati, vīṇāya upagāyati gītaṃ, upavīṇayati, daḷhaṃ karoti vīriyaṃ, daḷhayati, visuddhā hoti ratti, visuddhayati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 439
upagāhī

adj. grasping onto; seizing; lit. holding near [upa + √gah + ī] ~

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning grasping onto; seizing; lit. holding near
Root Family upa √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction upa + √gah + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Variant ūpagāmī, ūpaga

upagūhati

pr. embraces [upa + √guh] ✗
upagūhana

nt. embracing [upa + √guh] ✗
upagūhi

aor. embraced [upa + √guh] ✗
upagūhita

pp. embraced [upa + √guh] ✗
upaggamma

ger. (+acc) going near (to); entering (into) [upa + √gam + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning going near (to); entering (into)
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ya
Phonetic Change y > m
Antonym anupaggamma
Synonym anupakhajja
Variant upagamma
Sanskrit upagamya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma,
sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ,
na hi jātu gabbhaseyya punar'etī'ti.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
upagghāta

masc. jolting, sudden jerk ✗
upaghāta 1

masc. injury; damage; harm [upa + √ghaṭ + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upaghāteti
Meaning injury; damage; harm
Root Family upa √ghaṭ
Root √ghaṭ･8 *e (strike, kill)
Construction upa + √ghaṭ > ghāṭ + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ṭ > t
Antonym anupaghāta
Synonym anattha, byābādha, vyābādha
Sanskrit upaghāta
Sanskrit Root √han √ghaṭ 1, 2, 8 (smite)

Example

te bhikkhuṃ pañhaṃ vā puccheyyuṃ vādaṃ vā āropeyyuṃ akkoseyyuṃ paribhāseyyuṃ roseyyuṃ viroseyyuṃ hiṃseyyuṃ vihiṃseyyuṃ heṭheyyuṃ viheṭheyyuṃ ghāteyyuṃ upaghāteyyuṃ upaghātaṃ vā kareyyuṃ.

NIDD1 16 sāriputta sutta niddeso
upaghāta 2

masc. jolting, sudden jerk [upa + √ghaṭ] ✗
upaghātaka

adj. injuring, cutting short, destroying, who hurts or destroys [upa + √ghaṭ] ✗
upaghātana

nt. jolting, sudden jerk [upa + √ghaṭ] ✗
upaghāti

fem. hurting; damage ✗
upaghātikā

fem. hurting, injury; damage ✗
upaghātī

adj. who injures; who harms [upa + √ghaṭ + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from upaghāteti
Meaning who injures; who harms
Root Family upa √ghaṭ
Root √ghaṭ･8 *e (strike, kill)
Construction upa + √ghaṭ > ghāṭ + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ṭ > t
Sanskrit upaghātin
Sanskrit Root √han √ghaṭ 1, 2, 8 (smite)

Example

khantī paramaṃ tapo titikkhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā,
na hi pabbajito para-upaghātī,
na samaṇo hoti paraṃ viheṭhayanto.

sāsaṅkaṃ nāma ārāme ārām'ūpacāre corānaṃ niviṭṭh'okāso dissati, bhutt'okāso dissati, ṭhit'okāso dissati, nisinn'okāso dissati, nipann'okāso dissati.

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ
upacālā

fem. name of a nun; lit. younger sister of Cālā [upa + cāla + ā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a nun; lit. younger sister of Cālā
Construction upa + cāla + ā
upacāla + ā
Commentary (THIa) tassā nāmaggahaṇadivase cālā'ti nāmaṃ akaṃsu, tassā kaniṭṭhāya upacālā'ti, atha tassā kaniṭṭhāya sīs'ūpacālā'ti. imā tisso'pi dhammasenāpatissa kaniṭṭhabhaginiyo, imāsaṃ puttānam'pi tiṇṇaṃ idam'eva nāmaṃ. ye sandhāya theragāthāya, cāle upacāle sīsūpacāle'ti (theragā. 42) āgataṃ.
Notes younger sister of Sāriputta
upacālātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 60 (THI60) ✗
upacālāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 5.7 (SN5.7) ✗
upacikā

fem. termite; white ant ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning termite; white ant
Sanskrit upadīka

Examples

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ

naṭṭhacīvaro nāma bhikkhussa cīvaraṃ agginā vā daḍḍhaṃ hoti, udakena vā vuḷhaṃ hoti, undūrehi vā upacikāhi vā khāyitaṃ hoti, paribhogajiṇṇaṃ vā hoti.

VIN 1.4.1.6 aññātakaviññattisikkhāpadaṃ
upaciṇṇa

pp. practised, frequented, accumulated [upa + √ci] ✗
upacita 1

pp. heaped up; built up [upa + √ci + ta] ~

Grammar pp of upacināti
Meaning heaped up; built up
Root Family upa √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction upa + √ci + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit upacita
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)
upacita 2

pp. accumulated; increased [upa + √ci] ✗
upacitatta

nt. fact of having accumulated; fact of having collected [upa + √ci] ✗
upacinanta

prp. accumulating; heaping up [upa + √ci] ✗
upacināti

pr. (+acc) heaps up; gathers up; accumulates; regains [upa + √ci + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning heaps up; gathers up; accumulates; regains
Root Family upa √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + nā > cinā
Construction upa + cinā + ti
Commentary (MNa) pacchā upacinantī'ti pacchā uḷārakhādanīy'ādīhi santappenti, vaḍḍhenti.
Sanskrit upacinoti
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Example

yaṃ kho te, aggivessana, purimaṃ pahāya pacchā upacinanti, evaṃ imassa kāyassa ācay'āpacayo hoti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
upacini

aor. collected, accumulated, built [upa + √ci] ✗
upacinitvā

abs. (+acc) having heaped up; having gathered up [upa + √ci + nā + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of upacināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having heaped up; having gathered up
Root Family upa √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + nā > cinā
Construction upa + cinā + itvā
Commentary (MNa) kāye upacinitvā'ti samantato citakaṃ bandhitvā.
Sanskrit upcītvā
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Example

atha kho te, pāpima, gopālakā pasupālakā kassakā pathāvino tiṇañ'ca kaṭṭhañ'ca gomayañ'ca saṃkaḍḍhitvā āyasmato sañjīvassa kāye upacinitvā aggiṃ datvā pakkamiṃsu.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
upacīyati

pr. is heaped up; is piled up [upa + √ci + iya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of upacināti, intrans
Meaning is heaped up; is piled up
Root Family upa √ci
Root √ci･5 iya (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + iya > cīya (pass)
Construction upa + cīya + ti
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)
upaccagā 1

imperf. (+acc) passed by; escaped; went past [upa + ati + a + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of upātigacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning passed by; escaped; went past
Root Family upa ati √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + ati > aty > acc + a + √gam + ā
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Commentary (SNa) mā upaccagā'ti mā atikkami.
Notes mā upaccagā "don't let it pass"
Sanskrit upa + atigam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10
upaccagā 2

imperf. (+acc) beat; worsted; defeated; lit. went past [upa + ati + a + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of upātigacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning beat; worsted; defeated; lit. went past
Root Family upa ati √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + ati > aty > acc + a + √gam + ā
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Sanskrit upa + atigam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

yam'assa vādaṃ parihīnam'āhu,
apāhataṃ pañhavimaṃsakāse,
paridevati socati hīnavādo,
upaccagā man'ti anutthunāti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
upaccagā 3

imperf. (+acc) overcame; transcended; lit. went past [upa + ati + a + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of upātigacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning overcame; transcended; lit. went past
Root Family upa ati √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + ati > aty > acc + a + √gam + ā
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Synonym accagamā
Commentary (SNa) upaccagun'ti atikkamiṃsu.
Sanskrit upa + atigam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

yo'dha puññañ'ca pāpañ'ca,
ubho saṅgam'upaccagā,
asokaṃ virajaṃ suddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 412 brāhmaṇavaggo

ke ca te ataruṃ paṅkaṃ,
maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ,
ke hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
dibbayogaṃ upaccagun'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
upaccaguṃ

imperf. (+acc) they overcame; they transcended; lit. they went past [upa + ati + a + √gam + uṃ] ✓

Grammar imperf 3rd pl of upaccagā, trans (+acc)
Meaning they overcame; they transcended; lit. they went past
Root Family upa ati √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + ati > aty > acc + a + √gam + uṃ
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Commentary (SNa) upaccagun'ti atikkamiṃsu.
Sanskrit upa + atigam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

anattani anattā'ti,
asubhaṃ asubhat'addasuṃ,
sammādiṭṭhisamādānā,
sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun'ti.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ

ke ca te ataruṃ paṅkaṃ,
maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ,
ke hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
dibbayogaṃ upaccagun'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
upacchindati

pr. (+acc) severs; cuts off; breaks off; completely stops [upa + √chid + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning severs; cuts off; breaks off; completely stops
Root Family upa √chid
Root √chid･2 ṃa (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Base √chid + ṃa > chinda
Construction upa + chinda + ti
Synonym ucchindati, chindati, sañchindati
Commentary (VIN 1.1.3) tattha jīvit'indriyassa paveṇighaṭanaṃ upacchindanto uparodhento ca, jīvitindriyaṃ upacchindati uparodhetī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit ucchinatti
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Examples

okkhittacakkhu na ca pādalolo,
jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciya-upachinde.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

jīvitā voropeyyā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ upacchindati uparodheti santatiṃ vikopeti.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
upacchindi

aor. broke off, interrupted, destroyed [upa + √chid] ✗
upacchinna

pp. cut off; terminated; ended [upa + √chid + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upacchindati
Meaning cut off; terminated; ended
Root Family upa √chid
Root √chid･2 ṃa (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Construction upa + √chid + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Synonym avasita, bhagga
Commentary (VINa) cīvarāsā vā upacchinnā'ti, asukasmiṃ nāma kule cīvaraṃ labhissāmī'ti yā cīvar'āsā uppannā hoti, sā vā upacchinnā, etesam'pi hi karaṇapalibodhass'eva niṭṭhitattā niṭṭhitabhāvo veditabbo.
Sanskrit avacchinna, upacchinna (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Example

niṭṭhitacīvarasmin'ti bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvar'āsā vā upacchinnā.

VIN 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
upacchubhati

pr. (+acc) throws out; throws towards [upa + √chubh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning throws out; throws towards
Root Family upa √chubh
Root √chubh･1 a (throw out)
√ In Comps cchubh
Base √chubh + a > chubha
Construction upa + chubha + ti
Variant upasumbhati, upacchūbhati, upaccumbhati
Sanskrit upacchṛṇaṭṭi
Sanskrit Root √chṛd 2 (spue, eject)

Example

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, kukkuro jighacchādubbalyapareto goghātakasūnaṃ paccupaṭṭhito assa. tam'enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upacchubheyya.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
upacchumbhati

pr. throws (something, accusative) to (accusative) [upa + √chubh] ✗
upacchūbhati

pr. (+acc) throws out; throws towards [upa + √chubh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning throws out; throws towards
Root Family upa √chubh
Root √chubh･1 a (throw out)
√ In Comps cchubh
Base √chubh + a > chubha > chūbha (irreg)
Construction upa + chūbha + ti
Variant upasumbhati, upacchubhati, upaccumbhati
Sanskrit upacchṛṇaṭṭi
Sanskrit Root √chṛd 2 (spue, eject)

Example

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, kukkuro jighacchādubbalyapareto goghātakasūnaṃ paccupaṭṭhito assa. tam'enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upacchūbheyya.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
upaccheda

masc. (+gen) severing (of); cutting off (of); breaking off (of); complete stopping (of) [upa + √chid + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upacchindati (+gen)
Meaning severing (of); cutting off (of); breaking off (of); complete stopping (of)
Root Family upa √chid
Root √chid･2 ṃa (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Construction upa + √chid > ched + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit uccheda, upaccheda (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

Examples

ahesuṃ kho ye, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīgarahakā pathavījigucchakā ... te kāyassa bhedā pāṇ'upacchedā hīne kāye patiṭṭhitā ahesuṃ.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ? yaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvit'indriyass'upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
upacchedaka

adj. destroying, stopping [upa + √chid] ✗
upajānāti

pr. finds out (for oneself), ascertains; invents; knows by personal experience (+ accusative or genitive); (first) teaches [upa + √ñā] ✗
upajāyati

pr. is produced (in addition); appears; is (re)born [upa + √jan] ✗
upajīvati

pr. (+acc) lives (on); lives dependent (on); relies (on); lit. lives near [upa + √jīv + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning lives (on); lives dependent (on); relies (on); lit. lives near
Root Family upa √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Base √jīv + a > jīva
Construction upa + jīva + ti
Sanskrit upajīv
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Examples

puttā vatthu manussānaṃ,
bhariyā ca paramo sakhā,
vuṭṭhiṃ bhūtā upajīvanti,
ye pāṇā pathavissitā'ti.

SN 1.54 vatthusuttaṃ

vuṭṭhi alasaṃ analasañ'ca,
mātā puttaṃ'va posati,
vuṭṭhiṃ bhūtā upajīvanti,
ye pāṇā pathavissitā'ti.

SN 1.80 pajjotasuttaṃ
upajīvamāna

prp. (+acc) living on; living off; subsisting on [upa + √jīv + a + māna] ~

Grammar prp of upajīvati, trans (+acc)
Meaning living on; living off; subsisting on
Root Family upa √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Base √jīv + a > jīva
Construction upa + jīva + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit upajīvamāna
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)
upajīvi

aor. lived on, depended on [upa + √jīv] ✗
upajīvī

adj. living (on); living (off); subsisting (on) [upa + √jīv + ī] ~

Grammar adj, from upajīvati
Meaning living (on); living (off); subsisting (on)
Root Family upa √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √jīv + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Synonym ṭhitika
Sanskrit upajīvin
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)
upajjha

masc. spiritual teacher or preceptor [upa + adhi + √i] ✗
upajjhā

fem. state of having a preceptor; pupillage; being under instruction ✗
upajjhāya

masc. preceptor; teacher [upa + adhi + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning preceptor; teacher
Root Family upa adhi √i
Root √i･1 a (study, recite)
Construction upa + adhi > adhy > ajjh + √i > āy + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change dhi > dhy > jjh
i > āy
Synonym ācariya
Sanskrit upādhyāya
Sanskrit Root adhi√i 1, 2 (learn)

Examples

upajjhāyo maṃ avaca,
ito gacchāma sīvaka,
gāme me vasati kāyo,
araññaṃ me gato mano,
semānakopi gacchāmi,
n'atthi saṅgo vijānatan'ti.

TH 14 sivaka sāmaṇera gāthā

upajjhāyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ. sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā
upajjhāyamatta

adj. (one) having the status of preceptor; like a preceptor ✗
upajjhāyamūlaka

adj. deriving from the preceptor ✗
upajjhāyalesa

masc. preceptor as a pretext [upajjhāya + lesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning preceptor as a pretext
Construction upajjhāya + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (upajjhāya + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) upajjhāyaleso nāma itthan'nāmassa saddhivihāriko diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto. aññaṃ itthan'nāmassa saddhivihārikaṃ passitvā codeti, itthan'nāmassa saddhivihāriko mayā diṭṭho.
Sanskrit upādhyāya + leśa

Example

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

VIN 1.2.9 dutiyaduṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
upajjhāyavevacana

nt. synonym for a preceptor [upajjhāya + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for a preceptor
Construction upajjhāya + vevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.
upajjhāyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.56 (AN5.56) ✗
upajjhāyā

fem. preceptress (of a bhikkhunī); instructor ✗
upaññatta

pp. personally discovered; found out [upa + √ñā + *āpe + ta] ~

Grammar pp of upañāpeti, caus
Meaning personally discovered; found out
Root Family upa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpe (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + āpe > ñāpe > ñape (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ñape + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit upajñāta
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)
upaññāta

pp. found out, learnt, known [upa + √ñā] ✗
upaññātasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.5 (AN2.5) ✗
upaññātta

pp. made known; instituted; (first) taught [upa + √ñā] ✗
upaññāsi

aor. (+gen) found out by oneself (about); learned from experience (of); discovered for oneself (about); lit. learned [upa + √ñā + si] ✓

Grammar aor of upajānāti, intrans (+gen)
Meaning found out by oneself (about); learned from experience (of); discovered for oneself (about); lit. learned
Root Family upa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction upa + √ñā + si
Sanskrit upajñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Example

dvinn'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ upaññāsiṃ, yā ca asantuṭṭhitā kusalesu dhammesu, yā ca appaṭivānitā padhānasmiṃ.

AN 2.5 upaññātasuttaṃ
upaññissati

fut. (+acc) will explain; will teach [upa + √ñā + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of upajānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will explain; will teach
Root Family upa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction upa + √ñā + issa + ti
Sanskrit upajñāsyati
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ,
handa te naṃ pavakkhāmi,
santhambhassu daḷho bhava.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhār'ūpamo bhave,
jivhāya tālum'āhacca,
udare saññato siyā.

mahāvaggo 11

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upaṭṭhapana 1

nt. setting up; arranging; preparing; readying; lit. causing to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upaṭṭhapeti, caus
Meaning setting up; arranging; preparing; readying; lit. causing to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe > ṭhape (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ṭhape + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym sajjana
Sanskrit upasthāpana
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

pānīyaparibhojanīya-upaṭṭhapanañ'ca, chand'ārahānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ chand'āharaṇañ'ca, tesaññ'eva akat'uposathānaṃ pārisuddhiyā'pi āharaṇañ'ca

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca
upaṭṭhapana 2

nt. attendance; having (someone) served or cared for [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhapayati

pr. (also upaṭṭhāpeti, upaṭṭhapeti) brings near, provides; procures, fetches; makes serve or attend, employs; causes to appear, brings about [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhapetabba

ptp. should be appointed; lit. to cause to be stood near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tabba] ~

Construction upa + ṭhape + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upaṭṭhapeti 1

pr. (+acc) applies; exerts; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning applies; exerts; lit. causes to stand near

Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā

Construction upa + ṭhape + ti
Phonetic Change ā > a
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

āneñjapaṭisaṃyuttāya ca pana kathāya kacchamānāya na sussūsati, na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapeti, na ca taṃ purisaṃ bhajati, na ca tena vittiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tassa sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṃ odahanti, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhapeti 2

pr. (+acc) prepares; sets up; readies; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning prepares; sets up; readies; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā

Phonetic Change ā > a

Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

pr. (+acc) provides, procures, or waits on [upa + √ṭhā] ✗

abs. (+acc) having set up; having made sure is present; lit. having caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Examples

so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

tato paṭinivattitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

Sanskrit upasthāpayitvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

upasaṅkamitvā sabbasanthariṃ santh'āgāraṃ santharitvā āsanāni paññapetvā udakamaṇikaṃ upaṭṭhapetvā telappadīpaṃ āropetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

app'ekacce maṃ paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesuṃ, app'ekacce āsanaṃ paññapesuṃ, app'ekacce pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhapesuṃ. api ca kho maṃ nāmena ca āvusovādena ca samudācaranti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
upaṭṭhahati 1

pr. remains present; persists; lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning remains present; persists; lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + ti
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti, viditā saññā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti, viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti.

AN 4.41 samādhibhāvanāsuttaṃ
upaṭṭhahati 2

pr. (+acc) serves; provides (with); attends (to); lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning serves; provides (with); attends (to); lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + ti
Synonym paccupaṭṭhāti
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

aññena ca kevalinaṃ mah'esiṃ,
khīṇ'āsavaṃ kukkuccavūpasantaṃ,
annena pānena upaṭṭhahassu,
khettaṃ hi taṃ puññapekkhassa hotī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
upaṭṭhahati 3

pr. (+acc) nurses; looks after; cares for; lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning nurses; looks after; cares for; lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + ti
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi patirūpā upaṭṭhākā, ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ upaṭṭhahissāmi. mā āyasmā channo satthaṃ āharesi. yāpet'āyasmā channo, yāpentaṃ mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ icchāmā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhahati 4

pr. (+acc) understands [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhahanta

prp. (+acc) presenting [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhahi 1

aor. (+acc) attended (to); served; waited on; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning attended (to); served; waited on; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + i
Commentary (MNa) padhānapahit'attaṃ upaṭṭhahiṃsū'ti padhān'atthāya pesitattabhāvaṃ vasanaṭṭhāne pariveṇasammajjanena pattacīvaraṃ gahetvā anubandhanena mukh'odakadantakaṭṭhadān'ādinā ca upaṭṭhahiṃsu.
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi, bahukārā kho me pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū, ye maṃ padhānapahit'attaṃ upaṭṭhahiṃsu. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ pañcavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyan'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
upaṭṭhahi 2

aor. (+acc and +instr) provided (with); lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc and +instr)
Meaning provided (with); lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + i
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

atīte kira kassapasammāsambuddhakāle gāmavāsī eko kuṭumbiko ekassa therassa vihāraṃ katvā taṃ tattha viharantaṃ catūhi paccayehi upaṭṭhahi

DHPa 1.5.11 jambukatthera vatthu
upaṭṭhahi 3

aor. (+acc) cared for, nursed [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhahitvā

abs. having attended on [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhahiyati

pr. (+instr) is nursed; is looked after; is cared for (by); lit. is stood near [upa + √ṭhā + iya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of upaṭṭhahati, intrans (+instr)
Meaning is nursed; is looked after; is cared for (by); lit. is stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 iya (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + iya > ṭhahiya (pass)
Construction upa + ṭhahiya + ti
Sanskrit upasthīyate
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upaṭṭhahiyamāna

prp. (+instr) being nursed; being looked after; being cared for (by); lit. being stood near [upa + √ṭhā + iya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of upaṭṭhahiyati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being nursed; being looked after; being cared for (by); lit. being stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 iya (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + iya > ṭhahiya (pass)
Construction upa + ṭhahiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit upasthīyamāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upaṭṭhaheti

pr. stands near, stands by; places oneself by; presents oneself; is present, appears; stands near in order to serve, serves, attends (+ accusative, occasionally + dative/genitive); tends; worships [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāka 1

masc. attendant; assistant; lit. who stands near [upa + √ṭhā + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from upaṭṭhahati
Meaning attendant; assistant; lit. who stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit upasthāyaka
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto sāmaṃ sen'āsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya anāmantetvā upaṭṭhāke anapaloketvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ eko adutiyo cārikaṃ pakkāmi

SN 22.81 pālileyyasuttaṃ

etu kho āyasmā ānando! svāgataṃ āyasmato ānandassa bhagavato upaṭṭhākassa bhagavato santik'āvacarassa!

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

so na labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, na labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, na labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, na labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāka 3

masc. follower; devotee; supporter; lit. standing near [upa + √ṭhā + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from upaṭṭhahati
Meaning follower; devotee; supporter; lit. standing near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + aka
Derivative kita (aka)

Sanskrit upasthāyaka
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sāriputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa santike dārakaṃ pāhesi, imaṃ dārakaṃ thero pabbājetū'ti.

VIN 4.1.41 rāhula vatthu
upaṭṭhākakula

Meaning family of followers; family of devotees; supporting family

masc. better attendant; better assistant [upa + √ṭhā + aka + tara] ~

Meaning better attendant; better assistant

Sanskrit upasthāyaka +
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upaṭṭhākī

fem. nurse; nursing assistant; lit. who stands near [upa + √ṭhā + aka + ī] ✓

Sanskrit upasthāyika
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṃ upāsikānaṃ gilān'upaṭṭhākīnaṃ yadidaṃ suppiyā upāsikā.

AN 1.264 sattamavaggo

ptp. should be attended to; should be nursed; lit. to be stood near [upa + √ṭhā + tabba] ✓

Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit upasthātavya
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

imaṃ kho, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca gilānabhattaṃ anuññātaṃ gilānabhesajjaṃ anuññātaṃ gilān'upaṭṭhāko anuññāto. imañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca aññe'pi gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā.

AN 3.22 gilānasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāti 1

Construction upa + ṭhā + ti

Sanskrit upasthāti
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

inf. to stand near [upa + √ṭhā] ✗

upaṭṭhāna 4

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attending (to something) as essential
Construction upaṭṭhāna + sāra
Commentary (ANa) upaṭṭhānasāran'ti upaṭṭhānena sāraṃ, idaṃ varaṃ idaṃ niṭṭhā'ti evaṃ upaṭṭhitan'ti attho.

Examples

AN 10.69 paṭhamakathāvatthusuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā visākho pañcālaputto upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 9.2 (SN9.2) ✗
upaṭṭhānākāra

masc. mode of appearance; manifestation [upaṭṭhāna + ākāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mode of appearance; manifestation
Construction upaṭṭhāna + ākāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upaṭṭhānassa + ākāra)
Sanskrit upasthāna + ākāra

Example

lakkhaṇ'ādīsu ca tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ sabhāvo vā sāmaññaṃ vā lakkhaṇaṃ nāma, kiccaṃ vā sampatti vā raso nāma, upaṭṭhān'ākāro vā phalaṃ vā paccupaṭṭhānaṃ nāma, āsannakāraṇaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ nāma.

ADT kusalapadattho
upaṭṭhāpana

nt. producing, bringing about; arranging attendance; having (someone) served or cared for [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāpayati

pr. brings near, provides; procures, fetches; makes serve or attend, employs; causes to appear, brings about [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāpayanta

prp. (+acc) arousing; generating; lit. causing to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpaya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of upaṭṭhāpayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning arousing; generating; lit. causing to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpaya (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpaya > ṭhāpaya (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit upasthāyamāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

kudāssu nām'āhaṃ tadāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharissāmi yadariyā eta'r'ahi āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharantī'ti iti anuttaresu vimokkhesu pihaṃ upaṭṭhāpayato uppajjati pihapaccayā domanassaṃ.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpita

pp. prepared; set up; readied; stationed; lit. caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upaṭṭhapeti, caus
Meaning prepared; set up; readied; stationed; lit. caused to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym paccupaṭṭhita, paññatta, sajja
Sanskrit upasthāpita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

sabbasanthariṃ santhataṃ, bhante, santh'āgāraṃ, āsanāni paññattāni, udakamaṇiko upaṭṭhāpito, telappadīpo āropito. yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṃ maññatī'ti.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpetabba 1

ptp. should be established; should be set up; should cause to be present; should makes sure one has; lit. to cause to be stood near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of upaṭṭhāpeti, caus
Meaning should be established; should be set up; should cause to be present; should makes sure one has; lit. to cause to be stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit upasthāpayitavya
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

kālena vakkhāmi no akālena, bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena, saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena, atthasaṃhitena vakkhāmi no anatthasaṃhitena, mettacitto vakkhāmi, no dos'antaro'ti, ime pañca dhammā ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbā

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmato sāriputtassa etadahosi, bhagavatā paññattaṃ, na ekena dve sāmaṇerā upaṭṭhāpetabbā'ti.

VIN 4.1.41 rāhula vatthu
upaṭṭhāpetabba 2

ptp. should be cared for; should be attended to [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāpetar

masc. who makes (someone) serve them; who appoints an attendant [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tar] ~

Construction upa + ṭhāpe + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upaṭṭhāpeti 1

pr. (+acc) sets out; makes available; provides; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning sets out; makes available; provides; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

idha, bhante, amhākaṃ yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati so āsanāni paññapeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, avakkārapātiṃ upaṭṭhāpeti

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpeti 2

pr. (+acc) establishes; sets up; causes to be present; makes sure one has; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning establishes; sets up; causes to be present; makes sure one has; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Synonym ṭhapeti, ṭhāpeti, niveseti, patiṭṭhahati, pavattayati
Variant upaṭṭhapeti
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu mettaṃ cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpehī'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro.

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

āneñjapaṭisaṃyuttāya ca pana kathāya kacchamānāya na sussūsati, na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na ca taṃ purisaṃ bhajati, na ca tena vittiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpeti 3

pr. (+acc) gets (a doctor) to treat; make attend (to); lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning gets (a doctor) to treat; make attend (to); lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Variant upaṭṭhapeti
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sallena viddho assa savisena gāḷh'ūpalepanena. tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṃ sallakattaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṃ sallakattaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpeti 4

pr. (+acc) arouses; generates; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning arouses; generates; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Variant upaṭṭhapeti
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

rūpānaṃ tv'eva aniccataṃ viditvā vipariṇāmavirāganirodhaṃ, pubbe c'eva rūpā eta'r'ahi ca sabbe te rūpā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā anuttaresu vimokkhesu pihaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

so tasmiṃ purise kāruññaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anuddayaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anukampaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, aho vat'āyaṃ puriso labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ!

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpeti 5

pr. (+acc) makes serve; appoints as attendant; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes serve; appoints as attendant; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Variant upaṭṭhapeti
Commentary (VIN 2.5.7.10) upaṭṭhāpeyya vā'ti tassa cuṇṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā dantakaṭṭhaṃ vā mukh'odakaṃ vā sādiyati (VINa) upaṭṭhāpeyyā'ti tena attano upaṭṭhānaṃ kārāpeyya.
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ samaṇ'uddesaṃ upalāpeyya vā, upaṭṭhāpeyya vā, sambhuñjeyya vā, saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ
upaṭṭhāpetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to set up; to establish; to make sure is present; lit. to cause to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of upaṭṭhāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to set up; to establish; to make sure is present; lit. to cause to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + tuṃ
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

cha, bhikkhave, ānisaṃse sampassamānena alam'eva bhikkhunā sabbasaṅkhāresu anodhiṃ karitvā aniccasaññaṃ upaṭṭhāpetuṃ. katame cha?

AN 6.102 anavatthitasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having set up; having made sure is present; lit. having caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of upaṭṭhāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having set up; having made sure is present; lit. having caused to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + tvā
Variant upaṭṭhapetvā
Sanskrit upasthāpayitvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

na kho, ānanda, sukaraṃ paresaṃ dhammaṃ desetuṃ. paresaṃ, ānanda, dhammaṃ desentena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo. katame pañca?

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpesi

aor. (+acc) supplied; provided; furnished (with); lit. caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + si] ✓

Grammar aor of upaṭṭhāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning supplied; provided; furnished (with); lit. caused to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + si
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi

DN 14.4 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo bhagavantaṃ paccuggantvā, eko bhagavato pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi, eko āsanaṃ paññapesi, eko pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhāpesi.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāyikā

fem. female attendant; nurse [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāsi 1

aor. (+acc) took a stand (on); was established (in); lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + si] ✓

Grammar aor of upatiṭṭhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning took a stand (on); was established (in); lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + si
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ. taṃ tathāgatassa viditaṃ, taṃ tathāgato na upaṭṭhāsi.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāsi 2

aor. attended; served; waited on [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāsi 3

aor. (+acc) looked after; cared for; nursed [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhita 1

pp. present; in attendance; available; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upaṭṭhāti
Meaning present; in attendance; available; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym muṭṭha, anupaṭṭhita
Sanskrit upasthita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

sati kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā,
chasu phass'āyatanesu saṃvuto,
satataṃ bhikkhu samāhito,
jaññā nibbānam'attano'ti.

UD 25 mahāmoggallānasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, saṃvaro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhita 2

pp. arrived; present; standing near; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upaṭṭhāti
Meaning arrived; present; standing near; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym anupaṭṭhita
Sanskrit upasthita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

yo brāhmaṇaṃ samaṇaṃ vā,
bhattakāle upaṭṭhite,
roseti vācā na ca deti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṃ na maṃsaṃ na suraṃ na merayaṃ na thus'odakaṃ pivanti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhita 3

pp. stuck to; devoted to; applied oneself to; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upaṭṭhāti
Meaning stuck to; devoted to; applied oneself to; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym anupaṭṭhita
Notes upaṭṭhitāse is masc nom pl
Sanskrit upasthita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

sīl'uttamā saññamen'āhu suddhiṃ,
vataṃ samādāya upaṭṭhitāse,
idh'eva sikkhema ath'assa suddhiṃ,
bhavūpanītā kusalā vadānā.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

sa piṇḍacāraṃ caritvā,
vanantam'abhihāraye,
upaṭṭhito rukkhamūlasmiṃ,
āsan'ūpagato muni.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upaṭṭhitakāyasati

adj. with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body [upaṭṭhita + kāyasati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body
Construction upaṭṭhita + kāyasati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + kāyasati)
Variant upaṭṭhitakāyassati
Sanskrit upasthita + kāya + smṛti

Example

so cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe na sārajjati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyasati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso. tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, yatth'assa te pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitakāyassati

adj. with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body [upaṭṭhita + kāyassati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body
Construction upaṭṭhita + kāyassati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + kāyassati)
Variant upaṭṭhitakāyasati
Sanskrit upasthita + kāya + smṛti

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitasati

adj. with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully [upaṭṭhita + sati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully
Construction upaṭṭhita + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + sati)
Antonym muṭṭhasati
Variant upaṭṭhitassati
Sanskrit upasthita + smṛti

Examples

upaṭṭhitasatissa-ayaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo muṭṭhasatissa

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ vossagg'ārammaṇaṃ karitvā labhissati samādhiṃ, labhissati cittassa ek'aggataṃ.

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitasuvaṇṇamayarukkha

masc. gold tree which is present ✗
upaṭṭhitassati

adj. with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully [upaṭṭhita + sati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully
Construction upaṭṭhita + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + sati)
Antonym muṭṭhassati
Variant upaṭṭhitasati
Sanskrit upasthita + smṛti

Examples

tasmā hi dhīro idh'upaṭṭhitassatī,
kāme ca pāpe ca asevamāno,
sahā'pi dukkhena jaheyya kāme,
paṭisotagāmī'ti tam'āhu puggalaṃ.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ

ye pana te kulaputtā ... āraddhavīriyā pahit'attā upaṭṭhitassatino sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā paññavanto aneḷamūgā, tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitassatitā

fem. fact of having presence of mind; state of attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully state [upaṭṭhita + sati + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from upaṭṭhitassati
Meaning fact of having presence of mind; state of attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully state
Construction upaṭṭhita + sati + tā
upaṭṭhitassati + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit upasthita + smṛtitā

Examples

etam'ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, upaṭṭhitassatitaṃ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomam'āpādiṃ araññe vihārāya.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

kusītassa purisapuggalassa vīriyārambho hoti parikkamanāya, muṭṭhassatissa purisapuggalassa upaṭṭhitassatitā hoti parikkamanāya, duppaññassa purisapuggalassa paññāsampadā hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitassatisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.23 (SN37.23) ✗
upaṭṭhitvā

abs. having attended on [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhiyamāna

prp. (+instr) being attended (to); being waited (on); lit. being stood near [upa + √ṭhā + iya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of upaṭṭhiyati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being attended (to); being waited (on); lit. being stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 iya (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + iya > ṭhiya (pass)
Construction upa + ṭhiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit upasthīyamāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

tathāgatassa tattha hatthināgena upaṭṭhiyamānassa vasanabhāvo sakalajambudīpe pākaṭo ahosi

DHPa 1.1.5 kosambaka vatthu
upaṭṭheti 1

pr. stands near, stands by; places oneself by [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭheti 2

pr. presents oneself; is present, appears [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭheti 3

pr. stands near in order to serve, serves, attends; tends; worships [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhenta

prp. standing near, standing by; placing oneself by; presenting oneself; being present, appearing; standing near in order to serve, serving, attending (+ accusative, occasionally + dative/genitive); tending; worshipping [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaḍayhati

pr. burns up [upa + √ḍah] ✗
upaḍayhi

aor. burnt up [upa + √ḍah] ✗
upaḍḍha 1

adj. half [upa + aḍḍha] ✓

Grammar adj, from aḍḍha
Meaning half
Construction upa + aḍḍha
Synonym addha, aḍḍha
Sanskrit upārdha

Examples

ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ekaṃ vā rattiṃ ekaṃ vā divasaṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā rattiṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā divasaṃ ek'antasukhiṃ attānaṃ sañjānāthā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

aho vat'āhaṃ tad'antaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yad'antaraṃ upaḍḍhapiṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā'ti.

AN 8.73 paṭhama maraṇassatisuttaṃ
upaḍḍha 2

nt. one half; half [upa + aḍḍha] ✓

Grammar nt, from aḍḍha
Meaning one half; half
Construction upa + aḍḍha
Sanskrit upārdha

Example

tena hi, bhaṇe, yo bāhiresu janapadesu āyo sañjāyati tato upaḍḍhaṃ antepure pavesetha, upaḍḍhaṃ tatth'eva dānaṃ detha samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-kapaṇ'addhika-vanibbaka-yācakānan'ti.

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ
upaḍḍhakappa

masc. half an aeon ✗
upaḍḍhakāya

masc. one half of the body [upaḍḍha + kāya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one half of the body
Construction upaḍḍha + kāya
Commentary (SNa) heṭṭhimena upaḍḍhakāyenā'ti nābhito paṭṭhāya heṭṭhimakāyena.
upaḍḍhacchanna

adj. half-roofed; partially covered [upaḍḍha + channa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning half-roofed; partially covered
Construction upaḍḍha + channa
Commentary (VINt) yassa dvīsu bhāgesu eko channo, eko acchanno, idaṃ upaḍḍhacchannaṃ nāma sen'āsanaṃ.
upaḍḍhadivasaṃ

ind. for half a day [upaḍḍha + divasa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for half a day
Construction upaḍḍha + divasa + aṃ
upaḍḍhadivasa + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (upaḍḍha + divasaṃ)
Sanskrit upārdha + divasa

Example

yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin'ti? idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti, aho vat'āhaṃ upaḍḍhadivasaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā'ti. evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin'ti.

AN 8.73 paṭhamamaraṇassatisuttaṃ
upaḍḍhapatha

masc. half-way; lit. half road [upaḍḍha + patha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning half-way; lit. half road
Construction upaḍḍha + patha
upaḍḍhaparicchanna

adj. half-enclosed; partially walled [upaḍḍha + paricchanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning half-enclosed; partially walled
Construction upaḍḍha + paricchanna
upaḍḍhapiṇḍapātaṃ

ind. for half (a meal of) alms food [upaḍḍha + piṇḍapāta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for half (a meal of) alms food
Construction upaḍḍha + piṇḍapāta + aṃ
upaḍḍhapiṇḍapāta + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (upaḍḍha + piṇḍapātaṃ)
Sanskrit upārdha + piṇḍapāta

Example

idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti, aho vat'āhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ upaḍḍhapiṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā'ti. evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin'ti.

AN 8.73 paṭhamamaraṇassatisuttaṃ
upaḍḍhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.2 (SN45.2) ✗
upaḍḍhullikhita

adj. half combed, half dressed ✗
upatappati

pr. vexes or torments [upa + √tapp] ✗
upatappi

aor. vexed or tormented [upa + √tapp] ✗
upatāpa

masc. vexation, trouble, remorse [upa + √tap] ✗
upatāpaka

adj. causing pain or remorse [upa + √tap] ✗
upatāpatā

fem. fact of vexing; fact of troubling; fact of causing pain [upa + √tap + *a + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from upatāpa
Meaning fact of vexing; fact of troubling; fact of causing pain
Root Family upa √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction upa + √tap > tāp + *a + tā
upatāpa + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit upatāpa +
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
upatāpana

nt. vexation, trouble, remorse [upa + √tap] ✗
upatāpita

pp. caused pain, tormented, harassed [upa + √tap] ✗
upatāpeti

pr. causes pain, torments, harasses [upa + √tap] ✗
upatāpesi

aor. caused pain, tormented, harassed [upa + √tap] ✗
upatiṭṭhati

pr. (+acc) stands around; stands next to; lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning stands around; stands next to; lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction upa + tiṭṭha + ti
Phonetic Change t > ṭ
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.

upatissa

masc. name of Sāriputta; lit. son of Tissa [upa + tissa] ✓

Grammar masc, patr
Meaning name of Sāriputta; lit. son of Tissa
Construction upa + tissa
Sanskrit upatiṣya

Example

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca, ko nāmo āyasmā, kathañ'ca pan'āyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti? upatisso'ti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṃ, sāriputto'ti ca pana maṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
upatissasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 21.2 (SN21.2) ✗
upatthaddha 1

pp. (+instr) supported (by); helped (by); lit. stiff [upa + √thambh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upatthambhati (+instr)
Meaning supported (by); helped (by); lit. stiff
Root Family upa √thambh
Root √thambh･1 a (support, be stiff)
√ In Comps tthambh
Construction upa + √thambh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change bht > ddh
Synonym anuggahita
Sanskrit upastabdha
Sanskrit Root √ṣṭabh √stabh √ṣṭambh √stambh 1, 5, 9 (prop)

Example

yo vejayantaṃ pāsādaṃ,
pād'aṅguṭṭhena kampayi,
iddhibalen'upatthaddho,
saṃvejesi ca devatā.

Base √dis + e > dise > dasse (caus, irreg)

Example

MIL 4.4.7 kusalākusalasamavisamapañho

MIL 5.3.1 vessantarapañho

upadaṃsetuṃ

Meaning points out; explains; shows; indicates

Example

Root √du･1 a (burn, torment)
√ In Comps ddu

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa

puññaṃ mayā yaṃ mama sabb'upaddavā mā hontu ve tassa pabhāvasiddhiyā

Thai

upaddava 2

masc. risk [upa + √du] ✗
upaddaveti

pr. annoys, troubles [upa + √du] ✗
upaddavesi

aor. annoyed, troubled [upa + √du] ✗
upadduta

pp. (+instr) afflicted (by); troubled (by); persecuted (by); oppressed (by); tyrannized (by) [upa + √du + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaddaveti (+instr)
Meaning afflicted (by); troubled (by); persecuted (by); oppressed (by); tyrannized (by)
Root Family upa √du
Root √du･1 a (burn, torment)
√ In Comps ddu
Construction upa + √du + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym ajjhāpanna, aṭṭita, paṭipīḷita, piḷesita, pīḷita, pīḷesita
Commentary (THa) maccujarāy'upaddutan'ti maraṇena c'eva jarāya ca pīḷitaṃ
Sanskrit upadruta
Sanskrit Root √du √dru √drū 5 (hurt)

Examples

kadā aniccaṃ vadharoganīḷaṃ,
kāyaṃ imaṃ maccujarāy'upaddutaṃ,
vipassamāno vītabhayo vihassaṃ,
eko vane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

nagā samuddā saritā vasun'dharā,
disā catasso vidisā adho divā,
sabbe aniccā tibhavā upaddutā,
kuhiṃ gato citta sukhaṃ ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
upaddūta

pp. oppressed; tyrannized over; assailed; visited by calamities [upa + √du] ✗
upadhā

fem. pillow; lit. placing near [upa + √dhā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from upadahati
Meaning pillow; lit. placing near
Root Family upa √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + √dhā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Commentary (MNa) upadhāyā'ti yathā sīs'ūpadhānañ'ca pād'ūpadhānañ'ca paññāyati, evaṃ santharitvā tattha seyyaṃ kappemī'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit upadhāna
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, susāne seyyaṃ kappemi chav'aṭṭhikāni upadhāya. apissu maṃ, sāriputta, gāmaṇḍalā upasaṅkamitvā oṭṭhubhanti'pi, omuttenti'pi, paṃsukena'pi okiranti, kaṇṇasotesu'pi salākaṃ pavesenti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
upadhāna 1

nt. imposing; inflicting; causing; lit. placing near [upa + √dhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, in comps, from upadahati
Meaning imposing; inflicting; causing; lit. placing near
Root Family upa √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + √dhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upadhana
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

paradukkha-upadhānena,
attano sukham'icchati.
verasaṃsaggasaṃsaṭṭho,
verā so na parimuccati.

DHP 291 pakiṇṇakavaggo
upadhāna 2

nt. cushion; pillow; bolster; lit. placing near [upa + √dhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from upadahati
Meaning cushion; pillow; bolster; lit. placing near
Root Family upa √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + √dhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym ohana, bibbohana, bimbohana
Sanskrit upadhāna
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhatolohitaka-upadhāno

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

kaliṅgara-upadhānā, bhikkhave, eta'r'ahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ. tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhatolohitaka-upadhāno

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ
upadhāya

ger. placing upon; laying down, imposing; giving in addition, handing over; placing under oneself, lying down upon [upa + √dhā] ✗
upadhāraṇa 1

nt. (of a veena) headstock; lit. supporting [upa + √dhar + *aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from upadhāreti
Meaning (of a veena) headstock; lit. supporting
Root Family upa √dhar
Root √dhar･8 *e (wear, hold, carry)
Construction upa + √dhar > dhār + *aṇa
Derivative kita (*aṇa)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit upadhāraṇa
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

anekehi sambhārehi samāraddhā vadati, seyyath'idaṃ, doṇiñ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca daṇḍañ'ca paṭicca upadhāraṇe ca paṭicca tantiyo ca paṭicca koṇañ'ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjaṃ vāyāmaṃ paṭicca ev'āyaṃ, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītidhenusahassāni ahesuṃ dukūlasandanāni kaṃsa-upadhāraṇāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
upadhāraṇa 3

nt. upholding, holding up, supporting [upa + √dhar] ✗
upadhāraṇā

upadhārayati

pr. considers, reflects on; holds in the mind, pays attention to; holds, considers as; looks for, investigates, finds out [upa + √dhar] ✗

Meaning understood; reflected on; considered; lit. carried near

Construction upa + dhāre + ita

Examples

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā āyasmato soṇassa sarabhaññapariyosāne abbhanumodi, sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu, suggahitāni te, bhikkhu, soḷasa aṭṭhakavaggikāni sumanasikatāni su-upadhāritāni

UD 46 soṇasuttaṃ
upadhārita 2

upadhi 1

masc. attachment; taking as mine; appropriation; acquisition; sense of ownership; identification; lit. placing near [upa + √dhā + i] ✓

Grammar masc, from upadahati
Meaning attachment; taking as mine; appropriation; acquisition; sense of ownership; identification; lit. placing near
Root Family upa √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + √dhā + i
Derivative kita (i)
Antonym nirupadhi
Commentary (MNa) upadhī hontī'ti khandhūpadhi kilesūpadhi abhisaṅkhārūpadhi pañcakāmaguṇ'ūpadhī'ti ime upadhayo honti.
Sanskrit upadhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno upadhī honti samattā samādinnā. ty'āssa pahīnā honti ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upadhi 2

masc. essential ground of existence, substrate of being [upa + √dhā] ✗
upadhika

upadhikkhaya

masc. wearing away of attachment; exhaustion of appropriation; slow destruction of identification [upadhi + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of attachment; exhaustion of appropriation; slow destruction of identification
Construction upadhi + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upadhissa + khaya)
Commentary (ANa) passato upadhikkhayan'ti tesaṃ'y'eva kiles'ūpadhīnaṃ khayasaṅkhātaṃ mettaṃ adhigamavasena passantassa.
Sanskrit upadhi + kṣaya

Example

yo ca mettaṃ bhāvayati,
appamāṇaṃ paṭissato,
tanū saṃyojanā honti,
passato upadhikkhayaṃ.

Example

ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā,
yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī'ti.

masc. giving up of acquisition; relinquishing of appropriation; abandoning of identification [upadhi + paṭinissagga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning giving up of acquisition; relinquishing of appropriation; abandoning of identification

Commentary (ITIa) upadhippaṭinissaggan'ti tesaṃ'y'eva ca upadhīnaṃ paṭinissajjanakāraṇaṃ. nibbānassa hi maggañāṇena sacchikiriyāya sabbe upadhayo paṭinissaṭṭhā hontī'ti taṃ tesaṃ paṭinissajjanakāraṇaṃ.
Sanskrit upadhi + pratiniḥsṛjya

Example

kāyena amataṃ dhātuṃ,
phusayitvā nirūpadhiṃ,
upadhippaṭinissaggaṃ,
sacchikatvā anāsavo,
deseti sammāsambuddho,
asokaṃ virajaṃ padan'ti.

ITI 51 dhātusuttaṃ
upadhibandhana

adj. bound by appropriation; tied by identification [upadhi + bandhana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound by appropriation; tied by identification
Construction upadhi + bandhana
Compound kammadhāraya (upadhi + bandhana)
Variant upadhisambandhana
Commentary (UDa) upadhibandhano bālo, tamasā parivārito. sassato'riva khāyatī'ti na kevalañ'ca mohasambandhano eva, apica kho upadhibandhano'pi ayaṃ andhabālaloko avijjātamasā parivārito.
Sanskrit upadhi + bandhana

Example

mohasambandhano loko,
bhabbarūpo'va dissati,
upadhibandhano bālo,
tamasā parivārito,
sassato'riva khāyati,
passato n'atthi kiñcanan'ti.

Example

sammādiṭṭhiṃ'p'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, dvayaṃ vadāmi. atthi, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi s'āsavā puññabhāgiyā upadhivepakkā, atthi, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi ariyā anāsavā lok'uttarā magg'aṅgā.

aor. (+acc) borne enmity towards; kept grudge [upa + √nadh] ✗

upanamana

upanamanta

Example

na ca hāyetha kadāci tulyasevī,
seṭṭham'upanamaṃ udeti khippaṃ,
tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
upanami

aor. bent on, came near [upa + √nam] ✗

upanayhati 1

pr. (+acc) resents; bears a grudge (towards); harbours enmity (towards); lit. binds onto [upa + √nah + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning resents; bears a grudge (towards); harbours enmity (towards); lit. binds onto
Root Family upa √nah
Root √nah･3 ya (bind, arm)
Base √nah + ya > nayha
Construction upa + nayha + ti
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Antonym nupanayhati
Sanskrit upanahyati
Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

Example

akkocchi maṃ avadhi maṃ,

veraṃ tesaṃ na sammati.

DHP 3 yamakavaggo
upanayhati 2

pr. (+acc) wraps up; bundles; binds together; lit. binds onto [upa + √nah + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning wraps up; bundles; binds together; lit. binds onto
Root Family upa √nah
Root √nah･3 ya (bind, arm)
Base √nah + ya > nayha
Construction upa + nayha + ti
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Sanskrit upanahyati
Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

Examples

pūtimacchaṃ kus'aggena,
yo naro upanayhati,
kusā'pi pūti vāyanti,
evaṃ bāl'ūpasevanā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ

tagarañ'ca palāsena,
yo naro upanayhati,
pattā'pi surabhi vāyanti,
evaṃ dhīr'ūpasevanā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
upanayhanā 1

fem. ill-will, enmity [upa + √nah] ✗
upanayhanā 2

fem. wrapping over [upa + √nah] ✗
upanayhi

aor. bore enmity towards, wrapped with [upa + √nah] ✗
upanāmana

nt. presenting; offering [upa + √nam] ✗
upanāmanahetubhūta

adj. done for the sake of offering ✗
upanāmayati

pr. makes bends towards, makes touch; brings near, hands (to); holds out, offers, presents [upa + √nam] ✗
upanāmayanta

prp. (+acc) (of food) serving (to); offering (to) [upa + √nam + *aya + nta] ~

Grammar prp of upanāmayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of food) serving (to); offering (to)
Root Family upa √nam
Root √nam･1 *aya (bend)
Base √nam + *aya > nāmaya (caus)
Construction upa + nāmaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit upanāmayat
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)
upanāmita

pp. brought near, offered [upa + √nam] ✗
upanāmetabba

ptp. (+dat) (of food) should be served (to); should be offered (to); lit. to cause to bend near [upa + √nam + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of upanāmeti, caus (+dat)
Meaning (of food) should be served (to); should be offered (to); lit. to cause to bend near
Root Family upa √nam
Root √nam･1 *e (bend)
Base √nam + *e > nāme (caus)
Construction upa + nāme + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit upanāmayitavya
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Example

sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā. yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā
upanāmeti

pr. (+acc) (of food) serves; brings near; takes the next mouthful; lit. causes to bend near [upa + √nam + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upanamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of food) serves; brings near; takes the next mouthful; lit. causes to bend near
Root Family upa √nam
Root √nam･1 *e (bend)
Base √nam + *e > nāme (caus)
Construction upa + nāme + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit upanāmayati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Example

dvattikkhattuṃ kho bhavaṃ gotamo mukhe ālopaṃ samparivattetvā ajjhoharati, na c'assa kāci odanamiñjā asambhinnā kāyaṃ pavisati, na c'assa kāci odanamiñjā mukhe avasiṭṭhā hoti, ath'āparaṃ ālopaṃ upanāmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
upanāmesi

aor. (+dat) (of food) served (to); offered (to); lit. caused to bend near [upa + √nam + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of upanāmeti, caus, trans (+dat)
Meaning (of food) served (to); offered (to); lit. caused to bend near
Root Family upa √nam
Root √nam･1 *e (bend)
Base √nam + *e > nāme (caus)
Construction upa + nāme + si
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym abhihari
Sanskrit upanam
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Example

atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo mahatiyā kaṃsapātiyā pāyāsaṃ vaḍḍhetvā bhagavato upanāmesi, bhuñjatu bhavaṃ gotamo pāyasaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
upanāyika 1

adj. entering; approaching; leading to; lit. related to leading near [upa + √nī + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upanaya
Meaning entering; approaching; leading to; lit. related to leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī > nay + *a + *ika
upanaya + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Synonym upagama
Sanskrit upanāyika
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

te upakaṭṭhāya vassa-upanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
upanāyika 2

adj. relating to; referring to; regarding; applying to; lit. related to leading near [upa + √nī + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upānaya
Meaning relating to; referring to; regarding; applying to; lit. related to leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī > nay > nāy + *a + *ika
upanaya + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Sanskrit upanāyika
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu anabhijānaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ att'upanāyikaṃ alam'ariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya iti jānāmi, iti passāmī'ti

VIN PAT PA 4 uttarimanussadhammasikkhāpadaṃ
upanāha

masc. resentment; bearing a grudge; harbouring enmity; rancour; lit. binding onto [upa + √nah + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upanayhati
Meaning resentment; bearing a grudge; harbouring enmity; rancour; lit. binding onto
Root Family upa √nah
Root √nah･3 ya (bind, arm)
Construction upa + √nah > nāh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anupanāha
Commentary (MNa) upanandhanalakkhaṇo upanāho, vera appaṭinissajjanaraso, kodh'ānupabandhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhāno. vuttañ'c'etaṃ, pubbakāle kodho, aparakāle upanāho'tiādi
Sanskrit upanāha
Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

Examples

upanāho cittassa upakkileso'ti, iti viditvā upanāhaṃ cittassa upakkilesaṃ pajahati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

upanāhissa upanāho appahīno hoti, makkhissa makkho appahīno hoti, paḷāsissa paḷāso appahīno hoti, issukissa issā appahīnā hoti, maccharissa macchariyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
upanāhapariyuṭṭhāna

nt. being obsessed by a grudge; being consumed by resentment [upanāha + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning being obsessed by a grudge; being consumed by resentment
Construction upanāha + pariyuṭṭhāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upanāhena + pariyuṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit upanāha + paryavasthāna

Example

upanāhī kho pana ayam'āyasmā, upanāhapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. upanāhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

upanāhī

adj. resentful; who bears a grudge; who harbours enmity; who is vengeful; having rancour; lit. bound onto [upa + √nah + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from upanayhati
Meaning resentful; who bears a grudge; who harbours enmity; who is vengeful; having rancour; lit. bound onto

Examples

kodhano upanāhī ca,
pāpamakkhī ca yo naro,

taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

uragavaggo 7

upanāhissa upanāho appahīno hoti, makkhissa makkho appahīno hoti, paḷāsissa paḷāso appahīno hoti, issukissa issā appahīnā hoti, maccharissa macchariyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
upanāhīsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.6 (SN37.6) ✗
upanikkhamati

pr. goes out; comes out [upa + nī + √kam] ✗
upanikkhami

aor. (+abl) left; came out (from); exited [upa + nī + √kam + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upanikkhamati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning left; came out (from); exited
Root Family upa nī √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + a > kama > khama (irreg)
Construction upa + nī + khama + i
Phonetic Change īk > ikkh
k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
Synonym nikkhami, niyyāsi
Sanskrit niṣkram
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

ahaṃ middhena pakato,
vihārā upanikkhamiṃ,
caṅkamaṃ abhiruhanto,
tatth'eva papatiṃ chamā.

TH 187 bhaguttheragāthā
upanikkhitta

pp. placed down; deposited [upa + ni + √khip + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upanikkhipati
Meaning placed down; deposited
Root Family upa ni √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction upa + ni + √khip + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change p > t
Sanskrit upanikṣipta
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu jātarūparajataṃ uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 18 rūpiyasikkhāpadaṃ

upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyyā'ti idaṃ ayyassa hotū'ti upanikkhittaṃ sādiyati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.2.8 rūpiyasikkhāpadaṃ
upanikkhittapaññatti

fem. additive description (concept) ✗
upanikkhipati

pr. deposits near, lays up, sets out [upa + ni + √khip] ✗
upanikkhipana

nt. putting down, depositing near [upa + ni + √khip] ✗
upanikkhipi

aor. deposited near, laid up, set out [upa + ni + √khip] ✗
upanikkhipitvā

abs. having placed down; having deposited [upa + ni + √khip] ✗
upanikkhepa

masc. putting down, depositing near [upa + ni + √khip] ✗
upanikkhepana

Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip

Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit upanikṣepa
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)
upanikkhepanamatta

adj. placing next to (for the purpose of comparison) [upanikkhepana + matta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning placing next to (for the purpose of comparison)
Construction upanikkhepana + matta
Commentary (SNa) yāva'd'eva upanikkhepanamattāyā'ti tiyojanasahassavitthārassa himavato santike ṭhapitā sāsapamattā pāsāṇasakkharā himavā nu kho mahā, ayaṃ nu kho pāsāṇasakkharā'ti evaṃ yāva upanikkhepanamattass'eva atthāya bhaveyyāti vuttaṃ hoti. parato'pi eseva nayo.
Sanskrit upanikṣepa + mātra
upanigghāna

nt. consideration, reflection [upa + ni + √jhā] ✗
upanighaṃsati

pr. rubs up against, crushes [upa + ni + √ghaṃs] ✗
upanighaṃsanta

prp. rubbing against, pressing up near to [upa + ni + √ghaṃs] ✗
upanighaṃsi

aor. rubbed up against, crushed [upa + ni + √ghaṃs] ✗
upanijjhayi

aor. (+acc) meditated upon, reflected on [upa + ni + √jhā] ✗
upanijjhāna

nt. (+gen) contemplating; meditating (on); reflecting (on) [upa + ni + √jhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upanijjhāyati (+gen)
Meaning contemplating; meditating (on); reflecting (on)
Root Family upa ni √jhā
Root √jhā･3 ya (think, meditate)
√ In Comps jjhā
Construction upa + ni + √jhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym upanijjhāyana, nijjhāna
Sanskrit upanidhyāna (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

Example

jhāyanto'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānena ca ārammaṇ'ūpanijjhānena ca jhāyanto. tattha lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ nāma vipassanāmaggaphalāni. vipassanā hi tīṇi lakkhaṇāni upanijjhāyatī'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ.

SNa 1.36 saddhāsuttavaṇṇanā
upanijjhāyati 1

pr. (+acc) meditates (on); contemplates; reflects (on) [upa + ni + √jhā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning meditates (on); contemplates; reflects (on)
Root Family upa ni √jhā
Root √jhā･3 ya (think, meditate)
√ In Comps jjhā
Base √jhā + ya > jhāya
Construction upa + ni + jhāya + ti
Synonym anuvicāreti, jhāyati, nijjhāyati
Commentary (SNt) upanijjhāyatī'ti upecca ñāṇacakkhunā pekkhati, anupassatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit upanidhyāyati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

Example

vipassanā hi tīṇi lakkhaṇāni upanijjhāyatī'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ. maggo vipassanāya āgatakiccaṃ sādhetī'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ. phalaṃ tathalakkhaṇaṃ nirodhasaccaṃ upanijjhāyatī'ti lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānaṃ.

SNa 1.36 saddhāsuttavaṇṇanā
upanijjhāyati 2

pr. regards with envy [upa + ni + √jhā] ✗

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning looks (at); gazes (at); stares (at)

Root √jhā･3 ya (think, meditate)
√ In Comps jjhā

Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

Example

api ca kho mātugāmassa cakkhunā cakkhuṃ upanijjhāyati pekkhati

upanijjhāyana

nt. (+gen) contemplating; meditating (on); reflecting (on) [upa + ni + √jhā + ya + ana] ✓

SNa 1.36 saddhāsuttavaṇṇanā
upanijjhāyanta

prp. regarding with envy [upa + ni + √jhā] ✗
upanijjhāyi

aor. regarded with envy [upa + ni + √jhā] ✗

Meaning reflected upon; thought over; meditated upon

Root √jhā･3 ya (think, meditate)
√ In Comps jjhā

Construction upa + ni + jhāya + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
