Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

Examples

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya idaṃ saccan'ti upanijjhāyitaṃ ta'dam'ariyānaṃ etaṃ musā'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ, ayam'ek'ānupassanā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya idaṃ sukhan'ti upanijjhāyitaṃ, ta'dam'ariyānaṃ etaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ, ayam'ek'ānupassanā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
upanijjhāyitabba

ptp. observed, thought of [upa + ni + √jhā] ✗
upanidhā 1

fem. comparison; resemblance; equivalence; lit. placing near [upa + ni + √dhā + ā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from upanidahati
Meaning comparison; resemblance; equivalence; lit. placing near
Root Family upa ni √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + ni + √dhā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
upanidhā 2

fem. pledge [upa + ni + √dhā] ✗
upanidhāpaññatti

fem. appositional (comparative) descriptive (concept) ✗
upanidhāya

ger. (+acc or +gen) compared (to); in comparison (with); lit. placing down near [upa + ni + √dhā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upa ni √dhā, trans (+acc or +gen)
Meaning compared (to); in comparison (with); lit. placing down near
Root Family upa ni √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + ni + √dhā + ya
Commentary (MNa) upanidhāyā'ti upanikkhipitvā.
Sanskrit upanidhāya
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

saṅkham'pi na upeti upanidhim'pi na upeti kalabhāgam'pi na upeti mahāpathaviṃ upanidhāya bhagavatā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito'ti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ

kiñ'hi sobhati chavo manodaṇḍo imassa evaṃ oḷārikassa kāyadaṇḍassa upanidhāya! atha kho kāyadaṇḍo'va mahāsāvajjataro pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā, no tathā vacīdaṇḍo, no tathā manodaṇḍo'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
upanidhi 1

masc. comparison; resemblance; lit. placing down near [upa + ni + √dhā + i] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning comparison; resemblance; lit. placing down near
Root Family upa ni √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + ni + √dhā + i
Derivative kita (i)
Sanskrit upanidhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

saṅkham'pi na upeti upanidhim'pi na upeti kalabhāgam'pi na upeti mahāpathaviṃ upanidhāya bhagavatā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito'ti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ
upanidhi 2

masc. deposit; stash; property put under the care of another; entrusted item; lit. placing down near [upa + ni + √dhā + i] ~

Grammar masc
Meaning deposit; stash; property put under the care of another; entrusted item; lit. placing down near
Root Family upa ni √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + ni + √dhā + i
Derivative kita (i)
Commentary (VMVt) oṇirakkhassa santike ṭhapitabhaṇḍaṃ upanidhi viya guttaṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā saṅgopan'atthāya anikkhipitvā yathāṭhapitaṭṭhāne eva muhuttamattaṃ olokan'atthāya ṭhapitattā tassa bhaṇḍassa ṭhānācāvanamattena oṇirakkhakassa pārājikaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit upanidhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
upanidhi 3

masc. pledge [upa + ni + √dhā] ✗
upanipajjati

pr. (+acc) lies down next to; lies down around [upa + ni + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning lies down next to; lies down around
Root Family upa ni √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction upa + ni + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit upanipadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
upanipajji

aor. lied down close to [upa + ni + √pad] ✗
upanipanna

pp. lying down near; laying close [upa + ni + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upanipajjati
Meaning lying down near; laying close
Root Family upa ni √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + ni + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Sanskrit upa + nipanna (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

nisajjaṃ kappeyyā'ti mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
upanibajjhati

pr. (+loc) is tied (to); is attached (to); lit. is tied down near [upa + ni + √badh + ya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of upanibandhati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is tied (to); is attached (to); lit. is tied down near
Root Family upa ni √badh
Root √badh･1 ya (bind, tie)
Base √badh + ya > bajjha (pass)
Construction upa + ni + bajjha + ti
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Antonym nopanibajjhati
Sanskrit upabandh, upanibadhyate
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)
upanibatta

adj. come into being, originated [upa + ni + √vatt] ✗
upanibaddha

pp. (+loc) tied (onto); fastened (onto) [upa + ni + √badh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upanibandhati (+loc)
Meaning tied (onto); fastened (onto)
Root Family upa ni √badh
Root √badh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction upa + ni + √badh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Synonym baddha
Sanskrit upanibaddha
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sā gaddulabaddho daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibaddho. so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
upanibandha

pp. tied close to, entreated [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibandhati 1

pr. (+loc) ties (onto); fastens (to); ties down (onto) [upa + ni + √bandh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning ties (onto); fastens (to); ties down (onto)
Root Family upa ni √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Base √bandh + a > bandha
Construction upa + ni + bandha + ti
Synonym nibandhati
Sanskrit upabadhnāti
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Examples

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibandheyya. atha kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, hatthidamako mahantaṃ thambhaṃ pathaviyaṃ nikhaṇitvā āraññakassa nāgassa gīvāyaṃ upanibandhati āraññakānañ'c'eva sīlānaṃ abhinimmadanāya āraññakānañ'c'eva sarasaṅkappānaṃ abhinimmadanāya

MN 125 dantabhūmisuttaṃ
upanibandhati 2

pr. (+loc) entreats [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibandhana 1

nt. tying; fastening [upa + ni + √bandh + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from upanibandhati
Meaning tying; fastening
Root Family upa ni √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction upa + ni + √bandh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upanibandhana (description)
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)
upanibandhana 2

nt. close connection [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibandhana 3

nt. importunity [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibandhana 4

nt. connection; bond; fastening [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibandhanā

fem. binding; fastening; tying device [upa + ni + √bandh + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from upanibandhati
Meaning binding; fastening; tying device
Root Family upa ni √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction upa + ni + √bandh + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Sanskrit upanibandhana (description)
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

evam'eva kho, aggivessana, ariyasāvakassa ime cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cetaso upanibandhanā honti gehasitānañ'c'eva sīlānaṃ abhinimmadanāya gehasitānañ'c'eva sarasaṅkappānaṃ abhinimmadanāya gehasitānañ'c'eva darathakilamathapariḷāhānaṃ abhinimmadanāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.

MN 125 dantabhūmisuttaṃ
upanibandhi

aor. tied close to, entreated [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibandhitvā

abs. (+loc) having tied onto; having fastened (to) [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibbatta

pp. appeared; arose [upa + nī + √vatt] ✗
upanibha

adj. like; resembling; similar to [upa + ni + √bhā + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning like; resembling; similar to
Root Family upa ni √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Construction upa + ni + √bhā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym upama, disa, nibha, patirūpaka, bhūta, saṅkāsa, sadisa, sannibha, sappaṭibhāga, sarikkhaka, sarūpa
Variant paṭibhāga
Sanskrit upanibha
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni setāni saṅkhavaṇṇa-upanibhāni

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
upanibhandha 1

masc. close connection [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upanibhandha 2

adj. dependent on, connected with [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗
upaniyyati

pr. is brought near; is alluded to; is brought to the end [upa + √nī] ✗
upanivattati

pr. (+acc) returns (to); comes back (to) [upa + ni + √vatt + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning returns (to); comes back (to)
Root Family upa ni √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Base √vatt + a > vatta
Construction upa + ni + vatta + ti
Synonym āgacchati, paccāgacchati, pacceti, paṭikkamati, punupeti
Variant pativattati, upātivattati
Sanskrit upanivartate
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

alatthaṃ yadidaṃ sādhu,
n'ālatthaṃ kusalaṃ iti.
ubhayen'eva so tādī,
rukkhaṃ'v'upanivattati.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upanisa 1

adj. based on, living near [upa + ni + √si] ✗
upanisa 2

adj. caused by; as precondition; as prerequisite; lit. sitting down near [upa + ni + √si + ā + a] ~

Grammar adj, from upanisā
Meaning caused by; as precondition; as prerequisite; lit. sitting down near
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si + ā + a
upanisā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Sanskrit upaniśri
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)
upanisasampanna

adj. having the precondition for; with the prerequisite for [upanisa + sampanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the precondition for; with the prerequisite for
Construction upanisa + sampanna
Antonym hatūpanisa
upanisasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.23 (SN12.23) ✗
upanisā 1.1

fem. (+dat) cause (for); precondition (for); prerequisite (for); lit. sitting down near [upa + ni + √si + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, in comps, from upanissayati (+dat)
Meaning cause (for); precondition (for); prerequisite (for); lit. sitting down near
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Notes (PED) contracted form of upanissaya
Sanskrit upaniśri
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Examples

sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, sambodhipakkhikānaṃ, āvuso, dhammānaṃ kā upanisā bhāvanāyā'ti, evaṃ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ kin'ti byākareyyāthā'ti?

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ

yam'pi'ssa taṃ, bhikkhave, khayasmiṃ khayeññāṇaṃ, tam'pi saupanisaṃ vadāmi, no anupanisaṃ. kā ca, bhikkhave, khayeñāṇassa upanisā? vimuttī'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

SN 12.23 upanisasuttaṃ
upanisā 1.2

fem. (+dat) reason (for); purpose (of); lit. sitting down near [upa + ni + √si + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from upanissayati (+dat)
Meaning reason (for); purpose (of); lit. sitting down near
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym atthavasa
Notes (PED) contracted form of upanissaya
Sanskrit upaniśri
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Examples

ye te, bhikkhave, kusalā dhammā ariyā niyyānikā sambodhagāmino, tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ariyānaṃ niyyānikānaṃ sambodhagāmīnaṃ kā upanisā savanāyā'ti

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

aññā hi lābha-upanisā,
aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
vivekam'anubrūhaye.

DHP 75 bālavaggo
upanisā 2.1

fem. sitting near; approaching [upa + ni + √sad + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from upanisīdati
Meaning sitting near; approaching
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction upa + ni + √sad + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit upaniṣad (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

etadatthā, bhikkhave, kathā, etadatthā mantanā, etadatthā upanisā, etadatthaṃ sot'āvadhānaṃ, yadidaṃ anupādā cittassa vimokkho'ti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
upanisinna

pp. seated close; sitting nearby [upa + ni + √sad + a + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upanisīdati
Meaning seated close; sitting nearby
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīda + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > ī
d > n
Sanskrit upa + niṣaṇṇa
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

nisajjaṃ kappeyyā'ti mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ

upanisinna + ka

Phonetic Change a > ī
d > n
Sanskrit upa + niṣaṇṇaka
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
upanisinnakakathā

fem. Dhamma talk delivered to someone close at hand [upanisinnaka + kathā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning Dhamma talk delivered to someone close at hand
Construction upanisinnaka + kathā
Commentary (ANt) attano santikaṃ upagantvā nisinnassa kātabbā tadanucchavikā dhammakathā upanisinnakakathā.
upanisinnakathā

fem. form of discourse ✗
upanisinnavagga

masc. Chapter 4 of the Rādhasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 3 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
upanisīdati

pr. (+acc) sits next to; sits around [upa + ni + √sad + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sits next to; sits around
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīda + ti
Phonetic Change a > ī
Sanskrit upasīdati
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Examples

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
upanisīdāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having made (someone) sit nearby [upa + ni + √sad + *āpe + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of upanisīdāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having made (someone) sit nearby
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 *āpe (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + āpe > sadāpe > sīdāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīdāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change a > ī
Sanskrit upasad
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
upanisīdi

aor. sat close to [upa + ni + √sad] ✗
upanisīdituṃ

inf. (+acc) to sit down; to sit (with); lit. to sit near [upa + ni + √sad + a + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of upanisīdati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to sit down; to sit (with); lit. to sit near
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīda + ituṃ
Synonym abhinisīdituṃ, nisīdituṃ
Sanskrit upaniṣad
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

sattahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ kulaṃ anupagantvā vā n'ālaṃ upagantuṃ, upagantvā vā n'ālaṃ upanisīdituṃ. katamehi sattahi?

AN 7.13 kulasuttaṃ
upanisīditvā

abs. having sat down near (to) [upa + ni + √sad] ✗
upanisevati 1

pr. (+acc) latches onto; cling into; lit. associates closely [upa + ni + √sev + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning latches onto; cling into; lit. associates closely
Root Family upa ni √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction upa + ni + seva + ti
Sanskrit upaniṣevate
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Example

s'āssa māluvālatā taruṇā mudukā lomasā vilambinī, sā taṃ sālaṃ upaniseveyya.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
upanisevati 2

pr. (+acc) associates closely [upa + ni + √sev] ✗
upanissaya

masc. decisive support; supporting condition; sufficient condition [upa + ni + √si + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upanissayati
Meaning decisive support; supporting condition; sufficient condition
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si > say + *a

Phonetic Change i > ay
Sanskrit upaniśraya (bsk)

Example

nissayapaccayo, upanissayapaccayo, purejātapaccayo, pacchājātapaccayo, āsevanapaccayo, kammapaccayo, vipākapaccayo, āhārapaccayo

DSa Nidānakathā
upanissayati

pr. associates closely, depends on [upa + ni + √si] ✗

adj. successfully attained the supporting conditions [upanissaya + sampanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning successfully attained the supporting conditions
Construction upanissaya + sampanna
upanissayi

aor. associated closely, depended on [upa + ni + √si] ✗
upanissāya 1

ger. (+acc) depending (on); based (on); supported (by) [upa + ni + √si + *ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upanissayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning depending (on); based (on); supported (by)
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si > sāy + *ya
Phonetic Change i > āy
Synonym paṭicca
Commentary (VIN 1.2.13) upanissāya viharatī'ti tattha paṭibaddhā honti cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā.
Sanskrit upaniśrāya
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Examples

bhikkhu pan'eva aññataraṃ gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā upanissāya viharati kuladūsako pāpasamācāro, tassa kho pāpakā samācārā dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca, kulāni ca tena duṭṭhāni dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca

VIN PAT SA 13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satthāraṃ upanissāya viharati aññataraṃ vā garuṭṭhāniyaṃ sabrahmacāriṃ, yatth'assa tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti pemañ'ca gāravo ca.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
upanissāya 2

ind. (+acc) nearby; near (to) [upa + ni + √si + *ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of upanissayati (+acc)
Meaning nearby; near (to)
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si > sāy + *ya
Phonetic Change i > āy
Synonym nissāya, santike, samīpe
Sanskrit upaniśrāya
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Examples

tenah'ānanda, yāvatikā bhikkhū vesāliṃ upanissāya viharanti te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannipātehī'ti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

yaṃnūna mayaṃ amuṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ nevāpikassa upanissāya āsayaṃ kappeyyāma.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
upanissita

pp. dependent on; clinging to; relying on [upa + ni + √si + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upanissayati
Meaning dependent on; clinging to; relying on
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit upaniśrita
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Example

ete ca ñatvā upanissitā'ti,
ñatvā munī nissaye so vimaṃsī,
ñatvā vimutto na vivādam'eti,
bhav'ābhavāya na sameti dhīro'ti.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
upanīta 1

pp. (+loc) led (into); brought (into); presented; lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaneti, in comps (+loc)
Meaning led (into); brought (into); presented; lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym anūpanīta
Synonym pābhata
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Examples

kāmesu giddhā pasutā pamūḷhā,
avadāniyā te visame niviṭṭhā,
dukkha-upanītā paridevayanti,
kiṃ'sū bhavissāma ito cutāse.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

sīl'uttamā saññamen'āhu suddhiṃ,
vataṃ samādāya upaṭṭhitāse,
idh'eva sikkhema athassa suddhiṃ,
bhava-upanītā kusalā vadānā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
upanīta 2

pp. (+acc) (of a sacrifice) led (to); offered; presented; lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaneti (+acc)
Meaning (of a sacrifice) led (to); offered; presented; lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym paccupaṭṭhita, pābhata
Commentary (SNa) thūṇ'ūpanītānī'ti thūṇaṃ upanītāni, thūṇāya baddhāni honti. (SNt) upanītāni yaññaṃ yajituṃ ārambhāya.
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Examples

saccena danto damasā upeto,
vedantagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
yañño-upanīto tam'upavhayetha,
kālena so juhati dakkhiṇeyye'ti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito hoti, pañca ca usabhasatāni pañca ca vacchatarasatāni pañca ca vacchatarisatāni pañca ca ajasatāni pañca ca urabbhasatāni thūṇā-upanītāni honti yaññ'atthāya.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
upanīta 3

pp. suggestive; implicative; allusory; insinuative; accusatory; lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaneti
Meaning suggestive; implicative; allusory; insinuative; accusatory; lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (MNa) upanītehī'ti upanetvā kathitehi.
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

yāvañ'c'idaṃ bhoto gotamassa evaṃ āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa, upanītehi vacanappathehi samudācariyamānassa, chavivaṇṇo c'eva pariyodāyati, mukhavaṇṇo ca vippasīdati, yathā taṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
upanīta 4

pp. (+loc) compared (to); in comparison (with); lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaneti (+loc)
Meaning compared (to); in comparison (with); lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

sara catur'odadhī,
upanīte assuthaññarudhiramhi,
sara ekakappam'aṭṭhīnaṃ,
sañcayaṃ vipulena samaṃ.

THI 73 sumedhātherīgāthā
upanīta 5

pp. ended; concluded; passed; lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaneti, in comps
Meaning ended; concluded; passed; lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym avasita
Commentary (DHPa) upanītavayo'ti upā'ti nipātam'attaṃ, nītavayo'ti vigatavayo atikkantavayo, tvañ'c'asi dāni tayo vaye atikkamitvā maraṇamukhe ṭhito'ti attho.
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

upanītavayo ca dāni'si,
sampayāto'si yamassa santike,
vāso te n'atthi antarā,
pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

upanītavaya

adj. at the end of life; come to the last stage of life; lit. brought to age [upanīta + vayas + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning at the end of life; come to the last stage of life; lit. brought to age
Construction upanīta + vayas + a
upanītavayas + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upanīta + vayaṃ)
Commentary (DHPa) upanītavayo'ti upā'ti nipātam'attaṃ, nītavayo'ti vigatavayo atikkantavayo, tvañ'c'asi dāni tayo vaye atikkamitvā maraṇamukhe ṭhito'ti attho.
Sanskrit upanīta + vayas

Example

upanītavayo ca dāni'si,
sampayāto'si yamassa santike,
vāso te n'atthi antarā,
pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

DHP 237 malavaggo
upanīya

ger. (+acc) suggesting; alluding; insinuating; accusing; lit. leading near [upa + √nī + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upaneti, trans (+acc)
Meaning suggesting; alluding; insinuating; accusing; lit. leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ya
Synonym upaneyya
Commentary (MNa) āsajja upanīyā'ti guṇe ghaṭṭetvā c'eva upanetvā ca.
Sanskrit upanīya
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

addhā kho te ayaṃ, aggivessana, āsajja upanīya vācā bhāsitā, api ca te ahaṃ byākarissāmi.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
upanīyati 1

pr. is carried away; is lead to the end; is brought to a conclusion; (comm) slowly approaches death; lit. is lead near [upa + √nī + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of upaneti, intrans
Meaning is carried away; is lead to the end; is brought to a conclusion; (comm) slowly approaches death; lit. is lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 ya (lead, carry)
Base √nī + ya > nīya (pass)
Construction upa + nīya + ti
Commentary (SNa) upanīyatī'ti parikkhīyati nirujjhati, upagacchati vā, anupubbena maraṇaṃ upetī'ti attho
Sanskrit upanīyate
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

upanīyati jīvitam'appam'āyu,
jar'ūpanītassa na santi tāṇā,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

upanīyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.3 (SN1.3) ✗
upanīhātuṃ

inf. (+acc) (of money) to produce; to come up with [upa + nī + √har + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of upanīharati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of money) to produce; to come up with
Root Family upa nī √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction upa + nī + √har > hā + tuṃ
Phonetic Change ar > ā
Variant upanihantuṃ
Sanskrit upanirhṛ
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

so kismiñci'd'eva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne na sakkuṇeyya upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā.

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ

upaneti 1

pr. (+acc) leads (to); carries (to); guides (to); lit. leads near [upa + √nī + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning leads (to); carries (to); guides (to); lit. leads near

Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Base √nī + a > ne
Construction upa + ne + ti
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym anūpaneti
Synonym nayati, paṭipādeti
Sanskrit upanayati
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa appamattakam'pi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tam'enaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ

atha khv'assa pubb'eva tathā cittaṃ bhāvitaṃ hoti yaṃ taṃ tathattāya upanetī'ti.

VIN 1.1.4 catutthapārājikaṃ

upanetvā

abs. (+acc) having led; having guided; lit. having led near [upa + √nī + a + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of upaneti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having led; having guided; lit. having led near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Base √nī + a > ne
Construction upa + ne + tvā
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym anūpanetvā
Sanskrit upanītvā
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

te sāvake upanetvā pabbajite, sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desetvā pabbajitānaṃ, sāvakesu gedhitacittā pabbajitesu, kāyassa bhedā pāṇ'upacchedā hīne kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upanenta

prp. (+acc) leading; guiding; lit. leading near [upa + √nī + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of upaneti, trans (+acc)
Meaning leading; guiding; lit. leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Base √nī + a > ne
Construction upa + ne + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym anupanenta
Synonym nayamāna
Sanskrit upaniyat
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

desento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ t'ādiso'va, adesento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ t'ādiso'va. upanento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvake t'ādiso'va, anupanento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvake t'ādiso'va.

Sanskrit upanīya

aor. (+acc) brought up; presented; directed attention (to); lit. led near [upa + √nī + a + si] ✓

Example

nanu tvaṃ, bhikkhu, passasi brahmaparisaṃ sannipatitan'ti? iti kho maṃ, bhikkhave, māro pāpimā brahmaparisaṃ upanesi.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upanesi 2

aor. (+acc) led; guided; lit. led near [upa + √nī + a + si] ✓

Examples

sace kho tvaṃ, mārisa, evaṃ pajānāsi, sace tvaṃ evaṃ anubuddho, mā sāvake upanesi, mā pabbajite, mā sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesi, mā pabbajitānaṃ, mā sāvakesu gedhim'akāsi, mā pabbajitesu.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahesuṃ kho, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā paṭijānamānā. te sāvake upanesuṃ pabbajite, sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesuṃ pabbajitānaṃ, sāvakesu gedhim'akaṃsu pabbajitesu

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upanesi 3

upantika 2

upapajja 1

adj. reborn; re-arisen; lit. gone towards [upa + √pad + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from upapajjati
Meaning reborn; re-arisen; lit. gone towards
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + √pad + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Synonym upapanna
Sanskrit utpad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

katamo ca, bhikkhave, kammānaṃ vipāko? tividh'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, kammānaṃ vipākaṃ vadāmi, diṭṭh'eva dhamme, upapajje vā, apare vā pariyāye. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, kammānaṃ vipāko.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
upapajja 2

ger. (+acc) being reborn (in); re-arising (in); lit. going towards [upa + √pad + ya] ~

Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit utpadya
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
upapajjati 1

pr. (+acc) is reborn (in); re-arises (in); lit. goes towards [upa + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning is reborn (in); re-arises (in); lit. goes towards
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction upa + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Antonym cavati
Synonym uppajjati, nibbattati
Commentary (ANa) upapajjatī'ti suddhasīle patiṭṭhito devaloke nibbattati.
Sanskrit udpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

atha v'āssa agārāni,
aggi ḍahati pāvako,
kāyassa bhedā duppañño,
nirayaṃ so-upapajjati.

DHP 140 daṇḍavaggo

yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ
upapajjati 2

pr. (+acc) appears; arises; lit. goes towards [upa + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Example

chinda sotaṃ parakkamma,
kāme panuda brāhmaṇa,
nappahāya munī kāme,
n'ekattam'upapajjati.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

tividh'āhaṃ kammānaṃ vipākaṃ vadāmi, diṭṭh'eva dhamme, upapajjaṃ vā, apare vā pariyāye. ayaṃ vuccati kammānaṃ vipāko.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
upapajji

aor. (+acc) was reborn (in); re-arose (in); lit. went towards [upa + √pad + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upapajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning was reborn (in); re-arose (in); lit. went towards
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction upa + pajja + i
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit utpad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

m'āyaṃ āyasmā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjī'ti! evaṃ tasmiṃ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

atha kho, pāpima, kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho nāg'āpalokitaṃ apalokesi, na v'āyaṃ dūsī māro mattam'aññāsī'ti. sah'āpalokanāya ca pana, pāpima, dūsī māro tamhā ca ṭhānā cavi mahānirayañ'ca upapajji.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
upapajjitar

masc. (from upapajjati) who comes into existence (in), is reborn (in) [upa + √pad] ✗
upapajjitvā

abs. (+acc) having been reborn [upa + √pad + ya + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of upapajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having been reborn
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction upa + pajja + itvā
Synonym nibbattitvā, nibbattetvā
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
upapajjeyya

opt. (+acc) would be reborn (in); would re-arise (in); lit. could go towards [upa + √pad + ya + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of upapajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning would be reborn (in); would re-arise (in); lit. could go towards
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction upa + pajja + eyya
Commentary (ADHa) nirayaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti'ādi duggatipahānam'eva duggatigāminitaṇhāpahānaṃ vā dīpeti, na duggatisattānaṃ rūp'ādiārammaṇāya taṇhāya pahānaṃ, tasmā asādhakan'ti.
Sanskrit udpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

evam'eva kho, mahārāja, idh'ekacco puggalo akusalaṃ kammaṃ cetanāya cetayitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.

MIL 2.3.11 cetanālakkhaṇa pañho

bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
upapatti 1

fem. rebirth; re-arising; reappearance; lit. going near [upa + √pad + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from upapajjati
Meaning rebirth; re-arising; reappearance; lit. going near
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + √pad + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change d > t
Antonym cuti
Synonym upapāta
Sanskrit upapatti
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

n'eva pubbenivāsāya,
na'pi dibbassa cakkhuno,
cetopariyāya iddhiyā,
cutiyā upapattiyā,
sotadhātuvisuddhiyā,
paṇidhī me na vijjati.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
upapatti 2

fem. appearance; occasion; occurrence; happening; taking place; lit. going near [upa + √pad + ti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from upapajjati
Meaning appearance; occasion; occurrence; happening; taking place; lit. going near
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + √pad + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change d > t
Synonym avakkanti, uppatti, pavatti, samuppatti
Commentary (DNa) kām'ūpapattiyo'ti kām'ūpasevanā kāmappaṭilābhā vā.
Sanskrit upapatti
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
upapatti 3

fem. approach [upa + √pad] ✗
upapattika

Grammar adj, from upapatti

upapattijjhāna

nt. rebirth according to meditation ✗
upapattipaṭilābhiya

Meaning danger of rebirth; peril of reappearance
Construction upapatti + bhaya
upapattibhava

masc. resultant existence ✗
upapada

nt. (gram) auxiliary word; subordinate word; accessory [upa + √pad] ✗
upapadatappurisa

masc. (gram) verbal case compound ✗
upapanna 1

pp. arose; appeared; lit. went towards [upa + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upapajjati
Meaning arose; appeared; lit. went towards
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Antonym anupapanna
Sanskrit upapanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno, yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahit'attassa viharato

AN 8.11 verañjasuttaṃ
upapanna 2

pp. (+acc) reborn (in); re-arisen (in); lit. went towards [upa + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upapajjati (+acc)
Meaning reborn (in); re-arisen (in); lit. went towards
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Synonym upapajja
Commentary (SNa) upapannāse'ti nibbattivasena upagatā
Sanskrit upapanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto yā tā devatā ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ upapannā, tāsaṃ bhāsamānānaṃ saddaṃ suṇātha, suppaṭipannāttha, mārisā, ujuppaṭipannāttha, mārisā, ek'antasukhassa lokassa sacchikiriyāya

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

avihaṃ upapannāse,
vimuttā satta bhikkhavo,
rāgadosaparikkhīṇā,
tiṇṇā loke visattikan'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
upapanna 3

pp. (+instr) because (of); possessed (of); having; lit. went towards [upa + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upapajjati (+instr)
Meaning because (of); possessed (of); having; lit. went towards
Root Family upa √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Synonym upeta
Sanskrit upapanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

santi loke munayo,
janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇa-upapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīvitena-upapannaṃ.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7

apissu taṃ jano disvā evam'āha, abhirūpo vata, bho, rañño nāgo, dassanīyo vata, bho, rañño nāgo, pāsādiko vata, bho, rañño nāgo, kāy'upapanno vata, bho, rañño nāgo'ti!

upapannaphala

adj. laden with fruit; full of fruit [upapanna + phala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning laden with fruit; full of fruit
Construction upapanna + phala
Compound kammadhāraya (upapanna + phala)

Commentary (MNa) upapannaphalan'ti phal'ūpapannaṃ bahuphalaṃ.
Sanskrit upapanna + phala

Example

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre tibbo vanasaṇḍo. tatr'assa rukkho sampannaphalo ca upapannaphalo ca, na c'assu kānici phalāni bhūmiyaṃ patitāni.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
upaparikkhati

pr. (+acc) explores; examines; investigates; inspects; inquires (into); looks (into) [upa + pari + √ikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning explores; examines; investigates; inspects; inquires (into); looks (into)
Root Family upa pari √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction upa + pari + ikkha + ti
Synonym upavicarati, oloketi, paṭivicarati, pavicarati, pavicinati, vicāreti, vicināti, vīmaṃsati, samannesati, samanvesati
Sanskrit upaparīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhante, cetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko, yato yato imassa dhammapariyāyassa paññāya atthaṃ upaparikkheyya, labheth'eva attamanataṃ, labheth'eva cetaso pasādaṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhātuso upaparikkhati, āyatanaso upaparikkhati, paṭiccasamuppādaso upaparikkhati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī hoti.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
upaparikkhana

nt. investigation, examination [upa + pari + √ikkh] ✗
upaparikkhanta

prp. (+acc) exploring; examining; investigating; inspecting; inquiring (into) [upa + pari + √ikkh + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of upaparikkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning exploring; examining; investigating; inspecting; inquiring (into)
Root Family upa pari √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction upa + pari + ikkha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym anupaparikkhanta
Synonym pavicinanta, vicinanta, samannesanta, samannesamāna, samanvesanta
Sanskrit upaparīkṣat
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Examples

tassa taṃ passato nijjhāyato yoniso upaparikkhato rittakaññ'eva khāyeyya, tucchakaññ'eva khāyeyya, asārakaññ'eva khāyeyya.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

tesaṃ te dhammā paññāya atthaṃ upaparikkhataṃ nijjhānaṃ khamanti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
upaparikkhamāna

prp. investigating; examining; inspecting [upa + pari + √ikkh] ✗
upaparikkhasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 94 (ITI 94) ✗

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ ādīnavo upaparikkhitabbo.

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

attadīpānaṃ, bhikkhave, viharataṃ attasaraṇānaṃ anaññasaraṇānaṃ, dhammadīpānaṃ dhammasaraṇānaṃ anaññasaraṇānaṃ yoni upaparikkhitabbā.

SN 22.43 attadīpasuttaṃ

masc. investigator; explorer; examiner; enquirer [upa + pari + √ikkh + itar] ~

Meaning investigator; explorer; examiner; enquirer

Examples

sattaṭṭhānakusalo, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividha-upaparikkhī imasmiṃ dhammavinaye kevalī vusitavā uttamapuriso'ti vuccati.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo khippanisantī ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu, sutānañ'ca dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, dhātānañ'ca dhammānaṃ atth'ūpaparikkhī hoti attham'aññāya dhammam'aññāya, dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.

AN 4.97 khippanisantisuttaṃ

Example

dasa pāramiyo, dasa upapāramiyo, dasa param'atthapāramiyo'ti

upabrūhita

upama

adj. similar to; like; lit. nearer to [upa + √mā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from upameti
Meaning similar to; like; lit. nearer to
Root Family upa √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction upa + √mā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anopama
Synonym upanibha, nibha, paṭibhāga, bhūta, sannibha
Sanskrit upamā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā,
nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

DHP 40 cittavaggo

pheṇapiṇḍ'ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ,
vedanā bubbuḷ'ūpamā,
marīcik'ūpamā saññā,
saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā,
māy'ūpamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ,
desitādiccabandhunā.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
upamañña

masc. name of a clan ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a clan
Sanskrit upamanyu
upamaṇikaṃ

ind. near the water-jar [upa + maṇika + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from maṇika
Meaning near the water-jar
Construction upa + maṇika + aṃ
upamaṇika + aṃ
Sanskrit upa + maṇika

Examples

kumārīsu adhikicca pavattati kathā iti adhikumāri, vadhuyā samīpe pavattati kathā iti upavadhu, gaṅgāya samīpe pavattati kathā iti upagaṅgaṃ, maṇikāya samīpe pavattati kathā iti upamaṇikaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 320

napuṃsake vattamānassa abyayībhāvasamāsassa liṅgassa saro rasso hoti. kumārīsu adhikicca pavattati kathā iti adhikumāri. upavadhu, upagaṅgaṃ, upamaṇikaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 342
upamaṃ te karissāmi

idiom. I will give a simile to you; I will make an analogy for you; I will give an example to you ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + pron + fut
Meaning I will give a simile to you; I will make an analogy for you; I will give an example to you

Example

sādhu sādhu, āvuso yamaka! tena h'āvuso, yamaka, upamaṃ te karissāmi etass'eva atthassa bhiyyosomattāya ñāṇāya.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
upamā 1

fem. simile; comparison; parallel [upa + √mā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from upameti
Meaning simile; comparison; parallel
Root Family upa √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction upa + √mā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit upamā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

tena h'āvuso, upamaṃ te karissāmi. upamāya'p'idh'ekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānanti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.

SN 1.48 paṇihitācchavaggo
upamā 2

fem. example; illustration [upa + √mā + ā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from upameti
Meaning example; illustration
Root Family upa √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction upa + √mā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit upamā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)
upamāna

nt. (gram) comparison; analogy; simile; lit. comparing [upa + √mā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from upameti
Meaning (gram) comparison; analogy; simile; lit. comparing
Root Family upa √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction upa + √mā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym opamma
Sanskrit upamāna
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

435, 536. āya nāmato kattu-upamānā'd'ācāre.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 435

436, 537. īya-upamānā ca.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 436
upamāyapidhekacce

sandhi. just by means of a simile some people here [upamāya + api + idha + ekacce] ✓

Grammar sandhi, fem + ind + adv + pron
Meaning just by means of a simile some people here
Construction upamāya + api + idha + ekacce
Commentary (MNa) tena hī'ti yena kāraṇena ekacce paṇḍitā upamāya atthaṃ jānanti, tena kāraṇena upamaṃ te karissāmī'ti attho.
Sanskrit upamā + api + iha + ekatya

Example

tena h'āvuso, upamaṃ te karissāmi. upamāya'p'idh'ekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānanti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
upamārahita

adj. without comparison; incomparable; devoid of comparison; without compare ✗
upamāsaṃsandana

nt. application of a simile; connection in the comparison [upamā + saṃsandana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning application of a simile; connection in the comparison
Construction upamā + saṃsandana
Variant opammasaṃsandana
upamita

pp. compared [upa + √mā] ✗
upamīyati

pr. is compared [upa + √mā] ✗
upameti

pr. (+instr) compares [upa + √mā] ✗
upametvā

abs. (+instr) having compared (with); having likened (to) [upa + √mā + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of upameti, caus, intrans (+instr)
Meaning having compared (with); having likened (to)
Root Family upa √mā
Root √mā･5 *e (measure)
Base √mā + e > me (caus)
Construction upa + me + tvā
Sanskrit upamā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Example

taṃ alabhantena sukhito'pi pāpakārī puggalo vajjhena upametvā karuṇāyitabbo.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
upamenta

prp. comparing [upa + √mā] ✗
upameyya

ptp. (+instr) to be compared or likened [upa + √mā] ✗
upamesi

aor. (+instr) compared [upa + √mā] ✗
upaya 1

masc. approach; engagement [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti
Meaning approach; engagement
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anūpaya
Commentary (SNa) taṇhādiṭṭhiyo hi yasmā ahaṃ maman'tiādīhi ākārehi tebhūmakadhamme upenti upagacchanti, tasmā upayā'ti vuccanti.
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

upaya-upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upaya-upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ
upaya 2

masc. attachment; lit. going near [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti
Meaning attachment; lit. going near
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anūpaya
Synonym taṇhā
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

yā kācimā sammutiyo puthujjā,
sabbāva etā na upeti vidvā,
anūpayo so upayaṃ kim'eyya,
diṭṭhe sute khantim'akubbamāno.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

rūpadhātuyā kho yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upay'upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā, tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā cittaṃ suvimuttan'ti vuccati.

SN 22.4 dutiyahāliddikānisuttaṃ
upaya 3

masc. (+loc) who is attached (to); who is engaged (with); lit. going near [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti (+loc)
Meaning who is attached (to); who is engaged (with); lit. going near
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anūpaya
Variant upāya
Commentary (SNa) upayo'ti taṇhā-māna-diṭṭhivasena pañcakkhandhe upagato.
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

upayo, bhikkhave, avimutto, anupayo vimutto. rūp'upayaṃ vā, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭheyya, rūp'ārammaṇaṃ rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ nand'ūpasecanaṃ vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 22.53 upayasuttaṃ

Root √yā･1 a (go)
Base √yā + a > yā
Construction upa + yā + nta

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning goes (to); goes near (to); approaches

Root √yā･1 a (go)
Base √yā + a > yā
Construction upa + yā + ti

Examples

papañcayantā upayanti saññino,
manomayaṃ gehasitañ'ca sabbaṃ,
panujja nekkhammasitaṃ irīyati.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

aj'eḷakā ca gāvo ca,
vividhā yattha haññare,
na taṃ sammaggatā yaññaṃ,
upayanti mah'esino.

upayupādāna

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning engaging and grasping; approaching and clinging; going near and grabbing hold

Examples

kathañ'ca, gahapati, anokasārī hoti? rūpadhātuyā kho, gahapati, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upay'upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ
upayupādānābhinivesavinibandha

adj. attached to engaging, grasping and clinging; shackled to going near, grabbing and holding [upaya + upādāna + abhinivesa + vinibandha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attached to engaging, grasping and clinging; shackled to going near, grabbing and holding
Construction upaya + upādāna + abhinivesa + vinibandha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upayupādānābhinivesehi + vinibandha)
Variant upāyupādānābhinivesavinibaddha, upāyupādānābhinivesavinibandha
Commentary (SNa) upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho'ti upayehi ca upādānehi ca abhinivesehi ca vinibandho. tattha upayā'ti dve upayā taṇh'upayo ca diṭṭh'upayo ca. upādān'ādīsu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit upāya + upādāna + abhiniveśa + vinibandha

Example

upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

SN 12.23 upanisasuttaṃ

yadā uparipabbate mahāmegho abhippavuṭṭho hoti, ath'āyaṃ aciravatī nadī ubhato kūlāni saṃvissandantī gacchati, evam'eva kho, bhante, āyasmā ānando imāya bāhitikāya attano ticīvaraṃ karissati.

MN 88 bāhitikasuttaṃ
uparipāṭha

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) following variant reading
Construction upari + pāṭha
uparipāsāda

masc. upper storey of mansion; top terrace of a palace; lit. above mansion [upari + pāsāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning upper storey of mansion; top terrace of a palace; lit. above mansion
Construction upari + pāsāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upari + pāsādassa)
Commentary (MNa) uparipāsādavaragato'ti sattabhūmakassa vā navabhūmakassa vā pāsādavarassa upari gato.
Sanskrit upari + prāsāda

Examples

idh'ānanda, rañño mahāsudassanassa tadah'uposathe pannarase sīsaṃ nhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ pāturahosi sahass'āraṃ sanemikaṃ sanābhikaṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ.

DN 17.3 mahāsudassanasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavoca, atthi nu kho te, mallike, koc'añño attanā piyataro'ti?

SN 3.8 mallikāsuttaṃ
uparipāsādavaragata

adj. promenading on the top deck of the palace [uparipāsāda + varagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning promenading on the top deck of the palace
Construction uparipāsāda + varagata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (uparipāsāde + varagata)
Commentary (DNa) uparipāsādavaragatassā'ti pāsādavarassa upari gatassa
Sanskrit upari + prāsāda + vara + gata

Examples

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavoca, atthi nu kho te, mallike, koc'añño attanā piyataro'ti?

SN 3.8 mallikāsuttaṃ

idh'ānanda, rañño mahāsudassanassa tadah'uposathe pannarase sīsaṃ nhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ pāturahosi sahass'āraṃ sanemikaṃ sanābhikaṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ.

DN 17.3 mahāsudassanasuttaṃ
uparibhāga

masc. upper part; top part; upwards [upari + bhāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning upper part; top part; upwards
Construction upari + bhāga
Compound kammadhāraya (upari + bhāga)
Antonym heṭṭhābhāga, adhobhāga
Variant uparibhāva
Sanskrit uparibhāga

Examples

seyyathā'pi, cunda, ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te adhobhāgaṅ'gamanīyā, ye keci kusalā dhammā sabbe te uparibhāgaṅ'gamanīyā, evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti uparibhāgāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

vattu'kāmo haṃsānaṃ sīghavegatāya bārāṇasinagare rājanivesanassa uparibhāgaṃ sampattakāle daṭṭhaṭṭhānato daṇḍakaṃ vissajjetvā ākāsaṅgaṇe patitvā dvedhā bhijji.

DHPa 2.25.3 kokālika vatthu
uparibhāgaṅgamanīya

adj. leading upwards; lit. leading to the upper part [uparibhāgaṃ + gamanīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading upwards; lit. leading to the upper part
Construction uparibhāgaṃ + gamanīya
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (uparibhāgaṃ + gamanīya)
Antonym adhobhāgaṅgamanīya
Variant uparibhāvaṅgamanīya
Sanskrit uparibhāga + gamanīya

Example

seyyathā'pi, cunda, ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te adhobhāgaṅ'gamanīyā, ye keci kusalā dhammā sabbe te uparibhāgaṅ'gamanīyā, evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti uparibhāgāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
uparibhāgapariyāya

masc. way of going upwards; method of ascending [uparibhāga + pariyāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning way of going upwards; method of ascending
Construction uparibhāga + pariyāya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uparibhāgassa + pariyāya)
Sanskrit uparibhāga + paryāya

Example

iti kho, cunda, desito mayā sallekhapariyāyo, desito citt'uppādapariyāyo, desito parikkamanapariyāyo, desito uparibhāgapariyāyo, desito parinibbānapariyāyo. yaṃ kho, cunda, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
uparibhāva

masc. higher state of being; superior state of existence [upari + bhāva] ~

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning higher state of being; superior state of existence
Construction upari + bhāva
uparibhāvaṅgamanīya

adj. leading to higher states of existence [uparibhāvaṃ + gamanīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to higher states of existence
Construction uparibhāvaṃ + gamanīya
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (uparibhāvaṃ + gamanīya)
Antonym adhobhāvaṅgamanīya
Variant uparibhāgaṅgamanīya
Sanskrit upari + bhāva + gamanīya

Example

seyyathā'pi, cunda, ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te adhobhāgaṅ'gamanīyā, ye keci kusalā dhammā sabbe te uparibhāvaṅ'gamanīyā, evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti uparibhāgāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
uparima

adj. upper; higher [upari + ima] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of upari
Meaning upper; higher
Construction upari + ima
Derivative taddhita (ima)
Antonym heṭṭhima
Synonym uddhambhāgiya
Sanskrit uparima (bsk)

Example

aññataro bhikkhu heṭṭhā hutvā silaṃ uccāresi. uparimena bhikkhunā duggahitā silā heṭṭhimassa bhikkhuno matthake avatthāsi. so bhikkhu kālam'akāsi

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ, vinītavatthu
uparimaggattayasambodhiparāyaṇa

adj. destined for the higher three paths and enlightenment ✗

Meaning upper body
Construction uparima + sarīra
uparimukha

adj. face upwards ✗
uparimuddhani

ind. on top of the head [upari + muddha + ani] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning on top of the head
Construction upari + muddha + ani
uparimuddha + ani
Commentary (UDa) uparimuddhani mahantaṃ phaṇaṃ vihaccā'ti bhagavato muddhappadesassa upari attano mahantaṃ phaṇaṃ pasāretvā. phaṇaṃ karitvā'ti'pi pāṭho, so ev'attho.
uparivehāsa

adj. upper; upstairs; above the ground; lit. up in the air [upari + vehāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning upper; upstairs; above the ground; lit. up in the air
Construction upari + vehāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (upari + vehāsa)
Commentary (VINa) uparivehāsakuṭiyā'ti upari acchannatalāya dvibhūmikakuṭiyā vā tibhūmikādikuṭiyā vā.
Sanskrit upari + vaihāyasa

Example

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 18 vehāsakuṭisikkhāpadaṃ
uparivehāsakuṭi

fem. loft bedroom; upper-floor room; attic room; lit. above sky hut [upari + vehāsa + kuṭi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning loft bedroom; upper-floor room; attic room; lit. above sky hut
Construction upari + vehāsa + kuṭi
Compound sattamī tappurisa (uparivehāse + kuṭi)
Commentary (VINa) uparivehāsakuṭiyā'ti upari acchannatalāya dvibhūmikakuṭiyā vā tibhūmikādikuṭiyā vā, vehāsakuṭī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit upari + vaihāyasa + kuṭi

Example

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 18 vehāsakuṭisikkhāpadaṃ
uparivehāsakutī

fem. hut with its top story open to the air (?) ✗
uparivehāsaṃ

ind. up in the air; in the sky above; lit. above sky [upari + vehāsa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of uparivehāsa
Meaning up in the air; in the sky above; lit. above sky
Construction upari + vehāsa + aṃ
uparivehāsa + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (upari + vehāsaṃ)
Sanskrit upari + vaihāyasam

Example

tena kho pana samayena vajirapāṇi yakkho āyasaṃ vajiraṃ ādāya ādittaṃ sampajjalitaṃ sajotibhūtaṃ saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa uparivehāsaṃ ṭhito hoti, sac'āyaṃ saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavatā yāvatatiyaṃ sahadhammikaṃ pañhaṃ puṭṭho na byākarissati etth'ev'assa sattadhā muddhaṃ phālessāmī'ti.

uparujjhati

pr. is stopped; is ended; is finished [upa + √rudh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of uparundhati, intrans
Meaning is stopped; is ended; is finished
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ya (obstruct)
Base √rudh + ya > rujjha (pass)
Construction upa + rujjha + ti
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Antonym nūparujjhati
Sanskrit uparudhyate
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Examples

sabbaloke ca atam'mayo bhavissāmi, ahaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti, mamaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti

AN 6.104 atammayasuttaṃ

yam'etaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi,
ajita taṃ vadāmi te,
yattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhati,
viññāṇassa nirodhena,
etth'etaṃ uparujjhati.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1
uparujjhi

aor. stopped or ceased [upa + √rudh] ✗
uparuddha 1

pp. stopped; blocked; prevented; held in check [upa + √rudh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uparujjhati
Meaning stopped; blocked; prevented; held in check
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Construction upa + √rudh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Sanskrit uparuddha
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāsesu uparuddhesu kaṇṇasotehi vātānaṃ nikkhamantānaṃ adhimatto saddo hoti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uparuddha 2

pp. hindered [upa + √rudh] ✗
uparuddhati

pr. stops, obstructs; besieges; molests, troubles [upa + √rudh] ✗
uparundhati

pr. (+acc) stops; ends; finishes [upa + √rudh + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning stops; ends; finishes
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Base √rudh + ṃa > rundha
Construction upa + rundha + ti
Synonym osāpeti, nirujjhati
Variant uparuddha
Sanskrit uparundhati
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Examples

aniccaṃ dukkhan'ti vipassa yoniso,
suññaṃ anattā'ti aghaṃ vadhan'ti ca,
manovicāre uparundha cetaso,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

mūlaṃ papañcasaṅkhāya,
mantā asmī'ti sabbam'uparundhe,
yā kāci taṇhā ajjhattaṃ,
tāsaṃ vinayā sadā sato sikkhe.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
uparundhi

aor. (+acc) stopped; blocked; prevented; held in check [upa + √rudh + ṃa + i] ✓

Grammar aor of uparundhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning stopped; blocked; prevented; held in check
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Base √rudh + ṃa > rundha
Construction upa + rundha + i
Synonym antarāyamakāsi
Sanskrit uparudh
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ appāṇakaṃ'y'eva jhānaṃ jhāyeyyan'ti. so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāse uparundhiṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uparundhitvā

abs. having blocked [upa + √rudh] ✗
uparundhiya

ger. (+acc) stopping; ending; finishing [upa + √rudh + ṃa + iya] ✓

Grammar ger of uparundhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning stopping; ending; finishing
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Base √rudh + ṃa > rundha
Construction upa + rundha + iya
Commentary (SNPa) saṅkhāre uparundhiyā'ti kammaṃ kammasampayutte ca saṅkhāre nirodhetvā.
Sanskrit uparundhya
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Example

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
dukkhaṃ iñjitapaccayā,
tasmā hi ejaṃ vossajja,
saṅkhāre uparundhiya,
anejo anupādāno,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
uparūpapattika

adj. who get reborn in a higher realm; who reappear higher [upari + upapattika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who get reborn in a higher realm; who reappear higher
Construction upari + upapattika
Sanskrit upari + aupapattika, upapattika (bsk)
uparūpari

ind. higher and higher; over; on top of; right above ✗
uparevata

masc. name of a novice ✗
uparodhati

pr. stops, obstructs; besieges; molests, troubles [upa + √rudh] ✗
uparodhana

nt. (+gen) stopping (of); ending (of) [upa + √rudh + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from uparundhati (+gen)
Meaning stopping (of); ending (of)
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Construction upa + √rudh > rodh + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym nirujjhana
Sanskrit uparodhana
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Examples

sukhan'ti diṭṭham'ariyehi,
sakkāyass'uparodhanaṃ,
paccanīkam'idaṃ hoti,
sabbalokena passataṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
dukkhaṃ saṅkhārapaccayā,
sabbasaṅkhārasamathā,
saññānaṃ uparodhanā,
evaṃ dukkhakkhayo hoti,
etaṃ ñatvā yathātathaṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
uparodheti

pr. (+acc) makes stop; interrupts; causes to ends [upa + √rudh + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of uparundhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes stop; interrupts; causes to ends
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 *e (obstruct)
Base √rudh + *e > rodhe (caus)
Construction upa + rodhe + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit uparodhayati
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Examples

yaṃ kuddho uparodheti,
sukaraṃ viya dukkaraṃ,
pacchā so vigate kodhe,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

jīvitā voropeyyā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ upacchindati uparodheti santatiṃ vikopeti.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
uparopa

masc. plant ✗

masc. stone ✗

upalabbha

ger. getting [upa + √labh] ✗
upalabbhati 1

pr. (+loc) is found (in); exists (in); is present (in); lit. is obtained [upa + √labh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of upalabhati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is found (in); exists (in); is present (in); lit. is obtained
Root Family upa √labh
Root √labh･1 ya (get)
Base √labh + ya > labbha (pass)
Construction upa + labbha + ti
Phonetic Change bhy > bbh
Synonym vijjati, saṃvijjati
Sanskrit upalabhyate
Sanskrit Root √labh 1 (take)

Examples

kiṃ nu satto'ti paccesi,
māra diṭṭhigataṃ nu te,
suddhasaṅkhārapuñjo'yaṃ,
na'y'idha satt'upalabbhati.

SN 5.10 vajirāsuttaṃ

na tassa puttā pasavo,
khettaṃ vatthuñ'ca vijjati,
attā vā'pi nirattā vā,
na tasmiṃ upalabbhati.

aṭṭhakavaggo 10

Construction upa + lāpe + ti

Example

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ samaṇ'uddesaṃ upalāpeyya vā, upaṭṭhāpeyya vā, sambhuñjeyya vā, saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √likh 6 (scratch)
upalitta 1

pp. smeared; coated [upa + √lip + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upalimpati
Meaning smeared; coated
Root Family upa √lip
Root √lip･2 ṃa (coat, smear)
Construction upa + √lip + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change p > t
Antonym anūpalitta, anupalitta
Sanskrit upalipta
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

Example

kena loko litto saṃlitto upalitto kiliṭṭho saṃkiliṭṭho makkhito saṃsaṭṭho laggo laggito palibuddho, brūsi ācikkhasi desesi paññapesi paṭṭhapesi vivarasi vibhajasi uttānīkarosi pakāsesīti, kiss'ābhilepanaṃ brūsi.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
upalitta 2

pp. spread; covered; lit. smeared [upa + √lip + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upalimpati
Meaning spread; covered; lit. smeared
Root Family upa √lip
Root √lip･2 ṃa (coat, smear)
Construction upa + √lip + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change p > t
Synonym atthata, ācita, santhata
Sanskrit upalipta
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

Example

so tattha anantarahitāya bhūmiyā harit'upalittāya seyyaṃ kappeti.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
upalippati 1

pr. is smeared, is defiled (by, instrumental) [upa + √lip] ✗
upalippati 2

pr. is attached to, sticks, adheres (to, locative) [upa + √lip] ✗
upalimpati 1

pr. (+acc) smears; coats; stains; sticks to; contaminates [upa + √lip + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning smears; coats; stains; sticks to; contaminates
Root Family upa √lip
Root √lip･2 ṃa (coat, smear)
Base √lip + ṃa > limpa
Construction upa + limpa + ti
Synonym limpati
Sanskrit upalimpati
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

Examples

sukhumacchavi kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo. sukhumattā chaviyā rajojallaṃ kāye na upalimpati, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

sevamāno sevamānaṃ,
samphuṭṭho samphusaṃ paraṃ,
saro diddho kalāpaṃ'va,
alittam'upalimpati.
upalepabhayā dhīro,
n'eva pāpasakhā siyā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
upalimpati 2

pr. (+instr or +loc) is smeared (by); is coated (by); is stained (by); is contaminated (by) [upa + √lip + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, irreg, pass, intrans (+instr or +loc)
Meaning is smeared (by); is coated (by); is stained (by); is contaminated (by)
Root Family upa √lip
Root √lip･2 ya (coat, smear)
Base √lip + ya > lippa > limpa (pass, irreg)
Construction upa + limpa + ti
Synonym limpati
Variant upalippati
Notes active base but passive meaning. perhaps a textual error.
Sanskrit upalimpati
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

Examples

udabindu yathā'pi pokkhare,
padume vāri yathā na limpati,
evaṃ muni na-upalimpati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

yathā'pi udake jātā,
kumudā mandālakā bahū,
upalimpanti toyena,
kaddamakalalena ca.

APA 3 sāriputta therāpadānaṃ
upalimpana

nt. coating, defilement, smearing [upa + √lip] ✗
upalimpi

aor. smeared, defiled, tainted [upa + √lip] ✗
upalimpeti

pr. bedaubs, smears [upa + √lip] ✗
upalepa

masc. smearing; contamination [upa + √lip + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upalimpati
Meaning smearing; contamination
Root Family upa √lip
Root √lip･2 ṃa (coat, smear)
Construction upa + √lip > lep + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant upalimpa
Sanskrit upalepa
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

Example

sevamāno sevamānaṃ,
samphuṭṭho samphusaṃ paraṃ,
saro diddho kalāpaṃ'va,
alittam'upalimpati.
upalepabhayā dhīro,
n'eva pāpasakhā siyā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
upalepana

nt. smearing; coating [upa + √lip + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upalimpati
Meaning smearing; coating
Root Family upa √lip
Root √lip･2 ṃa (coat, smear)
Construction upa + √lip > lep + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym lepana
Sanskrit upalepana
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

Example

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sallena viddho assa savisena gāḷha-upalepanena.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
upalepabhaya

nt. fear of contamination [upalepa + bhaya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fear of contamination
Construction upalepa + bhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upalepassa + bhaya)
Commentary (ITIa) evaṃ pāpena upalepabhayā dhīro'ti dhitisampannattā dhīro paṇḍitapuriso pāpasahāyo na bhaveyya.
Sanskrit upalepa + bhaya

Example

sevamāno sevamānaṃ,
samphuṭṭho samphusaṃ paraṃ,
saro diddho kalāpaṃ'va,
alittam'upalimpati,
upalepabhayā dhīro,
n'eva pāpasakhā siyā.

upallavi

aor. swam, floated [ud + √plu] ✗
upavajja 1.1

ptp. approachable; hospitable; lit. to be gone to [upa + √vaj + ya] ✓

Grammar ptp of upa √vaj
Meaning approachable; hospitable; lit. to be gone to
Root Family upa √vaj
Root √vaj･1 a (go on)
√ In Comps vaj or vvaj
Construction upa + √vaj + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change y > j
Commentary (SNa) upavajjakulānī'ti upasaṅkamitabbakulāni.
Sanskrit upavrajya
Sanskrit Root √vraj 1 (proceed)

Examples

atthi, bhante, pubbavijjanaṃ nāma vajjigāmo. tatth'āyasmato channassa mittakulāni suhajjakulāni upavajjakulānī'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

honti h'ete, sāriputta, channassa bhikkhuno mittakulāni suhajjakulāni upavajjakulāni.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 320

napuṃsake vattamānassa abyayībhāvasamāsassa liṅgassa saro rasso hoti. kumārīsu adhikicca pavattati kathā iti adhikumāri. upavadhu, upagaṅgaṃ, upamaṇikaṃ.

Example

aṭṭhakavaggo 14

par'ūpavādā na karonti pāpaṃ,
bhīruṃ pasaṃsanti na hi tattha sūraṃ,
bhayā hi santo na karonti pāpan'ti.

Construction upa + vi + cara + ti
Synonym upadhāreti, upaparikkhati, paṭivicarati, pavicarati, pavicinati, vicāreti, vicināti, vīmaṃsati, samannesati, samanvesati

Example

aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā somanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, domanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, upekkhāṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upavicāra 1

masc. exploration; examination; probing; consideration; lit. approach [upa + vi + √car + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upavicarati
Meaning exploration; examination; probing; consideration; lit. approach
Root Family upa vi √car
Root √car･1 a (move, walk)
Construction upa + vi + √car > cār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym vicaya
Sanskrit upavicāra

Examples

katamā ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭhārasa vedanā? cha somanass'ūpavicārā, cha domanass'ūpavicārā, cha upekkh'ūpavicārā

upavijaññā

fem. woman close to giving birth; woman in an advanced stage of pregnancy [upa + vi + √jan + yā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning woman close to giving birth; woman in an advanced stage of pregnancy
Root Family upa vi √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction upa + vi + √jan + yā
Derivative kita (yā)
Commentary (MNa) upavijaññā'ti vijāyanakālaṃ upagatā.
Sanskrit upa + vijanyā
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhante, aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa jiṇṇassa vuḍḍhassa mahallakassa daharā māṇavikā pajāpatī ahosi gabbhinī upavijaññā.

Meaning observed; celebrated; kept
Root Family upa √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √vas > vus + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change a > u (sk ṛ)
st > tth
Sanskrit upa + uṣita
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

Example

iminā'pi aṅgena arahataṃ anukaromi uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati

AN 3.71 uposathasuttaṃ
upavuttha 2

pp. dwelt in or at, observed [upa + √vas] ✗
upavutthuposatha

adj. who has observed the uposatha day ✗
upavhayati

pr. (+acc) invokes; calls the name [upa + √vhe + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning invokes; calls the name
Root Family upa √vhe
Root √vhe･1 a (call, name)
Base √vhe + a > vhaya
Construction upa + vhaya + ti
Sanskrit upahvayati
Sanskrit Root √hve √hū 1 (call)

Example

saccena danto damasā upeto,
vedantagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
yaññ'opanīto tam'upavhayetha,
kālena so juhati dakkhiṇeyye'ti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ
upavhayanta

prp. calling the name; invoking the name [upa + √vhe] ✗
upavhayeyya

opt. (+acc) should invoke; should call the name [upa + √vhe + a + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of upavhayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning should invoke; should call the name
Root Family upa √vhe
Root √vhe･1 a (call, name)
Base √vhe + a > vhaya
Construction upa + vhaya + eyya
Sanskrit upahve
Sanskrit Root √hve √hū 1 (call)

Example

saccena danto damasā upeto,
vedantagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
yaññ'opanīto tam'upavhayetha,
kālena so juhati dakkhiṇeyye'ti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ
upasagga 1

masc. (+abl) danger (from); trouble (from); misfortune (from) [upa + √sajj + a] ✓

Grammar masc (+abl)
Meaning danger (from); trouble (from); misfortune (from)
Root Family upa √sajj
Root √sajj･1 a (relinquish, let loose)
√ In Comps ssajj
Construction upa + √sajj > sagg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change jj > gg
Synonym anaya
Variant upassagga
Sanskrit upasarga
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)

Examples

rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.

DHP 139 daṇḍavaggo

kiṃsu tassa mahabbhayan'ti kiṃ lokassa bhayaṃ mahabbhayaṃ pīḷanaṃ ghaṭṭanaṃ upaddavo upasaggo'ti, kiṃsu tassa mahabbhayaṃ.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa

Root Family upa √sajj
Root √sajj･1 a (relinquish, let loose)
√ In Comps ssajj

Derivative kita (a)

Examples

pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, pahāro, parābhavo, nihāro, nīhāro, uhāro, duhāro, saṃhāro, vihāro, avahāro, anuhāro, parihāro, adhihāro, abhihāro, patihāro, suhāro, āhāro, atihāro, apihāro, apahāro, upahāro, evaṃ vīsati upasaggehi ca.

kaccāyana nāmakappa 221

319, 330. upasagganipātapubbako abyayībhāvo.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 319
upasagga 3

masc. relinquishment [upa + √sajj] ✗
upasaggapada

nt. (gram) preposition; prefix; prepositional part of speech [upasagga + pada] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (gram) preposition; prefix; prepositional part of speech
Construction upasagga + pada
Compound kammadhāraya (upasagga + pada)
Sanskrit upasarga + pada

Example

yaṃ pan'etaṃ, evaṃ me sutan'tiādikaṃ nidānaṃ, tattha evan'ti nipātapadaṃ. me'tiādīni nāmapadāni. sāvatthiyaṃ viharatī'ti ettha vī'ti upasaggapadaṃ, haratī'ti ākhyātapadan'ti iminā tāva nayena padavibhāgo veditabbo.

SNa 1.1 oghataraṇasuttavaṇṇanā
upasaṅkanta

pp. approached; drew near; come to [upa + saṃ + √kam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upasaṅkamati
Meaning approached; drew near; come to
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa + saṃ + √kam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
m > n
Antonym anupasaṅkanta
Sanskrit upasaṃkram
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

imāni, bhante, asīti gāmikasahassāni idha-upasaṅkantāni bhagavantaṃ dassanāya. sādhu mayaṃ, bhante, labheyyāma bhagavantaṃ dassanāyā'ti.

VIN 4.5.147 soṇakoḷivisa vatthu
upasaṅkamatāyasmā

sandhi. may the venerable approach!; reverend go to! [upasaṅkamatu + āyasmā] ✓

Meaning may the venerable approach!; reverend go to!
Construction upasaṅkamatu + āyasmā
Sanskrit upasaṅkramatu + āyuṣmān

Example

upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
upasaṅkamati

pr. (+acc) approaches; goes (to); visits; lit. goes near [upa + saṃ + √kam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning approaches; goes (to); visits; lit. goes near
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + a > kama
Construction upa + saṃ + kama + ti
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Synonym āyāti, upayāti
Sanskrit upasaṃkrāmati
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

sace bhavaṃ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.

DN 4.2 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme. tena kho pana samayena aññataro navo bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamati.

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ
upasaṅkamana

nt. (+gen) approaching; visiting; lit. going near [upa + saṃ + √kam + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upasaṅkamati (+gen)
Meaning approaching; visiting; lit. going near
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa + saṃ + √kam + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Sanskrit upasaṃkramaṇa
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

dassanam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi, savanam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi, upasaṅkamanam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ
upasaṅkamanta

prp. (+acc) approaching; going (to); lit. going near [upa + saṃ + √kam + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of upasaṅkamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning approaching; going (to); lit. going near
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + a > kama
Construction upa + saṃ + kama + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Sanskrit upasaṃkramat
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

disvāna yen'āyasmā revato ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ revataṃ etadavoca, upasaṅkamantā kho amū, āvuso revata, sappurisā yen'āyasmā sāriputto tena dhammassavanāya.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ

ayañ'hi so udapāno mayi upasaṅkamante sabbaṃ taṃ tiṇañ'ca bhusañ'ca mukhato ovamitvā acchassa udakassa anāvilassa vippasannassa yāva mukhato pūrito vissandanto maññe ṭhito'ti!

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ
upasaṅkami

aor. (+acc) approached; drew near; went (to); lit. went near [upa + saṃ + √kam + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upasaṅkamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning approached; drew near; went (to); lit. went near

Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam

Synonym upāgami
Variant upasaṃkami
Sanskrit upasaṃkram
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

atha kho āyasmā ānando pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya yena aññataro bhikkhun'upassayo ten'upasaṅkami

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

UD 70 utenasuttaṃ
upasaṅkamitabba

ptp. (+instr) should be approached (by); could be visited (by); lit. to be gone near [upa + saṃ + √kam + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of upasaṅkamati (+instr)
Meaning should be approached (by); could be visited (by); lit. to be gone near
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa + saṃ + √kam + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Sanskrit upasaṃkramitavya
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, icchām'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, aḍḍhamāsaṃ paṭisallīyituṃ. n'āmhi kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakenā'ti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ bhikkhū evam'āhaṃsu, m'āyasmā ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamī'ti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno evam'āha, ime hi nāma therā bhikkhū kulāni upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññissanti, kim'aṅgaṃ pan'āhan'ti?

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ
upasaṅkamitar 1

masc. visitor; guest; lit. approacher [upa + saṃ + √kam + itar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from upasaṅkamati
Meaning visitor; guest; lit. approacher
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa + saṃ + √kam + itar
Derivative kita (itar)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Synonym āgata, āgantar, pāhuna, pāhunaka
Sanskrit upasaṃkramitṛ
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
upasaṅkamitar 2

masc. who approaches; who comes to see; lit. approacher [upa + saṃ + √kam + itar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from upasaṅkamati
Meaning who approaches; who comes to see; lit. approacher
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa + saṃ + √kam + itar
Derivative kita (itar)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Sanskrit upasaṃkramitṛ
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

saddho ca, puṇṇiya, bhikkhu hoti, no ca upasaṅkamitā, n'eva tāva tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā paṭibhāti. yato ca kho, puṇṇiya, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti upasaṅkamitā ca, evaṃ tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā paṭibhāti.

AN 10.83 puṇṇiyasuttaṃ

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, anekasataṃ khattiyaparisaṃ upasaṅkamitā. tatra'pi mayā sannisinnapubbañ'c'eva, sallapitapubbañ'ca, sākacchā ca samāpajjitapubbā.

DN 5.2 kūṭadantasuttaṃ

na kho, bhikkhu, sukaro so bhagavā amhehi upasaṅkamituṃ, aññāhi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi parivuto.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
upasaṅkamitvā

Meaning having approached; having gone (to); having drawn near (to)

Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa + saṃ + √kam + itvā
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Antonym anupasaṅkamitvā
Variant upasaṃkamitvā
Commentary (VIN 2.5.3.3) upasaṅkamitvā'ti tattha gantvā.

Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

upasaṅkamitvā kummaṃ kacchapaṃ paccupaṭṭhito ahosi, yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
upasaṅkamma

y > m

TH 227 sopākattheragāthā

eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ,
app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ'v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ,
kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma,
kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti

SN 1.30 eṇijaṅghasuttaṃ
upasaṅkheyya

ptp. calculable; fathomable; comprehensible; definable; lit. to be calculated [upa + saṃ + √khā + eyya] ✓

Meaning calculable; fathomable; comprehensible; definable; lit. to be calculated

Antonym nupasaṅkheyya
Sanskrit upasaṃkhyeya
Sanskrit Root √khyā 2 (see)

Example

pubbam'antam'anissito,

tassa n'atthi purakkhataṃ.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

Commentary (DNa) pād'ūpasaṅgayhā'ti pāde upasaṅgayha pādadhovana-pādamakkhan'ānuppadānena pūjetvā c'eva vanditvā ca.
