VIN 2.5.1.4 padasodhammasikkhāpadaṃ
upasaṭṭha

adj. troubled, afflicted, visited by troubles; trouble, affliction [upa + √sajj] ✗
upasanta 1

pp. calmed; cooled; composed; still; calm; at peace; tranquil [upa + √sam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upasammati
Meaning calmed; cooled; composed; still; calm; at peace; tranquil
Root Family upa √sam
Root √sam･3 ya (be calm, tired)
Construction upa + √sam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym anupasanta
Synonym vippasanna, santa, samita
Commentary (MNa) upasantā'ti nibbutā.
Sanskrit upaśānta
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)

Examples

santakāyo santavāco,
santavā susamāhito,
vantalok'āmiso bhikkhu,
upasanto'ti vuccati.

DHP 378 bhikkhuvaggo

upasanto uparato,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
dhunāti pāpake dhamme,
dumapattaṃ'va māluto'ti.

TH 2 mahākoṭṭhikattheragāthā
upasanta 2

masc. name of Vessabhū Buddha's attendant; lit. calmed [upa + √sam] ✗
upasantacitta

adj. with a calm mind; with a peaceful heart [upasanta + citta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a calm mind; with a peaceful heart
Construction upasanta + citta
upasantapadissa

adj. of calm appearance, looking at peace ✗
upasantasantacitta

adj. at peace with a calm mind; tranquil with a peaceful heart [upasanta + santacitta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning at peace with a calm mind; tranquil with a peaceful heart
Construction upasanta + santacitta
Compound dvanda (upasanta ca santacitta ca)
Commentary (UDa) tattha upasantasantacittassā'ti upasantam'eva hutvā santaṃ cittaṃ etassā'ti upasantasantacitto. samāpattiyā vikkhambhanena hi upasantakilesattā upasantacittaṃ na sabbathā upasantasantan'ti vuccati tassa upasamassa anaccantikabhāvato, na tathā aggam'aggena. tena pana accantam'eva kilesānaṃ samucchinnattā arahato cittaṃ puna kilesānaṃ anupasametabbatāya samathavipassanāheṭṭhimamaggehi upasantakilesaṃ hutvā accantasantabhāvato'va upasantasantan'ti vuccati. tena vuttaṃ, upasantam'eva hutvā santaṃ cittaṃ etassā'ti upasantasantacitto'ti.
Sanskrit upaśānta + śānta + citta

Example

upasantasantacittassa,
netticchinnassa bhikkhuno,
vikkhīṇo jātisaṃsāro,
mutto so mārabandhanā'ti.

UD 40 sāriputtaupasamasuttaṃ
upasantupasanta

adj. calmest of the calm [upasanta + upasanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning calmest of the calm
Construction upasanta + upasanta
Commentary (ANa) upasant'upasanto'ti upasanto viya upasanto.
upasantūpasanta

adj. extremely calm; very peaceful [upasanta + upasanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning extremely calm; very peaceful
Construction upasanta + upasanta
Compound kammadhāraya (upasanta + upasanta)
Sanskrit upaśānta + upaśānta

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu tāva'd'eva soratasorato hoti nivātanivāto hoti upasant'ūpasanto hoti yāva na amanāpā vacanapathā phusanti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
upasama

masc. (+gen) calmness (of); tranquillisation (of); stillness (of); peace (of) [upa + √sam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, from upasammati (+gen)
Meaning calmness (of); tranquillisation (of); stillness (of); peace (of)
Root Family upa √sam
Root √sam･3 ya (be calm, tired)
Construction upa + √sam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym asārambha
Commentary (SNa) upasamena ... rāg'ādiupasamena (SNt) upasamenā'ti rāg'ādīnaṃ sabbaso vūpasamena.
Sanskrit upaśama
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)

Examples

tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena upasam'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo upasamo yadidaṃ, rāgadosamohānaṃ upasamo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upasamagāmī

adj. leading to peace; conducive to calm [upasama + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to peace; conducive to calm
Construction upasama + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upasamaṃ + gāmī)
upasamati

pr. becomes calm or quiet; ceases; is allayed, is extinguished [upa + √sam] ✗
upasamaddhiṭṭhāna 1

adj. fixing the mind on tranquility; resolving for calmness ✗
upasamaddhiṭṭhāna 2

nt. fixing the mind on tranquility; resolution for calmness ✗
upasamana

nt. calmness; appeasement; appeasing [upa + √sam] ✗
upasamamāna

prp. being calm; being cool; being settled [upa + √sam + ya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of upasamati, intrans
Meaning being calm; being cool; being settled
Root Family upa √sam
Root √sam･3 ya (be calm, tired)
Base √sam + ya > samma > sama (irreg)
Construction upa + sama + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit upaśamyamāna
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)
upasamasaṃvattanika

adj. leading to mental peace; conducive to tranquillity [upasama + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to mental peace; conducive to tranquillity
Construction upasama + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (upasamāya + saṃvattanika)
Antonym anupasamasaṃvattanika
Sanskrit upaśama + saṃvartanīya

Example

evañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti yathā taṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye suppavedite niyyānike upasamasaṃvattanike sammāsambuddhappavedite.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
upasamasukha

nt. pleasure of peace; happiness of tranquillity [upasama + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning pleasure of peace; happiness of tranquillity
Construction upasama + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upasamassa + sukha)
Commentary (MNa) upasamasukhan'ti rāg'ādivūpasamatthāya sukhaṃ.
Sanskrit upaśama + sukha

Examples

idaṃ vuccati nekkhammasukhaṃ pavivekasukhaṃ upasamasukhaṃ sambodhisukhaṃ. āsevitabbaṃ, bhāvetabbaṃ, bahulīkātabbaṃ, na bhāyitabbaṃ etassa sukhassā'ti, vadāmi.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yo kho, nāgita, na'y'imassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī ... so taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyyā'ti.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
upasamātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 10 (THI10) ✗
upasamādhiṭṭhāna

adj. having calmness as a basis; with tranquillity as foundation; established in peace [upasama + adhiṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having calmness as a basis; with tranquillity as foundation; established in peace
Construction upasama + adhiṭṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (upasama + adhiṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit upaśama + adhiṣṭhāna

Examples

catur'ādhiṭṭhāno ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? paññ'ādhiṭṭhāno, sacc'ādhiṭṭhāno, cāg'ādhiṭṭhāno, upasam'ādhiṭṭhāno.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena upasam'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo upasamo yadidaṃ, rāgadosamohānaṃ upasamo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upasamānussati

fem. recollection of peace [upasama + anussati] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning recollection of peace
Construction upasama + anussati
Commentary (ANa) upasamaṃ ārabbha uppannā anussati upasam'ānussati, sabbadukkh'ūpasam'ārammaṇāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. duvidho vā upasamo accant'ūpasamo ca khay'ūpasamo ca. tattha accant'ūpasamo nāma nibbānaṃ, khay'ūpasamo nāma maggo. evam'etaṃ duvidham'pi upasamaṃ anussarantassa uppannā sati upasam'ānussatīti ayam'ettha attho.
upasamika

adj. calming; bringing peace; tranquilizing [upa + √sam] ✗
upasamita

pp. appeased, calmed [upa + √sam] ✗
upasameti

pr. (+acc) calms; settles; tranquillises; lit. makes calm; makes peaceful [upa + √sam + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upasammati, trans (+acc)
Meaning calms; settles; tranquillises; lit. makes calm; makes peaceful
Root Family upa √sam
Root √sam･3 *e (be calm, tired)
Base √sam + *e > sāme > same (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + same + ti
Sanskrit upaśamayati
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)

Example

ajjhattam'ev'upasame,
na aññato bhikkhu santim'eseyya,
ajjhattaṃ upasantassa,
n'atthi attāṃ kuto nirattāṃ vā.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
upasamesi

aor. appeased, calmed [upa + √sam] ✗
upasampajja 1

ger. (+acc) reaching; attaining; arriving at [upa + saṃ + √pad + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upasampajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning reaching; attaining; arriving at
Root Family upa saṃ √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + saṃ + √pad + ya
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
dy > jj
Synonym pappuyya
Commentary (MNa) upasampajja vihareyyā'ti paṭilabhitvā vihareyya.
Sanskrit upa + sampad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ pitu sakkassa kamm'ante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharitā.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti. so ca āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati. āsavānaṃ khayā samaṇo hoti.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
upasampajja 2

ger. becoming fully ordained [upa + saṃ + √pad] ✗

ger. undertaking [upa + saṃ + √pad] ✗

pr. attains, enters on, becomes fully ordained [upa + saṃ + √pad] ✗

aor. attained, entered on, became fully ordained [upa + saṃ + √pad] ✗

āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.

THI 46 bhaddākuṇḍalakesātherīgāthā

es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca, labheyyāhaṃ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
upasampadāvagga

masc. Chapter 26 of Pañcakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.251-271 ✗
upasampadāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.34 (AN10.34) ✗

VIN 2.5.2.3 ujjhāpanakasikkhāpadaṃ

aṅgulipatodako nāma aṅguliyā'pi tudanti upasampanno upasampannaṃ has'ādhippāyo kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.2 aṅgulipatodakasikkhāpadaṃ
upasampanna 2

Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction upa + saṃ + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
d > n
Antonym anupasampanna
Commentary (VINa) upasampanno nāma uparibhāvaṃ samāpanno, patto'ti attho. bhikkhubhāvo hi uparibhāvo, tañ'c'esa yathāvuttena kammena samāpannattā, upasampanno'ti vuccati
Sanskrit upasaṃpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

acira-upasampanno kho pan'āyasmā bhāradvājo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto viharanto nacirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkhācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro

pp. possessed with, attained [upa + saṃ + √pad] ✗

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

ahaṃ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi, catunnaṃ vassānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā'ti.

anatthapadasaṃhitā,

samās'antagatānaṃ nāmānam'anto saro kvaci akāro hoti. devānaṃ rājā devarājo, devarājā, devānaṃ sakhā devasakho, devasakhā, pañca ahāni pañc'āhaṃ, satt'āhaṃ, pañcagavaṃ, chatt'upāhanaṃ, upasaradaṃ, visāl'akkho, vimukho.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 337
upasaṃkami

upasaṃyāti

pr. approaches [upa + saṃ + √yā] ✗
upasaṃhaṭa

upasaṃharaṇa

nt. gathering, folding, 2 comparison [upa + saṃ + √har] ✗
upasaṃharati 1

pr. (+acc) compares; likens; lit. brings near together [upa + saṃ + √har + a + ti] ✓

Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

so imam'eva kāyaṃ upasaṃharati, ayam'pi kho kāyo evaṃdhammo evaṃbhāvī evaṃanatīto'ti

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
upasaṃharati 2

pr. (+acc) focuses; concentrates; applies; lit. brings near together [upa + saṃ + √har + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning focuses; concentrates; applies; lit. brings near together
Root Family upa saṃ √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Base √har + a > hara
Construction upa + saṃ + hara + ti
Synonym adhiṭṭhāti
Commentary (ANa) upasaṃharatī'ti ñāṇena ānisaṃsaṃ disvā otāreti.
Sanskrit upasaṃharati
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Examples

so tehi dhammehi cittaṃ paṭivāpeti. so tehi dhammehi cittaṃ paṭivāpetvā amatāya dhātuyā cittaṃ upasaṃharati

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ

upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
upasaṃharati 3

pr. (+acc) brings; causes; arranges; lit. brings near together [upa + saṃ + √har + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning brings; causes; arranges; lit. brings near together
Root Family upa saṃ √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Base √har + a > hara
Construction upa + saṃ + hara + ti
Sanskrit upasaṃharati
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Examples

dasah'ākārehi pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati, jātito'pi, nāmato'pi, gottato'pi, kammato'pi, sippato'pi, ābādhato'pi, liṅgato'pi, kilesato'pi, āpattito'pi, akkosato'pi.

VIN 2.5.1.3 pesuññasikkhāpadaṃ

bhiṃsāpeyyā'ti upasampanno upasampannaṃ bhiṃsāpetu'kāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati. bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.5 bhiṃsāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
upasaṃharati 4

pr. (+acc) puts together; brings together; lit. brings near together [upa + saṃ + √har + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning puts together; brings together; lit. brings near together
Root Family upa saṃ √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Base √har + a > hara
Construction upa + saṃ + hara + ti
Sanskrit upasaṃharati
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

tam'enaṃ rajako yasmiṃ yasmiṃ raṅgajāte upasaṃhareyya, yadi nīlakāya yadi pītakāya yadi lohitakāya yadi mañjeṭṭhakāya durattavaṇṇam'ev'assa aparisuddhavaṇṇam'ev'assa.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
upasaṃharanta

prp. (+acc) bringing (to); carrying (towards); lit. bringing near together [upa + saṃ + √har + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of upasaṃharati, trans (+acc)
Meaning bringing (to); carrying (towards); lit. bringing near together
Root Family upa saṃ √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Base √har + a > hara
Construction upa + saṃ + hara + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit upasaṃharat
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)
upasaṃhari

aor. collected, focussed, concentrated, compared [upa + saṃ + √har] ✗
upasaṃharitvā

abs. having brought together; having assembled [upa + saṃ + √har] ✗
upasaṃhāra

masc. gathering, folding, 2 comparison [upa + saṃ + √har] ✗
upasaṃhita 1

pp. (+instr) connected (with); concerning; to do (with) [upa + saṃ + √dhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upasaṃdahati (+instr)
Meaning connected (with); concerning; to do (with)
Root Family upa saṃ √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + saṃ + √dhā > (da)h + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change dhā > h
Synonym sannissita, saṃhita
Variant upasañhita
Sanskrit upasaṃhita
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

yathodhi kho pan'assa cattaṃ hoti vantaṃ muttaṃ pahīnaṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, so buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatomhī'ti labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamma-upasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamma-upasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

upasiṅghi

upasumbhati

pr. (+acc) throws near; tosses (to) [upa + √sumbh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning throws near; tosses (to)
Root Family upa √sumbh
Root √sumbh･1 a (throw, strike)
Base √sumbh + a > sumbha
Construction upa + sumbha + ti
Variant upacchubhati, upacchūbhati, upaccumbhati
Commentary (MNa) upasumbheyyā'ti iminā saddhiṃ sambandho veditabbo. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, tam'enaṃ kukkuraṃ upasumbheyya, tassa samīpe khipeyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit upa + śumbhati
Sanskrit Root √śumbh 1 (kill)

Example

tam'enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upasumbheyya.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
upasussati

pr. dries up; withers; shrivels [upa + √sus + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning dries up; withers; shrivels
Root Family upa √sus
Root √sus･3 ya (dry, wither)
Base √sus + ya > sussa
Construction upa + sussa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Synonym milāyati, sussati
Variant upassussati
Sanskrit upaśuṣyati
Sanskrit Root √śuṣ 4 (dry)

Example

appaṭivānī sud'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, padahāmi, kāmaṃ taco ca nahāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

AN 2.5 upaññātasuttaṃ
upasussana

nt. becoming dry [upa + √sus] ✗
upasussi

aor. became dry [upa + √sus] ✗
upasecana 1

adj. (+instr) sprinkled (with); with a sprinkling (of); lit. sprinkling [upa + √sic + *ana] ✓

Grammar adj (+instr)
Meaning sprinkled (with); with a sprinkling (of); lit. sprinkling
Root Family upa √sic
Root √sic･2 ṃa (sprinkle, pour)
Construction upa + √sic > sec + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (DNa) nand'ūpasecanan'ti lobhasahagataṃ sampayuttanandiyā'va upasittaṃ hutvā. itaraṃ upanissayakoṭiyā.
Sanskrit upasecana
Sanskrit Root √sic 6 (pour out)

Example

upayo, bhikkhave, avimutto, anupayo vimutto. rūp'upayaṃ vā, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭheyya, rūp'ārammaṇaṃ rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ nand'ūpasecanaṃ vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 22.53 upayasuttaṃ
upasecana 2

nt. sauce; gravy; topping; lit. sprinkling [upa + √sic + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning sauce; gravy; topping; lit. sprinkling
Root Family upa √sic
Root √sic･2 ṃa (sprinkle, pour)
Construction upa + √sic > sec + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (VINa) sucimaṃs'ūpasecano'ti nānappakāravikatisampāditaṃ sucimaṃs'ūpasecanaṃ missīkaraṇam'assā'ti
Sanskrit upasecana
Sanskrit Root √sic 6 (pour out)

Example

sālīnaṃ odano bhutto,
sucimaṃs'ūpasecano,
tasmā dhamme na vattāmi,
dhammo ariyebhi vaṇṇito.

upasevati

pr. (+acc) associates (with); keeps company (with) [upa + √sev + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning associates (with); keeps company (with)
Root Family upa √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction upa + seva + ti
Antonym nupasevati
Synonym bhajati, sevati
Sanskrit upasevate
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Examples

akaronto'pi ce pāpaṃ,
karontam'upasevati,
saṅkiyo hoti pāpasmiṃ,
avaṇṇo c'assa rūhati.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ

yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ,
yādisaṃ ca-upasevati,
sa ve t'ādisako hoti,
sahavāso hi t'ādiso.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
upasevanā 1

fem. (+gen) keeping company (with); associating (with); beings friends (with) [upa + √sev + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from upasevati (+gen)
Meaning keeping company (with); associating (with); beings friends (with)
Root Family upa √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Construction upa + √sev + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Sanskrit upasevana
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

Example

pūtimacchaṃ kus'aggena,
yo naro upanayhati,
kusā'pi pūti vāyanti,
evaṃ bālā-upasevanā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
upasevanā 2

Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)

Sanskrit upasevana

upasevita

nindaṃ tatīyaṃ nirayaṃ catutthaṃ.

upassaṭṭhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.52 (SN35.52) ✗
upassaya 1

masc. dwelling; shelter; home; lit. dependence [upa + √si + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upassayati
Meaning dwelling; shelter; home; lit. dependence
Root Family upa √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + √si > say + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Synonym attha, āsaya, passaya
Variant upāsaya
Commentary (SNa) upassayan'ti vās'āgāraṃ. upāsayan'ti'pi pāṭho.
Sanskrit upāśraya
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Examples

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

so ca sabbadado hoti,
yo dadāti upassayaṃ,
amataṃ dado ca so hoti,
yo dhammam'anusāsatī'ti.

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.113 (SN35.113) ✗
upassutiṃ

ind. eavesdropping; snooping; listening in [upa + √su + ti + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of upassuti
Meaning eavesdropping; snooping; listening in
Root Family upa √su
Root √su･4 ṇā (hear)
√ In Comps ssu
Construction upa + √su + ti + iṃ
upassuti + iṃ
Commentary (VIN 2.5.8.8) upassutiṃ tiṭṭheyyā'ti imesaṃ sutvā codessāmi sāressāmi paṭicodessāmi paṭisāressāmi maṅkū karissāmī'ti (VINa) upassutin'ti sutisamīpaṃ, yattha ṭhatvā sakkā hoti tesaṃ vacanaṃ sotuṃ, tatthā'ti attho.
Sanskrit upaśruti
Sanskrit Root √śru 5 (hear)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivād'āpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭheyya, yaṃ ime bhaṇissanti, taṃ sossāmī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

upahacca 1

ger. (+acc) reducing; cutting short; lit. damaging [upa + √han + tya] ✓

Grammar ger of upahanati, trans (+acc)
Meaning reducing; cutting short; lit. damaging
Root Family upa √han
Root √han･1 a (strike, kill)
Construction upa + √han + tya
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Antonym anupahacca
Sanskrit upahantya
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)

Example

taṃ vā pana anabhisambhavaṃ appaṭivijjhaṃ pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
upahacca 2

ger. (+acc) touching, injuring, or spoiling [upa + √han] ✗
upahaccaparinibbāyī

adj. who is extinguished having cut short (the next life) [upahacca + parinibbāyī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is extinguished having cut short (the next life)
Construction upahacca + parinibbāyī
Compound kammadhāraya (upahacca + parinibbāyī)
Commentary (ANa) yo pana kappasahassāyukesu avihesu nibbattitvā pañcamaṃ kappasataṃ atikkamitvā arahattaṃ patto, ayaṃ upahaccaparinibbāyī nāma.
Sanskrit upahantya + parinirvāyin

Examples

no ce pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti, atha pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

taṃ vā pana anabhisambhavaṃ appaṭivijjhaṃ pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
upahaññati 1

pr. (+abl) is afflicted; is disturbed; is distressed (by) [upa + √han + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of upahanati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning is afflicted; is disturbed; is distressed (by)
Root Family upa √han
Root √han･1 ya (strike, kill)
Base √han + ya > hañña (pass)
Construction upa + hañña + ti
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Variant ūhaññati
Sanskrit upahanyate
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)

Examples

tassa vaḍḍhanti vedanā,
anekā rūpasambhavā,
abhijjhā ca vihesā ca,
cittam'assa-upahaññati,
evaṃ ācinato dukkhaṃ,
ārā nibbānam'uccati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

Sanskrit upahanyate

upahaññi

aor. spoilt or injured [upa + √han] ✗
upahata 1

sace n'eresi attānaṃ,
kaṃso upahato yathā,
esa patto'si nibbānaṃ,
sārambho te na vijjati.

DHP 134 daṇḍavaggo

dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati

AN 2.135 āyācanavaggo
upahata 2

pp. upset; disturbed [upa + √han + ta] ~

upahatatta

nt. (+instr) fact of being spoiled (by); fact of being ruined (by) [upa + √han + ta + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from upahata (+instr)
Meaning fact of being spoiled (by); fact of being ruined (by)

Root √han･1 a (strike, kill)

upahata + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change nt > t
Sanskrit upahata +
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)
upahatapubba

adj. harmed before; hurt before [upahata + pubba] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning harmed before; hurt before
Construction upahata + pubba
upahatindriya

adj. with impaired judgement; with diminished faculties; of unsound mind; mentally unbalanced; lit. broken faculty [upahata + indriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with impaired judgement; with diminished faculties; of unsound mind; mentally unbalanced; lit. broken faculty
Construction upahata + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (upahata + indriya)
Commentary (MNa) upahat'indriyā'ti upahatapaññ'indriyā. te yathā so upahatakāy'indriyo kuṭṭhī dukkhasamphassasmiṃy'eva aggismiṃ sukham'iti viparītasaññaṃ paccalattha, evaṃ paññ'indriyassa upahatattā dukkhasamphassesv'eva kāmesu sukham'iti viparītasaññaṃ paccalatthuṃ.
Sanskrit upahata + indriya

Example

asu ca, bho gotama, kuṭṭhī puriso arugatto pakkagatto kimīhi khajjamāno nakhehi vaṇamukhāni vippatacchamāno upahat'indriyo dukkhasamphasse'y'eva aggismiṃ sukham'iti viparītasaññaṃ paccalatthā'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
upahattar

masc. who brings or conveys [upa + √har] ✗
upahanati

pr. injures, destroys [upa + √han] ✗
upahani

aor. injured, destroyed [upa + √han] ✗
upahanti

pr. hits, comes into contact with, reaches; hurts, damages, impairs [upa + √han] ✗
upahantvā

abs. having hurt; having harmed; having injured [upa + √han + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of upahanati, intrans
Meaning having hurt; having harmed; having injured
Root Family upa √han
Root √han･1 ya (strike, kill)
Construction upa + √han + tvā
Synonym upahantvāna
Sanskrit upahantvā
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)
upahantvāna

abs. having hurt; having harmed; having injured [upa + √han + tvāna] ~

Grammar abs of upahanati, intrans
Meaning having hurt; having harmed; having injured
Root Family upa √han
Root √han･1 ya (strike, kill)
Construction upa + √han + tvāna
Synonym upahantvā
Sanskrit upahantvā
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)
upaharati

pr. brings, brings near; offers, presents [upa + √har] ✗
upaharitar

masc. who presents; offerer [upa + √har + itar] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from upaharati
Meaning who presents; offerer
Root Family upa √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction upa + √har + itar
Derivative kita (itar)
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)
upahāra 1

masc. (+gen) giving (of); provision (of); supply (of); adding (of); lit. bringing near [upa + √har + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from upaharati (+gen)
Meaning giving (of); provision (of); supply (of); adding (of); lit. bringing near
Root Family upa √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction upa + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anupahāra
Synonym nicaya
Sanskrit upahāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)
upahāra 2

masc. offering; service; attendance; lit. bringing near [upa + √har + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upaharati
Meaning offering; service; attendance; lit. bringing near
Root Family upa √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction upa + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anupahāra
Synonym nicaya
Commentary (ANa) santaṃ'y'eva upahāraṃ upaharissāmā'ti kāyacitt'ūpahāraṃ santaṃ nibbutaṃ paṇītaṃ'y'eva upaharissāma.
Sanskrit upahāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

sant'indriyānañ'hi vo, sāriputta, santamānasānaṃ santaṃ'y'eva kāyakammaṃ bhavissati santaṃ vacīkammaṃ santaṃ manokammaṃ. santaṃ'y'eva upahāraṃ upaharissāma sabrahmacārīsū'ti. evañ'hi vo, sāriputta, sikkhitabbaṃ.

AN 2.10 vassūpanāyikasuttaṃ
upahāraka

masc. giver; bringer; provider; lit. who brings near [upa + √har + *aka] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from upaharati
Meaning giver; bringer; provider; lit. who brings near
Root Family upa √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction upa + √har > hār + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym anuppadātar
Sanskrit upahāraka
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)
upahiṃsati

pr. troubles; hurts; injures [upa + √his] ✗
upaḷāsitvā

abs. having made sound; having played [upa + √las] ✗
upaḷāsetvā

abs. having made sound; having played [upa + √las] ✗
upāgacchi

aor. (+acc) approached; entered [upa + √gam] ✗
upāgata

pp. reached; attained; entered into a state; reached a condition [upa + ā + √gam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upāgacchati
Meaning reached; attained; entered into a state; reached a condition
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + ā + √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Synonym ajjhāpanna, patta, phusita, samāpanna
Sanskrit upāgata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

na yuttaṃ socituṃ putta,
hāsakāle upaṭṭhite,
tayā me saraṇaṃ putta,
nibbānaṃ tam'upāgataṃ.

API 17 mahāpajāpatigotamītherīapadānaṃ
upāgami

aor. (+acc) went (to); came (to); approached; arrived (at) [upa + ā + √gam + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upāgacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning went (to); came (to); approached; arrived (at)
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + ā + √gam + i
Synonym agamāsi, āgañchi, āgamāsi, upasaṅkami, upasaṃkami
Sanskrit upāgam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

ev'āhaṃ cintayitvāna,
n'ekakoṭisataṃ dhanaṃ,
nāth'ānāthānaṃ datvāna,
himavantam'upāgamiṃ.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā

ubbiggā tasitā bhītā,
bhantā byāthitamānasā,
mahājanā samāgamma,
dīpaṅkaram'upāgamuṃ.

BV 2.170 sumedha patthanā kathā
upāgamma

ind. approaching; having entered upon; beings subject to ✗
upāgā

imperf. approached; arrived at; (also upāgā) [upa + √gam] ✗
upāgāmi

aor. approached, came [upa + √gam] ✗
upāti

ind. in reference to Upātidhāvantisutta; Udāna 59 (UD 59) [upa + ati] ~

Grammar ind
Meaning in reference to Upātidhāvantisutta; Udāna 59 (UD 59)
Construction upa + ati
upātidhāvati

pr. runs beyond, rushes over [upa + ati + √dhāv] ✗
upātidhāvantisutta

nt. Udāna 59 (UD 59) ✗
upātipanna

pp. fallen into the power of, prey to (+locative.) [upa + ati + √pad] ✗
upātivatta

pp. (+acc) gone beyond; passed beyond; transcended [upa + ati + √vatt + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upātivattati (+acc)
Meaning gone beyond; passed beyond; transcended
Root Family upa ati √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Construction upa + ati + √vatt + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym atigata
Sanskrit upa + ativṛtta
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Examples

samitāvi pahāya puññapāpaṃ,
virajo ñatvā imaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ,
jātimaraṇaṃ upātivatto,
samaṇo tādi pavuccate tath'attā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

na brāhmaṇassa paraneyyam'atthi,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā vivādāni upātivatto,
na hi seṭṭhato passati dhammam'aññaṃ.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
upātivattati 1

pr. (+acc) goes beyond; oversteps; transgresses [upa + ati + √vatt + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning goes beyond; oversteps; transgresses
Root Family upa ati √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Base √vatt + a > vatta
Construction upa + ati + vatta + ti
Synonym atikkamati
Sanskrit upa + ativṛt
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Examples

sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattissasi, seyyathā'pi nāma puriso siriṃ āgacchantiṃ daṇḍena paṭippaṇāmeyya ... evaṃ sampadam'idaṃ, bhikkhu, tuyhaṃ bhavissati.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattissasi, seyyathā'pi nāma puriso siriṃ āgacchantiṃ daṇḍena paṭippaṇāmeyya ... evaṃ sampadam'idaṃ, bhikkhu, tuyhaṃ bhavissati.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upātivattati 2

pr. (+acc) goes beyond; escapes; gets out (of) [upa + ati + √vatt + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning goes beyond; escapes; gets out (of)
Root Family upa ati √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Base √vatt + a > vatta
Construction upa + ati + vatta + ti
Synonym ativattati, uttarati, nibbeṭheti
Sanskrit upa + ativṛt
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

na maṃ tvaṃ, pāpima, hit'ānukampī evaṃ vadesi, ahit'ānukampī maṃ tvaṃ, pāpima, evaṃ vadesi. tuyhañ'hi, pāpima, evaṃ hoti, yesaṃ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ desessati, te me visayaṃ upātivattissantī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upātivatti

aor. (+acc) went beyond; overstepped; transgressed [upa + ati + √vatt + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upātivattati, trans (+acc)
Meaning went beyond; overstepped; transgressed
Root Family upa ati √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Construction upa + ati + √vatt + i
Sanskrit upa + ativṛt
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

Example

taṃ t'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ vadāmi, iṅgha tvaṃ, mārisa, yadeva te brahmā āha tadeva tvaṃ karohi, mā tvaṃ brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattittho.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upādahati

pr. places upon; lays upon, imposes [upa + √dhā] ✗
upādaheti

pr. places upon; lays upon, imposes [upa + √dhā] ✗
upādā 1

ger. (+acc) holding (on); grasping (on); attaching; clinging; taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ~

Grammar ger of upādiyati, irreg form of upādāya, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning holding (on); grasping (on); attaching; clinging; taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya > upādā
Phonetic Change ādāya > ādā (contraction)
Antonym anupādā
Synonym ajjhosa, ajjhosāya, abhinivissa, uggayha
Variant upādāya
Commentary (SNa) upādāparitassanan'ti gahaṇena uppannaṃ paritassanaṃ.
Sanskrit upādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
upādā 2

ind. secondary; derivative; accessory; lit. taking up [upa + √ādā + ya] ~

Grammar ind, adv, abbrev of upādāya
Meaning secondary; derivative; accessory; lit. taking up
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya > upādā
Phonetic Change ādāya > ādā (contraction)
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
upādāna 1

nt. fuel (for fire); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from upādiyati
Meaning fuel (for fire); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym anupādāna
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

laddhā hi so upādānaṃ,
mahā hutvāna pāvako,
so āsajja ḍahe bālaṃ,
naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye acci vātena khittā dūram'pi gacchati, tam'ahaṃ vāta-upādānaṃ paññāpemi. vāto hi'ssa, vaccha, tasmiṃ samaye upādānaṃ hotī'ti.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
upādāna 2

nt. acquiring; appropriating; taking possession; grasping; clinging; identifying; lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upādiyati
Meaning acquiring; appropriating; taking possession; grasping; clinging; identifying; lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym anupādāna
Commentary (SNa) upādānan'ti daḷhaggahaṇaṃ vuccati. daḷh'attho hi ettha upasaddo upāyāsaupakaṭṭh'ādīsu viya. pañcakāmaguṇikarāgass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. ayam'ettha saṅkhepo.
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

pañcasu kho, nāgita, upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassino viharato upādāne pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando'ti.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ

upādāniye ca, bhikkhave, dhamme desessāmi upādānañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katame ca, bhikkhave, upādāniyā dhammā, katamaṃ upādānaṃ?

SN 22.121 upādāniyasuttaṃ
upādāna 3

adj. related to fuel; lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ana] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, from upādiyati
Meaning related to fuel; lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
upādānakkhandha

masc. pile of fuel (for the fire); heap of acquisition; physical and mental conglomerations that are clung to; pile of matter and mind that are held onto as a self; grasping group; lit. mass of taking near [upādāna + khandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pile of fuel (for the fire); heap of acquisition; physical and mental conglomerations that are clung to; pile of matter and mind that are held onto as a self; grasping group; lit. mass of taking near
Construction upādāna + khandha
Compound kammadhāraya (upādāna + khandha)
Commentary (KPa) tattha pañcā'ti gaṇanaparicchedo. upādānajanitā upādānajanakā vā khandhā upādānakkhandhā. yaṃkiñci rūpaṃ, vedanā, saññā, saṅkhārā, viññāṇañ'ca sāsavā upādāniyā, etesam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit upādāna + skandha

Examples

so evaṃ pajānāti, evañ'hi kira imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ saṅgaho sannipāto samavāyo hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

pañcasu kho pana upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassī viharati, iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅ'gamo. iti vedanā, iti vedanāya samudayo, iti vedanāya atthaṅ'gamo.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
upādānakkhandhasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.179 (SN45.179) ✗
upādānakkhandhasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.66 (AN9.66) ✗
upādānakkhaya

masc. wearing away of grasping; ending of clinging; extinction of attachment; lit. exhaustion of taking near [upādāna + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of grasping; ending of clinging; extinction of attachment; lit. exhaustion of taking near
Construction upādāna + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upādānassa + khaya)
Sanskrit upādāna + kṣaya

Examples

tasmā upādānakkhayā,
samma'd'aññāya paṇḍitā,
jātikkhayaṃ abhiññāya,
na gacchanti punabbhavan'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti, nekkhamm'ādhimutto hoti, pavivek'ādhimutto hoti, abyāpajj'ādhimutto hoti, taṇhākkhay'ādhimutto hoti, upādānakkhay'ādhimutto hoti, asammoh'ādhimutto hoti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
upādānakkhayādhimutta

adj. habituated to the destruction of ownership; established in the destruction of possession; firmly entrenched in extinction of attachment [upādānakkhaya + adhimutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning habituated to the destruction of ownership; established in the destruction of possession; firmly entrenched in extinction of attachment
Construction upādānakkhaya + adhimutta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upādānakkhayaṃ + adhimutta)
Commentary (ANa) upādānakkhayante uppannattā upādānakkhayo
Sanskrit upādāna + kṣaya + adhimukta

Example

so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti, nekkhamm'ādhimutto hoti, pavivek'ādhimutto hoti, abyāpajj'ādhimutto hoti, taṇhākkhay'ādhimutto hoti, upādānakkhay'ādhimutto hoti, asammoh'ādhimutto hoti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
upādānakkhayārāma

adj. talking pleasure in the wearing away of grasping; enjoying the ending of clinging [upādānakkhaya + ārāma] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning talking pleasure in the wearing away of grasping; enjoying the ending of clinging
Construction upādānakkhaya + ārāma
Commentary (SNa) upādānakkhay'ārāman'ti upādānakkhayasaṅkhāte nibbāne rataṃ.
upādānagata

nt. type of acquisition; kind of appropriation; identification of a sort; lit. taking near gone [upādāna + gata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning type of acquisition; kind of appropriation; identification of a sort; lit. taking near gone
Construction upādāna + gata

Sanskrit upādāna + gata

Example

hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā'ti kho, bhikkhu, taṇhāgatam'etaṃ ... saññāgatam'etaṃ ... maññitam'etaṃ ... papañcitam'etaṃ ... upādānagatam'etaṃ ...

AN 7.54 abyākatasuttaṃ
upādānajātika

Meaning born from grasping

Meaning having grasping as origin

upādānanirodha

masc. ending of acquisition; cessation of grasping; lit. end of taking near [upādāna + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of acquisition; cessation of grasping; lit. end of taking near
Construction upādāna + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upādānassa + nirodha)
Commentary (MNa) upādānanirodhā'ti vivaṭṭaṃ dassento āha.
Sanskrit upādāna + nirodha

Examples

vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

tassa me upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti, evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hotī'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
upādānanirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the ending of acquisition; leading to the cessation of identification [upādānanirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of acquisition; leading to the cessation of identification
Construction upādānanirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upādānanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit upādāna + nirodha + gāmin

Example

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako upādānañ'ca pajānāti, upādānasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, upādānanirodhañ'ca pajānāti, upādānanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
upādānapaccayā

ind. dependent on acquisition; due to clinging; lit. from condition of taking near [upādāna + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of upādānapaccaya
Meaning dependent on acquisition; due to clinging; lit. from condition of taking near
Construction upādāna + paccaya + ā
upādānapaccaya + ā
Sanskrit upādāna + pratyayāt

Examples

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti sabbaṃ upādānapaccayā

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upādānapañhāsutta

tayo'me, āvuso, bhavā, kāmabhavo, rūpabhavo, arūpabhavo. upādānasamudayā bhavasamudayo, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo bhavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā

upādānasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.52 (SN12.52) ✗
upādānasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.174 (SN45.174) ✗
upādānaseṭṭha

nt. highest thing to grasp; foremost possession [upādāna + seṭṭha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning highest thing to grasp; foremost possession
Construction upādāna + seṭṭha
upādānārāma

adj. enjoying grasping; taking pleasure in acquisition [upādāna + ārāma] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying grasping; taking pleasure in acquisition
Construction upādāna + ārāma
upādāniya

adj. graspable; which could be clung to; which can be used for fuel; which can be taken possession of; lit. to be taken near [upa + √ādā + aniya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of upādiyati
Meaning graspable; which could be clung to; which can be used for fuel; which can be taken possession of; lit. to be taken near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + aniya
Derivative kicca (aniya)
Commentary (DNa) s'āsavo upādāniyo'ti āsavānañ'c'eva upādānānañ'ca paccayabhūto. iti tebhūmakadhammam'eva niyameti.
Sanskrit upādānīya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, upādāniyo dhammo, yo tattha chandarāgo, taṃ tattha upādānaṃ.

SN 22.121 upādāniyasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, upādāniyesu dhammesu ādīnav'ānupassino viharato taṇhā nirujjhati.

SN 12.55 mahārukkhasuttaṃ
upādāniyadhammasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.123 (SN35.123) ✗
upādāniyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.121 (SN22.121) ✗
upādāniyasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.110 (SN35.110) ✗
upādānūpanisa

adj. with grasping as pre-condition [upādāna + upanisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with grasping as pre-condition
Construction upādāna + upanisa
upādāpaññatti

fem. accessory description, derivative concept) ✗
upādāparitassana

nt. agitation through clinging; anxiety through attachment [upādā + paritassana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning agitation through clinging; anxiety through attachment
Construction upādā + paritassana
Commentary (SNa) upādāparitassanan'ti gahaṇena uppannaṃ paritassanaṃ.
upādāparitassanāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.7 (SN22.7) ✗
upādāya 1

ger. (+acc) taking; taking up; grasping (onto); taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking; taking up; grasping (onto); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Antonym anupādāya
Synonym uggayha, samuggahāya
Variant upādā
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

puṇṇo nāma, āvuso, āyasmā mantāṇiputto amhākaṃ navakānaṃ sataṃ bah'ūpakāro hoti. so amhe iminā ovādena ovadati, upādāya, āvuso ānanda, asmī'ti hoti, no anupādāya.

SN 22.83 ānandasuttaṃ

yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
upādāya 2

ind. (+gen) derived (from); dependent (on); based (on); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of upādiyati, trans (+gen)
Meaning derived (from); dependent (on); based (on); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Antonym anupādāya
Commentary (SNa) upādāyā'ti tāni'y'eva ca upādāya āgamma paṭicca pavattati.
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, nāmarūpaṃ? vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccati nāmaṃ. cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

chasu loko samuppanno,
chasu kubbati santhavaṃ,
channam'eva upādāya,
chasu loko vihaññatī'ti.

SN 1.70 lokasuttaṃ
upādāya 3

ind. (+acc) on account (of); because (of); with reference (to); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning on account (of); because (of); with reference (to); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Synonym adhikicca
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāyā'ti sādh'atthiko mah'aggh'atthiko.
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

na sūpaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā odanena paṭicchādessāmi bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāyā'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 36 odanappaṭicchādanasikkhāpadaṃ
upādāya 4

ind. (+acc) according (to); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning according (to); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Example

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ
upādāya 5

ind. (+acc) compared (to); in comparison (with); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Construction upa + √ādā + ya

Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Example

pāpakaṃ nāma jīvitaṃ aḍḍhānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya daliddānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ lāmakaṃ, sadhanānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya adhanānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ, devānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya manussānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
upādāyarūpa

nt. (+gen) derived materiality (of) [upādāya + rūpa] ✓

Sanskrit upādāya + rūpa

Example

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, nāmarūpaṃ? vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccati nāmaṃ. cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāyarūpaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upādāyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.105 (SN35.105) ✗
upādāyupādāya

ind. continuously; successively; repeatedly; lit. taking up, taking up [upādāya + upādāya] ✓

Grammar ind, comp
Meaning continuously; successively; repeatedly; lit. taking up, taking up
Construction upādāya + upādāya
Synonym aparāparaṃ, abhiṇhaso, abhiṇhaṃ
Sanskrit upādāya + upādāya

Example

te maṃ catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ upādāy'upādāya pañhaṃ puccheyyuṃ, puṭṭho puṭṭho c'āhaṃ tesaṃ byākareyyaṃ, byākatañ'ca me byākatato dhāreyyuṃ, na ca maṃ dutiyakaṃ uttari paṭipuccheyyuṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
upādārūpa

nt. derived matter; accessory form; co-nascent material phenomena; lit. clinging form [upādā + rūpa] ~

Meaning derived matter; accessory form; co-nascent material phenomena; lit. clinging form
Construction upādā + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (upādā + rūpa)
Sanskrit upādāna + rūpa
upādi

masc. what is grasped; fuel of existence; what is taken possession (of); lit. taken near [upa + √ādā + i] ✓

Grammar masc, from upādiyati
Meaning what is grasped; fuel of existence; what is taken possession (of); lit. taken near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + i
Derivative kita (i)
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

evaṃ sammā dvayat'ānupassino kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appamattassa ātāpino pahit'attassa viharato dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, diṭṭh'eva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bahū ce'pi bhikkhū anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyanti, na tena nibbānadhātuyā ūnattaṃ vā pūrattaṃ vā paññāyati

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
upādiṇṇa

pp. clung-to [upa + √ādā] ✗
upādinna 1

pp. grasped; clung to; attached to; taken as mine; taken possession (of); lit. taken near [upa + √ādā + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upādiyati
Meaning grasped; clung to; attached to; taken as mine; taken possession (of); lit. taken near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā > ādī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ā > ī
īn > inn
Antonym anupādinna
Synonym ajjhosanna, ajjhosita
Commentary (MNa) upādinnan'tiādinnaṃ gahitaṃ parāmaṭṭhaṃ, sarīr'aṭṭhakan'ti attho.
Sanskrit upātta
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

so rūpaṃ viññāṇaṃ upeti upādiyati adhiṭṭhāti attā me'ti. tass'ime pañc'upādānakkhandhā upetā upādinnā dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci, rāhula, ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ kakkhaḷaṃ kharigataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ kakkhaḷaṃ kharigataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā pathavīdhātu

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
upādinna 2

pp. (of a legal dispute) taken up; lit. taken near [upa + √ādā + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upādiyati
Meaning (of a legal dispute) taken up; lit. taken near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā > ādī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ā > ī
īn > inn
Antonym anupādinna
Sanskrit upātta
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā aññabhāgiyañ'c'eva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti kocideso lesamatto upādinno, bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 9 aññabhāgiyasikkhāpadaṃ

koci deso lesamatto upādinno'ti tesaṃ dasannaṃ lesānaṃ aññataro leso upādinno hoti.

VIN 1.2.9 dutiyaduṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning grasped; clung to; attached to; taken as mine; taken possession (of); lit. taken near

upādinna + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change ā > ī
īn > inn
Sanskrit upātta +
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
upādinnakasantatipavattiṭṭhāna

nt. place where the continuity that is grasped to occurs [upādinnaka + santati + pavattiṭṭhāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning place where the continuity that is grasped to occurs
Construction upādinnaka + santati + pavattiṭṭhāna
upādiyati

pr. (+acc) grasps; holds (onto); clings (to); takes possession (of); lit. takes near [upa + √ādā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasps; holds (onto); clings (to); takes possession (of); lit. takes near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + ti
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym nikkhipati
Commentary (ANa) na kiñci loke upādiyatī'ti kiñci ekam'pi saṅkhāragataṃ taṇhāvasena na upādiyati na gaṇhāti na parāmasati.
Notes passive in form, active in meaning.
Sanskrit upādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ettāvatā saupavajjo'ti vadāmi. yo kho, sāriputta, tañ'ca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, aññañ'ca kāyaṃ upādiyati, tam'ahaṃ saupavajjo'ti vadāmi.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.

SN 35.234 udāyīsuttaṃ
upādiyanta

prp. (+acc) grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Synonym upādiyamāna
Sanskrit upādāyat
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

anissito na calati,
nissito ca upādiyaṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

taṃ, bhikkhave, attavād'upādānaṃ upādiyetha, yaṃsa attavād'upādānaṃ upādiyato na uppajjeyyuṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
upādiyamāna

prp. (+acc) grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Synonym upādiyanta
Notes passive in form, active in meaning.
Sanskrit upādīyamāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto vihareyyan'ti. upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti.

SN 22.63 upādiyamānasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi rūpaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, vedanaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saññaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saṅkhāreyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, viññāṇaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
upādiyamānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.63 (SN22.63) ✗
upādiyi

aor. (+acc) grasped; held (onto); clung (to); took possession (of); lit. took near [upa + √ādā + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasped; held (onto); clung (to); took possession (of); lit. took near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + i
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit upādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

Examples

bhav'ev'āhaṃ bhayaṃ disvā,
bhavañ'ca vibhav'esinaṃ,
bhavaṃ n'ābhivadiṃ kiñci,
nandiñ'ca na upādiyin'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi rūpaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, vedanaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saññaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saṅkhāreyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, viññāṇaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
upādiyitvā

abs. having grasped hold (of); having clung (to); having taken possession (of) [upa + √ādā] ✗
upādisesa

masc. remnant of grasping; remaining fuel of existence [upādi + sesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning remnant of grasping; remaining fuel of existence
Construction upādi + sesa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upādissa + sesa)
Antonym anupādisesa
Sanskrit upadhiśeṣa

Examples

evaṃ sammā dvayat'ānupassino kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appamattassa ātāpino pahit'attassa viharato dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, diṭṭh'eva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bahū ce'pi bhikkhū anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyanti, na tena nibbānadhātuyā ūnattaṃ vā pūrattaṃ vā paññāyati

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
upādhi

masc. little ✗
upāya 1

masc. means; method; way [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti
Meaning means; method; way
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > āy + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > āy
Synonym upakkama, ñāya, niyāma, patha, pariyāya, magga
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

upāyakusalen'āhaṃ,
buddhen'ādiccabandhunā
yoniso paṭipajjitvā,
bhave cittaṃ udabbahin'ti.

TH 139 nandattheragāthā

evaṃ taṃ puggalaṃ karuṇāyitvā tato paraṃ eten'eva upāyena piyapuggale, tato majjhatte, tato verimhī'ti anukkamena karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
upāya 2

masc. (+loc) attraction (to); interest (in); engagement (with); attachment (to); lit. going near [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti (+loc)
Meaning attraction (to); interest (in); engagement (with); attachment (to); lit. going near
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anupāya
Commentary (MNa) taṇhādiṭṭhiyo hi tebhūmakadhamme upentī'ti upāyā
Sanskrit upāya (approach)
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

viññāṇaṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, abalaṃ virāgunaṃ anassāsikan'ti viditvā ye viññāṇe upāy'ūpādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā vimuttaṃ me cittan'ti pajānāmi.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
upāya 3

masc. bias [upa + √i] ✗
upāyakusala

adj. skilful in ways; adept in methods [upāya + kusala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilful in ways; adept in methods
Construction upāya + kusala
Compound sattamī tappurisa (upāyesu + kusala)
Sanskrit upāyakauśalya

Example

upāyakusalena-ahaṃ,
buddhen'ādiccabandhunā
yoniso paṭipajjitvā,
bhave cittaṃ udabbahin'ti.

TH 139 nandattheragāthā
upāyakosalla

nt. skill in means; skill in expedience ✗
upāyaññū

adj. knowing the means, knowing the way ✗
upāyana

nt. tribute, gift [upa + ā + √i] ✗
upāyāsa

masc. affliction; difficulty; trouble [upa + ā + √yas + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning affliction; difficulty; trouble
Root Family upa ā √yas
Root √yas×3 ya (strive, struggle)
Construction upa + ā + √yas > yās + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anupāyāsa
Synonym aphāsu, āyāsa, vighāta
Sanskrit upāyāsa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √yas 1, 3, 4 (be heated)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā sambhavanti

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
upāyāsabahula

adj. full of difficulty; very afflicted; greatly troubled [upāyāsa + bahula] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of difficulty; very afflicted; greatly troubled
Construction upāyāsa + bahula
Compound kammadhāraya (upāyāsa + bahula)
Sanskrit upāyāsa (bsk) + bahula

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

idha, mallike, ekacco mātugāmo kodhanā hoti upāyāsabahulā. appam'pi vuttā samānā abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
upāyāsita

adj. troubled, irritated [upa + ā + √yas] ✗
upāyāsitatta

nt. affliction; adversity; lit. troubled state [upa + ā + √yas + *ita + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from upāyāsita
Meaning affliction; adversity; lit. troubled state
Root Family upa ā √yas
Root √yas×3 ya (strive, struggle)
Construction upa + ā + √yas > yās + *ita + tta
upāyāsita + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym āyāsitatta
Sanskrit upāyāsa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √yas 1, 3, 4 (be heated)

Example

katamo ca, bhikkhave, upāyāso? yo kho, bhikkhave, aññatar'aññatarena byasanena samannāgatassa aññatar'aññatarena dukkhadhammena phuṭṭhassa āyāso upāyāso āyāsitattaṃ upāyāsitattaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, upāyāso

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
upāyupādāna

nt. involvement and holding on to ✗
upāyupādānābhinivesavinibandha

adj. attached to engaging, grasping and clinging; shackled to going near, grabbing and holding [upāya + upādāna + abhinivesa + vinibandha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attached to engaging, grasping and clinging; shackled to going near, grabbing and holding
Construction upāya + upādāna + abhinivesa + vinibandha
Compound dvanda (upāya ca upādāna ca abhinivesa ca vinibandha ca)
Variant upayupādānābhinivesavinibandha, upāyupādānābhinivesavinibaddha
Commentary (SNa) upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho'ti upayehi ca upādānehi ca abhinivesehi ca vinibandho. tattha upayā'ti dve upayā taṇh'upayo ca diṭṭh'upayo ca. upādān'ādīsu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit upāya + upādāna + abhiniveśa + vinibandha

Example

upāy'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ
upāyūpādāna

masc. engaging and grasping; approaching and clinging; going near and grabbing hold [upāya + upādāna] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning engaging and grasping; approaching and clinging; going near and grabbing hold
Construction upāya + upādāna
Compound dvanda (upāya ca upādāna ca)
Variant upayupādāna, upāyupādāna
Sanskrit upāya + upādāna

Example

viññāṇaṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, abalaṃ virāgunaṃ anassāsikan'ti viditvā ye viññāṇe upāy'ūpādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā vimuttaṃ me cittan'ti pajānāmi.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
upāyena

ind. skillfully; in the right way; by a stratagem [upa + √i] ✗
upāraddha

pp. criticized; challenged, confuted [upa + ā + √rabh] ✗
upārambha

masc. criticism; accusation; conflict; condemnation [upa + ā + √rabh + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upārambhati
Meaning criticism; accusation; conflict; condemnation
Root Family upa ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction upa + ā + rambha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym abhisāpa
Sanskrit upārambha
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Examples

te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu. taṃ kissa hetu? nindā-ghaṭṭana-byārosa-upārambha-bhayā'ti.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

upārambhaṃ na sikkheyya,
khalitañ'ca na gāhaye,
n'ābhihare n'ābhimadde,
na vācaṃ payutaṃ bhaṇe.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
upārambhaka

adj. critical; accusing; condemning; fault-finding [upa + ā + √rabh + a + a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from upārambha
Meaning critical; accusing; condemning; fault-finding
Root Family upa ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction upa + ā + rambha + a + ka
upārambha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit upārambha (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

Example

appasādo ca bhikkhūsu,
bhiyyo bhiyyo pavaḍḍhati,
upārambhakacitto ca,
saddhammaṃ sotum'icchati.

AN 7.29 dutiyaparihānisuttaṃ
upārambhakacitta

adj. with a fault-finding mind; with a critical attitude [upārambhaka + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a fault-finding mind; with a critical attitude
Construction upārambhaka + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (upārambhaka + citta)
Synonym upārambhacitta, saupārambhacitta
Sanskrit upārambha + citta

Example

appasādo ca bhikkhūsu,
bhiyyo bhiyyo pavaḍḍhati,
upārambhakacitto ca,
saddhammaṃ sotum'icchati.

AN 7.29 dutiyaparihānisuttaṃ
upārambhacitta

adj. with a fault-finding mind; with a critical attitude [upārambha + citta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a fault-finding mind; with a critical attitude
Construction upārambha + citta
Synonym upārambhakacitta
Variant saupārambhacitta
Commentary (ANa) upārambhacitto'ti niggahāropanacitto.
Sanskrit upārambha + citta
upārambhacittatā

fem. fact of having a fault-finding mind; fact of having a critical attitude [upārambha + cittatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having a fault-finding mind; fact of having a critical attitude
Construction upārambha + cittatā
Commentary (ADHa) upārambhacittatā'ti upārambhacittabhāvo. yasmā pana so atthato upārambho'va hoti, tasmā taṃ dassetuṃ tattha katamo upārambho'tiādi vuttaṃ. (ADHt) parassa dos'āropane randhagavesitāsaṅkhāto upārambho'va upārambhacittatā nāma.
Sanskrit upārambha + cittatā

Example

ariyānaṃ adassanakamyataṃ appahāya, ariyadhammassa asotu'kamyataṃ appahāya, upārambhacittataṃ appahāya, ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo dhamme appahāya abhabbo muṭṭhasaccaṃ pahātuṃ asampajaññaṃ pahātuṃ cetaso vikkhepaṃ pahātuṃ.

AN 10.76 tayodhammasuttaṃ
upārambhati

pr. criticizes, finds fault; challenges, confutes [upa + ā + √rabh] ✗
upārambhānisaṃsa

masc. for the purpose of debating; for the sake of argument; for the sake of condemnation [upārambha + ānisaṃsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning for the purpose of debating; for the sake of argument; for the sake of condemnation

Example

upāsakasatāni

nt. one hundred lay disciples; one hundred lay devotees [upāsaka + sata + āni] ✓

Grammar nt pl, comp
Meaning one hundred lay disciples; one hundred lay devotees
Construction upāsaka + sata + āni
upāsakasata + āni
Compound digu (upāsakā + satāni)
Commentary (ANa) pañcamattehi upāsakasatehī'ti sot'āpanna-sakadāgāmīnaṃ'y'eva ariyasāvakaupāsakānaṃ pañcahi satehi parivuto bhuttapātarāso gandhamālavilepenacuṇṇāni gahetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami.
Sanskrit upāsaka + śatāni

Examples

atha kho āyasmā puṇṇo ten'ev'antaravassena pañcamattāni upāsakasatāni paṭivedesi. ten'ev'antaravassena pañcamattāni upāsikāsatāni paṭivedesi. ten'ev'antaravassena tisso vijjā sacchākāsi. ten'ev'antaravassena parinibbāyi.

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ

atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati pañcamattehi upāsakasatehi parivuto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 5.176 pītisuttaṃ
upāsakasutta

nt. Udāna 15 (UD 15) ✗
upāsati

pr. attends or serve; sits at the feet (of) [upa + √ās] ✗
upāsana 1.1

nt. training; military training; apprenticeship; lit. sitting near [upa + √ās + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upāsati
Meaning training; military training; apprenticeship; lit. sitting near

Root √ās･1 a (sit)
Construction upa + √ās + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upāsana
Sanskrit Root √ās 2 (sit)

Examples

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

kaliṅgar'ūpadhānā, bhikkhave, eta'r'ahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ. tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.
