Sanskrit upānah
Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

Examples

samās'antagatānaṃ nāmānam'anto saro kvaci akāro hoti. devānaṃ rājā devarājo, devarājā, devānaṃ sakhā devasakho, devasakhā, pañca ahāni pañc'āhaṃ, satt'āhaṃ, pañcagavaṃ, chatt'upāhanaṃ, upasaradaṃ, visāl'akkho, vimukho.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 337

avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'eva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇa-upāhanaṃ anujāneyya

VIN 4.5.158 mahākaccānassa pañcavaraparidassanā
upāhanajātaka

nt. Jātaka 231 (JA 231) ✗
upāhanapappoṭhanasadda

masc. sound of the knocking of sandals ✗
upāhanā

fem. sandals; lit. binding onto [upa + ā + √nah + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from upanayhati
Meaning sandals; lit. binding onto
Root Family upa √nah
Root √nah･3 ya (bind, arm)
Construction upa + ā + √nah > han + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change nah > han (metathesis)
Synonym upāhana
Sanskrit upānah
Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

Examples

potaliyo'pi kho gahapati sampannanivāsanapāvuraṇo chatt'upāhanāhi jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena so vanasaṇḍo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ ajjhogāhetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'eva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇa-upāhanaṃ anujāneyya

VIN 4.5.158 mahākaccānassa pañcavaraparidassanā
upāhanāruḷha

adj. wearing sandals; lit. ascended bindings [upāhana + āruḷha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wearing sandals; lit. ascended bindings
Construction upāhana + āruḷha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upāhanaṃ + āruḷha)
Sanskrit upānah + ārūḍha

Examples

na upāhan'āruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 62 upāhanasikkhāpadaṃ

na upāhan'āruḷhassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca akkantassa vā paṭimukkassa vā omukkassa vā agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
upāhanāruḷhasikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 62; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone) wearing sandals [upāhanāruḷha + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 62; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone) wearing sandals
Construction upāhanāruḷha + sikkhāpada
upiya

adj. suitable; appropriate [upa + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from upa
Meaning suitable; appropriate
Construction upa + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Synonym anukūla, anucchavi, anucchavika, anurūpa, kappa, tajja, tathārūpa, tadanurūpa, paṭirūpa, patirūpa, patirūpī, pattayutta, yutta, yuttaka, yuttarūpa, sāmaggiya, sāruppa
Commentary (VINa) tadupiyaṃ byañjanan'ti tassa odanassa anurūpaṃ maccha-maṃsa-sāka-phala-kaḷīr'ādi-byañjanaṃ.
Sanskrit upaka (bsk)

Example

ukkaṭṭho nāma patto aḍḍh'āḷhak'odanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ
upekkha

adj. disinterested, unaffected [upa + √ikkh] ✗
upekkhaka

adj. mental poised; mentally balanced; equanimous; non-reactive; looking on; disregarding; lit. onlooker [upa + √ikkh + a + ā + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from upekkhā
Meaning mental poised; mentally balanced; equanimous; non-reactive; looking on; disregarding; lit. onlooker
Root Family upa √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction upa + ikkha + ā + ka
upekkhā + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym samacitta
Commentary (MNa) upekkhako'ti chaḷaṅgupekkhāya upekkhako.
Sanskrit upekṣaka
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Examples

upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

vissajja ganthāni mun'īdha loke,
vivādajātesu na vaggasārī,
santo asantesu upekkhako so,
anuggaho uggahaṇanti m'aññe.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
upekkhati

pr. looks on; is not interested; is indifferent [upa + √ikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning looks on; is not interested; is indifferent
Root Family upa √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction upa + ikkha + ti
Phonetic Change upekkhatī with metrically lengthened ī
Sanskrit upīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Examples

phassena phuṭṭho na sukhena majje,
dukkhena phuṭṭho'pi na sampavedhe,
phassadvayaṃ sukhadukkhe upekkhe,
anānuruddho aviruddha kenaci.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

na brāhmaṇo kappam'upeti saṅkhā,
na diṭṭhisārī na'pi ñāṇabandhu,
ñatvā ca so sammutiyo puthujjā,
upekkhatī uggahaṇanti m'aññe.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
upekkhanā

fem. neutrality, equanimity, indifference [upa + √ikkh] ✗
upekkhā

fem. looking on; mental poise; mental balance; equanimity; equipoise; non-reactivity; composure [upa + √ikkh + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from upekkhati
Meaning looking on; mental poise; mental balance; equanimity; equipoise; non-reactivity; composure
Root Family upa √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Construction upa + √ikkh + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit upekṣā
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

Examples

etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ upekkhā'ti

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

upekkhaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. upekkhañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo paṭigho so pahīyissati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
upekkhācetovimutti

fem. liberation of the mind by equanimity (for); emancipation of the heart by non-reactivity [upekkhā + cetovimutti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning liberation of the mind by equanimity (for); emancipation of the heart by non-reactivity
Construction upekkhā + cetovimutti
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + cetovimutti)
Sanskrit upekṣā + ceto + vimukti

Example

nissaraṇañ'h'etaṃ, āvuso, rāgassa yadidaṃ upekkhācetovimuttī'ti.

AN 6.13 nissāraṇīyasuttaṃ
upekkhāṭṭhāniya

adj. based on equanimity; supported by mental poise [upekkhā + ṭhāniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on equanimity; supported by mental poise
Construction upekkhā + ṭhāniya
Variant upekkhāṭhāniya
upekkhāṭṭhānīya

adj. productive of mental poise; which supports equanimity; serving as a basis for non-reactivity [upekkhā + ṭhānīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning productive of mental poise; which supports equanimity; serving as a basis for non-reactivity
Construction upekkhā + ṭhānīya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upekkhaṃ + ṭhānīya)
Sanskrit upekṣā + sthānīya

Example

aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā somanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, domanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, upekkhāṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upekkhāṭhāniya

adj. based on equanimity; supported by mental poise [upekkhā + ṭhāniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on equanimity; supported by mental poise
Construction upekkhā + ṭhāniya
Variant upekkhāṭṭhāniya
upekkhādhātu

fem. state of equanimity [upekkhā + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of equanimity
Construction upekkhā + dhātu
upekkhānimitta

nt. theme of mental balance; cause for mental poise; lit. looking-on sign [upekkhā + nimitta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning theme of mental balance; cause for mental poise; lit. looking-on sign
Construction upekkhā + nimitta
Compound kammadhāraya (upekkhā + nimitta)
Commentary (ANa) upekkhā'ti majjhattabhāvassa.
Sanskrit upekṣā + nimitta

Example

adhicittam'anuyuttena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tīṇi nimittāni kālena kālaṃ manasi kātabbāni, kālena kālaṃ samādhinimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ, kālena kālaṃ paggahanimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ, kālena kālaṃ upekkhānimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ.

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ
upekkhānusārī

adj. following the equanimity [upekkhā + anusārī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning following the equanimity
Construction upekkhā + anusārī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upekkhaṃ + anusārī)
upekkhāpāramī

fem. highest state of equanimity; perfection of equanimity [upekkhā + pāramī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning highest state of equanimity; perfection of equanimity
Construction upekkhā + pāramī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upekkhāya + pāramī)
Sanskrit upekṣā + pārami

Examples

so lābhasakkāraṃ jigucchanto pabbajjaṃ anupagantvā, pahomi c'āhaṃ lābh'ālābh'ādīsu nibbikāro hotun'ti attānaṃ takkento, visesato paraparibhavasahanādipaṭipadaṃ pūrento upekkhāpāramiṃ matthakaṃ pāpessāmī'ti

CPa 3.15 mahālomahaṃsacariyāvaṇṇanā

aṭṭhamaṃ adhiṭṭhānapārami, navamaṃ mettāpārami, dasamaṃ upekkhāpāramī'ti

Sri Lanka buddhavassasajjhāyanā
upekkhābhāvanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the development of equanimity; engaged in the cultivation of non-reactivity [upekkhā + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the development of equanimity; engaged in the cultivation of non-reactivity
Construction upekkhā + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (upekkhābhāvanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Sanskrit upekkhā + bhāvanā + anuyoga + anuyukta

Example

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe upekkhābhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
upekkhārammaṇa

adj. based on equipoise; founded on non-reactivity [upekkhā + ārammaṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on equipoise; founded on non-reactivity
Construction upekkhā + ārammaṇa
Antonym sātārammaṇa
upekkhāvihāra

masc. remaining equanimous; abiding in equanimity [upekkhā + vihāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning remaining equanimous; abiding in equanimity
Construction upekkhā + vihāra
Compound sattamī tappurisa (upekkhāyaṃ + vihāra)
Sanskrit upekṣā + vihāra

Example

na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, abhijānāmi tesu pāpakaṃ cittaṃ uppādetā. idaṃsu me, sāriputta, upekkhāvihārasmiṃ hoti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
upekkhāvihārī

adj. living in a state of equanimity; dwelling with perfect mental poise; lit. living with looking on [upekkhā + vihārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in a state of equanimity; dwelling with perfect mental poise; lit. living with looking on
Construction upekkhā + vihārī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + vihārī)
Sanskrit upekṣā + vihārin

Example

evaṃ, bhante. sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, brahmā upekkhāvihārī'ti. taṃ me idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā sakkhidiṭṭho, bhagavā hi, bhante, upekkhāvihārī'ti.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
upekkhāvedaniya

adj. neutral; serving as a basis for mental poise; lit. to be felt equanimously [upekkhā + vedaniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning neutral; serving as a basis for mental poise; lit. to be felt equanimously
Construction upekkhā + vedaniya
Commentary (SNt) evaṃ rūpā ca manāpā upekkhāvedaniyā'ti etthā'pi yath'ārahaṃ vattabbaṃ.
upekkhāsatipārisuddhi

adj. which possesses purification of awareness by equanimity [upekkhā + sati + pārisuddhi] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which possesses purification of awareness by equanimity
Construction upekkhā + sati + pārisuddhi
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + satipārisuddhi)
Commentary (VINa) upekkhāsatipārisuddhin'ti upekkhāya janitasatipārisuddhiṃ. imasmiñ'hi jhāne suparisuddhā sati. yā ca tassā satiyā pārisuddhi, sā upekkhāya katā na aññena, tasmā etaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhin'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit upekṣā + smṛti + pariśuddhi

Examples

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubb'eva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā adukkham'asukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako imaṃ'y'eva anuttaraṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ āgamma anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarati, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo ...

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
upekkhāsatisaṃsuddha

nt. awareness perfectly purified by equanimity; (comm) perfectly purified equanimity and awareness [upekkhā + sati + saṃsuddha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning awareness perfectly purified by equanimity; (comm) perfectly purified equanimity and awareness
Construction upekkhā + sati + saṃsuddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + satisaṃsuddha)
Commentary (ANa) upekkhāsatisaṃsuddhan'ti catutthajjhānike phale uppannāya upekkhāya ca satiyā ca saṃsuddhaṃ.
Sanskrit upekṣā + smṛti + saṃśuddha

Example

upekkhāsatisaṃsuddhaṃ,
dhammatakkapurejavaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūmi,
avijjāya pabhedanan'ti.

AN 3.33 sāriputtasuttaṃ
upekkhāsambojjhaṅga

masc. equanimity as an element of awakening; mental poise as a factor of enlightenment [upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning equanimity as an element of awakening; mental poise as a factor of enlightenment
Construction upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga
Compound kammadhāraya (upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga)
Sanskrit upekṣā + sambodhyaṅga

Examples

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti, upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṭṭhāniya

adj. serving as a basis for equanimity as an element of awakening; giving support to mental poise as a factor of enlightenment [upekkhāsambojjhaṅga + ṭhāniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning serving as a basis for equanimity as an element of awakening; giving support to mental poise as a factor of enlightenment
Construction upekkhāsambojjhaṅga + ṭhāniya
upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṭṭhānīya

adj. which supports equanimity as an element of awakening; serving as a basis for mental poise as a factor of enlightenment [upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga + ṭhānīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which supports equanimity as an element of awakening; serving as a basis for mental poise as a factor of enlightenment
Construction upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga + ṭhānīya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa + ṭhānīya)
Commentary (SNa) upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgaṭṭhānīyā'ti upekkhāya ārammaṇadhammā, atthato pana majjhatt'ākāro upekkhāṭṭhānīyā dhammo'ti veditabbo.
Sanskrit upekṣā + sambodhyaṅga + sthānīya

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgaṭṭhānīyā dhammā. tattha yonisomanasikārabahulīkāro, ayam'āhāro anuppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
upekkhāsahagata

adj. mentally balanced; full of equanimity; lit. going along with looking on [upekkha + sahagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mentally balanced; full of equanimity; lit. going along with looking on
Construction upekkha + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + sahagata)
Sanskrit upekṣā + sahagata

Examples

so upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

imaṃ samādhiṃ savitakkam'pi savicāraṃ bhāveyyāsi, avitakkam'pi vicāramattaṃ bhāveyyāsi, avitakkam'pi avicāraṃ bhāveyyāsi, sappītikam'pi bhāveyyāsi, nippītikam'pi bhāveyyāsi, sātasahagatam'pi bhāveyyāsi, upekkhāsahagatam'pi bhāveyyāsi.

AN 8.63 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
upekkhāsukha 1

nt. comfort and mental poise; ease and equanimity [upekkhā + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning comfort and mental poise; ease and equanimity
Construction upekkhā + sukha
Compound dvanda (upekkhā ca sukha ca)
Sanskrit upekṣā + sukha

Example

tassa yā purimā samādhija-pītisukha-sukhumasacca-saññā, sā nirujjhati. upekkhāsukha-sukhumasacca-saññā tasmiṃ samaye hoti, upekkhāsukha-sukhumasacca-saññī'y'eva tasmiṃ samaye hoti.

DN 9.3 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, sahetukasaññuppādanirodhakathā
upekkhāsukha 2

nt. pleasure of equipoise; happiness of non-reactivity; (comm) pleasure of the fourth jhāna [upekkhā + sukha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning pleasure of equipoise; happiness of non-reactivity; (comm) pleasure of the fourth jhāna
Construction upekkhā + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upekkhāya + sukha)
Antonym sātasukha
Commentary (ANa) upekkhāsukhan'ti catutthajjhānasukhaṃ.
Sanskrit upekṣā + sukha
upekkhāsukhasukhumasaccasaññā

fem. refined and true perception of equanimity ✗
upekkhāsukhasukhumasaccasaññī

adj. with a refined and true perception of equanimity ✗
upekkhāsukhassādagadhita

adj. tied by gratification to the pleasure of equanimity [upekkhā + sukha + assāda + gadhita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning tied by gratification to the pleasure of equanimity
Construction upekkhā + sukha + assāda + gadhita
upekkhāsukhassādavinibandha

adj. chained by gratification to the pleasure of equanimity [upekkhā + sukha + assāda + vinibandha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning chained by gratification to the pleasure of equanimity
Construction upekkhā + sukha + assāda + vinibandha
upekkhāsukhassādasaṃyojanasaṃyutta

adj. bound with a chain by gratification to the pleasure of equanimity [upekkhā + sukha + assāda + saṃyojana + saṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound with a chain by gratification to the pleasure of equanimity
Construction upekkhā + sukha + assāda + saṃyojana + saṃyutta
upekkhāsutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 28.4 (SN28.4) ✗
upekkhāsutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.65 (SN46.65) ✗
upekkhāsetadantavant

adj. with equanimity as white tusks [upekkhā + seta + dantavant] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with equanimity as white tusks
Construction upekkhā + seta + dantavant
Compound kammadhāraya (upekkhā + setadantavant)
Commentary (ANa) upekkhāsetadantavā'ti cha'ḷ'aṅg'upekkhāmayehi setadantehi samannāgato. (THa) upekkhā setadantā te etassa atthī'ti, upekkhāsetadantavā.
Sanskrit upekṣā + śveta + dantavat

Example

sati ca sampajaññañ'ca,
caraṇā nāgassa tepare,
saddhāhattho mahānāgo,
upekkhāsetadantavā.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
upekkhi

aor. was indifferent [upa + √ikkh] ✗
upekkhindriya

nt. power of equipoise; faculty of equanimity [upekkhā + indriya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning power of equipoise; faculty of equanimity
Construction upekkhā + indriya
Commentary (PMa) sukhadukkh'ākārapavattiṃ upekkhati majjhatt'ākārasaṇṭhitattā ten'ākārena pavattatī'ti upekkhā, majjhattalakkhaṇe ind'aṭṭhaṃ kāretī'ti indriyaṃ, upekkhā eva indriyaṃ upekkh'indriyaṃ.
Sanskrit upekṣā + indriya

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, upekkh'indriyaṃ? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kāyikaṃ vā cetasikaṃ vā n'eva sātaṃ n'āsātaṃ vedayitaṃ

SN 48.38 tatiyavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

jīvit'indriyaṃ, sukh'indriyaṃ, dukkh'indriyaṃ, somanass'indriyaṃ, domanass'indriyaṃ, upekkh'indriyaṃ

Abhi Vibh 5.1 vipassanā-bhūmi-pāṭho
upekkhindriyanirodha

masc. ending of equipoise; cessation of the faculty of equanimity [upekkhindriya + nirodha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of equipoise; cessation of the faculty of equanimity
Construction upekkhindriya + nirodha
upekkhindriyanirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the ending of equipoise; going to the cessation of the faculty of equanimity [upekkhindriya + nirodhagāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of equipoise; going to the cessation of the faculty of equanimity
Construction upekkhindriya + nirodhagāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upekkhindriyanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
upekkhindriyasamudaya

masc. appearance of equipoise; arising of the faculty of equanimity [upekkhindriya + samudaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning appearance of equipoise; arising of the faculty of equanimity
Construction upekkhindriya + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upekkhindriyassa + samudaya)
upekkhiya

ger. being neutral or indifferent [upa + √ikkh] ✗
upekkhupavicārā

fem. exploration with non-reactivity [upekkhā + upavicārā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning exploration with non-reactivity
Construction upekkhā + upavicārā
upekkhūpavicāra

masc. exploration with equanimity; probing with poise [upekkhā + upavicāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning exploration with equanimity; probing with poise
Construction upekkhā + upavicāra
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + upavicāra)
Sanskrit upekṣā + upavicāra

Example

iti cha somanass'ūpavicārā, cha domanass'ūpavicārā, cha upekkh'ūpavicārā, aṭṭhārasa mano'pavicārā veditabbā'ti, iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upekhā

fem. neutrality, equanimity, indifference [upa + √ikkh] ✗
upekhitvā

abs. having become neutral; having become indifferent [upa + √ikkh] ✗
upecca 1

ger. (+acc) approaching; arriving (at); coming towards [upa + √i + a + tya] ✓

Grammar ger of upeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning approaching; arriving (at); coming towards
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction upa + e + tya
Phonetic Change i > e
ty > cc
Sanskrit upetya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

sace ca pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
karissatha karotha vā,
na vo dukkhā pamuty'atthi,
upecca'pi palāyatan'ti.

UD 44 kumārakasuttaṃ

tuvañ'ca bhante anukampakaṃ viduṃ,
upecca vandiṃ kusalañ'ca pucchisaṃ,
tato te ucchussa adāsi khaṇḍikaṃ,
pasannacitā atulāya pītiyā'ti.

VV 30 ucchudāyikā vimānavatthu
upecca 2

ger. (+acc) following [upa + √i] ✗
upeta 1

pp. (+instr) endowed (with); possessed (of); having; lit. approached [upa + √i + a + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upeti (+instr)
Meaning endowed (with); possessed (of); having; lit. approached
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction upa + e + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym apeta, durūpeta
Synonym upapanna, parikkhata, samannāgata, samāhita, sampanna
Sanskrit upeta
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

saccena danto damasā upeto,
vedantagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
yaññ'opanīto tam'upavhayetha,
kālena so juhati dakkhiṇeyye'ti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

yo ca vantakasāvassa,
sīlesu susamāhito,
upeto damasaccena,
sa ve kāsāvam'arahati.

DHP 10 yamakavaggo
upeta 2

pp. (+acc) arrived at; entered; undertaken; living; lit. approached [upa + √i + a + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upeti, in comps (+acc)
Meaning arrived at; entered; undertaken; living; lit. approached
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction upa + e + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit upeta
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

dukkaraṃ vā'pi karonti,
sekhā sīlasamāhitā,
ṭhitattā anagāriy'upetassa,
tuṭṭhi hoti sukh'āvahā'ti.

SN 2.6 kāmadasuttaṃ

anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upeta 3

Example

tass'ime pañc'upādānakkhandhā upetā upādinnā dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
upeti 1

pr. (+acc) comes; approaches; enters [upa + √i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning comes; approaches; enters
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction upa + e + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym nopeti, apeti
Synonym abhikkamati
Sanskrit upeti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

evaṃ vutte yasmiṃ samaye upeti, saññī tasmiṃ samaye hoti. yasmiṃ samaye apeti, asaññī tasmiṃ samaye hotī'ti. itth'eke abhisaññānirodhaṃ paññapenti.

DN 9.2 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, abhisaññānirodhakathā

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca,
niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,
mahāvarāho'va nivāpapuṭṭho,
punappunaṃ gabbham'upeti mando.

DHP 325 nāgavaggo
upeti 2

pr. (+acc) enters; gets involved (with); engages (in); lit. approaches [upa + √i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning enters; gets involved (with); engages (in); lit. approaches
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction upa + e + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym nopeti
Synonym voyuñjati
Sanskrit upeti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke,
atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti,
vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti,
tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabban'ti.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
upeti 3

pr. (+acc) obtains; gets; experiences; suffers; lit. approaches [upa + √i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning obtains; gets; experiences; suffers; lit. approaches
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction upa + e + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym nopeti
Synonym anubhavati, abhijānāti, āpajjati, nigacchati, paṭisevati, pappoti, vindati
Sanskrit upeti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

tasiṇāya purakkhatā pajā,
parisappanti saso'va bādhito,
saṃyojanasaṅgasattakā,
dukkham'upenti punappunaṃ cirāya.

DHP 342 taṇhāvaggo

yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
upeti 4

pr. (+dat) is suitable (for); is ready (for); is fit (for); lit. approaches [upa + √i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, impers, intrans (+dat)
Meaning is suitable (for); is ready (for); is fit (for); lit. approaches

Construction upa + e + ti

Antonym nopeti
Sanskrit upeti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ nihitaṃ ninnītakasāvaṃ, mudu ca hoti kammaniyañ'ca pabhassarañ'ca, na ca pabhaṅgu, sammā upeti kammāya.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
upetvā

abs. having approached, having obtained [upa + √i] ✗
upesi

aor. approached, obtained [upa + √i] ✗
upehiti

fut. (+acc) will approach; will arrive (at); will reach [upa + √i + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of upeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will approach; will arrive (at); will reach
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a + ssa > ehi (fut, irreg)
Construction upa + ehi + ti
Sanskrit upeṣyati
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

ajapālarukkhamūlasmiṃ,
nisīditvā tathāgato,
tattha pāyāsaṃ paggayha,
nerañjaram'upehiti.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā

nerañjarāya tīramhi,
pāyāsaṃ ada so jino,
paṭiyattavaramaggena,
bodhimūlam'upehiti.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā
upehisi

fut. (+acc) you will approach; you will arrive (at); you will reach [upa + √i + a + ssa + si] ✓

Grammar fut 2nd sg of upehiti, trans (+acc)
Meaning you will approach; you will arrive (at); you will reach
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a + ssa > ehi (fut, irreg)
Construction upa + ehi + si
Sanskrit upeṣyasi
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

so karohi dīpam'attano,
khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.

DHP 236 malavaggo

muñca pure muñca pacchato,
majjhe muñca bhavassa pāragū,
sabbattha vimuttamānaso,
na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.

DHP 348 taṇhāvaggo
uposatha 1

masc. full moon or new moon observance day [upa + √vas + a + tha] ✓

Grammar masc, from upavasa
Meaning full moon or new moon observance day
Root Family upa √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √vas + a + tha
upavasa > uposa + tha
Derivative taddhita (tha)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym uposathadivasa
Sanskrit upavasatha
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

Examples

suṇātu me bhante saṅgho? ajj'uposatho pannaraso, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

ayaṃ hem'anto'tu, asmiñ'ca utumhi aṭṭha uposathā, iminā pakkhena, eko uposatho sampatto, satta uposathā atikkantā, aṭṭha uposathā paripuṇṇā.

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca
uposatha 2

masc. observance day ceremony [upa + √vas + a + tha] ✓

Grammar masc, from upavasa
Meaning observance day ceremony
Root Family upa √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √vas + a + tha
upavasa > uposa + tha
Derivative taddhita (tha)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit upavasatha
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

Example

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, na dān'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, ito paraṃ uposathaṃ karissāmi, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissāmi

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
uposatha 3

masc. name of a king Mahāsudassana's royal elephant; lit. observance [upa + √vas + a + tha] ✓

Grammar masc, from upavasa
Meaning name of a king Mahāsudassana's royal elephant; lit. observance
Root Family upa √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √vas + a + tha
upavasa > uposa + tha
Derivative taddhita (tha)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit upavasatha
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītināgasahassāni ahesuṃ sovaṇṇ'ālaṅkārāni sovaṇṇaddhajāni hemajālapaṭicchannāni uposathanāgarājappamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

esaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā nāgasahassānaṃ eko'y'eva so nāgo hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena abhiruhāmi, uposatho nāgarājā.

uposathakamma

nt. (vinaya) performance of the observance day ceremony [uposatha + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (vinaya) performance of the observance day ceremony
Construction uposatha + kamma
Compound kammadhāraya (uposatha + kamma)
Sanskrit upavasatha + karman

Examples

ettāni cattāri vattāni sammajjanakaraṇādīni saṅghasannipatato paṭhamaṃ kattabbatā, uposathassa uposathakammassa pubbakaraṇan'ti vuccati. pubbakaraṇānī'ti akkhātāni.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi

evan'taṃ uposathakammaṃ imehi catūhi lakkhaṇehi saṅgahitaṃ pattakallaṃ nāma hoti, kātuṃ yuttarūpaṃ.

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca

Example

uposathakaraṇato pubbe navavidhaṃ pubbakiccaṃ kātabbaṃ hoti

Meaning observing the eight precepts

Phonetic Change d > p
dy > jj
Synonym samuṭṭhāya
Variant ubbhijja
Sanskrit utpadya
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

savanti sabbadhi sotā,
latā uppajja tiṭṭhati,
tañ'ca disvā lataṃ jātaṃ,
mūlaṃ paññāya chindatha.

DHP 340 taṇhāvaggo
uppajjati 1

pr. appears; arises; takes place [ud + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning appears; arises; takes place
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ud + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change d > p
dy > jj
Antonym nirujjhati, nuppajjati, pahīyati
Synonym upapajjati, nibbattati, pabhavati, vuppajjati, sañjāyati, samudayati, samudeti
Sanskrit utpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udake udakabubbuḷaṃ uppajjati c'eva nirujjhati ca.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti

AN 3.71 uposathasuttaṃ
uppajjati 2

pr. (+acc) is reborn (in); re-arises (in) [ud + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning is reborn (in); re-arises (in)
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ud + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change d > p
dy > jj
Antonym nirujjhati, nuppajjati
Synonym upapajjati, nibbattati
Sanskrit utpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

gabbham'eke uppajjanti,
nirayaṃ pāpakammino,
saggaṃ sugatino yanti,
parinibbanti anāsavā.

DHP 126 pāpavaggo
uppajjati 3

pr. (+dat) becomes available (for); accrues (to); crops up (for); lit. arises [ud + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning becomes available (for); accrues (to); crops up (for); lit. arises
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ud + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change d > p
dy > jj
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.3) uppajjeyyā'ti uppajjeyya saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.
Sanskrit utpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine bhikkhuno pan'eva akālacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā khippam'eva kāretabbaṃ

VIN PAT NP 3 akālacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

bhikkhuno pan'eva addhānamaggappaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni, paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake.

uppajjantisutta

nt. Udāna 60 (UD 60) ✗
uppajjamāna

prp. arising; appearing; coming into being [ud + √pad + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of uppajjati, intrans
Meaning arising; appearing; coming into being
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ud + pajja + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change d > p
dy > jj
Antonym nirujjhamāna, nuppajjamāna
Synonym jāyamāna
Sanskrit utpadyamāna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

dukkham'eva uppajjamānaṃ uppajjati, dukkhaṃ nirujjhamānaṃ nirujjhatī'ti na kaṅkhati na vicikicchati aparapaccayā ñāṇam'ev'assa ettha hoti. ettāvatā kho, kaccāna, sammādiṭṭhi hoti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

sā kho pan'esā, bhikkhave, taṇhā kattha uppajjamānā uppajjati, kattha nivisamānā nivisati

DN 22.16 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
uppajji

aor. appeared; arose; was born; took place [ud + √pad + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of uppajjati, intrans
Meaning appeared; arose; was born; took place
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ud + pajja + i
Phonetic Change d > p
dy > jj
Synonym nibbatti
Sanskrit utpad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpena javena samannāgatassa evarūpena ca padavītihārena evarūpaṃ icchāgataṃ uppajji, ahaṃ gamanena lokassa antaṃ pāpuṇissāmī'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

evaṃ byākaramāno kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sammā byākaramāno byākareyya, idha me sāvatthiyaṃ paṭivasantassa sākete kiñci'd'eva accāyikaṃ karaṇīyaṃ uppajji.

UDa 1.10 bāhiyasuttavaṇṇanā
uppajjitvā

dy > jj

Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

uppatati 2

pr. jumps up [ud + √pat] ✗
uppatana

nt. flying, rising up, jumping [ud + √pat] ✗
uppatanta

prp. rising up; emerging; growing; lit. falling up [ud + √pat + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of uppatati, intrans
Meaning rising up; emerging; growing; lit. falling up
Root Family ud √pat
Root √pat･1 a (fall)
Base √pat + a > pata
Construction ud + pata + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > p
Synonym ummujjanta
Commentary (SNa) bījan'ti uppatantānaṃ sattavidhaṃ dhaññabījaṃ seṭṭhaṃ. tasmiñ'hi uggate janapado khemo hoti subhikkho. (SNt) uppatantānan'ti pathaviṃ bhinditvā uṭṭhahantānaṃ.
Sanskrit utpatat
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

Examples

kiṃsu uppatataṃ seṭṭhaṃ,
kiṃsu nipatataṃ varaṃ,
kiṃsu pavajamānānaṃ,
kiṃsu pavadataṃ varan'ti.

SN 1.74 vuṭṭhisuttaṃ

bījaṃ uppatataṃ seṭṭhaṃ,
vuṭṭhi nipatataṃ varā,
gāvo pavajamānānaṃ,
putto pavadataṃ varo'ti.

uppatamāna

prp. flying, jumping [ud + √pat] ✗

aor. flew, jumped up [ud + √pat] ✗

rasmiggāho itaro jano.

DHP 222 kodhavaggo

yo uppatitaṃ vineti kodhaṃ,
visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

uragavaggo 1

na uppathena gacchantena pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca uppathena gacchanto pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > p
Antonym patha
Synonym kummagga
Commentary (SNa) uppatho'ti sugatiñ'ca nibbānañ'ca gacchantassa amaggo.
Sanskrit utpatha
Sanskrit Root √path √panth 1 (go)

Examples

kiṃsu uppatho akkhāto,
kiṃsu rattin'divakkhayo,
kiṃ malaṃ brahmacariyassa,
kiṃ sinānam'anodakan'ti.

SN 1.58 uppathasuttaṃ

rūpaṃ jīrati maccānaṃ,
nāmagottaṃ na jīrati,
rāgo uppatho'ti vuccati,
lobho dhammānaṃ paripantho,
vayo rattin'divakkhayo.

SN 1.76 najīratisuttaṃ
uppathagamana

nt. going off course ✗
uppathasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.58 (SN1.58) ✗
uppathenagamanasikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 72; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone while) walking off the path [uppathena + gamana + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 72; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone while) walking off the path
Construction uppathena + gamana + sikkhāpada
uppanna 1

pp. arisen; appeared; come into being [ud + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of uppajjati
Meaning arisen; appeared; come into being
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ud + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > p
d > n
Antonym anuppanna
Synonym uṭṭhita, pahūta, sañjāta
Sanskrit utpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

tass'idaṃ, bhikkhave, manussattaṃ laddhaṃ, tathāgato loke uppanno arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, tathāgatappavedito ca dhammavinayo loke dibbati.

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ

tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
uppanna 2

pp. born (in) [ud + √pad + na] ~

Grammar pp of uppajjati
Meaning born (in)
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ud + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > p
d > n
Sanskrit utpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
uppannaka

masc. arising; appearance [ud + √pad] ✗
uppannañāṇa

adj. for whom understanding has arisen; who has attained knowledge [uppanna + ñāṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning for whom understanding has arisen; who has attained knowledge
Construction uppanna + ñāṇa
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (uppanna + ñāṇa)
Commentary (NIDD2) uppannañāṇo'mhi anaññaneyyo'ti tassa paccekasambuddhassa ñāṇaṃ uppannaṃ samuppannaṃ nibbattaṃ abhinibbattaṃ pātubhūtaṃ. sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti ñāṇaṃ uppannaṃ samuppannaṃ nibbattaṃ abhinibbattaṃ pātubhūtaṃ, sabbe saṅkhārā dukkhā'ti … sabbe dhammā anattā'ti … yaṃ kiñ'ci samudayadhammaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti ñāṇaṃ uppannaṃ samuppannaṃ nibbattaṃ abhinibbattaṃ pātubhūtan'ti, uppannañāṇo'mhi. (SNPa) uppannañāṇo'mhī'ti uppannapaccekabodhiñāṇo amhi. etena phalaṃ dasseti.
Sanskrit utpanna + jñāna

Example

diṭṭhīvisūkāni upātivatto,
patto niyāmaṃ paṭiladdhamaggo,
uppannañāṇo'mhi anaññaneyyo,
eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.

SNP 3 khaggavisāṇasuttaṃ

Root Family ud √pad

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre tibbo vanasaṇḍo. tatr'assa rukkho sampannaphalo ca uppannaphalo ca, na c'assu kānici phalāni bhūmiyaṃ patitāni.

Examples

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

uppann'uppannānaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ samathāya vūpasamāya sammukhāvinayo dātabbo, sativinayo dātabbo, amūḷhavinayo dātabbo, paṭiññāya kāretabbaṃ, yebhuyyasikā, tassapāpiyasikā, tiṇ'avatthārako'ti.

aor. (+acc and +abl) turned out of the Order [ud + pa + √vaj] ✗
uppala 1

nt. lotus; water lilly ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning lotus; water lilly
Commentary (ANa) ettha ca setarattanīlesu yaṃkiñci uppalam'eva, ūnakasatapattaṃ puṇḍarīkaṃ, satapattaṃ padumaṃ. pattaniyamaṃ vā vinā'pi setaṃ padumaṃ, rattaṃ puṇḍarīkan'ti ayam'ettha vinicchayo.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nymphaea_nouchali
Sanskrit utpala

Examples

candanaṃ tagaraṃ vā'pi,
uppalaṃ atha vassikī,
etesaṃ gandhajātānaṃ,
sīlagandho anuttaro.

DHP 55 pupphavaggo

seyyathā'pi, vāhana, uppalaṃ vā padumaṃ vā puṇḍarīkaṃ vā udake jātaṃ udake saṃvaḍḍhaṃ udakā paccuggamma ṭhitaṃ anupalittaṃ udakena.

AN 10.81 vāhanasuttaṃ
uppala 2

card. 10⁹⁸ (20 sogandhika = 1 uppala) [uppala] ✗

Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. lotus
uppalaka

adj. rending ✗
uppalakavāta

masc. rending wind ✗
uppalagandha

masc. scent of lotus; lotus's perfume ✗
uppalagandhapaccatthika

masc. (comm) enemy human-sacrificer [uppala + gandha + paccatthika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (comm) enemy human-sacrificer
Construction uppala + gandha + paccatthika
Variant uppaḷagandhapaccatthika
Commentary (VINa) gandhan'ti hadayaṃ vuccati, taṃ uppāṭentī'ti uppalagandhā, uppalagandhā eva paccatthikā uppalagandhapaccatthikā. ete kira na kasivaṇijjādīhi jīvanti, panthaghātagāmaghāt'ādīni katvā puttadāraṃ posenti. te kammasiddhiṃ patthayamānā devatānaṃ āyācetvā tāsaṃ balikamm'atthaṃ manussānaṃ hadayaṃ uppāṭenti. sabbakāle ca manussā dullabhā. bhikkhū pana araññe viharantā sulabhā honti. te sīlavantaṃ bhikkhuṃ gahetvā, sīlavato vadho nāma bhāriyo hotī'ti maññamānā tassa sīlavināsan'atthaṃ manuss'itthi'ādike vā ānenti, taṃ vā tattha nenti. ayam'ettha viseso.
uppalaniraya

masc. (comm) part of the Avīci hell where one must stay an uppala-count in duration [uppala + niraya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (comm) part of the Avīci hell where one must stay an uppala-count in duration
Construction uppala + niraya
Notes see abbuda 5
uppalapatta

nt. water lilly leaf; lotus leaf [uppala + patta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning water lilly leaf; lotus leaf
Construction uppala + patta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uppalassa + patta)
Sanskrit utpala + pattra

Examples

pahāraṃ dadeyyā'ti kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā antamaso uppalapattena'pi pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.4 pahārasikkhāpadaṃ

talasattikaṃ uggireyyā'ti kāyaṃ vā kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ vā antamaso uppalapattam'pi uccāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.4 pahārasikkhāpadaṃ

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnhāto uppalamālaṃ vā vassikamālaṃ vā atimuttakamālaṃ vā labhitvā ubhohi hatthehi paṭiggahetvā uttam'aṅge sirasmiṃ patiṭṭhapeyya

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
uppalavaṇṇā

fem. name of a nun; lit. complexion of a lotus [uppala + vaṇṇa + ā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a nun; lit. complexion of a lotus
Construction uppala + vaṇṇa + ā
uppalavaṇṇa + ā
Commentary (VINa) uppalavaṇṇā'ti sā therī sāvatthiyaṃ seṭṭhidhītā satasahassakappe abhinīhārasampannā. tassā pakatiyā'pi atidassanīyā nīl'uppalavaṇṇā kāyacchavi, abbhantare pana kilesasantāpassa abhāvena ativiya virocati. sā tā'y'eva vaṇṇapokkharatāya uppalavaṇṇā'ti nāmaṃ labhi.
uppalavaṇṇātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 64 (THI64) ✗
uppalavaṇṇāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 5.5 (SN5.5) ✗
uppalavati

pr. swims (up); floats, floats around; leaps up, jumps; is frisky, excited [ud + √plu] ✗
uppalasikharopama

adj. like the tips of blue lilies or lotuses [uppala + sikhara + upama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like the tips of blue lilies or lotuses
Construction uppala + sikhara + upama
Compound kammadhāraya (uppalasikhara + upama)
Commentary (THIa) uppalasikhar'opamāni te'ti ratt'uppal'āggasadisāni pamhāni tava.
Sanskrit utpala + śikhara + upamā

Example

uppalasikhar'opamāni te,
vimale hāṭakasannibhe mukhe,
tava me nayanāni dakkhiya,
bhiyyo kāmaguṇo pavaḍḍhati.

Meaning bunch of water lilies; bunch of lotuses

Example

āveḷatthaṃ ahaṃsu me,
tena buddhaṃ apūjesiṃ,
pasanno sehi pāṇibhi.

Commentary (VINa) gandhan'ti hadayaṃ vuccati, taṃ uppāṭentī'ti uppalagandhā, uppalagandhā eva paccatthikā uppalagandhapaccatthikā. ete kira na kasivaṇijjādīhi jīvanti, panthaghātagāmaghāt'ādīni katvā puttadāraṃ posenti. te kammasiddhiṃ patthayamānā devatānaṃ āyācetvā tāsaṃ balikamm'atthaṃ manussānaṃ hadayaṃ uppāṭenti. sabbakāle ca manussā dullabhā. bhikkhū pana araññe viharantā sulabhā honti. te sīlavantaṃ bhikkhuṃ gahetvā, sīlavato vadho nāma bhāriyo hotī'ti maññamānā tassa sīlavināsan'atthaṃ manuss'itthi'ādike vā ānenti, taṃ vā tattha nenti. ayam'ettha viseso.
uppāṭaka

masc. insect ✗
uppāṭana 1

nt. pulling out; tearing out; uprooting [ud + √paṭ] ✗
uppāṭana 2

nt. skinning [ud + √paṭ] ✗

adj. doing the work of uprooting or skinning [ud + √paṭ] ✗

pp. torn asunder, rooted out [ud + √paṭ] ✗
uppāṭita 2

pp. skinned [ud + √paṭ] ✗
uppāṭitakkhaṇe

ind. at the moment it was torn out ✗
uppāṭiya

ger. (+acc) plucking out; tearing out [ud + √paṭ + *e + iya] ✓

Grammar ger of uppāṭeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning plucking out; tearing out
Root Family ud √paṭ
Root √paṭ･1 *e (split, tear)
Base √paṭ + *e > pāṭe (caus)
Construction ud + pāṭe + iya
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Variant phāletvā
Commentary (THIa) tattha uppāṭiyā'ti uppāṭetvā cakkhukūpato nīharitvā.
Sanskrit utpaṭayya
Sanskrit Root √paṭ 1 (tear)

Example

uppāṭiya cārudassanā,
na ca pajjittha asaṅgamānasā,
handa te cakkhuṃ harassu taṃ,
tassa narassa adāsi tāva'd'e.

Grammar pr, caus of uppajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning produces; generates; causes; gives rise to; lit. causes to arise
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 *aya (go, step)
Base √pad + *aya > pādaya (caus)
Construction ud + pādaya + ti
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Synonym abhijāyati, āpādeti, āharati, uppādeti, janeti, nipphādeti, pavatteti, pasavati, pātukaroti, savati
Sanskrit utpādayati
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

yadapi luddho lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto parassa asatā dukkhaṃ uppādayati.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
uppādayanta

prp. (+acc) producing; generating; causing; giving rise to; lit. causing to arise [ud + √pad + *aya + nta] ~

Grammar prp of uppādayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning producing; generating; causing; giving rise to; lit. causing to arise
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 *aya (go, step)
Base √pad + *aya > pādaya (caus)
Construction ud + pādaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Synonym āpādenta, uppādenta
Sanskrit utpādayat
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)
uppādavagga

masc. Chapter 1 of the Uppādasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 26 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
uppādavaya

masc. arising and passing; appearing and disappearing; coming and going; appearance and dissolution [uppāda + vaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising and passing; appearing and disappearing; coming and going; appearance and dissolution
Construction uppāda + vaya
Compound dvanda (uppāda ca vaya ca)
Sanskrit utpāda + vyaya

Example

na tvaṃ bāle pajānāsi,
yathā arahataṃ vaco,
aniccā sabbasaṅkhārā,
uppādavayadhammino,
uppajjitvā nirujjhanti,
tesaṃ vūpasamo sukho'ti.

SN 1.11 nandanasuttaṃ
uppādavayadhamma

adj. liable to arise and pass way; prone to appearing and disappearing ✗
uppādavayadhammī

adj. marked by arising and passing away; with the nature of appearing and disappearing [uppāda + vaya + dhammī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning marked by arising and passing away; with the nature of appearing and disappearing
Construction uppāda + vaya + dhammī
Compound kammadhāraya (uppādavaya + dhammī)
Commentary (SNa) uppādavayadhammino'ti uppādavayasabhāvā.
Sanskrit utpāda + vyaya + dharmin

Example

na tvaṃ bāle pajānāsi,
yathā arahataṃ vaco,
aniccā sabbasaṅkhārā,
uppādavayadhammino,
uppajjitvā nirujjhanti,
tesaṃ vūpasamo sukho'ti.

SN 1.11 nandanasuttaṃ
uppādasaṃyutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 26 (SN26) ✗
uppādasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 14.36 (SN14.36) ✗
uppādasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.30 (SN22.30) ✗
uppādāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.137 (AN3.137) ✗
uppādikā

fem. storm [ud + √pad] ✗
uppādita

pp. produced; made; generated; caused to appear; lit. caused to go up [ud + √pad + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of uppādeti, caus
Meaning produced; made; generated; caused to appear; lit. caused to go up
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ud + pāde + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Antonym anuppādita
Synonym abhinibbatta, abhinimmita, pakata, samuṭṭhāpita
Sanskrit utpādita
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

paṇḍito uppāditadhanañ'ca, ābhatadhanañ'ca sabbaṃ tassā mātāpitūnaṃ datvā samassāsetvā sasure āpucchitvā taṃ ādāya nagar'ābhimukho agamāsi.

JAa 542 umaṅgajātakavaṇṇanā
uppādī

adj. having nature to arise; bound to arise [ud + √pad] ✗
uppādetabba

ptp. should be produced; should be generated; lit. to cause to be arisen [ud + √pad + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of uppādeti, caus
Meaning should be produced; should be generated; lit. to cause to be arisen
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ud + pāde + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Synonym janetabba
Commentary (DNa) uppādetabbo'ti nipphādetabbo.
Sanskrit utpādayitavya
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

eko, āvuso, dhammo bahukāro, eko dhammo bhāvetabbo, eko dhammo pariññeyyo, eko dhammo pahātabbo, eko dhammo hānabhāgiyo, eko dhammo visesabhāgiyo, eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho, eko dhammo uppādetabbo, eko dhammo abhiññeyyo, eko dhammo sacchikātabbo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ

katamo eko dhammo uppādetabbo? akuppaṃ ñāṇaṃ. ayaṃ eko dhammo uppādetabbo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
uppādetabbadhammasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.193 (AN10.193) ✗
uppādetabbasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.149 (AN10.149) ✗
uppādetar

masc. (+acc) generator; producer; who gives rise (to); lit. who causes to arise [ud + √pad + *e + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from uppādeti, caus (+acc)
Meaning generator; producer; who gives rise (to); lit. who causes to arise
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ud + pāde + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Synonym sañjanetar, sañjānetar
Commentary (MNa) tesu pāpakaṃ cittaṃ uppādetā'ti. na mayā tesu pāpakaṃ cittam'pi uppāditan'ti attho.
Sanskrit utpādayitṛ
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, abhijānāmi tesu pāpakaṃ cittaṃ uppādetā. idaṃsu me, sāriputta, upekkhāvihārasmiṃ hoti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
uppādeti

pr. (+acc) produces; generates; causes; gives rise to; lit. causes to arise [ud + √pad + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of uppajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning produces; generates; causes; gives rise to; lit. causes to arise
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ud + pāde + ti
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Synonym abhijāyati, āpādeti, āharati, uppādayati, janeti, nipphādeti, pavatteti, pasavati, pātukaroti, savati
Sanskrit utpādayati
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

iti purāṇañ'ca vedanaṃ paṭihaṅkhāma navañ'ca vedanaṃ na uppādessāma yātrā ca no bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsu vihāro cā'ti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

Variant upacāla

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ sambahulehi abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ, āyasmatā ca pālena, āyasmatā uppālena, āyasmatā ca kakkaṭena, āyasmatā ca kavimbhena, āyasmatā ca kaṭena, āyasmatā ca kaṭissahena, aññehi ca abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ.

Construction ud + √plu > pilu + a

Phonetic Change plu > pilu

Variant ubbila

Base √plu + a > pilava
Construction ud + pilava + ti

Meaning due to elation; because of exhilaration
Construction uppila + adhikaraṇaṃ
uppilāva

masc. (+gen) (something which causes) excitement; stirring up (of); lit. swinging up; springing up [ud + √plu + a + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from uppilavati (+gen)
Meaning (something which causes) excitement; stirring up (of); lit. swinging up; springing up
Root Family ud √plu
Root √plu･1 a (spring, swing)
Base √plu + a > pilava
Construction ud + pilava > pilāva + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > āv
Commentary (UDa) manaso uppilāvā'ti cetaso uppilāvitattakarā.
Sanskrit utpru
Sanskrit Root √pru 1 (spring)

Example

khuddā vitakkā sukhumā vitakkā,
anugatā manaso uppilāvā,
ete avidvā manaso vitakke,
hurā huraṃ dhāvati bhantacitto.

UD 31 meghiyasuttaṃ
uppilāvita

pp. elated; exhilarated; excited [ud + √plu] ✗
uppilāvitatta

Meaning elation; exhilaration; excitement; lit. jumping up state

Root √plu･1 *e (spring, swing)
Base √plu + *e > plāve > pilāve (caus, irreg)

uppilāvita + tta

Phonetic Change d > p
u > āv
Synonym uppila, ubbila, ubbilla, macchara
Commentary (MNa) uppilāvitattan'ti uppilāpanapīti.
Sanskrit utpru
Sanskrit Root √pru 1 (spring)

Example

tatra ce, bhikkhave, pare tathāgataṃ sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa na hoti ānando na somanassaṃ na cetaso uppilāvitattaṃ.

Example

v > b

Examples

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ

mataṃ me jīvitā seyyaṃ, tasmā araññaṃ pavisitvā ubbandhitvā marissāmī'ti araññaṃ gato maraṇabhayatajjito paṭinivatti.

VVa 1.3.5 guttilavimānavaṇṇanā
ubbaripetavatthu

nt. Petavatthu 25 (PV 25) ✗
ubbarivagga

masc. Chapter 2 of the Petavatthu (PV 13-25) ✗
ubbahati

pr. (+acc) pulls out, takes away, lifts [ud + √vah] ✗
ubbahana

nt. lifting, bearing, pulling out [ud + √vah] ✗
ubbahāpeti

pr. (+acc) makes transport; causes to carry; (comm) cause to bring to the threshing floor [ud + √vah + *āpe + ti] ~

Meaning makes transport; causes to carry; (comm) cause to bring to the threshing floor

Construction ud + bahāpe + ti
Phonetic Change d > b
Commentary (ANa) ubbahāpeyyā'ti khalaṭṭhānaṃ āharāpeyya.
Sanskrit udvāhayati
Sanskrit Root √vah 1 (carry)
ubbahāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having made transport; having caused to carry; (comm) having caused to bring to the threshing floor [ud + √vah + *āpe + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of ubbahāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having made transport; having caused to carry; (comm) having caused to bring to the threshing floor
Root Family ud √vah
Root √vah･1 *āpe (carry, bring)
Base √vah + *āpe > vāhāpe > bahāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ud + bahāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change d > b
Sanskrit udvahayitvā
Sanskrit Root √vah 1 (carry)
ubbahi

aor. (+acc) pulled out, took away, lifted [ud + √vah] ✗
ubbādha

masc. harassment; trouble; annoyance [ud + √bādh + a] ~

Grammar masc, from ubbādhati
Meaning harassment; trouble; annoyance
Root Family ud √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ud + √bādh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > b
Synonym vighāta
Sanskrit udbādh (burst forth)
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Meaning harassing; troubling; annoying; lit. making affliction

Synonym ubbādhika, viheṭhaka, vihesaka

pr. harasses; troubles; annoys [ud + √bādh] ✗
ubbādhanā

fem. oppressing, harassing; paining [ud + √bādh] ✗
ubbādhika

adj. harassing; troubling; annoying [ud + √bādh + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from ubbādhati
Meaning harassing; troubling; annoying
Root Family ud √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ud + √bādh + ika
Derivative kita (ika)
Synonym ubbādhakara, viheṭhaka, vihesaka
Commentary (DNa) ubbādhikan'ti akkosayuttattā ābādhakariṃ
Sanskrit ud + bādhaka
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

akkosabhaṇḍanavihesakāriṃ,
ubbādhikaṃ bahujanappamaddanaṃ,
abāḷhaṃ giraṃ so na bhaṇi pharusaṃ,
madhuraṃ bhaṇi susaṃhitaṃ sakhilaṃ.

ubbāhikāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.33 (AN10.33) ✗

ubbāḷha

pp. troubled, annoyed, harassed [ud + √bādh] ✗
ubbigga 1

pp. agitated; frantic; anxious; lit. shaken up [ud + √vij + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ubbijjati
Meaning agitated; frantic; anxious; lit. shaken up
Root Family ud √vij
Root √vij･3 ya (shake, be afraid, be in awe)
Construction ud + √vij > bij + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dv > bb
jt > gg
Sanskrit udvigna
Sanskrit Root √vij 1, 6 (tremble)

Example

niccaṃ utrastam'idaṃ cittaṃ,
niccaṃ ubbiggam'idaṃ mano,
anuppannesu kicchesu,
atho uppatitesu ca,
sace atthi anutrastaṃ,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

SN 2.17 subrahmasuttaṃ
ubbigga 2

pp. startled; terrified; frightened; lit. shaken up [ud + √vij + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ubbijjati
Meaning startled; terrified; frightened; lit. shaken up
Root Family ud √vij
Root √vij･3 ya (shake, be afraid, be in awe)
Construction ud + √vij > bij + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dv > bb
jt > gg
Antonym anubbigga
Synonym utrasta, tajjita, bhīta, saṃvijita
Sanskrit udvigna
Sanskrit Root √vij 1, 6 (tremble)

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, evaṃ rakkhito gopito santo bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrāsī vihāsiṃ. eta'r'ahi kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, araññagato'pi rukkhamūlagato'pi suññ'āgāragato'pi eko abhīto anubbiggo anussaṅkī anutrāsī app'ossukko pannalomo paradattavutto, migabhūtena cetasā viharāmi.

UD 20 bhaddiyasuttaṃ

ubbiggā tasitā bhītā,
bhantā byāthitamānasā,
mahājanā samāgamma,
dīpaṅkaram'upāgamuṃ.

nt. anxiety, fear and dread [ubbega + uttāsa + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning anxiety, fear and dread
Construction ubbega + uttāsa + bhaya
Commentary (DNa) ubbegauttāsabhayan'ti ubbegabhayañ'c'eva uttāsabhayañ'ca. tattha corato vā rājato vā paccatthikato vā vilopanabandhan'ādinissayaṃ bhayaṃ ubbego nāma, taṃmuhuttikaṃ caṇḍahatthiass'ādīni vā ahiyakkh'ādayo vā paṭicca lomahaṃsanakaraṃ bhayaṃ uttāsabhayaṃ nāma. taṃ sabbaṃ apanuditā vūpasametā.
ubbegauttāsabhayāpanūdana

ubbha

ind. above; up; on top ✓

Grammar ind, adv, in comps
Meaning above; up; on top
Antonym adho
Synonym upari
Variant uddhaṃ
Commentary (VINa) yassa adhonābhi ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalan'ti yassa bhikkhuno nābhiyā heṭṭhā jāṇumaṇḍalānaṃ upari.
Sanskrit ūrdhva

Examples

kaṇḍuppaṭicchādi nāma yassa adhonābhi ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kaṇḍu vā pīḷakā vā assāvo vā thullakacchu vā ābādho, tassa paṭicchādan'atthāya.

ubbhaṭṭhaka

masc. ascetic who practices continuous standing; ascetic who practices self-immolation by standing upright [ubbha + ṭha + ka] ✓

Meaning ascetic who practices continuous standing; ascetic who practices self-immolation by standing upright

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
ubbhaṭṭhakamatta

nt. mere fact of practising continuous standing [ubbhaṭṭhaka + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mere fact of practising continuous standing
Construction ubbhaṭṭhaka + matta
Sanskrit ūrdhvasthiti + mātra

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, ubbhaṭṭhakassa ubbhaṭṭhakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, pariyāyabhattikassa pariyāyabhattikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, mantajjhāyakassa mantajjhāyakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

DHP 340 taṇhāvaggo
ubbhijjati

Example

atha kho tamhā'va udakarahadā sītā vāridhārā ubbhijjitvā tam'eva udakarahadaṃ sītena vārinā abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripūreyya paripphareyya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ubbhitodaka

adj. with water welling up; with spring water; lit. water breaking up [ubbhida + udaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with water welling up; with spring water; lit. water breaking up
Construction ubbhida > ubbhita + udaka
Phonetic Change d > r
Compound kammadhāraya (ubbhita + udaka)
Variant ubbhidodaka
Commentary (DNa) ubbhid'odako'ti ubbhinnaudako, na heṭṭhā ubbhijjitvā uggacchanakaudako. anto'y'eva pana ubbhijjanakaudako'ti attho
Sanskrit udbhida + udaka

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakarahado ubbhit'odako. tassa n'ev'assa puratthimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ ... devo ca na kālena kālaṃ sammādhāraṃ anuppaveccheyya.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ubbhida 1

adj. welling up; bursting up; lit. breaking up [ud + √bhid + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from ubbhindati
Meaning welling up; bursting up; lit. breaking up
Root Family ud √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction ud + √bhid + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > b
Sanskrit udbhida
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave udakarahado ubbhida-udako

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ubbhida 2

masc. well; spring; lit. break up [ud + √bhid + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ubbhindati
Meaning well; spring; lit. break up
Root Family ud √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction ud + √bhid + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > b
Sanskrit udbhida
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave udakarahado ubbhida-udako

nt. kitchen salt [ud + √bhid] ✗

Variant ubbhitodaka
Commentary (DNa) ubbhid'odako'ti ubbhinnaudako, na heṭṭhā ubbhijjitvā uggacchanakaudako. anto'y'eva pana ubbhijjanakaudako'ti attho

Example

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ubbhindati

pr. breaks through (transitive); breaks through, bursts through (intrans.); springs up [ud + √bhid] ✗
ubbhinditvā

abs. having broken [ud + √bhid] ✗
ubbhinna 1

pp. sprung up; welled up; lit. broken up [ud + √bhid + na] ~

Grammar pp of ubbhijjati
Meaning sprung up; welled up; lit. broken up
Root Family ud √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction ud + √bhid + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > b
d > n
Sanskrit udbhinna
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)
ubbhinna 2

pp. sprouted [ud + √bhid] ✗
ubbhinnaudaka

adj. with water which has sprung up [ubbhinna + udaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with water which has sprung up
Construction ubbhinna + udaka
ubbhujati

pr. lifts up, raises one's under garment up [ud + √bhuj] ✗
ubbhuji

aor. lifted up, raised one's under garment up [ud + √bhuj] ✗
ubbhujitvā

abs. having pulled up (one's clothes) [ud + √bhuj] ✗
ubbhujitvāna

abs. having pulled up (one's clothes) [ud + √bhuj] ✗
ubbhegauttāsabhayāpanūdana

adj. dispelling anxiety, fear and dread [ubbhega + uttāsa + bhaya + apanūdana] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dispelling anxiety, fear and dread
Construction ubbhega + uttāsa + bhaya + apanūdana
ubha

pron. both ✓

Grammar pron, base
Meaning both
Sanskrit ubha

Example

appamādaṃ pasaṃsanti,
puññakiriyāsu paṇḍitā,
appamatto ubho atthe,
adhiggaṇhāti paṇḍito.

SN 3.17 attabyābādhasuttaṃ
ubhato

ind. (+gen) both; on both sides (of); in both ways; dually; lit. from both [ubha + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ubha (+gen)
Meaning both; on both sides (of); in both ways; dually; lit. from both
Construction ubha + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Antonym ekato
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubhayatas

Examples

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ubhato bhaṭṭho ubhato parihīno, seyyathā'pi sā gāvī pabbateyyā bālā abyattā akhettaññū akusalā visame pabbate carituṃ.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca. yassaṃ disāyaṃ aññe'pi bhaddā ass'ājānīyā jāyanti, tassaṃ disāyaṃ jāto hoti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
ubhatoanavassuta

adj. neither having lust; both being unaroused; lit. both not flooded [ubhato + anavassuta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning neither having lust; both being unaroused; lit. both not flooded
Construction ubhato + anavassuta
ubhatoavassuta

adj. both having lust; both being aroused; lit. both flooded [ubhato + avassuta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning both having lust; both being aroused; lit. both flooded
Construction ubhato + avassuta
Commentary (VINa) tattha ubhatoavassute'ti ubhatoavassave, bhikkhuniyā c'eva purisassa ca kāyasaṃsaggarāgena avassutabhāve satī'ti attho.
ubhatokāja

masc. carrying pole with a load at each end ✗
ubhatokoṭika

adj. (of a question) two-pronged; double-sided; double-edged [ubhato + koṭika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of a question) two-pronged; double-sided; double-edged
Construction ubhato + koṭika
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhato + koṭika)
Sanskrit ubhayatas + koṭika

Example

imaṃ kho te, rājakumāra, samaṇo gotamo ubhatokoṭikaṃ pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno n'eva sakkhiti uggilituṃ na sakkhiti ogilituṃ.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
ubhatokoṭikapañha

nt. dilemma, two-pronged question ✗
ubhatodaṇḍaka

adj. two-handled; double-handled; with handles on both sides [ubhato + daṇḍa + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning two-handled; double-handled; with handles on both sides
Construction ubhato + daṇḍa + ka
ubhatodaṇḍa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhato + daṇḍaka)
Sanskrit ubhayatas + daṇḍaka

Examples

ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

vuttaṃ kho pan'etaṃ bhagavatā kakac'ūpam'ovāde, ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya na me so tena sāsanakaro'ti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
ubhatodhāra

adj. sharpened on both sides; double-edged; double-bladed [ubhato + dhāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sharpened on both sides; double-edged; double-bladed
Construction ubhato + dhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhato + dhāra)
Antonym ekatodhāra
Sanskrit ubhayatas + dhārā

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, matajaṃ nāma āvudhajātaṃ ubhatodhāraṃ pītanisitaṃ. tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṃ sampaliveṭhitaṃ. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

satthaṃ nāma ekatodhāraṃ ubhatodhāraṃ paharaṇaṃ.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
ubhatopakkhaṃ

ind. in this double manner; in this dual way; in a double whammy; lit. from both sides [ubhato + pakkha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of ubhatopakkha
Meaning in this double manner; in this dual way; in a double whammy; lit. from both sides
Construction ubhato + pakkha + aṃ
ubhatopakkha + aṃ
Commentary (MNa) ubhatopakkhan'ti sukhaṃ ekaṃ pakkhaṃ dukkhaṃ ekaṃ pakkhan'ti evaṃ ubhatopakkhaṃ hutvā.
Sanskrit ubhayataḥpakṣa

Example

yassa kassaci, aggivessana, evaṃ ubhatopakkhaṃ uppannā'pi sukhā vedanā cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati abhāvitattā kāyassa, uppannā'pi dukkhā vedanā cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati abhāvitattā cittassa, evaṃ kho, aggivessana, abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca.

Meaning falling on both sides

adj. burnt at both end; scorched on both sides [ubhato + paditta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning burnt at both end; scorched on both sides
Construction ubhato + paditta
Commentary (SNa) ubhatopadittaṃ majjhe gūthagatan'ti pamāṇena aṭṭhaṅgulamattaṃ dvīsu ṭhānesu ādittaṃ majjhe gūthamakkhitaṃ. (VISMa) ubhatopadittan'ti ubhosu koṭīsu daḍḍhaṃ.

Meaning with both (husband and wife) having faith
Construction ubhato + pasanna

ubhatopassa

nt. both sides ✗
ubhatobyañjanaka

adj. hermaphrodite; with male and female sexual characteristics [ubhato + byañjanaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning hermaphrodite; with male and female sexual characteristics
Construction ubhato + byañjanaka
Commentary (VINa) ubhatobyañjanā'ti itthinimittena ca purisanimittena cā'ti ubhohi byañjanehi samannāgatā.
Sanskrit ubhayavyañjana
ubhatobyūḷha

adj. arrayed on both sides [ubhato + byūḷha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning arrayed on both sides
Construction ubhato + byūḷha
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhato + byūḷha)
Commentary (MNa) ubhatobyūḷan'ti ubhato rāsibhūtaṃ.
Sanskrit ubhayatas + vyūḍha

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu asicammaṃ gahetvā, dhanukalāpaṃ sannayhitvā, ubhatobyūḷhaṃ saṅgāmaṃ pakkhandanti usūsu'pi khippamānesu, sattīsu'pi khippamānāsu, asīsu'pi vijjotalantesu.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
ubhatobhaṭṭhajātaka

nt. Jātaka 139 (JA 139) ✗
ubhatobhāga

adj. on both sides; in both ways; lit. both parts [ubhato + bhāga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning on both sides; in both ways; lit. both parts
Construction ubhato + bhāga
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhato + bhāga)
Sanskrit ubhayatas + bhāga

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma umāpupphaṃ nīlaṃ nīlavaṇṇaṃ nīlanidassanaṃ nīlanibhāsaṃ, seyyathā vā pana taṃ vatthaṃ bārāṇaseyyakaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhaṃ nīlaṃ nīlavaṇṇaṃ nīlanidassanaṃ nīlanibhāsaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo ubhatobhāgavimutto.

MN 70 kīṭāgirisuttaṃ
ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭha

adj. smoothed on both sides; softened on both sides [ubhato + bhāga + vimaṭṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning smoothed on both sides; softened on both sides
Construction ubhato + bhāga + vimaṭṭha
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhatobhāga + vimaṭṭha)
Commentary (MNa) ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti maṇipāsāṇena ubhosu passesu suṭṭhu vimaṭṭhaṃ ghaṭṭetvā uppāditacchaviṃ.
Sanskrit ubhayatas + bhāga + vimṛṣṭa

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma umāpupphaṃ nīlaṃ nīlavaṇṇaṃ nīlanidassanaṃ nīlanibhāsaṃ, seyyathā vā pana taṃ vatthaṃ bārāṇaseyyakaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhaṃ nīlaṃ nīlavaṇṇaṃ nīlanidassanaṃ nīlanibhāsaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṃ rajakaputtaṃ evaṃ vadehi, icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
ubhatobhāgavimutta

ubhatomukha

Construction ubhato + mukha
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhato + mukha)
Sanskrit ubhaya + mukha

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave ubhatomukhā putoḷi pūrā nānāvihitassa dhaññassa seyyath'idaṃ sālīnaṃ vīhīnaṃ muggānaṃ māsānaṃ tilānaṃ taṇḍulānaṃ

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

dhitipparaṃ kiṃ mama citta kāhisi,
na te alaṃ citta vas'ānuvattako,
na jātu bhastaṃ ubhatomukhaṃ chupe,
dhi'r'atthu pūraṃ nava sotasandaniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
ubhatolohitakūpadhāna

adj. with red pillows both sides; (comm) with red cushions for head and feet [ubhato + lohitaka + upadhāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with red pillows both sides; (comm) with red cushions for head and feet
Construction ubhato + lohitaka + upadhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhato + lohitakūpadhāna)
Variant ubhato lohitakūpadhāno
Commentary (ANa) ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāno'ti sīs'ūpadhānañ'ca pād'ūpadhānañ'cā'ti pallaṅkassa ubhato ṭhapitalohitak'ūpadhāno.
Sanskrit ubhayatas + rohitaka + upadhāna

Examples

kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodh'ābhibhūto kodhapareto, kiñ'cā'pi so pallaṅke seti gonak'atthate paṭalik'atthate kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇe sauttaracchade ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāne, atha kho so dukkhaññ'eva seti kodh'ābhibhūto.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

tatr'assa pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāno

ubhanta

masc. both sides; both ends [ubha + anta] ✓

Meaning both sides; both ends

Variant ubhonta
Sanskrit ubha + anta

Example

so ubh'antam'abhiññāya,
majjhe mantā na lippati,
taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso'ti,
so idha sibbinim'accagā'ti.

SNP 57 tissametteyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 2
ubhaya

adj. both; referring to two things [ubha + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ubha, irreg
Meaning both; referring to two things
Construction ubha + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubhaya

Examples

tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha tato tvaṃ bāhiya n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.

SN 37.34 vaḍḍhīsuttaṃ
ubhayacchikāṇa

adj. blind in both eyes ✗
ubhayato

ind. as to both; on both sides ✗
ubhayattha 1

ind. in both cases; on both sides; lit. both matters [ubhaya + attha] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning in both cases; on both sides; lit. both matters
Construction ubhaya + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ubhayassa + attha)
Commentary (ANa) ubhay'attha kaliggāho'ti ubhay'esam'pi diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikānaṃ atthānaṃ kaliggāho, parājayaggāho'ti attho. (DHPa) idam'assa paraloke vipākasocanaṃ. evaṃ so ubhay'attha socati'y'eva.
Sanskrit ubhayatra

Examples

idha socati pecca socati,
pāpakārī ubhay'attha socati,
so socati so vihaññati,
disvā kammakiliṭṭham'attano.

DHP 15 yamakavaggo

sace kho atth'eva paro loko, evaṃ imassa bhoto purisapuggalassa ubhay'attha kaṭaggaho, yañ'ca diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ pāsaṃso, yañ'ca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissati.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ubhayattha 2

masc. benefit of both; welfare of both [ubhaya + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning benefit of both; welfare of both
Construction ubhaya + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ubhayassa + attha)
Synonym ubhayahita
Sanskrit ubhayārtha

Examples

att'atthaṃ vā ñassati par'atthaṃ vā ñassati ubhay'atthaṃ vā ñassati uttariṃ vā manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikarissatī'ti n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

AN 5.51 āvaraṇasuttaṃ

ubhay'atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam'eva appamādena sampādetun'ti

SN 12.22 dhamma-pahaṃsāna
ubhayatthasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 23 (ITI 23) ✗
ubhayathā

ind. in both ways; in both cases [ubha] ✗
ubhayanta

masc. both ends; both extremes ✗
ubhayantarena

ind. in-between the two [ubhaya + antara + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of ubhayantara
Meaning in-between the two
Construction ubhaya + antara + ena
ubhayantara + ena
Compound abyayībhāva (ubhaya + antarena)
Variant ubhayamantarena
Sanskrit ubhaya + antareṇa

Example

yo sukhaṃ dukkhato adda,
dukkham'addakkhi sallato,
ubhay'antarena n'āhosi,
kena lokasmi kiṃ siyā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
ubhayabyābādha

masc. hurting both; affliction of both; harm to both (self and other) [ubhaya + byābādha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning hurting both; affliction of both; harm to both (self and other)
Construction ubhaya + byābādha
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ubhayāya + byābādha)
Variant ubhayavyābādha
Sanskrit ubhaya + vyābādha

Examples

yaṃ nu kho ahaṃ idaṃ kāyena kammaṃ kattu'kāmo idaṃ me kāyakammaṃ attabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, parabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, ubhayabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhu, paṇḍito mahāpañño n'ev'attabyābādhāya ceteti na parabyābādhāya ceteti na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti attahita-parahita-ubhayahita-sabbalokahitam'eva cintayamāno cinteti.

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ
ubhayamantare

ind. between the two; within the two ✗
ubhayamantarena

ind. in-between the two [ubhayaṃ + antara + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of ubhayamantara
Meaning in-between the two
Construction ubhayaṃ + antara + ena
ubhayamantara + ena
Compound abyayībhāva (ubhayaṃ + antarena)
Variant ubhayantarena, ubhayamantare
Sanskrit ubhaya + antareṇa

Examples

yato tvaṃ, māluṅkyaputta, na tattha, tato tvaṃ, māluṅkyaputta, n'ev'idha, na huraṃ, na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 74 catutthanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
ubhayametaṃ

sandhi. both of these; both of them [ubhayaṃ + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + pron
Meaning both of these; both of them
Construction ubhayaṃ + etaṃ
Sanskrit ubhayam + etam

Examples

ye ca diṭṭhadhammikā kāmā, ye ca samparāyikā kāmā, yā ca diṭṭhadhammikā kāmasaññā, yā ca samparāyikā kāmasaññā, ubhayam'etaṃ māradheyyaṃ, mārass'esa visayo, mārass'esa nivāpo, mārass'esa gocaro.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ taṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ, āpattiṃ āpanno'ti. jānanti maṃ bhikkhū āpattiṃ āpanno'ti, iti so kupito hoti appatīto. yo c'eva kho, āvuso, kopo yo ca appaccayo, ubhayam'etaṃ aṅgaṇaṃ.

ubhayasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.166 (AN4.166) ✗

Example

idha, bhikkhu, paṇḍito mahāpañño n'ev'attabyābādhāya ceteti na parabyābādhāya ceteti na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti attahita-parahita-ubhayahita-sabbalokahitam'eva cintayamāno cinteti

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ
ubhayaṃ

ind. also, as well (usually following ca) ✗
ubhayaṃsa

masc. both parts; both sides; both aspects [ubhaya + aṃsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning both parts; both sides; both aspects
Construction ubhaya + aṃsa
Compound kammadhāraya (ubhaya + aṃsa)
Commentary (MNa) ubhay'aṃsaṃ ... ubhay'antaṃ ubhayakoṭṭhāsaṃ
Sanskrit ubhaya + aṃśa

Example

evam'ass'āyaṃ apaṇṇako dhammo susamatto samādinno, ubhay'aṃsaṃ pharitvā tiṭṭhati, riñcati akusalaṃ ṭhānaṃ.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ubhayaṃsabhāvita

adj. developed in both parts; practiced for both aspects or objects; (ubhayaṃsa) ✗
ubhayena

ind. on both sides; in both ways ✗
ubhinnamattha

masc. benefit of both; good of both parties [ubhinnaṃ + attha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning benefit of both; good of both parties
Construction ubhinnaṃ + attha
ubhinnaṃ 1

pron. to both; for both [ubha] ✗
ubhinnaṃ 2

pron. of both [ubha + innaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, gen pl of ubha
Meaning of both
Construction ubha + innaṃ
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.9) ubhinnan'ti dvinnaṃ.
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubhayoḥ

Examples

ubhinnam'atthaṃ carati,
attano ca parassa ca,
paraṃ saṅkupitaṃ ñatvā,
yo sato upasammati.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

ubhinnaṃ tikicchantānaṃ,
attano ca parassa ca,
janā maññanti bālo'ti,
ye dhammassa akovidā'ti.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ
ubhe

pron. both [ubha + e] ✓

Grammar pron, nom pl of ubha
Meaning both
Construction ubha + e
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubhe

Examples

326, 341. ubhe tappurisā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 326

ubhe digukammadhārayasamāsā tappurisasaññā honti.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 326
ubho

pron. both [ubha + o] ✓

Grammar pron, nom and acc pl of ubha
Meaning both
Construction ubha + o
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubhe, ubhān

Examples

tassa te nāga nāgassa,
mahāvīrassa bhāsato,
sabbe dev'ānumodanti,
ubho nāradapabbatā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

mam'eva kata maññantu,
gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu,
kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

DHP 74 bālavaggo
ubhonta

masc. both sides; both ends; both extremes [ubho + anta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning both sides; both ends; both extremes
Construction ubho + anta
Compound kammadhāraya (ubho + anta)
Variant ubhanta
Sanskrit ubha + anta

Example

yo ubho'nte viditvāna,
majjhe mantā na lippati,
taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso'ti,
so'dha sibbinim'accagā'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning and both; as well as
Construction ubho + api
Sanskrit ubhe + api

Examples

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

abhūtavādī nirayaṃ upeti,
yo vā'pi katvā na karomi c'āha,
ubho'pi te pecca samā bhavanti,
nihīnakammā manujā parattha.

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning victory in both worlds; success here and hereafter
Construction ubholoka + vijaya
ubhova

sandhi. both together [ubho + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning both together
Construction ubho + eva
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.9) ubho'va santā ekenā'ti dve'pi janā ekena.
Sanskrit ubhe + eva

Examples

ehi dāni, āvuso, ubho'va santā imaṃ gaṇaṃ pariharāmā'ti. iti kho, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo ācariyo me samāno attano antevāsiṃ maṃ samānaṃ attanā samasamaṃ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṃ pūjāya pūjesi.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

sādhu vata maṃ āyasmanto imehi paccekacīvaracetāpannehi evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādetha ubho'va santā ekenā'ti kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 9 dutiyaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ
ubhosaṅga

masc. both attachments, attachment to both ✗

Meaning in both; on both

Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubheṣu

Examples

phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno,
na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

tassā ubhosu tīresu kāsā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, kusā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, pabbajā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, bīraṇā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, rukkhā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ.

masc. wrong way; side road; deviation; diversion [ud + √magg + a] ✓

Meaning wrong way; side road; deviation; diversion

Root √magg･8 *e (seek, search)

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako, hupeyya'p'āvuso'ti vatvā sīsaṃ okampetvā ummaggaṃ gahetvā pakkāmi.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ummagga 2.1

masc. coming up with question; emergence of an enquiry; lit. emergence [ud + √mujj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ummujjati
Meaning coming up with question; emergence of an enquiry; lit. emergence
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Construction ud + √mujj > majj > magg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > m
j > g
Variant ummaṅga
Commentary (ANa) ummaggo'ti pañh'ummaggo.
Sanskrit unmajjana
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

Examples

sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu! bhaddako kho te, bhikkhu, ummaggo, bhaddakaṃ paṭibhānaṃ, kalyāṇī paripucchā

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalena saddhiṃ sākacchāyamāno evaṃ jānāti, yathā kho imassa āyasmato ummaggo yathā ca abhinīhāro yathā ca pañhāsamudāhāro, duppañño ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā paññavā.

AN 4.192 ṭhānasuttaṃ
ummagga 2.2

masc. emergence; surfacing [ud + √mujj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ummujjati, intrans
Meaning emergence; surfacing
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Construction ud + √mujj > majj > magg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > m
j > g
Antonym nimujjamāna
Sanskrit unmajjana
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso udakarahadassa tīre ṭhito passeyya parittaṃ macchaṃ ummujjamānaṃ. tassa evam'assa, yathā kho imassa macchassa ummaggo yathā ca ūmighāto yathā ca vegāyitattaṃ, paritto ayaṃ maccho, nāyaṃ maccho mahanto'ti.

masc. tunnel [ud + √magg] ✗
