ummatta

pp. mad; insane; crazy; loony; nuts; lit. maddened [ud + √mad + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ummajjati
Meaning mad; insane; crazy; loony; nuts; lit. maddened
Root Family ud √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction ud + √mad + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit unmatta
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

evaṃ vutte, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto upāliṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca, ummatto'si tvaṃ, gahapati, datto'si tvaṃ, gahapati!

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

kiṃ ummatto'si, nanu idān'eva divākaro atthaṅ'gato, so kathaṃ imaṃ puṇṇacandaṃ anubandhamāno uggacchissati?

DNa 2.4.2 mahāsudassanasuttavaṇṇanā
ummattaka 1

masc. madman; crazy; lunatic; loony; nut-job [ud + √mad + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from ummatta
Meaning madman; crazy; lunatic; loony; nut-job
Root Family ud √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction ud + √mad + ta + ka
ummatta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit unmattaka
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

nanu dubbhissasi maṃ punappunaṃ,
muhuṃ muhuṃ cāraṇikaṃ'va dassayaṃ,
ummattaken'eva mayā palobhasi,
kiñ'cā'pi te citta virādhitaṃ mayā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

saññasaññino vuccanti ye pakatisaññāya ṭhitā, na'pi so pakatisaññāya ṭhito. visaññasaññino vuccanti ummattakā ye ca khittacittā, na'pi so ummattako, no'pi khittacitto'ti.

NIDD1 11 kalahavivāda suttaniddesa
ummattaka 2

nt. madness; insanity; lunacy [ud + √mad + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from ummatta
Meaning madness; insanity; lunacy
Root Family ud √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction ud + √mad + ta + ka
ummatta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > t
Synonym ummāda
Sanskrit unmattaka
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Example

ruṇṇam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ gītaṃ. ummattakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ naccaṃ. komārakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ ativelaṃ dantavidaṃsakahasitaṃ.

ummattakabhāva

masc. madness; insanity; lunacy ✗
ummattakasaṃvattanika

adj. leading to madness; conducive to insanity [ummattaka + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to madness; conducive to insanity
Construction ummattaka + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ummattakāya + saṃvattanika)
Commentary (ANa) ummattakasaṃvattaniko hotī'ti ummattakabhāvaṃ saṃvatteti. tena hi manusso ummatto vā khittacitto vā eḷamūgo vā hoti. ayaṃ surāpānassa nissando.
Sanskrit unmattaka + saṃvartanīya

Example

surāmerayapānaṃ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ nirayasaṃvattanikaṃ tiracchānayonisaṃvattanikaṃ pettivisayasaṃvattanikaṃ. yo sabbalahuso surāmerayapānassa vipāko, manussabhūtassa ummattakasaṃvattaniko hotī'ti. dasamaṃ.

ummadanta + ī

Sanskrit unmādinī

nt. making rub; causing to massage [ud + √madd + *āpe + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from ummaddāpeti, caus
Meaning making rub; causing to massage

Root √madd･1 *āpe (crush, grind)

Construction ud + maddāpe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change d > m
Sanskrit unmardana
Sanskrit Root √mṛd √mrad 1, 9 (rub, crush)
ummaddāpeti

pr. causes (someone) to massage or rub (with unguents) [ud + √madd] ✗
ummaddeti

pr. massages, rubs (with unguents) [ud + √madd] ✗
ummasati

pr. touches; strokes in an upward direction; lifts [ud + √mas] ✗
ummasanā

fem. stroking upwards; lifting [ud + √mas] ✗
ummā

fem. linseed, flax ✗
ummāda

masc. madness; insanity; lunacy [ud + √mad + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning madness; insanity; lunacy
Root Family ud √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction ud + √mad > mād + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ummattaka, cittakkhepa
Commentary (ANa) ummādassā'ti ummattakabhāvassa.
Sanskrit unmāda
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

mandattā momūhattā aññaṃ byākaroti, pāpiccho icchāpakato aññaṃ byākaroti, ummādā cittakkhepā aññaṃ byākaroti, adhimānena aññaṃ byākaroti, samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaroti.

AN 5.93 byākaraṇasuttaṃ

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, acinteyyāni, na cintetabbāni, yāni cintento ummādassa vighātassa bhāgī assa. katamāni cattāri?

AN 4.77 acinteyyasuttaṃ
ummādana

adj. that which is maddening ✗
ummādananta

adj. ending in causing intoxication, with intoxication as its end ✗
ummādantījātaka

nt. Jātaka 527 (JA 527) ✗
ummādaṃ pāpuṇāti

idiom. goes mad; goes insane ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning goes mad; goes insane
Sanskrit unmādam + prāpnoti

Examples

bhūtapubbaṃ, bho gotama, sārīrikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambho'pi nāma bhavissati, hadayam'pi nāma phalissati, uṇham'pi lohitaṃ mukhato uggamissati, ummādam'pi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

so evam'āha, ahaṃ kho, āvuso, ummādaṃ pāpuṇiṃ cetaso vipariyāsaṃ. tena me ummattakena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ

MN 104 sāmagāmasuttaṃ
ummādita

pp. become made; gone crazy [ud + √mad] ✗
ummāpuppha

masc. flax flower ✗
ummāra

masc. threshold; doorway; entrance ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning threshold; doorway; entrance
Synonym indakhīla, eḷaka
Sanskrit umbara

Examples

kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyyā'ti aññassa ghar'ūpacāraṃ okkamantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa. paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ ummāraṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. dutiyaṃ pādaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.5.6 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ

indakhīlo nāma sayanigharassa ummāro vuccati.

ummukka

pp. untied; loosened; taken off; lit. freed up [ud + √muc + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ud √muc
Meaning untied; loosened; taken off; lit. freed up
Root Family ud √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Construction ud + √muc + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ct > kk
Antonym paṭimukka
Sanskrit unmukta
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu mutto cakkhuviññeyyehi rūpehi, n'āvāsagato mārassa, na mārassa vasaṃ gato, ummukk'assa mārapāso. mutto so mārabandhanena na yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato.

ummukha 1

adj. having one's face upwards, heedless ✗
ummukha 2

adj. fallen down ✗
ummujjati

pr. (+loc) (from water) rises up; emerges [ud + √mujj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning (from water) rises up; emerges
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)

Antonym nimujjati

Examples

tatr'assa kāṇo kacchapo. so vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṃ sakiṃ ummujjeyya.

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ
ummujjana

nt. emergence [ud + √mujj] ✗
ummujjanimujjā

fem. (of earth or water) emerging and diving; lit. sinking up and down [ummujjā + nimujjā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning (of earth or water) emerging and diving; lit. sinking up and down
Construction ummujjā + nimujjā
Compound dvanda (ummujjā ca nimujjā ca)
Commentary (SNa) ummujjanimujjan'ti ummujjanañ'ca nimujjanañ'ca.
Sanskrit unmajjana + nimajjana

Examples

pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā jaṭilā sītāsu hemantikāsu rattīsu antar'aṭṭhake himapātasamaye gayāyaṃ ummujjanti'pi nimujjanti'pi, ummujjanimujjam'pi karonti osiñcanti'pi, aggim'pi juhanti, iminā suddhī'ti.

UD9 jaṭilasuttaṃ
ummujjanta

prp. (from water) rising up; emerging [ud + √mujj + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ummujjati, intrans
Meaning (from water) rising up; emerging
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Base √mujj + a > mujja
Construction ud + mujja + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > m
Antonym nimujjanta
Synonym uppatanta
Sanskrit unmajjat
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu kho kāṇo kacchapo vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṃ sakiṃ ummujjanto amusmiṃ ekacchiggaḷe yuge gīvaṃ paveseyyā'ti?

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ
ummujjamāna

prp. emerging; coming out; surfacing [ud + √mujj + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ummujjati, intrans
Meaning emerging; coming out; surfacing
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Base √mujj + a > mujja
Construction ud + mujja + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change d > m
Antonym nimujjamāna
Synonym vuṭṭhahanta
Sanskrit unmajjamāna
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso udakarahadassa tīre ṭhito passeyya parittaṃ macchaṃ ummujjamānaṃ. tassa evam'assa, yathā kho imassa macchassa ummaggo yathā ca ūmighāto yathā ca vegāyitattaṃ, paritto ayaṃ maccho, nāyaṃ maccho mahanto'ti.

ummujjamānaka

Meaning emergence; coming out; surfacing
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Construction ud + √mujj + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change d > m
Antonym nimujjā
Commentary (SNa) ummujjanimujjan'ti ummujjanañ'ca nimujjanañ'ca.
Sanskrit unmajjana
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ
ummujji

aor. emerged, rose out of water [ud + √mujj] ✗
ummujjitvā

Grammar abs of, intrans (+loc)
Meaning (from water) having risen up; having emerged; lit. having submerged up
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Construction ud + √mujj + itvā
Antonym nimujjitvā
Synonym uggañchitvāna, uggantvā, uṭṭhahitvā
Commentary (ANa) ummujjitvā vipassati viloketī'ti uṭṭhahitvā gantabbadisaṃ vipassati viloketi.
Sanskrit unmajjitvā
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sakiṃ nimuggo nimuggo'va hoti, idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā nimujjati, idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā ṭhito hoti, idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi

Grammar pp of ud √yu (+acc)
Meaning engaged (in); intent (on); actively undertaking
Root Family ud √yu
Root √yu×1 a (unite, fasten)
Construction ud + √yu + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dy > yy
Synonym payutta
Commentary (PMa) uyyutto'ti anekesu kiccesu niccabyāpāratāya katayogo kataussāho, satatakiccesu saussukko'ti attho. ghaṭṭanayutto'ti vā uyyutto.

Sanskrit Root √yu 2, 6, 9 (unite)

Example

ye idha pāṇesu asaññatā janā,
paresam'ādāya vihesam'uyyutā,
dussīlaluddā pharusā anādarā,
es'āmagandho na hi maṃsabhojanaṃ.

Phonetic Change d > y
j > t
Antonym anuyyutta
Synonym payāta

Sanskrit udyukta
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

masc. departure; leaving; setting out [ud + √yuj + *e + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from uyyojeti, caus
Meaning departure; leaving; setting out
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje > yoge + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
j > g
Sanskrit udyoga (exertion)
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

paṇḍupalāso'va dāni'si,
yamapurisā'pi ca te upaṭṭhitā,
uyyogamukhe ca tiṭṭhasi,
pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

DHP 235 malavaggo
uyyoga 2

masc. exertion, effort [ud + √yuj] ✗

paṇḍupalāso'va dāni'si,

u > o

uyyojana 2

uyyojanika 1

nt. dismissing; sending away; lit. up yoking [ud + √yuj + *e + ana + ika] ✓

Grammar nt, from uyyojana, caus
Meaning dismissing; sending away; lit. up yoking
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + ana + ika
uyyojana + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Synonym uyyojana
Commentary (MNa) uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttan'ti gacchatha tumhe'ti evaṃ uyyojanikena vacanena paṭisaṃyuttaṃ. (ANa) uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttan'ti uyyojanikeh'eva vacanehi paṭisaṃyuttaṃ, tesaṃ upaṭṭhānagamanakaṃ'y'evā'ti attho.
Notes see uyyojanika 2
Sanskrit udyuj
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivek'aṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
uyyojanika 2

nt. inspiring; persuading; arousing; lit. up yoking [ud + √yuj + *e + ana + ika] ✓

Grammar nt, from uyyojana, caus
Meaning inspiring; persuading; arousing; lit. up yoking
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + ana + ika
uyyojana + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Notes see uyyojanika 1
Sanskrit udyuj
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivek'aṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyutta 1

adj. concerned with dismissal; interested in sending away [uyyojanika + paṭisaṃyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning concerned with dismissal; interested in sending away
Construction uyyojanika + paṭisaṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uyyojanikena + paṭisaṃyutta)
Commentary (MNa) uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttan'ti gacchatha tumhe'ti evaṃ uyyojanikena vacanena paṭisaṃyuttaṃ. (ANa) uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttan'ti uyyojanikeh'eva vacanehi paṭisaṃyuttaṃ, tesaṃ upaṭṭhānagamanakaṃ'y'evā'ti attho.
Notes see uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyutta 2
Sanskrit udyuj + pratisaṃyukta

Example

tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivek'aṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyutta 2

adj. concerned with inspiring; interested in persuading [uyyojanika + paṭisaṃyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning concerned with inspiring; interested in persuading
Construction uyyojanika + paṭisaṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uyyojanikena + paṭisaṃyutta)
Notes see uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyutta 1
Sanskrit udyuj + pratisaṃyukta

Example

tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivek'aṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
uyyojayati

pr. stimulates, rouses to action; makes go; sends out, sends away, dismisses [ud + √yuj] ✗
uyyojita

pp. instigated, dismissed, sent off [ud + √yuj] ✗
uyyojīyati

pr. (+instr) is dismissed; is sent away (by) [ud + √yuj + *e + īya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of uyyojeti, caus, intrans (+instr)
Meaning is dismissed; is sent away (by)
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e + īya (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e + īya > yojīya (caus, pass)
Construction ud + yojīya + ti
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Sanskrit udyujyate
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)
uyyojīyamāna

prp. (+instr) being dismissed; being sent away (by) [ud + √yuj + *e + īya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of uyyojīyati, caus, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being dismissed; being sent away (by)
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e + īya (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e + īya > yojīya (caus, pass)
Construction ud + yojīya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Sanskrit udyujyamāna
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)
uyyojetabba

ptp. should be dismissed; should be sent away; lit. to cause to be up yoked [ud + √yuj + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of uyyojeti, caus
Meaning should be dismissed; should be sent away; lit. to cause to be up yoked
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Sanskrit udyojayitavya
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

sappaṭibhayaṃ nāma tasmiṃ magge corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti, sappaṭibhayaṃ gantvā appaṭibhayaṃ dassetvā uyyojetabbā, gacchatha bhaginiyo'ti.

VIN 2.5.3.7 saṃvidhānasikkhāpadaṃ
uyyojeti 1

pr. (+acc) dismisses; sends away; sends off; lit. up yokes [ud + √yuj + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of uyyuñjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning dismisses; sends away; sends off; lit. up yokes
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + ti
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Commentary (VIN 2.5.5.2) uyyojeyyā'ti mātugāmena saddhiṃ hasitu'kāmo kīḷitu'kāmo raho nisīditu'kāmo anācāraṃ ācaritu'kāmo evaṃ vadeti, gacch'āvuso
Sanskrit udyojayati
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ, eh'āvuso, gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisissāmā'ti tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti

VIN PAT PC 42 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ

upasampanne upasampannasaññī uyyojeti, āpatti pācittiyassa. upasampanne vematiko uyyojeti, āpatti pācittiyassa. upasampanne anupasampannasaññī uyyojeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.5.2 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ
uyyojeti 2

pr. (+acc) makes (someone) do something; persuades; incites into action; lit. up yokes [ud + √yuj + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of uyyuñjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes (someone) do something; persuades; incites into action; lit. up yokes
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + ti
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Sanskrit udyojayati
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)
uyyojetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to dismiss; to send away; to send off; lit. to up yoke [ud + √yuj + *e + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of uyyojeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to dismiss; to send away; to send off; lit. to up yoke
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + tuṃ
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Sanskrit udyoktum
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññan'ti na añño koci paccayo hoti uyyojetuṃ.

VIN 2.5.5.2 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ
uyyojetvā

abs. (+acc) having dismissed; having sent away; having sent off [ud + √yuj] ✗
uyyojesi 1

aor. (+acc) dismissed; released; sent away; sent off; lit. up yoked [ud + √yuj + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of uyyojeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning dismissed; released; sent away; sent off; lit. up yoked
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + si
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Sanskrit udyuj
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

Example

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
uyyojesi 2

aor. (+acc) instigated [ud + √yuj] ✗
uyyodhika

nt. battleground; battlefield [ud + √yudh + *a + ika] ✓

Grammar nt, from uyyodha
Meaning battleground; battlefield
Root Family ud √yudh
Root √yudh･3 ya (fight)
Construction ud + √yudh > yodh + *a + ika
uyyodha + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Commentary (VIN 2.5.5.10) uyyodhikaṃ nāma yattha sampahāro dissati. (VINa) uggantvā uggantvā ettha yujjhantī'ti uyyodhikaṃ, sampahāraṭṭhānass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit udyūthikā (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √yudh 1, 4 (fight)

Example

dirattatirattaṃ ce bhikkhu senāya vasamāno uyyodhikaṃ vā bal'aggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīkadassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

uyyodhikā

fem. battle; military exercise; (or a battlefield(?)) ✗
uraga

masc. snake; lit. going on the chest [ura + ga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning snake; lit. going on the chest
Construction ura + ga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (urasi + ga)
Synonym bhujaṅgama, pādudara, sappa
Commentary (SNa) urago'ti āsīviso.
Sanskrit uraga

Examples

yo uppatitaṃ vineti kodhaṃ,
visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

urago kho, mahārāja, daharo'ti na uññātabbo, daharo'ti na paribhotabbo.

urattāḷiṃ

ind. beating one’s breast [ura + tāḷī + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of urattāḷī
Meaning beating one’s breast
Construction ura + tāḷī + iṃ

Commentary (ANa) urattāḷiṃ kandatī'ti uraṃ tāḷetvā rodati.
Sanskrit uras + tāla

Examples

tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti

MN 13 mahā dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī'ti.

Meaning ram

tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito hoti, pañca ca usabhasatāni pañca ca vacchatarasatāni pañca ca vacchatarisatāni pañca ca ajasatāni pañca ca urabbhasatāni thūṇ'ūpanītāni honti yaññ'atthāya.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
uras

masc. breast; heart; chest ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning breast; heart; chest
Notes mano-group nouns, while neuter in Sanskrit, are considered to be masculine by classical Pāḷi grammars such as Saddanīti
Sanskrit uras

Examples

te puttamaṃsāni c'eva khādeyyuṃ, ure ca paṭipiseyyuṃ, kahaṃ, ekaputtaka, kahaṃ, ekaputtakā'ti

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

abhumme kathaṃ nu bhaṇasi,
sallaṃ me deva urasi kappesi,
sattasatā te bhariyā,
kathaṃ nu te tā bhavissanti.

JA 525 cūḷasutasomajātakaṃ
urasāsajja

ger. attacking with your chest; assaulting with your breast [urasā + āsajja] ~

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning attacking with your chest; assaulting with your breast
Construction urasā + āsajja
Commentary (SNa) khāṇuṃ'va uras'āsajjā'ti urasi khāṇuṃ paharitvā viya.
uraṃ datvā

idiom. having given one's heart (to) ✗
uraṃ pisati

idiom. beats one's breast ✗
uru

adj. wide; large; broad [√ar + u] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning wide; large; broad
Root Family √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction √ar + u > uru
Derivative kita (u)
Phonetic Change a > u
Synonym puthu, visāla
Notes MW suggests from √vṛ or √ūrṇu
Sanskrit uru
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Example

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, kiṃkusalagavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno magadhesu anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena uruvelā senānigamo tadavasariṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uruññā

fem. name of a town ✗
urunda

adj. spacious; roomy; large [uruṃ + da] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning spacious; roomy; large
Construction uruṃ + da
Variant ūrūnda, urūddhaṃ
Sanskrit uru

Examples

sace te, bhikkhu, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. urundaṃ, āvuso, kumbhakār'āvesanaṃ. viharat'āyasmā yathāsukhan'ti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena indasālaguhā visamā santī samā sampādi, sambādhā santī urundā sampādi, andhakāro guhāyaṃ antaradhāyi, āloko udapādi yathā taṃ devānaṃ dev'ānubhāvena.

masc. Chapter 3 of Catukkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.21-30 ✗
uruvelā

fem. name of a town in Magadha; lit. broad banks [uru + velā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a town in Magadha; lit. broad banks
Construction uru + velā
Compound kammadhāraya (uru + velā)
Commentary (MNa) uruvelā'ti mahāvelā, mahāvālikarāsī'ti attho. atha vā urū'ti vālikā vuccati, velā'ti mariyādā, vel'ātikkamanahetu āhaṭā uru uruvelā'ti evam'ettha attho daṭṭhabbo.
Sanskrit urubilvā, uruvilvā (bsk)

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, kiṃkusalagavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno magadhesu anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena uruvelā senānigamo tadavasariṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

atha khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, uruvelāyaṃ yath'ābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena bārāṇasī tena cārikaṃ pakkamiṃ.

Meaning massive; mighty; enormous; lit. having ascended up quality

urūḷha + vant

t > ḍ > ḷ

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato purimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti, pacchimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti

Meaning owl wing
Construction ulūka + patta
ulūkapārāvatādivaccasammakkhitatta

Grammar nt, abstr, comp

nt. jumping over, transgression [ud + √lagh] ✗

ullapa

adj. praising; extolling; lauding; lit. chatting up [ud + √lap + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from ullapati
Meaning praising; extolling; lauding; lit. chatting up
Root Family ud √lap
Root √lap･1 a (speak, chat)
Construction ud + √lap + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > l
Commentary (SNa) sat'ullapakāyikā'ti sataṃ dhammaṃ samādānavasena ullapetvā sagge nibbattā'ti sat'ullapakāyikā.
Sanskrit ullāpa
Sanskrit Root √lap 1 (prate)

Example

atha kho sambahulā sat'ullapakāyikā devatāyo abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.

VIN 1.1.4 catutthapārājikaṃ

pārājiko hotī'ti seyyathā'pi nāma tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna virūḷhiyā, evam'eva bhikkhu pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.

ullokaka

adj. looking at, spectator [ud + √lok] ✗
ullokana 1

nt. looking up [ud + √lok] ✗
ullokana 2

nt. window [ud + √lok] ✗
ullokayati

pr. looks up, looks up at; looks to [ud + √lok] ✗
ullokayamāna

prp. looking up [ud + √lok] ✗
ulloketabba

ptp. should be looked up at; should be gazed up at; lit. to be looked up (at) [ud + √lok + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of ulloketi
Meaning should be looked up at; should be gazed up at; lit. to be looked up (at)
Root Family ud √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ud + loke + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change d > l
Antonym oloketabba
English Cognate look, looks, looking
Sanskrit ullokayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Example

sace, bhikkhave, nandassa uddhaṃ ulloketabbā hoti, sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā nando anudisaṃ anuviloketi, evaṃ me anudisaṃ anuvilokayato n'ābhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssavissantīti. itiha tattha sampajāno hoti.

AN 8.9 nandasuttaṃ
ulloketi

pr. (+acc) looks up (at); gazes up (at) [ud + √lok + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning looks up (at); gazes up (at)
Root Family ud √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ud + loke + ti
Phonetic Change d > l
Antonym oloketi
Commentary (MNa) na uddhan'tiādīsu nakkhattāni gaṇento viya na uddhaṃ ulloketi
English Cognate look, looks, looking
Sanskrit ullokayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Examples

apalokento kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo sabbakāyen'eva apaloketi, so na uddhaṃ ulloketi, na adho oloketi, na ca vipekkhamāno gacchati, yugamattañ'ca pekkhati, tato c'assa uttari anāvaṭaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
ulloketvā

abs. (+acc) having looked up (at); having gazed up (at) [ud + √lok + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ulloketi, trans (+acc)
Meaning having looked up (at); having gazed up (at)
Root Family ud √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ud + loke + tvā
Phonetic Change d > l
Antonym oloketvā
English Cognate look, looks, looking
Sanskrit ullokayitvā
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Example

ekam'antaṃ nisinnassa kho abhayassa rājakumārassa sūriyaṃ ulloketvā etadahosi, akālo kho ajja bhagavato vādaṃ āropetuṃ.

uviṭṭha

adj. seated; (or having entered) ✗
usabha 1

masc. head bull; stud bull ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning head bull; stud bull
Synonym vasabha
Commentary (ANa) gavasatajeṭṭhako usabho, gavasahassajeṭṭhako vasabho. vajasatajeṭṭhako vā usabho, vajasahassajeṭṭhako vasabho.
Sanskrit ṛṣabha

Examples

so evam'āha, ettakā usabhā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā vacchatarā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā vacchatariyo haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā ajā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā urabbhā haññantu yaññ'atthāya

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā

usabha 2

masc. formost; finest example; leader; lit. stud bull ✓

Meaning formost; finest example; leader; lit. stud bull

Example

usabhaṃ pavaraṃ vīraṃ,
mah'esiṃ vijitāvinaṃ,
anejaṃ nhātakaṃ buddhaṃ,

Example

seyyathāpi, bhante, usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, usabhachinnavisāṇasamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
usīra

nt. fragrant root of vetiver grass ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning fragrant root of vetiver grass
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chrysopogon_zizanioides
Sanskrit uśīra

Examples

taṃ vo vadāmi bhaddaṃ vo,
yāvant'ettha samāgatā,
taṇhāya mūlaṃ khaṇatha,
usīra-attho'va bīraṇaṃ,
mā vo naḷaṃ'va soto'va,
māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

DHP 337 taṇhāvaggo

mūlabījaṃ nāma, haliddi, siṅgiveraṃ, vacā, vacattaṃ, ativisā, kaṭukarohiṇī, usīraṃ, bhaddamūttakaṃ, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi mūle jāyanti, mūle sañjāyanti, etaṃ mūlabījaṃ nāma.

VIN 2.5.2.1 bhūtagāmasikkhāpadaṃ
usīrattha

adj. who wants the fragrant root of vetiver grass [usīra + attha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who wants the fragrant root of vetiver grass
Construction usīra + attha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa > bahubbīhi (usīrena + attha)
Commentary (DHPa) usīr'attho'va bīraṇaṃ, yathā usīrena atthiko puriso mahantena kudālena bīraṇaṃ khaṇati, evam'assā mūlaṃ khaṇathā'ti attho.
Sanskrit uśīra + artha

Example

taṃ vo vadāmi bhaddaṃ vo,
yāvant'ettha samāgatā,
taṇhāya mūlaṃ khaṇatha,
usīr'attho'va bīraṇaṃ,
mā vo naḷaṃ'va soto'va,
māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

DHP24 taṇhāvaggo
usīranāḷa

nt. usīra stalk or fiber ✗
usīranāḷamatta

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning all the root fibres; lit. root-stalk-measure
Construction usīra + nāḷa + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (usīranāḷa + matta)
Variant usīranāḷimatta
Sanskrit uśīra + nāḍī + mātra

Example

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷamattāni'pi.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
usīranāḷi

fem. usīra stalk or fiber ✗
usīranāḷimatta

nt. all the root fibres; lit. root-stalk-measure [usīra + nāḷi + matta] ✓

Meaning all the root fibres; lit. root-stalk-measure
Construction usīra + nāḷi + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (usīranāḷi + matta)
Variant usīranāḷamatta
Sanskrit uśīra + nāḍī + mātra

Examples

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷimattāni'pi.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, vappa, thūṇaṃ paṭicca chāyā paññāyati. atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ thūṇaṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chinditvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷimattāni'pi.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
usu

masc. arrow ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning arrow
Synonym asana, sara
Commentary (MNa) usūsū'ti kaṇḍesu.
Sanskrit iṣu

Examples

anamataggo'yaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃsāro. pubbā koṭi nappaññāyati sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ

SN 56.35 sattisatasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato khamo hoti sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavaninnādasaddānaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khantā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
usukāra

masc. arrow-maker; fletcher [usu + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning arrow-maker; fletcher
Construction usu + kāra
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (usuṃ + kāra)
Synonym usukāraka
Sanskrit iṣukāra

Examples

phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ,
dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

DHP 33 cittavaggo

udakañ'hi nayanti nettikā,
usukārā namayanti tejanaṃ,
dāruṃ namayanti tacchakā,
attānaṃ damayanti paṇḍitā.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
usumaka

adj. hot; boiling [√us + uma + ka] ~

Grammar adj, from usuma
Meaning hot; boiling
Root Family √us
Root √us×6 ṇhā (be hot)
Construction √us + uma + ka
usuma + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit uṣmaka
Sanskrit Root √uṣ 1, 9 (burn)
usumakajāta

adj. heated; boiling [usumaka + jāta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning heated; boiling
Construction usumaka + jāta
usumajāta

adj. heated up; boiling [usuma + jāta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning heated up; boiling
Construction usuma + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (usuma + jāta)
Sanskrit uṣma + jāta
usumā

fem. heat; warmth; body heat [√us + umā] ~

Grammar fem
Meaning heat; warmth; body heat
Root Family √us
Root √us×6 ṇhā (be hot)
Construction √us + umā
Derivative kita (umā)
Variant usmā
Sanskrit uṣma
Sanskrit Root √uṣ 1, 9 (burn)
usuyyaka

adj. discontented, envious [√usūy] ✗
usuyyati

pr. is discontented, resentful (at the merits or achievements of another); is jealous, is envious (of usually genitive/dative) [√usūy] ✗
usuyyā

fem. discontent (at the merits or achievements of another); envy, jealousy [√usūy] ✗
usulakkhaṇa

nt. auspicious marks of arrows ✗
usuloma

adj. with arrows for hair ✗
usulomasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 19.7 (SN19.7) ✗
usūyaka

adj. who envies, jealous [√usūy] ✗
usūyati

pr. is jealous, envies [√usūy] ✗
usūyanā

fem. envy, jealousy [√usūy] ✗
usūyamāna

prp. being jealous; envying [√usūy] ✗
usūyā

fem. envy, jealousy [√usūy] ✗
usūyi

aor. was jealous, envied [√usūy] ✗
usma

masc. heat, glow; ardor ✗
usmanudaka

nt. hot water, steaming water ✗
usmā

fem. heat; warmth; body heat [√us + mā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning heat; warmth; body heat
Root Family √us
Root √us×6 ṇhā (be hot)
Construction √us + mā
Derivative kita (mā)
Variant usumā
Commentary (MNa) usmaṃ paṭiccā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ kammajatejaṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati. yasmā pana kammajatejo'pi jīvit'indriyena vinā na tiṭṭhati, tasmā usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti āha.
Sanskrit uṣma
Sanskrit Root √uṣ 1, 9 (burn)

Examples

yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ,
yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti,
parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
usmādakajāta

adj. bubbling; boiling; steaming [usmā + udaka + jāta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bubbling; boiling; steaming
Construction usmā + udaka + jāta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (usmādakaṃ + jāta)
Variant ussadakajāta, usmudakajāta
Commentary (SNa) usmudakajāto'ti usumajāto. (SNt) usmudakajāto'ti tass'eva kuthitabhāvassa usmudakataṃ accuṇhataṃ patto. ten'āha usumajāto'ti.
Sanskrit uṣma + udaka + jāta
usmāsahagata

adj. having warmth; full of body-heat [usmā + sahagata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having warmth; full of body-heat
Construction usmā + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (usmāya + sahagata)
usmīkata

adj. getting warm; kindled a flicker of understanding; close to comprehension; in the ballpark; lit. made warm [usmā + kata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning getting warm; kindled a flicker of understanding; close to comprehension; in the ballpark; lit. made warm
Construction usmā > usmī + kata
Phonetic Change ā > ī before √kar
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (usmaṃ + kata)
Sanskrit uṣṇīkṛta

Example

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api n'āyaṃ ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo usmīkato'pi imasmiṃ dhammavinaye'ti? kiñ'hi siyā, bhante, no h'etaṃ, bhante'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
usmudakajāta

adj. bubbling; boiling; steaming [usmā + udaka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bubbling; boiling; steaming
Construction usmā + udaka + jāta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (usmudakaṃ + jāta)
Variant ussadakajāta, usmādakajāta
Commentary (SNa) usmudakajāto'ti usumajāto. (SNt) usmudakajāto'ti tass'eva kuthitabhāvassa usmudakataṃ accuṇhataṃ patto. ten'āha usumajāto'ti.
Sanskrit uṣma + udaka + jāta

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto agginā santatto pakkuthito usm'udakajāto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
ussa

adj. excellent; superior [ud + √sad + a] ✓

Grammar adj, abbrev of ussada
Meaning excellent; superior
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ud + √sad + a
ussada > ussa
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
Antonym avama
Synonym paṇīta, parama, visesi, seyyo
Sanskrit utsada (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Examples

vītagedho amaccharī,
na ussesu vadate muni,
na samesu na omesu,
kappaṃ n'eti akappiyo.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

na samesu na omesu,
na ussesu vadate muni,
santo so vītamaccharo,
n'ādeti na nirassatī'ti.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
ussakkati

pr. moves up, rises; moves forward, advance; progress [ud + √sakk] ✗
ussakkitvā

abs. (+abl) having climbed up (from); having crawled up (from); having moved up (from) [ud + √sakk + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ussakkati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning having climbed up (from); having crawled up (from); having moved up (from)
Root Family ud √sakk
Root √sakk･1 a (move)
Construction ud + √sakk + itvā
Phonetic Change d > s
Antonym osakkitvā
Commentary (ANa) pādehi ussakkitvā'ti agganakhato paṭṭhāya pādehi abhiruhitvā.
Sanskrit ud + ṣvaṣkitvā
Sanskrit Root √ṣvaṣk √ṣvakk 1 (go, move)
ussagga

masc. casting off; throwing off; throwing away [ud + √sajj + a] ~

Grammar masc, from ussajjati
Meaning casting off; throwing off; throwing away
Root Family ud √sajj
Root √sajj･1 a (relinquish, let loose)
√ In Comps ssajj
Construction ud + √sajj > sagg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
jj > gg
Synonym nikkhepa
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)
ussaṅkitaparisaṅkita

adj. doubted and distrusted ✗
ussaṅkitasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.102 (AN5.102) ✗
ussaṅkī

adj. distrustful, full of fear [ud + √saṅk] ✗
ussaṅkha

adj. arched; (comm) with ankles halfway along the foot [ud + saṃ + √khā + ā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from saṅkha
Meaning arched; (comm) with ankles halfway along the foot
Root Family ud saṃ √khā
Root √khā･1 (tell, announce)
Construction ud + saṃ + √khā + ā + a
ussaṅkhā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
Commentary (MNa) uddhaṃ patiṭṭhitagopphakattā ussaṅkhā pādā assā'ti ussaṅkhapādo.
Notes (MW) "utsaṅga" any horizontal area or level (as a roof of a house etc.)
Sanskrit ucchaṅkha (bsk), utsaṅga (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √khyā 2 (see)

Example

ussaṅkhapādo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
ussaṅkhapāda

adj. with arched feet; (comm) with ankles halfway along the foot; seventh of the thirty-two marks of a great man [ussaṅkha + pāda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with arched feet; (comm) with ankles halfway along the foot; seventh of the thirty-two marks of a great man
Construction ussaṅkha + pāda
Compound kammadhāraya (ussaṅkha + pāda)
Commentary (MNa) uddhaṃ patiṭṭhitagopphakattā ussaṅkhā pādā assā'ti ussaṅkhapādo.
Notes (MW) "utsaṅga" any horizontal area or level (as a roof of a house etc.)
Sanskrit ucchaṅkhapāda (bsk)

Example

ussaṅkhapādo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
ussaṅkhapādauddhaggalomatālakkhaṇa

nt. auspicious mark of having level feet and raised hair tips [ussaṅkhapāda + uddhagga + lomatā + lakkhaṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning auspicious mark of having level feet and raised hair tips
Construction ussaṅkhapāda + uddhagga + lomatā + lakkhaṇa
ussajitvā

abs. having let go, let loose; having quit, abandoned [ud + √saj] ✗
ussajjati

pr. (+acc) loosens; sets free; releases [ud + √sajj + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning loosens; sets free; releases
Root Family ud √sajj
Root √sajj･1 a (relinquish, let loose)
√ In Comps ssajj
Base √sajj + a > sajja
Construction ud + sajja + ti
Phonetic Change d > s
Synonym osajjati, ossajjati, parimoceti, moceti
Sanskrit utsṛjati
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)
ussajjitvā

abs. (+acc) having loosened; having set free; having released [ud + √sajj + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ussajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having loosened; having set free; having released
Root Family ud √sajj
Root √sajj･1 a (relinquish, let loose)
√ In Comps ssajj
Construction ud + √sajj + itvā
Phonetic Change d > s
Synonym mocetvā
Commentary (ANa) rathīsāya satthiṃ ussajjitvā'ti sīsaṃ nāmetvā yugaṃ bhūmiyaṃ pātetvā satthinā rathīsaṃ paharitvā.
Sanskrit utsṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā rath'īsāya satthiṃ ussajjitvā rath'īsaṃ'y'eva ajjhomaddati. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
ussaṭa

pp. moving away, slipping away; come from, emerged; possibly also: great, high [ud + √sar] ✗
ussada 1

adj. full of; covered with; abundant; excessive; lit. sinking up; swelling [ud + √sad + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning full of; covered with; abundant; excessive; lit. sinking up; swelling
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ud + √sad + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
Synonym ussanna, bahula, bahulī
Sanskrit utsada (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

alaṅ'katā suvasanā,
mālinī candan'ussadā,
majjhe mahāpathe nārī,
turiye naccati naṭṭakī.

TH 186 nāgasamālattheragāthā
ussada 2

masc. arrogance; conceit; self-importance; lit. sinking up; swelling [ud + √sad + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning arrogance; conceit; self-importance; lit. sinking up; swelling
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ud + √sad + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
Antonym anussada
Synonym atimāna
Notes see ussada 3
Sanskrit utsada (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Examples

santo ca bhikkhu abhinibbut'atto,
iti'han'ti sīlesu akatthamāno,
tam'ariyadhammaṃ kusalā vadanti,
yass'ussadā n'atthi kuhiñci loke.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

upekkhako sadā sato,
na loke maññate samaṃ,
na visesī na nīceyyo,
tassa no santi ussadā.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10
ussada 3

masc. distinction; qualification; prominence; lit. sinking up; swelling [ud + √sad + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning distinction; qualification; prominence; lit. sinking up; swelling
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ud + √sad + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
Commentary (SNPa) yassa c'ime rāga-dosa-moha-māna-diṭṭhi-kilesa-duccarita-saṅkhātā satt'ussadā keci oḷārikā vā sukhumā vā
Sanskrit utsada (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Examples

upekkhako sadā sato,
na loke maññate samaṃ,
na visesī na nīceyyo,
tassa no santi ussadā.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

sabbattha upekkhako satimā,
na so hiṃsati kañci sabbaloke,
tiṇṇo samaṇo anāvilo,
ussadā yassa na santi sorato so.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
ussada 4

masc. auxiliary hell; lit. sinking up; swelling [ud + √sad + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning auxiliary hell; lit. sinking up; swelling
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ud + √sad + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
Sanskrit utsada (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

dasavassasahassāni tass'eva mahānirayassa ussade apacciṃ vuṭṭhānimaṃ nāma vedanaṃ vediyamāno. tassa mayhaṃ, pāpima, evarūpo kāyo hoti, seyyathā'pi manussassa. evarūpaṃ sīsaṃ hoti, seyyathā'pi macchassa.

AN 5.193 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
ussadakajāta

adj. boiling over; overflowing [ussadaka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning boiling over; overflowing
Construction ussadaka + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (ussadaka + jāta)
Antonym anussadakajāta
Variant usumakajāta, ussurakajāta, usmudakajāta
Notes (ANa) ussadakajāto'ti usumakajāto.
Sanskrit utsada (bsk) + jāta

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto agginā santatto ukkudhito ussadakajāto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ nappajāneyya na passeyya.

ussava

masc. feast, festival, ceremony ✗
ussahati 1.1

pr. (+loc) makes an effort (in); strives (in); is active (with) [ud + √sah + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning makes an effort (in); strives (in); is active (with)
Root Family ud √sah
Root √sah･1 a (overcome, prevail)
Base √sah + a > saha
Construction ud + saha + ti
Phonetic Change d > s
Synonym āyūhati, ghaṭati, vāyamati
Sanskrit utsahate
Sanskrit Root √sah 1, 2, 4 (prevail)

Examples

yo so yodh'ājīvo saṅgāme ussahati vāyamati, tam'enaṃ ussahantaṃ vāyamantaṃ pare hananti pariyāpādenti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā parajitānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī'ti.

SN 42.3 yodhājīvasuttaṃ

no c'etaṃ chando jāyetha, na'y'idaṃ ussaheyya, no c'ete dhammā nijjhānaṃ khameyyuṃ, na'y'idaṃ chando jāyetha.

MN 95 caṅkīsuttaṃ
ussahati 2.1

pr. (+inf) can; is able (to); is capable (of) [ud + √sah + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+inf)
Meaning can; is able (to); is capable (of)
Root Family ud √sah
Root √sah･1 a (be able)
Base √sah + a > saha
Construction ud + saha + ti
Phonetic Change d > s
Synonym pahoti, sahati
Sanskrit utsahate
Sanskrit Root √sah 1 (prevail)

Example

taṇhā avijjā ca piy'āpiyañ'ca,
subhāni rūpāni sukhā ca vedanā,
manāpiyā kāmaguṇā ca vantā,
vante ahaṃ āvamituṃ na ussahe.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
ussahana

nt. striving, effort [ud + √sah] ✗
ussahanta

prp. (+loc) trying (with); making an effort (in); striving [ud + √sah + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ussahati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning trying (with); making an effort (in); striving
Root Family ud √sah
Root √sah･1 a (overcome, prevail)
Base √sah + a > saha
Construction ud + saha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > s
Synonym āyūhanta, ghaṭanta, vāyamanta, vāyamamāna
Sanskrit utsahat
Sanskrit Root √sah 1, 2, 4 (prevail)

Example

yo so yodh'ājīvo saṅgāme ussahati vāyamati, tam'enaṃ ussahantaṃ vāyamantaṃ pare hananti pariyāpādenti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā parajitānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī'ti.

SN 42.3 yodhājīvasuttaṃ
ussahi

aor. tried, strived, endeavoured [ud + √sah] ✗
ussahitvā

abs. (+loc) having made an effort (to); having strived (to) [ud + √sah + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ussahati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning having made an effort (to); having strived (to)
Root Family ud √sah
Root √sah･1 a (overcome, prevail)
Construction ud + √sah + itvā
Sanskrit Root √sah 1, 2, 4 (prevail)
ussāda

masc. (+loc) rising up (onto); running aground (on) [ud + √sad + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ussīdati (+loc)
Meaning rising up (onto); running aground (on)
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ud + √sad > sād + *a
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ā
Antonym saṃsāda
Sanskrit utsāda (ruin)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

kiṃ nu kho, bhante, orimaṃ tīraṃ, kiṃ pārimaṃ tīraṃ, ko majjhe saṃsādo, ko thale ussādo, ko manussaggāho, ko amanussaggāho, ko āvaṭṭaggāho, ko antopūtibhāvo'ti?

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
ussādana

nt. praise; elevation; raising up; bigging up; flattery [ud + √sad + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ussādeti, caus
Meaning praise; elevation; raising up; bigging up; flattery
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ud + sāde + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ā
Antonym apasādana
Sanskrit utsādana
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

ussādanañ'ca jaññā, apasādanañ'ca jaññā, ussādanañ'ca ñatvā apasādanañ'ca ñatvā n'ev'ussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammam'eva deseyya.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ussādanā 1

fem. raising, exalting; praise [ud + √sad] ✗
ussādanā 2

fem. noise, tumult [ud + √sad] ✗
ussādita

pp. lifted (on to), beached; piled up [ud + √sad] ✗
ussādiyati 1

pr. is too plentiful [ud + √sad] ✗
ussādiyati 2

pr. is removed [ud + √sad] ✗
ussādetabba

ptp. to be praise [ud + √sad] ✗
ussādetar

masc. who exalts, who praises [ud + √sad] ✗
ussādeti

pr. (+acc) praises; elevates; raises up; bigs up; flatters; lit. causes to raise up [ud + √sad + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ud √sad, trans (+acc)
Meaning praises; elevates; raises up; bigs up; flatters; lit. causes to raise up
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ud + sāde + ti
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ā
Antonym apasādeti
Synonym ullapati
Sanskrit utsādayati
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Examples

so ārāmagato parisati dhammaṃ deseti, na taṃ parisaṃ ussādeti, na taṃ parisaṃ apasādeti, añña'd'atthu dhammiyā kathāya taṃ parisaṃ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

ussādanañ'ca jaññā, apasādanañ'ca jaññā, ussādanañ'ca ñatvā apasādanañ'ca ñatvā n'ev'ussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammam'eva deseyya.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ussādetvā

abs. (+acc and +loc) having raised up (onto); having elevated (onto); lit. having caused to sit up [ud + √sad + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ussādeti, caus, trans (+acc and +loc)
Meaning having raised up (onto); having elevated (onto); lit. having caused to sit up
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ud + sāde + tvā
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ā
Variant ussāretvā
Sanskrit utsad
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ kullaṃ thale vā ussādetvā udake vā opilāpetvā yena kāmaṃ pakkameyyan'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ussādenta

prp. (+acc) praising; elevating; raising up; flattering; lit. causing to raise up [ud + √sad + *e + nta] ~

Grammar prp of ussādeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning praising; elevating; raising up; flattering; lit. causing to raise up
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ud + sāde + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ā
Antonym apasādenta
Sanskrit utsādayat
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
ussāpana

nt. lifting up, raising [ud + √si] ✗
ussāpayati

pr. raises; erects; lifts up [ud + √si] ✗
ussāpita

pp. lifted up, hoisted, raised [ud + √si] ✗
ussāpeti

pr. lifts up, hoists, raises [ud + √si] ✗
ussāpetukāma

adj. (+acc) wanting to raise; wishing to erect [ussāpetuṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+acc)
Meaning wanting to raise; wishing to erect
Construction ussāpetuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (ussāpetuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit utsadayitum + kāma

Example

atha kho uggatasarīro brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ahañ'hi, bho gotama, aggiṃ ādātu'kāmo yūpaṃ ussāpetu'kāmo. ovadatu maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo.

AN 7.47 dutiyaaggisuttaṃ
ussāpetuṃ

inf. to raise; to hoist; to lift up [ud + √si] ✗
ussāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having raised up; having lifted up; having hoisted [ud + √si + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ussāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having raised up; having lifted up; having hoisted
Root Family ud √si
Root √si･1 *āpe (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Base √si + āpe > sāpe (caus)
Construction ud + sāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change d > s
Synonym ukkhipitvā, uccopetvā, paggahetvā
Sanskrit ucchri, udśri
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Examples

tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, caṇḍālavaṃsiko caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ ussāpetvā medakathālikaṃ antevāsiṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, samma medakathālike, caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ abhiruhitvā mama uparikhandhe tiṭṭhāhī'ti.

SN 47.19 sedakasuttaṃ

nagaravīthiyo sodhāpetvā puṇṇaghaṭe ṭhapāpetvā dhajapaṭāk'ādayo ussāpetvā sakalanagaraṃ devavimānaṃ viya alaṅkaronti.

MNa 36 mahāsaccakasutavaṇṇanā
ussāpenta

prp. (+acc) raising; hoisting; lifting up [ud + √si + *āpe + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ussāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning raising; hoisting; lifting up
Root Family ud √si
Root √si･1 *āpe (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Base √si + āpe > sāpe (caus)
Construction ud + sāpe + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit ucchrāpayat (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

Example

aggiṃ, brāhmaṇa, ādhento yūpaṃ ussāpento pubb'eva yaññā tīṇi satthāni ussāpeti akusalāni dukkh'udrayāni dukkhavipākāni. katamāni tīṇi?

AN 7.47 dutiyaaggisuttaṃ
ussāpesi

aor. lifted up, hoisted, raised [ud + √si] ✗

ussārayati 1

pr. expels; sends away, dismisses [ud + √sar] ✗

Construction ud + sāre + ti
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ā
Sanskrit utsārayati
Sanskrit Root √sṛ 1, 3 (flow)

Example

yaṃ hoti mahāsamudde mataṃ kuṇapaṃ taṃ khippam'eva tīraṃ vāheti, thalaṃ ussāreti.

Example

jīvako … janaṃ ussāretvā tirokaraṇiyaṃ parikkhipitvā thambhe upanibandhitvā bhariyaṃ purato ṭhapetvā udaracchaviṃ uppāṭetvā antagaṇṭhiṃ nīharitvā bhariyāya dassesi

VIN 4.8.206 seṭṭhiputtavatthu
ussāresi

aor. pushed aside [ud + √sar] ✗
ussāva

masc. dew; lit. causing to flow up [ud + √su + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning dew; lit. causing to flow up
Root Family ud √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps ssu
Construction ud + √su > sāv + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ud + srāva
Sanskrit Root √sru 1 (flow)

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, tiṇ'agge ussāvabindu sūriye uggacchante khippaṃ'y'eva paṭivigacchati, na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ussāvabind'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ bahudukkhaṃ bah'upāyāsaṃ mantāyaṃ boddhabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, n'atthi jātassa amaraṇaṃ.

AN 7.74 arakasuttaṃ
ussāha

masc. effort; activity; perseverance; strenuous and continuous exertion; energy [ud + √sah + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ussahati
Meaning effort; activity; perseverance; strenuous and continuous exertion; energy
Root Family ud √sah
Root √sah･1 a (overcome, prevail)
Construction ud + √sah > sāh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ā
Synonym appaṭivānī, ussoḷhī, vāyāma, viyārabbha
Commentary (ANa) ussāho'ti tato adhimattataraṃ vīriyaṃ.
Sanskrit utsāha
Sanskrit Root √sah 1, 2, 4 (prevail)

Examples

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ'y'eva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca karaṇīyaṃ.

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā, tass'eva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañ'ca vāyāmañ'ca ussāhañ'ca ussoḷhiñ'ca appaṭivāniñ'ca satiñ'ca sampajaññañ'ca kareyya.

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ
ussīdati

pr. (+loc) rises up (onto); washes up (onto); runs aground (on) [ud + √sad + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning rises up (onto); washes up (onto); runs aground (on)
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction ud + sīda + ti
Phonetic Change d > s
a > ī
Antonym saṃsīdati
Commentary (SNa) na thale ussīdissatī'ti thalaṃ n'ābhiruhissati.
Sanskrit utsīdati
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, sace tumhe'pi na orimaṃ tīraṃ upagacchatha, na pārimaṃ tīraṃ upagacchatha, na majjhe saṃsīdissatha, na thale ussīdissatha, na manussaggāho gahessati

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
ussīsaka

nt. side where the head is laid, pillow [sīsa] ✗
ussuka

adj. zealously desiring; ambitious; anxiously striving; anxious; agitated; stressed [ud + su + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ud
Meaning zealously desiring; ambitious; anxiously striving; anxious; agitated; stressed
Construction ud + su + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > s
Antonym anussuka
Commentary (DHPa) pañcakāmaguṇapariyesane ussukesu tāya pariyesanāya abhāvena anussukā'ti.
Notes (MW) restless, uneasy, unquiet, anxious; fr. su, "well", with ud in the sense of "apart", and affix ka
Sanskrit utsuka

Examples

susukhaṃ vata jīvāma,
ussukesu anussukā,
ussukesu manassesu,
viharāma anussukā.

DHP 199 sukhavaggo

jīvitānaṃ parikkhāre, bhesajje atha paccaye.
na bāḷhaṃ ussukā āsuṃ, yathā te āsavakkhaye

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā
ussukka

nt. zeal; desire; ambition; effort [ud + su + ka + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from ussuka
Meaning zeal; desire; ambition; effort
Construction ud + su + ka + ya
ussuka + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change d > s
Commentary (SNa) ussukkajātesū'ti nānākiccajātesu anuppannānaṃ rūp'ādīnaṃ uppādan'atthāya uppannānaṃ anubhavan'atthāya ussukkesu.
Sanskrit autsukya

Examples

tesu ussukkajātesu,
bhavasot'ānusārisu,
ke'dha taṇhaṃ pajahiṃsu,
ke lokasmiṃ anussukā'ti.

SN 1.28 mahaddhanasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, āvuso uttiya, na tathāgatassa evaṃ ussukkaṃ hoti, sabbo vā tena loko nīyati, upaḍḍho vā, tibhāgo vā'ti.

AN 10.95 uttiyasuttaṃ
ussukkajāta

adj. zealous; full of desire; ambitious [ussukka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning zealous; full of desire; ambitious
Construction ussukka + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (ussukka + jāta)
Commentary (SNa) ussukkajātesū'ti nānākiccajātesu anuppannānaṃ rūp'ādīnaṃ uppādan'atthāya uppannānaṃ anubhavan'atthāya ussukkesu.

tesu ussukkajātesu,
bhavasot'ānusārisu,
ke'dha taṇhaṃ pajahiṃsu,
ke lokasmiṃ anussukā'ti.

SN 1.28 mahaddhanasuttaṃ
ussukkati

pr. endeavours, tries [ussuka] ✗
ussukkamāpanna

adj. actively engaged (in); busy with affairs (of) [ussukkaṃ + āpanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning actively engaged (in); busy with affairs (of)
Construction ussukkaṃ + āpanna
ussukkaṃ āpajjati

idiom. makes every effort to provide; eagerly supplies; lit. arouses zeal ~

Grammar idiom, nt + pr
Meaning makes every effort to provide; eagerly supplies; lit. arouses zeal
Synonym ussukkaṃ karoti
Sanskrit autsukya + āpadyate
ussukkaṃ āpanno

idiom. actively engaged; energetically involved ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pp
Meaning actively engaged; energetically involved
Commentary (MNa) ussukkaṃ āpanno hotī'ti ussukkabhāvaṃ kattabbataṃ paṭipanno hoti.
Sanskrit autsukya + āpannaḥ

Example

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'cā'pi yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tattha ussukkaṃ āpanno hoti, atha khv'āssa tibb'āpekkhā hoti adhisīlasikkhāya adhicittasikkhāya adhipaññāsikkhāya.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
ussukkaṃ karoti

idiom. (+dat) makes every effort to provide; eagerly supplies; lit. makes zeal ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr (+dat)
Meaning makes every effort to provide; eagerly supplies; lit. makes zeal
Synonym ussukkaṃ āpajjati
Sanskrit autsukya + karoti

Example

abhiramatu, bhante, ayyo mahako macchikāsaṇḍe. ramaṇīyaṃ ambāṭakavanaṃ. ahaṃ ayyassa mahakassa ussukkaṃ karissāmi cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānan'ti.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ
ussukkāpeti

pr. entices, arouses [ussuka] ✗
ussukkāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having made an effort; having tried [ud + su + ka + ya + āpe + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of ussukkāpeti, deno, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having made an effort; having tried
Construction ud + su + ka + ya + āpe + tvā
Commentary (VIBHt) ussukkāpetvā'ti uddhaṃ uddhaṃ santivisesayuttaṃ katvā, vaḍḍhetvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit autsukya +
ussukkāpenta

prp. (+acc) making an effort (with); endeavouring (with); eagerly practising [ussuka + āpe + nta] ~

Grammar prp of ussukkāpeti, deno, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning making an effort (with); endeavouring (with); eagerly practising
Construction ussuka + āpe + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit autsukya +
ussukkāpesi

aor. enticed, aroused [ussuka] ✗
ussukki

aor. endeavoured, tried [ussuka] ✗
ussussati

pr. dries up; evaporates [ud + √sus + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning dries up; evaporates
Root Family ud √sus
Root √sus･3 ya (dry, wither)
Base √sus + ya > sussa
Construction ud + sussa + ti
Phonetic Change d > s
y > s
Commentary (SNa) yaṃ mahāsamuddo'ti yasmiṃ samaye pañcame sūriye uṭṭhite mahāsamuddo ussussati.
Sanskrit ucchuṣyati
Sanskrit Root √śuṣ 4 (dry)

Example

hoti so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ mahāsamuddo ussussati visussati na bhavati, na tv'ev'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi.

SN 22.99 gaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
ussussi

usseneti

pr. (+acc) (of an army) enlists; gathers; bands together; associates; (comm) raises up [ud + senā + e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of ussenā, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of an army) enlists; gathers; bands together; associates; (comm) raises up
Construction ud + senā + e + ti
Antonym viseneti, paṭiseneti
Variant ussineti
Commentary (ANa) na ussenetī'ti diṭṭhivasena na ukkhipati.
Sanskrit ut + senayati

Examples

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako apacināti no ācināti, pajahati no upādiyati, viseneti no usseneti, vidhūpeti no sandhūpeti

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu n'eva usseneti na paṭiseneti na dhūpāyati na pajjalati na sampajjhāyati.

AN 4.200 pemasuttaṃ
usseḷeti

pr. whistles [ud + √siḷ + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning whistles
Root Family ud √siḷ
Root √siḷ･8 *e (whistle)
Base √siḷ + *e > seḷe
Construction ud + seḷe + ti
Commentary (VINt) tattha usseḷentī'ti mukhena usseḷanasaddaṃ pamuñcanti, mahantaṃ katvā abyattasaddaṃ pavattentī'ti attho. ajānaṃ saññaṃ dentā ajapālakā viya mukhena vātaṃ nicchārentā sukhumaṃ abyattanādaṃ pavattentī'ti'pi vadanti.
Sanskrit Root - - (-)
ussoḷhi

fem. endurance; exertion [ud + √sah] ✗
ussoḷhikā

fem. great energy ✗
ussoḷhipañcama

adj. with exertion as the fifth; with enthusiasm as the fifth [ussoḷhī + pañcama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with exertion as the fifth; with enthusiasm as the fifth
Construction ussoḷhī + pañcama
ussoḷhipannarasaṅgasamannāgata

adj. endowed with fifteen factors including effort [ussoḷhī + pannarasa + aṅga + samannāgata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning endowed with fifteen factors including effort
Construction ussoḷhī + pannarasa + aṅga + samannāgata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgehi + samannāgata)
Variant ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgasamannāgata
Commentary (MNa) ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgasamannāgato'ti pañca cetokhilappahānāni pañca vinibandhappahānāni cattāro iddhipādā ussoḷhī'ti evaṃ ussoḷhiyā saddhiṃ pannarasahi aṅgehi samannāgato.
Sanskrit utsāha, utsoḍhi + pañcadaśa + aṅga + samanvāgata

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, evaṃ ussoḷhipannaras'aṅgasamannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo abhinibbidāya, bhabbo sambodhāya, bhabbo anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāyā'ti.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
ussoḷhī

fem. exertion; activity; active involvement; enthusiasm [ud + √sah + tī] ✓

Grammar fem, from ussahati
Meaning exertion; activity; active involvement; enthusiasm
Root Family ud √sah
Root √sah･1 a (overcome, prevail)
Construction ud + √sah + tī > soḍhī > soḷhī
Derivative kita (tī)
Phonetic Change d > s
a > o
t > ḍ > ḷ
Synonym vāyāma, ussāha, appaṭivānī
Commentary (ANa) ussoḷhī'ti paṅkalaggasakaṭauddharaṇasadisaṃ mahāvīriyaṃ.
Sanskrit utsāha, utsoḍhi
Sanskrit Root √sah 1, 2, 4 (prevail)

Example

so chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, cittasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, vīmaṃsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, ussoḷhī'y'eva pañcamī.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgasamannāgata

adj. endowed with fifteen factors including effort [ussoḷhī + pannarasa + aṅga + samannāgata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning endowed with fifteen factors including effort
Construction ussoḷhī + pannarasa + aṅga + samannāgata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgehi + samannāgata)
Variant ussoḷhipannarasaṅgasamannāgata
Commentary (MNa) ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgasamannāgato'ti pañca cetokhilappahānāni pañca vinibandhappahānāni cattāro iddhipādā ussoḷhī'ti evaṃ ussoḷhiyā saddhiṃ pannarasahi aṅgehi samannāgato.
Sanskrit utsāha, utsoḍhi + pañcadaśa + aṅga + samanvāgata

Example

sa kho so, bhikkhave, evaṃ ussoḷhīpannaras'aṅgasamannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo abhinibbidāya, bhabbo sambodhāya, bhabbo anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya.

uḷāra uḷāra

idiom. lots and lots of; lots of excellent ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + adj
Meaning lots and lots of; lots of excellent
Commentary (SNa) uḷāre uḷāre'ti paṇīte ca bahuke ca.
Sanskrit udāra + udāra

Examples

appakā te sattā lokasmiṃ ye uḷāre uḷāre bhoge labhitvā na c'eva majjanti, na ca pamajjanti, na ca kāmesu gedhaṃ āpajjanti, na ca sattesu vippaṭipajjanti.

SN 3.6 appakasuttaṃ

app'ekadā, bho gotama, uḷārāni uḷārāni khādanīyāni khādanti, uḷārāni uḷārāni bhojanāni bhuñjanti, uḷārāni uḷārāni sāyanīyāni sāyanti, uḷārāni uḷārāni pānāni pivanti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uḷāra 1

adj. excellent; lofty; high; noble [ud + √ar + *a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning excellent; lofty; high; noble
Root Family ud √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ud > uḷ + √ar > ār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > ḷ
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) uḷārāyā'ti uttamāya.
Sanskrit udāra
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Examples

idha, bhante ānanda, sambahulā bhikkhuniyo catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittā viharantiyo uḷāraṃ pubben'āparaṃ visesaṃ sañjānantī'ti

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

ehi dāni, āvuso, ubho'va santā imaṃ gaṇaṃ pariharāmā'ti. iti kho, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo ācariyo me samāno attano antevāsiṃ maṃ samānaṃ attanā samasamaṃ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṃ pūjāya pūjesi.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uḷāra 2

adj. vast; extensive [ud + √ar + *a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning vast; extensive
Root Family ud √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ud > uḷ + √ar > ār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > ḷ
a > ā
Synonym oḷāra, bhūri, mahanta, vipula
Commentary (SNa) uḷāre uḷāre'ti paṇīte ca bahuke ca.
Sanskrit udāra
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Examples

yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati

DN 18.4 janavasabhasuttaṃ

appakā te sattā lokasmiṃ ye uḷāre uḷāre bhoge labhitvā na c'eva majjanti, na ca pamajjanti, na ca kāmesu gedhaṃ āpajjanti, na ca sattesu vippaṭipajjanti.

adj. of vast wealth; very rich [uḷāra + bhoga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of vast wealth; very rich

Sanskrit udāra + bhoga

Example

mahāsatto hi tadā mahati uḷārabhoge kule nibbattitvā vuddhim'anvāya disāpāmokkhassa ācariyassa santike garuvāsaṃ vasanto sabbasippānaṃ nipphattiṃ patvā kulagharaṃ āgantvā

CPa 3.15 mahālomahaṃsacariyāvaṇṇanā
uḷārabhogakula

nt. family of vast wealth [uḷāra + bhoga + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning family of vast wealth
Construction uḷāra + bhoga + kula
Compound kammadhāraya (uḷārabhoga + kula)
Sanskrit udāra + bhoga + kula

Example

ahaṃ kho'mhi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uḷārabhogakulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya uḷārabhogatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
uḷārabhogatā

fem. fact of having extensive wealth [uḷāra + bhoga + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from uḷārabhoga
Meaning fact of having extensive wealth
Construction uḷāra + bhoga + tā
uḷārabhoga + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound kammadhāraya (uḷāra + bhogatā)
Sanskrit udāra + bhoga + tā

Examples

ahaṃ kho'mhi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uḷārabhogakulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya uḷārabhogatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho uḷārabhogatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

uḷuṅka

masc. ladle; spoon ✓

Grammar masc, dial
Meaning ladle; spoon
Sanskrit olaṅka

Examples

so yāva bhattaṃ otarati, tāva sandhāretuṃ asakkonto uḷuṅkena kañjikaṃ harāpetvā yathāladdhena byañjanena saddhiṃ allam'eva bhattaṃ pacchiyaṃ opīḷetvā ādāya yojanikaṃ maggaṃ pakkanto, tassa gacchantass'eva bhattaṃ pakkaṃ ahosi

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu

so araññato āgacchante mālākāre disvā thokaṃ thokaṃ phāṇitakhaṇḍaṃ datvā uḷuṅkena pānīyaṃ adāsi, te c'assa ek'ekaṃ pupphamuṭṭhiṃ adaṃsu.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 504
ubbaṭṭethāti

ubbhajitvāpi
